items.title: Shower of
items.review_text: So. My wife had a bump whilst heading to the station for a connecting train. So the main booking was missed. These clowns refused the refund. No reason given. Why not give the reasoning behind the decision? They just want to keep your money. Use a competitor if you can.

items.title: No contact at all! Disgusting
items.review_text:
I had return tickets booked this coming weekend.
I’ve just checked the app and on the front page my train on Saturday was still showing departure time etc, thankfully I clicked onto it as it then showed me it was cancelled. 

I have received no direct communication about the train I booked for and paid for being cancelled. There is nothing on the front page of the app, I’ve seen nothing on the tv or social media about the industrial action (I’ve since looked and saw they posted something on X 5 days ago). 

I’ve had to rebook at an extra cost for the outbound journey (as it’s now with hull trains), and it’s going to be carnage as we no longer have seat reservations, I envisage being stood up for 100 minutes 😡 the train is slightly later and will make it tight at the other end with existing reservations in London! 
I’m livid, no courtesy at all, how difficult would it be to just send a notification via email for existing customers with bookings, given they email you your booking confirmation in the first place. 
So glad I looked today or who knows what would’ve happened on Saturday.

items.title: Great service on every level
items.review_text:
The on train staff are professional, show respect and know their jobs. Nothing is too much trouble.
Occasionally, as an avid tea drinker, tea is served from a pot that previously held coffee. It is disgusting.

items.title: Outstanding customer service from LNER…
items.review_text: Outstanding customer service from LNER . I contacted them with an enquiry about a group booking I made and needed to make changes to , the person I spoke to listened to my problem , suggested solutions and went out of her way to help . Gold standard for call centre staff .

items.title: What customer service?
items.review_text: Customer service does not exist. My outward bound train was cancelled due to train strike so I had to drive to my destination. My train out was refunded but return not as LNER claimed my return was not connected to the outbound journey and they needed proof of this but could not say what proof. How do LNER expect customers to return home? I sent my flight itinerary showing outbound and return flight but was ignored sent follow up emails but I’m just being ignored. Shocking that a company can behave so badly to its customers.

items.title: Best customer service
items.review_text:
As far as customer service goes LNER should be the standard that every other should aspire to.  I've regularly travelled to Aberdeen for years and due to the nature of my job sometimes have to make last minute changes to my booking.  Contact LNER online and unlike most companies I'll actually chat with a human and not a robot.  I'm sometimes blown away with how far they go to help. 
 They'll bend over backwards and usually with 'enjoy your journey' at the end of the chat.  The trains are clean and the staff working in first class are funny, friendly and sometimes very generous with the complimentary refreshments.  If for whatever reason there's a delay or cancellation you'll receive a phone message while you're on the train to initiate a refund.  Absolutely no hesitation in recommending LNER.

items.title: Was looking to travel to London on…
items.review_text:
Was looking to travel to London on Wednesday to see family yesterday return was just over £53 when I looked yesterday but today  when I looked the prices are £213 absolutely ridiculous how can this be justified to increase the price by so much?
I will definitely not be traveling now

items.title: Bunch of scammers
items.review_text: Worst railway service in Europe hands down, crazy prices for some of the worst service I’ve ever experienced. Outdated trains often dirty and very slow, also quite dodgy practices around ticket prices and rules.

items.title: Claiming they've simplified tickets to…
items.review_text:
Claiming they've simplified tickets to get the best price for people is nothing more than corporate gaslighting. Let's look at the past prices.

Only a couple of years ago, a first class ticket to London from Aberdeen was £170 one way and £171 open return (the type of ticket they have removed).

Now, a one way is £167... But because there is no open return you have to pay for two one way tickets totalling £334. Claiming the removal of open returns as a cost saver is lying. Ok, this is first class, so let's look at standard class for the same period

One way previously £90, return £100. Now £87.90 one way and £175.80 return. It is just sheer greed. A 95% increase in cost for first class and a 75% increase on standard class. How does that translate to "simpler" or "cheaper" fares?

Until this practice is sorted, I'll no longer be taking the train and I recommend anyone else doesn't either. It costs between £80 and £120 per person to fly ABZ to LHR... Just fly.

LNER, if you do read this, please feel free to reach out and explain how your misleading statement of cheaper fares stacks up to this more expensive reality.

[edit following lner response]
These prices were advanced. You shouldn't need discounts to prevent the full price increase outlined. And thanks, your response clearly confirms the open return change was nothing but a money grab.

items.title: Punished twice for one mistake
items.review_text:
Where to start really - attitude of the ticket collector was poor. Yes I got on the wrong train at London - made a mistake, not as a fare dodger as I had a ticket. I was made to feel like an idiot - your responsibility, make sure you check when it’s such high jeopardy - £120 surcharge. On the one hand she was saying she had to charge for a full ticket (to York) and then on the other she was saying that I could pay the difference between what I had paid and the full fare at her discretion. I stayed calm and civil as I know that it is unreasonable on my part to be otherwise. I had to pay £60 to get off at Peterborough and wait for the next train - not sure what LNER gain from this?  I understand that I had made a  (genuine) mistake but wow was I punished for it by being humiliated and charged, even after I had agreed to break my journey and get into York an hour later than the train I was on and 30 minutes after I could have done  had I caught the right train (as the train I should have got doesn’t stop at York).

I get that the consequence of my mistake was to be delayed - that way I don’t get a higher price journey at a lower price. But I think it unfair that waiting at Peterborough for an hour wasn’t punishment enough - I had to pay £60 for that too. Spirit of Dick Turpin is alive and well in my opinion. You have nowhere to turn if you can’t afford the extra fare and the ticket collector even charges you for getting off as soon as you can at your own significant inconvenience. The ticket collector was very quick to threaten me with the Transport Police but backed off even more quickly when I agreed as I thought they might be more reasonable - especially as I accepted that I couldn’t get all the way to York on the train I was on.

Railcards aren’t valid either in this situation - I know it’s the ‘rules’ but it doesn’t have to be does it? Someone at LNER must have the ability for this process to be less draconian and Kafkaesque. 

I had two other London trips planned - will go somewhere else now and avoid LNER like the plague. Most companies support customers, not punish them twice for one mistake.

items.title: I have to leave a great review for LNER…
items.review_text:
I have to leave a great review for LNER staff on the ground that take all the abuse from angry passengers when things go wrong and probably don’t get enough praise when things go right.  
Firstly, for the man at the ticket desk at Kings X, the day the overhead lines went down due to bad weather and all trains were cancelled, he made sure l had a voucher and a bed for the night and ticket for the next available train out. 
Secondly, on Easter Sunday, again LNER saved me a lot of upset and expense when l left my bag on the platform at Doncaster. If not for the quick thinking of the steward RBhati and train manager who immediately rang the station and after a short wait confirmed they had located it and all in just 5 mins after leaving the station. If not for them my life would have been awful this week trying to replace iPads, phone, plus a lot of other valuable stuff.
Many thanks you’ve been wonderful. Gx

items.title: 11.22 King's Cross to York
items.review_text:
11.22 King's Cross to York
Don't waste your money paying for first class just do as everyone else has and wander in from standard class after one ticket check and order food and drink so that they have run out before reaching me.  Surely the door should be locked between first and standard class carriages!  This used to be the case.  Pleasant staff who probably aren't paid enough to tackle all these criminals but tickets can be checked at stations where help is at hand perhaps.  The criminals can be tracked by keeping hold of their actual ticket (assuming they have one).

items.title: Second class …
items.review_text: If you are ever lucky enough to afford first class tickets. Save your money and buy some food and drinks from the station with your money. You are treated mostly like an inconvenience in first class cabin. Staff only appear about once an hour and usually run out of food/drink that you want. Their priority is getting off the train before other passengers and doing as little work as possible.

items.title: A convert from Grand Central
items.review_text: I've read but can't believe the poor LNER reviews; these people should try Grand Central's 'first class' service , and then they'll appreciate the difference. For the first time, I travelled with LNER from and to King's Cross/Durham - what a different experience it was. At last, a company giving passengers what they want; cleanliness, comfort, food/drinks/beverages at their table, and at the same price as Grand Central. Well done to all.

items.title: Excellent Friendly and Professional…
items.review_text: Excellent Friendly and Professional Service from the platform Colleagues and the Crew both ways on a return trip from Lincoln to Inverness. Everything was on time and smoothly. The same goes for Passenger assist at all Stations - Lincoln-Doncaster-York and Inverness. Shame the company is being let down recently with the Drivers wanting more!

items.title: Excellence
items.review_text: On the offset of boarding the 7.57 train to London King’s Cross on 27th March I was so impressed with the staff who not only helped my dog and I into the train but assisted us all of our journey.  I would absolutely 100% travel with this train service again and leave the car at home

items.title: Disappointing Experience with LNER Perks
items.review_text: My friend and I have been loyal customers of LNER, and we claimed an LNER Perks offer - the Greggs Breakfast Deal - on 11/03/24. We received our code shortly after claiming it. The codes should be valid until 31/03/24 for a FREE Breakfast Roll Deal. However, when we redeemed it this morning (17/03/24), it did nothing to the bill. We were left with embarrassment and had to pay £2.85 for each deal, which we never thought LNER would send us an invalid code. We're glad we brought a bank card with us...

items.title: Back to Car travel
items.review_text:
It now seems inevitable that your train will be either delayed or cancelled, however try navigating the path to a refund or compensation, today after 25 minutes I found the relative form and completed it, now it appears only half of my return has been returned, even when the advised delay is so great I will not be able to have any time at the destination before I must return that is if that train has not been cancelled or delayed.
No empathy with customers whatsoever; this organisation simply hides behind over complicated web sites. The Bot is simply useless; such a shame used to be such a good railway but now so unreliable, too risky to book advance tickets when it is so difficult to even get your money back and turning up on the day is priced way beyond most people now.
Afraid my train travel days are over back to the car

items.title: All the staff are lovely just a shame…
items.review_text: All the staff are lovely just a shame you can't buy a drink on your 4 hour train journey because you only have cash didn't mind me buying my ticket with cash though.

items.title: Trains service today……….
items.review_text:
Cancel trains, 35 mins prior to leaving. Lack of any customer care, results in chaos with overloaded trains with people wanting to get home. As a country we want people off the roads and on the trains. Let’s sort this out UK and train network, train companies, and workers currently striking. 
As a service provider perhaps try and be customer focused.

items.title: Return trip from Kings Cross to…
items.review_text: Return trip from Kings Cross to Edinburgh in first class, excellent experience, comfort, service, staff, food and drinks all good, no complaints. 36 min delay on the return trip, email received within 30 mins for one click Delay/Repay, 👍

items.title: Outrageously expensive and if you park…
items.review_text:
Outrageously expensive and if you park in their car parks BE CAREFULL as they have different management running them , signs are badly marked and they will jump to give you a ticket 

And when you go on Trust Pilot they reach out with no interest in actually sorting the incorrect charge we paid £5.60 for a parking space and finished up paying £160 , so be careful

items.title: I would leave 0 stars if possible
items.review_text:
I would leave 0 stars if possible. LNER are the epitome of a company that takes the mick out of a captive audience. I have had regular cancellations, staff who have advised me not to travel and then had refund requests rejected and just a continual poor service over the last few years.
People used to say to me “l don’t know how you can trust travelling by train “ and I would tell them I had never had any problems, but the service from LNER is now so appalling I would prefer to drive through the night.
Terrible, terrible, terrible….

items.title: Avoid!!!!
items.review_text: Avoid!!!!! I wouldn’t even give 1 star if I could….! A family travelling home booked in coming back from holiday and they just cancel my train and don’t tell us. Sitting in the station and don’t know what to do no one can help and we have a disabled child. We booked first class and have problems every time we book. If it’s a toss up between driving and train I recommend driving we have problems every time I’m not doing this anymore. I pray they lose the contract to this line, we need to nationalise the rail and take it away from these private companies

items.title: Honestly wish my daughter had chosen a…
items.review_text:
Honestly wish my daughter had chosen a different university to go to as trains are always cancelled with minutes notice , leaving her stranded around the country at all hours. The amount of times we have to go and rescue her from several hours away is ridiculous. 
LNER is a dreadful and unsafe service for young adults travelling alone

items.title: My train delayed
items.review_text: My train delayed, didn’t give my platform until it was in delay time, public can imagine the panic of that, especially when you have luggage and need to take lifts. Then when they are shutting the food bar in 10 minutes I got up 5 minutes to get to the carriage where the food bar is in 8 minutes to say they are shut (2 minutes earlier then promised) no consideration to those at the other end of the train and only wanted a soft drink. But it those way, from someone who uses LNER to get to London to York every 2 weeks they have gone really done hill!

items.title: Disrespectful LNER delayed us more than four hours
items.review_text:
I took the train from Kirkcaldy to Peterborough. It stopped for more than TWO hours in York, and we were told that the overhead lines were faulty. Another train terminated at York and its passengers told me that they were asked to join our train. Was the overhead lines faulty or they just wanted to join two trains?

Staff were unhelpful and did not provide any information when I asked. They refused to arrange buses to take us to Peterborough.

LNER has to be one of the most unprofessional organisations and they should be ashamed of themselves.

items.title: Great experience today with Sam at LNER…
items.review_text: Great experience today with Sam at LNER customer services. Had some issues due to upcoming rail strikes which were sorted easily and professionally. Straightforward information provided and alternative arrangements sorted out. 👌

items.title: Never been 1st class 🤬🤬🤬🤬
items.review_text:
Just traveling from Doncaster to King’s Cross in first class. Sat down at our allocated seats to find a bottle of water and some sauce sachets still on the table… there was a member of staff stood in the aisle and immediately asked if we would like a drink, we asked for 2 coffees. Sat for approximately 25 mins when a different member of staff came and asked if she could take the menu from the table, told her that we hadn’t ordered food yet, she questioned that we had been served coffee but not ordered food…. 
We ordered and it arrived in about 10 mins ( toasted tea cake and a bacon sandwich) visited the toilet in first class, absolutely awful… floor full of water or urine, not sure which…. No paper hand towels, had to use toilet paper to dry hands. Over an hour into the journey, was asked if we wanted another drink and questioned what we had done with our cups ???? Informed her that someone had been and taken them ( half bottle of water from previous passenger still in situ) so she poured 2 more ( half cups) of coffee. 
Poor poor service, sub standard, 1st class??? I don’t think so!!! 
It really wouldn’t be hard to improve this service and make it a 1st class experience…… terrible.

items.title: Would give 0 stars if i could
items.review_text: Would give 0 stars if i could. Lner help desk staff at the Doncaster station. My train was cancelled so LNER booked me a taxi from doncaster to hull which im thankful for. However it doesn’t change the fact that I received the most racist experience since i’ve come to the UK. She answered my questions in a rude manner and yelled at me when i asked her if i would have to pay for the £70 taxi journey. Then noted the wrong number down for the taxi service, after that refused to give me details for the taxi and made me run across the train station 3 times at 9pm at night. Almost left me stranded in a random city at night by myself. not safe to travel with lner as a young adult.

items.title: Don’t commit the sin of changing your plans!
items.review_text:
I am a regular user of LNER for commuting, and I’m always baffled by the fare structure. As an essential form of transport, it amazes me how the cost of transporting a person from A to B can fluctuate so much. 
Aside from that I had an experience that clearly demonstrates their disregard for their customers. A recent family holiday had to be cut short due to train strikes in France. Our group of five had to travel a day earlier than planned because of this, so I asked LNER on their chat service if we could move our tickets. They weren’t interested at all in our plight. I understand that the strikes in France were not their fault, but some kind of empathy/humanity could sure have come in to play. 
LNER charged us £300 to change our tickets, including a £40 fine for rebooking. This “administration” fine is simply laughable, as I had to do the rebooking myself!
To make matters worse, when we boarded our train it was empty! 
So thank you LNER for your contribution to our ruined holiday. It pains me that I have to keep giving you my money to get to work. I wonder what the roulette of ticket prices will be this week!

items.title: Traveled first class for first time…
items.review_text: Traveled first class for first time Doncaster to Edinburgh, joined a table where a gentleman was already  seated , table was full of empty cups and glasses,service must have been good until  that point. waited ages to get a drink and table cleared and wasn't until near the end of the journey that someone came and asked what food we wanted. Left feedback  but it got ignore, will save my money and Travel standard

items.title: A complete disgrace
items.review_text: A complete disgrace. I was trying to buy 6 tickets on the website and within the space of 30mins the price went up 3 times totalling £147 more (bear in mind rail cards were applied). This is 5+ weeks before travel. It’s disgusting that the company uses cookies against you, this is an abominable and shameful practice.

items.title: Refund not received and bad service
items.review_text:
On 15th January a got an email from LNER saying that my refund payment has been issued, but I haven’t got any money.
Today I spent more than one hour speaking with Amelia and Brian, both were rude and unwilling to help.
I want please a proof of the payment, so I can challenge my bank, I won’t provide my bank statement, since it is personal.
Case LNER-231228-BRJW

items.title: Excellent customer service 27…
items.review_text: Rang customer services regarding my future tickets which unfortunately we can't travel on that date due to my sons work commitments. Spoke to very understanding lady. Refund agreed. Excellent rail company, will use again.

items.title: The worst service I have ever received
items.review_text: I booked a first class ticket for me, my wife, and we were travelling with a small baby. We were not allocated seats so had to stand between Edinburgh and London. Catering was not provided "due to staffing issues" and the one toilet with baby changing facilities was out of order so we had to walk five carriages to change the baby. An absolute disaster that ruined our first weekend away since our baby girl was born. I'll get the plane next time and avoid ever giving LNER any money again - sorry planet.

items.title: Worst line in the uk
items.review_text:
I can't believe that these work shy, rude and unprofessional operators want more money, I stopped using these jokers after reserved seats where made unavailable, the rudeness of the ticket inspector who was one meal away from a heart attack on the Leeds to London route.
You know who you are grey beard, I witnessed crying children and distressed paying passengers. 
Oh I didn't respond back to your request to discuss my issues via Trustpilot because you are a joke full stop.

items.title: Parking system at Durham needs improvement!
items.review_text: Parked at Durham Railway station on Thursday 9th November and used the LNER parking app. Paid the daily fee when I exited later the same day and received payment acknowledgement on my phone but the ANPR system failed to record my departure so according to LNER my car was still in the car park days after. I’ve emailed LNER but I’ve had no response within their published timescales. Very disappointing. Thankfully I was able to resolve the matter with help from FAAC who thankfully could tell my car wasn’t in the car park. Come on LNER sort this out.

items.title: Service wise I can't fault them.
items.review_text:
Since Virgin have left the franchise I've had no issues with the company except the fares (and the onboard wifi which is appalling). 

Great staff, clean trains and generally on time. 

The fares are extortionately high for peak services, and given their virtual monopoly on the route this needs looking at but service wise I can't fault them.

items.title: Poor first class…
items.review_text:
I used to enjoy travelling first class with LNER but over the last couple of years the service has continually declined.
Even when the train does run as planned there is often no hot breakfast supplied on morning trips from Aberdeen to Edinburgh, poor quality alcohol supplied and poor service.

items.title: Horrible service
items.review_text: LNER has a problem making refunds , how do you not want to refund a ticket within 30-40mins of purchase and even after confirming it wasn’t use . LNER will keep sending back and forth . You go to LNER office and staff tell you they can’t do anything because you you purchased ticket online on LNER platform . It is so frustrating. Simplest of complains can’t be resolved . I think the aim is to frustrate you into abandoning your refund .

items.title: Travelled from London Kings Cross to York
items.review_text: Travelled from London Kings Cross to York. Very aggressive guards on board- demanding I buy another ticket( without the use of my railcard) even though I had a valid ticket to travel. Avoid this rail company, if there is an alternative carrier.  They will find a way to overcharge you if they can!

items.title: The worst train line in the UK by far
items.review_text: The worst train line in the UK by far. I have been travelling London to Newcastle every week for last 3 months, they always find a way to get delayed. While I have taken other train for example LUMO, they are always onetime. It seems disruptions only affects LNER. Would suggest not to take LNER if possible or be prepared to get delayed.

items.title: Horrible
items.review_text:
Horrible.  We traveled from Edinburgh waverley to Durham back in November. I'm still waiting on a reply from my complaint.
There was an anti war protest in the station and as a result ticket restrictions were lifted. No one told the brutish LNER staff though so myself and my frightened autistic daughter weren't allowed to board the train as per the train manager who was desperate to exercise the little bit of authority that he had. 
LNER acknowledged me and told me they had investigated in private but they make no apology for the tickets being refused when in reality restrictions had been lifted.
Unrelated to this you now have to buy two singles rather than a return. Obviously to justify charging more. Why can't they be honest that this is financially motivated. They tell us it is to "simplify" the process. Coz yeah it's so complicated to get a return isn't it. When I use the other operators it takes me all of my mental capacity to work out whether it is the outward or return journey. Thanks LNER for making this so "simple". I feel so much better now about paying over the odds and not being respected as a customer or human being.

items.title: Constant delays & cancellations
items.review_text:
Constant delays & cancellations, they don't refund as stated on their site for delays.  

Toilets are disgusting. 

Overpriced tickets for substandard service.

items.title: Used to travel on LNER a lot pre-Covid
items.review_text:
Used to travel on LNER a lot pre-Covid. Never had any complaints. The experience recently however has been poor.

Trains are cancelled last minute surprisingly frequently. Maybe I've just been unlucky, but it's getting to the point where it's hard to trust getting to and from Kings X by train anymore.

I've also had an issue recently where the booking system on the website failed, and I ended up getting charged twice for a £100 journey. I raised this with customer support as soon as I noticed it over one week ago, and haven't heard anything back other than an automated acknowledgement.

Really not good enough. The "our response time could be longer than usual" rubbish, which is now a mantra in almost every customer service department in the country, doesn't cut it now. Covid was more than 2 years ago. Get a grip.

items.title: Very uncomfortable seats
items.review_text:
Very uncomfortable seats. 
Not sufficiently padded

Didn't tell us about the cafe bar position for over 2 hours. Long train, could have been anywhere. 
Cafe bar very small,  choosing food from almost unreadable tiny icons while in very awkwardly angled queue. 
The cafe App didn't work-- and we were not told for over 2 hours so many people trying and failing. No-one to help.
Cafe bar didn't take cash.
Staff curt and unfriendly.

Won't be travelling by them again if can be avoided (Edinburgh to York)

items.title: Their website states false information
items.review_text:
Their website states false information. I had purchased an advance ticket but due to a family emergency (and bad weather coming imminently), I decided to try to change my ticket to a train three days earlier. I read the guidance and followed the instructions to make sure I would be eligible to change it. The problem is, you need to book your new ticket and apply for a refund. And now, I've received an email stating my ticket isn't eligible for a refund with no explanation as to why! Ironically, the original train I should have caught ended up arriving 27 minutes late to a station I would have had to change at and so would have missed my connection. I've written a complaint to see if I'm entitled to delay repay - who knows?

Edit: I feel it appropriate to state that I was requesting to CHANGE my ticket, not have a refund, which is allowed with an advance ticket as stated on LNER's website. I have already contacted the email address stated and am waiting for a response

items.title: Customer service not interested
items.review_text: Customer service not interested. I purchased tickets for a return trip to Rugby, the first leg went well but on the return the train was so late I couldn't make the connection so I called to see if the terms of my ticket meant I could take alternative trains to get home they told me to call another company. Surely they could have told me the terms of the ticket since I bought it from them but apparently not.

items.title: I regret booking with LNER
items.review_text:
I regret booking with LNER. New Years Eve - weather not good, services ending early for holiday and my train cancelled. I dashed to station early and was told I could only take the train before/after my cancelled one because that is “policy”. Am terrified of getting stuck over new year. Btw I travelled up on Lumo which had really good customer service. Wish I had booked back with them.

Update - Happily I did make it home before new year but would still avoid LNER in future due to the inflexible rule which says you can only get the train before/after if yours is cancelled. If there is chaos, trains are ending early and there are spaces, why not allow people to use any available space to get to their destination? I suspect the staff shortages which caused cancellations on new year's eve are a regular feature of LNER.

items.title: Dreadful
items.review_text:
Dreadful - journey Leeds to London 11.45 28th October.
No reservation service available due a fault on the train, no food available despite the tannoy advising it is.
Understaffed and rude!
Simply awful company, I feel sorry for anyone who has to travel by train often!

items.title: Rubbish LNER
items.review_text:
I sent a review of 1 star and I was surprised that I got a response which is why I’m reviewing my experience and would like to say that sometimes if you vent your frustration it gets a response.
I’m also getting a refund .

items.title: Never going to use the train again
items.review_text: Never going to use the train again. Will drive or fly. Awful service. Train to Edinburgh cancelled from Newcastle. Expected to just get the next one at when there is only 2 services afterwards. Stressful. Due to train crew and unions. I am a supporter of unions but the fact that they would leave customers stranded is not okay.

items.title: Train at 12:00 from King’s Cross direct…
items.review_text:
Train at 12:00 from King’s Cross direct to Inverness terminated at Edinburgh Waverley and no specific alternative transport organised to take passengers north to their destination. 
Passengers had to find this for themselves, some being more able to do this than others. Not everyone is fluent at searching and booking on-line and have to ask. Told ticket not valid on Scot rail then told it was! 
I thought rail companies had a duty of care to get their passengers to their destinations?

items.title: Full Refund and good service when…
items.review_text: Full Refund and good service when visiting UK. My train from York to Edinburgh was cancelled. The staff in the service lounge helped me rebook to another train 1 hour later. The service on the train was very good, full breakfast was very nice. I arrived in Edinburgh and I got assistance (because I am blind /partically sighted) to a taxi. Nice ladies who helped. The trip was refunded because of the cancellation to my original train. Great and well done!

items.title: Incredibly rude cabin crew
items.review_text: Incredibly rude cabin crew. Lots of attitude & very little service. Food was bland & ordinary too. Don't waste your money.

items.title: A joke of a service
items.review_text:
Multiple mistakes with my season ticket
Sent me a defective smartcard
Causer huge amount of stress and pressure unable to get into work and pay out extra money. Awful customer service literally no help what so ever lied to and told different information everytime I spoke to someone.

Ah hello LNER I called the customer service number yesterday morning and was told “they don’t deal with smartcard issues” and that they couldn’t do anything. This is the same message I was given at the station. 
I also emailed the customer service email address and received no response. So I am looking forward to hearing how you can resolve it?

items.title: No seats on an overbooked journey 2.5 hrs long
items.review_text: How can you pay so much for a super off peak journey from London to Leeds and they allow you to buy a ticket without a seat reservation. It's very easy to omit the seat reservation during the checkout process. It's 2.5 hours. It should be a lot cheaper if you're expected to stand for the whole journey?! Especially if all the seats are booked, how can they sell more tickets to a pretty long journey than there are seats available?! This is just dishonest and frankly inconsiderate. Anything longer than an hour without a seat is already pushing it. 2.5 hours may be just about bearable for me, an adult, but for a kid or a mother or a person with a disability is unacceptable and disgraceful. Fix this asap.

items.title: Cancelled York train at last minute
items.review_text: Cancelled York train at last minute.  Train after also cancelled.  Ended up driving my daughter home.  YOUR excuse - staff shortages, so why only let people know literally minutes before train was due?  If I'd have known I'd not have spent £6.50 in the car park.  The gall of you to charge a £10 admin fee for ticket refund when you don't provide a service.  Utter joke of a rail company.

items.title: The worst experience and still ongoing 6 weeks later!!
items.review_text:
Trying to appeal a penalty fare that my daughter received on a train journey, after a genuine error. They have taken so long to respond to emails, that the 28 day appeal time has been and gone, she is now getting debt letters through the post with threat of prosecution, when the last communication from them was 2 weeks ago and they were looking into the situation and would be in touch. The amount of upset and distress this has caused to myself and young daughter has been awful. 
No-one responding to emails, seems to be just a money making penalty and taking advantage of a young passenger when the error has been clearly identified.

items.title: delay repay scammers
items.review_text:
EDIT: I got the same response from customer support.

I repeat: OUR TRAIN WAS CANCELLED. NOT DELAYED BY LESS THAN 30 MINUTES. CANCELLED. DID NOT EXIST ANY MORE. DO YOU UNDERSTAND?

November, family day out to London for 5... despite having booked seats, had to sit on the floor in between 2 coaches all the way. Somehow got a refund after 1+ month finally.

But on our way back, our train was completely cancelled, and we had to take another one. I could not get a refund response until JANUARY, when they told me I'm not eligible since my train was 15 minutes delayed. Again, we had to take another train, it was not a simple delay. And I'm pretty sure my Advance ticket would not have been accepted on another train if it wasn't for the cancellation so... I continue to fight for my refund for now.

items.title: Ruined my honeymoon
items.review_text:
Ruined my honeymoon. We booked a mini trip to London for our long anticipated honeymoon. Train cancelled...again!!! & had to squash into next available, no seats to be had anywhere 
I always reserve my seat as I have a disability and struggle to stand for more than 10 minutes. Just awful 😖

items.title: Compliment to station staff
items.review_text: I was waiting. To collect my elderly father in law at King’s Cross yesterday. It was overcrowded with multiple cancellations.  His train was hours late. Despite the chaos LNER station staff  were fantastic helpful and calm in the face of thousands of frustrated passengers they were great. Well done

items.title: No refund for cancelled first-class
items.review_text:
Girlfriend and I booked Leeds to London first class, which was cancelled before it left the station. We were crammed on to a commuter train to Sheffield taking turns to sit on a fold-out seat the size of a postage stamp in-between 2 doors and the toilet, and another service from there to London.

We were over 3 hours late, ruining our trip, and LNER won't refund us despite requesting it within 28 days and having insurance. Vile, grasping organisation.

Response to LNER's reply: It WAS an LNER journey because we booked an LNER train, first class. The other lines have no business refunding us because we didn't pay for a ticket with them, let alone a first class ticket, and they actually GOT US TO THE DESTINATION albeit over 3 hours late.

items.title: Bring back open returns!
items.review_text: The fact that there are no longer open returns and travellers are forced to buy 2 tickets, without any flexibility if plans change is a cynical attempt to get more money out of the public. The single tickets aren't cheaper. I've spent an extra £30 as my plans changed. I've always bought open returns in the past to give me that choice.

items.title: Booked a train from Bedford to…
items.review_text: Booked a train from Bedford to Inverness. The 7h40m ride I have from King’s Cross to Inverness I have no seat. Paid £160 for the journey which is by far the most expensive way to travel domestically to begin with. There are also children sitting in the floor with their mother at the toilets as they too also don’t have seats. LNER star actually told me you don’t actually pay for seat just the journey. Disgusting and a total rip off! They blaming trainline usual cop out, pass the buck nonsense. I want a refund?!

items.title: Consistently appalling service
items.review_text: Consistently appalling service. Trains are always delayed or cancelled last minute. Of only 3 trips using LNER this year, all 3 fall into the above. Any review on here above 2 stars surely have to be false.

items.title: I am a regular traveler on the LNER…
items.review_text: I am a regular traveler on the LNER service to Leeds and I actually can’t remember the last time a train was on time either going or returning! Just on yet another delayed service missing my connection and will be home 2 hours later than expected again!!

items.title: Compre por la web dono he recibido mis tiquites.s tiquetes ida y…
items.review_text: Compre por la web dos tiquetes ida y regreso Londres Edimburgo y el valor fue descontado de mi tarjeta de crédito, pero no he recibido mis tiquetes en mi email mencionado al comprar los tks. La referencia de transacción es 24svvdpv4f.

items.title: Travelled from Durham to Edinburgh on…
items.review_text:
Travelled from Durham to Edinburgh on Sunday 30th July. Staff changed at Newcastle.  It was our first family holiday for 3 years - we paid for first class tickets as a great start to our 2 week holiday in Croatia - flying from Edinburgh. 
The lady serving our drinks clearly did not want to be on that shift from the moment she set foot on train. It was like a scene from Fawlty Towers - as we practically had our drinks thrown at us.  She was utterly miserable and customer care skills left a lot to be desired.  Not a good ambassador for for LNER. Two stars given as train was on time and good journey.

items.title: Unacceptable parking charge
items.review_text:
Unable to give less than 1 star.
I was parked in the drop off, pick up area at Doncaster station waiting to pick up my wife late at night as the station area is infested with undesirables.
To our dismay her train was delayed 15 to 20 minutes
One week later i recieved a parking fine of £60 for not paying the parking charge.
There are no machines to pay for parking tickets as it is pick up/ drop off bays.
Thank you LNER as this is not very customer friendly.
The charges have been paid begrudgingly.

items.title: No room to move no food disgraceful
items.review_text: Train seats very narrow a cow would get more space view restricted due to pillar toilet stinks only just 1hour into journey no signs working to see occupied seats and No seat service for drinks or food no idea where the so called cafe is on this long train.My first time for 3 years I'll be returning to the airport if I survive these cramped conditions

items.title: 1st Class travel a real let down
items.review_text:
Sadly let down in 1st Class train travel.
Food served so late i was eating it as i was getting ready to leave the train.Gulping down a dry bun was made worse as the drink i was promised never arrived.
On the return 1st class journey zero food and drink.
Sent an email complaint over 3 weeks ago but never even had the courtesy of a reply.
A real shame and will never go 1st Class again.

items.title: Poor staff member!
items.review_text: 3 families travelled from London to Leeds after attending a wedding and cannot fault LNER. We allowed two teenagers and an 8 year old to go down carriage to buy snacks together without an adult.. unfortunately they walked through a carriage with several teenage boys who subjected them to vile abuse. Steven who worked for LNER was aware of the incident and was absolutely brilliant. When we pulled into the next station, police were waiting for these boys, some of who cowardly hid in the toilets on the train! Steven came and took statements from our family about the incident and sadly told us that he is subjected to that sort of abuse regularly!! The journey, service and staff were brilliant - this incident aside. Brilliant.

items.title: 5 stars to the staff
items.review_text: A full 5 stars as a compliment to the staff. Storm Gerrit had disrupted many services, however the train operator on the 10:30 AM Kings Cross to Edinburgh line today politely provided a clear and honest representation of how bad the situation actually was around Newcastle and Edinburgh. She provided an advisory relatively early on in the day to avoid traveling North if possible. This allowed us - and I'm sure many others - to change our plans well in time to account for the weather.

items.title: Thank you LNER.
items.review_text: Because of events totally out of their control the whole network was disrupted. London Kings X to Waverley delayed, missed onward connection. Train rerouted and delayed for several hours, but staff kept us informed, compensation organised, free food for the last few hours of journey, and taxis waiting for those of us who had missed our connection. A big thank you to all staff involved. It was an epic task undertaken with professionalism and great customer service. Many airlines would do well to observe how this, thankfully rare event, was handled.

items.title: I stood all the way from Alnmouth to…
items.review_text: I stood all the way from Alnmouth to Kings cross. Yes, it was a bank holiday but it’s not like that demand could not have been anticipated and worked with. Yes, I could have booked a seat reservation but sadly there were none available to book when I bought my tickets. One star is for the speed of the actual train which is pretty impressive. Perhaps sell standing tickets for a cheaper price ? Might sting less.

items.title: LNER 1st class
items.review_text:
I went 1st class on 06/12/23 - Stevenage to Wakefield. The luxurious food was the smallest bacon roll you can imagine, the freshly made coffee was lukewarm at best. Not exactly luxurious, the WiFi didn’t work and the charger at the seat was faulty. I emailed the companies  customer services email address whilst on the train as there is nobody to speak with. Nobody ever came back to me, I even complained after the adventure, they said on the automated email id get a response in 10 working days. Sadly I did not get any response, I would dread to think what economy is like.

Surprisingly I received a response from LNER and an offer was made by them, which was a good outcome for me, so despite giving such a lowly review 1 star, I have upgraded to 4 stars.

items.title: Shocking incompetence across the board
items.review_text: Shocking incompetence across the board. First train cancelled with only 5 minutes to departure. Next train late by 30 minutes because”we can’t find the driver”. Finally dumped 120 miles short of destination and told to sort our own onward travel. It’s Grantham, there aren’t enough cabs/ hotel rooms to cope. I’ll guess I’ll have to sleep in the station.  Re LNERs reply. There were no other services. They were all cancelled. Or so we were told.

items.title: Great customer service
items.review_text: Missed our train due to me being diabetic and having a low blood sugar. Went to the ticket desk and Carole at York helped us get a new train, and without asking allowed us into the first class lounge to get a biscuit to help. Went above and beyond, amazing service

items.title: Why you don't want pay back my money
items.review_text:
Why you don't want pay back my money. 
Is that your terms and conditions gives you right to take my money. Do you have right and freedom to take money from people even you didn't gave to people any services.
And your customer services staff thinking they can cheat us with RHETORIC....
I will continue ask and write any place of internets until get my money back.
You can not grabs people money from them especially if you didn't gave any services.

items.title: Useless service
items.review_text:
Train cancelled without notification or apology. Forced to take train an hour later. Really disrupted my day. Could have had an extra hour work done. Wi-Fi doesn’t work. 
Utterly useless and unreliable service.

items.title: THEY CHARGED ME £600+!!!!
items.review_text: They accused me of travelling from Edinburgh to London without a train ticket when in fact I had a valid train ticket booked in trainline!!! They also made a court case of which I was informed when I saw £600+ deducted from my paycheck through the court! What a joke - this is the customer service that they provide? AVOID AT ALL COST. NEVER TAKE LNER AGAIN EVER IN MY LIFE. To top it all, the train was 6 hours delayed lol. I SHOULD BE CHARGING THEM INSTEAD lol.

items.title: Great LNER Service
items.review_text: Passengers very rarely take time out to post a positive review. I travelled with my 2 young children from London KX to Leeds last night and had a fantastic experience. The train was clean, well ventilated and spacious and the staff were friendly and helpful. The Wi-Fi was quick and easy to connect to and the facilities were all well stocked and easy to access. I usually arrive home exhausted after a train journey but felt relaxed and ready for a long week at work: thank you LNER!

items.title: No hot food
items.review_text: No hot food - again. I'm a regular passenger on LNER between Aberdeen and Edinburgh or elsewhere. I usually travel 1st class as (if the food appears) it represents good value. However the excuses for not supplying the advertised hot food vary, but usually involve the temperature controls on the fridges not working, or the food not arriving at Aberdeen, or being frozen solid. I don't understand why LNER can't replace the faulty units, or change suppliers. So today we were offered Beef Olives on the menu. Then we were told no hot food after Dundee. It transpires they need a chef in the kitchen (a bit like Faulty Towers - to open a tin) but they don't employ chefs north of Edinburgh. I was on a packed 1st class train today with a lot of disappointed passengers. This does nothing to encourage travellers to leave their cars or planes and use what is otherwise a very good service.

items.title: DISGRACEFUL
items.review_text:
DISGRACEFUL! 
Staff member 1b90 Dean Doncaster on the 7.30am from lincoln to Peterborough  train cabin crew at 7.38am 

Ticket office in Lincoln closed and the ticket machine was also not working. 

Very rude when I explained the situation and then charged me double my normal travel charge absaloutly disgusting behaviour.  Passengers heard this and apologised to me afterwards. Unprofessional and just plain money grabbing nothing else.  I have travelled with Lner for four years twice a week with work and I can honestly say it's the worst company I have ever had the pleasure of dealing with. 

My normal Ticket cost 34 to 44 for my return journey to Peterborough 7.30 out 5pm back  £63.50 charged with a very bad attitude repeatedly telling me I would need to leave the train and miss my conferences as its my own fault for not buying at the station where staff where not working and the ticket machine was not operational

items.title: Refund process is terrible
items.review_text: The refund process is terrible. You cannot view your previous refund requests and the information you have added. You need to add a disruption for a cancelled train, but you can't as the disruption is the next day. However, before you can request a refund you need to book another ticket!!!!

items.title: Terrible customer service.
items.review_text:
Terrible customer service.
I contacted LNER on the 13 May  to say I was having problems with upgrading my booking (for 3 adults) to first class, I was told to email customers at lner.co.uk
with screenshots of the errors which I did and I was given a case reference LNER-230513-BTDE.
I have since contacted customer services but have just been passed around. I have also (on numerous occasions) logged into the LNER website to check my case history via the 'my support cases' page, but all I get is 'we are experiencing issues' with 'My case history'
The journey has long gone now, as it was for 25th June 😥
*it was the 03457 225 333 that I originally called.

items.title: Five star service
items.review_text: We’ve just had the most wonderful assistance at Leeds train station. We’d completely overpacked as my daughter is off to university in London and wanted to take as many of her belongings as possible. The guard helped us with all of our luggage and arranged for us to have trolley assistance at Kings Cross. We are so grateful. Massive thank you for the five star service. 💕😁👍

items.title: solved my cancelled train
items.review_text: been dealing with Richard Zayne and Leon at LNER after around a month of back and forth contact i finally got my issue resolved and i think without the help of Richard i may have been at a lost cause. Truly appreciate everything they have done for me and how professional they have been.

items.title: Wifi sucked
items.review_text:
Wifi sucked, cut out every 5 seconds and made me lose my clash royale trophies… my opponent hasn’t touched my towers in 3 games in a row and yet the WiFi would just completely go and I would open the app to a three crown loss. 
Thanks liner, you owe me 89 trophies.

items.title: Refunds
items.review_text:
I have had to cancel/ change plans twice this year due to health problems & LNER    refunded me with no quibbles, even though advance tickets are not usually refundable.
Excellent  customer service
Also have decaf tea on their trains! 👍

items.title: Great customer service
items.review_text: Travelled from Edinburgh to London Kings Cross on Saturday 26 August 2023.  Very close to the destination when the train was stopped due to a trespasser being on the line. Staff looked after us and kept us up to speed with how the delay was progressing.  Cannot speak highly enough of the service provided by staff who, like us, were delayed.  Within no time at all delay payment approved.  Great company; will always use them to travel "hame" to Bonnie Scotland.

items.title: LNER always put on short trains
items.review_text: LNER always put on short trains. Then cancel services and expect passengers to stand for 2.5 hours with no real apology or compensation for the overcrowding. Unfortunately because of the government sponsored rail monopoly I cannot travel to my desired destination by any other operator

items.title: Great experience amid disruption
items.review_text:
LNER were fantastic even when things didn’t go to plan. Train was cancelled, information clearly communicated, regular updates and staff on hand to assist.
I was allowed to reserve seats on a replacement, which gave me assurance that I would get seats on my second train.
Shout out to Train Manager Kevin from Newcastle who was magnificent.
Unfortunately, I deducted 1 star as the Air Conditioning is not good enough. These are brand new trains, and the carriages should be cool on a hot day. Too often it’s just in the vestibule that one can feel comfortable air temperature.

items.title: Meal service not as advertised when buying ticket
items.review_text: Specifically chose (and paid more for) a less convenient train to get the full meal service, which wasn’t available for reasons that were not explained at all. Think next time I’ll just get an earlier one and grab breakfast in London.

items.title: Privatisation of rail has failed!!!!
items.review_text: They oversell tickets so I had to stand all the way from London to Leeds, after paying £130 for a ticket! Make the trains publicly owned again the services are disgraceful, in comparison to the rest of Europe the U.K. must be one if not the worse for public transport.

items.title: Disgusting customer service
items.review_text: Disgusting customer service. Having to chase a refund request from the last set of strikes. LNER cancelled my refund without even informing me and when I tried to speak to customer service, they were incredibly rude and unhelpful. I have been travelling with LNER for years and I am absolutely disgusted by the way they treat customers now.

items.title: Just had a fabulous trip first class…
items.review_text:
Just had a fabulous trip first class heading from Durham to London kings cross. We have been waited on exceptionally despite a busy train . 

Thanks so much to Jackie and her team for making our trip so special.


We are off to see Madonna now - looking forward to our return x

items.title: I travelled with this train several…
items.review_text:
I travelled with this train several times and I arrived at the conclusion that I rather take a plane than this train. It’s always so full of children, loud people and it’s so boring. 
I didn’t enjoy at all 5 hours of trip from London to Edinburgh

items.title: Fantastic Service
items.review_text:
Absolutely fantastic service in first class on the LNER 12:30 today from Kings Cross. Staff very attentive and always coming around with refreshments.

Honestly couldn’t fault them and the first class lounge at Kings Cross was spot on!

items.title: Booking Amendment support…
items.review_text: Libby from the LNER X page was really helpful is solving a problem for me. I had accidentally booked the wrong day for a return journey. When completing the booking late at night I was unable to contact LNER at that time. However first thing in the morning Libby swiftly replied to my message and amended my booking was very understanding of the situation. Thank you Libby!

items.title: 5* Customer Service from the LNER team
items.review_text: A BIG THANKS to "KT" on Twitter( which I'm leaving soon ) who directed me to getting a seat ,when by chance I checked the LNER app and found my train to London for the rugby cancelled,and  got me a seat on another train. It's not LNER's fault over the strike.It's why I travel on LNER 9 times out of 10 with the odd trip on Grand Central ( which I will NEVER use again due to their shocking record )  A big thanks to "KT" on Twitter for pointing me in the right direction and fingers crossed. ..adding Grand Central aka "Grand Cancellations" could learn a lot from  LNER customer services who reply with "Yup" "Yeah"  "Nope" to questions on that social media platform

items.title: LNER…crew experience
items.review_text:
The staff on our journeys were absolutely superb both going to York and on our return journey home.
They couldn't do enough for us. A bus took us from Morpeth To Newcastle train station. 
We could only travel from Newcastle to York via train as there was rail repairs but the staff worked very hard to make our journey comfortable and happy. They were very cheerful and helped us.

items.title: You can guarantee that once they…
items.review_text: You can guarantee that once they removed the word 'great' and replaced it with London, that the service would go down hill from there! Are these trains ever on time? Of course not! I can travel all over the world to most locations and receive a far superior service!! Sitting in a station 3 times as long as the journey takes because the driver needs a break (and before you say it, dont offer a service you can't complete)?? Bring back The Great North East, the inventors of the railway, pack your poor service up and retreat back down south. Shambles.  Also, on Saturday I got on a train from Newcastle to Durham. You made an announcement that the last 4 carages wouldn't leave the station. So everyone got off, leaving no space on the train. So many people had to wait, then you had the nerve to leave the station with all carages in tact. Subzero temperatures and another hours wait for the next train.  You should just hand the keys on to someone who realises where the money comes from YOUR CUSTOMERS. We should go on strike until you lose your contract.

items.title: Rude train staff
items.review_text:
Booked a ticket from Newcastle central to London Kings X departing at 19:02. When I went to collect tickets from the station the counter was shut and none of the self service machines had option to collect tickets. Nonetheless, I was allowed to pass through the ticket gate with the help of an LNER staff,  who kindly scanned his card and explained there wasn’t much he could do. After boarding the train, when the ticket inspection man came, I explained the trouble but he threatened to charge me for another ticket. In the interest of avoiding an argument, I did not escalate on his condescending talk and reply to his opinion that I should have got “handwritten a note” from the staff at the gate. The subpar attitude, thinking that I was travelling “illegally” and I was still allowed on the train as a result of his perpetual grace - is really embarrassing.

I do not understand what I could’ve been done so that I was travelling “legally”.  I am not suggesting LNER starts a worldwide search for employees with Einstein level IQ or Nightingale’s solicitude. Surely an employee of such a large company knows how better to deal with customer? Absolutely appalling customer service from the onboard train staff.

items.title: Thank you LNER
items.review_text: Wanted to say thank you to LNER for the service we've received during the storm Babet. We traveled to London where we then got stranded for a night with loads of luggage and a cat, since no trains were going north. When we tried next day it was still bad, but staff at the Kings Cross station was very helpful despite the pressure they were under. We had a ticket with a different train company however LNER staff let us on their train with no problem and wished us to get home safely. We later changed to the northern rail to get further to our destination and that was the opposite of good service. Compassion and kindness goes long way during such stressful times, helping people to get home will earn loyalty. I would be happy to always choose LNER when I travel.

items.title: Don't purchase in advance, unless you can guarantee 100% you can get on that train on that day
items.review_text:
Awful policy around refunds / cancellations / rescheduling, I'm now £217 out of pocket, thank you LNER. 

I had tickets booked for a trip that has been cancelled due to events beyond my control, and I followed their instructions to request a refund - which the website let me do. I got an email saying they would try to contact me within 10 working days. 

13 working days later I had to chase them via their online chat, only to find that they had cancelled my request for a refund because I had selected 'no longer needed' as the reason for applying. 

Not only that - because I requested a refund and it got cancelled, the tickets are now not eligible for me to amend, and move to any future date!!

How is that a fair policy? They've kept over £200 of my money, which I can't get back OR transfer to a future journey AND there will be 4 'booked' empty seats on a return journey that is usually standing-room only (which, let's face it, they'll probably resell so that they make double bubble).

Disgusting policy, but they get away with it because there's no other viable option on the East Coast Mainline. I'm furious.

items.title: Amazing communication despite difficult…
items.review_text:
Amazing communication despite difficult circumstances for the 10:00 train leaving London Kings Cross on June 15th 2023. 

The train ahead of this service struck a person on the track, leading to massive delays. The train manager on the 10:00 service kept all passengers very well informed, apologising for the delays throughout. He really went above and beyond to make all passengers as comfortable and informed as possible. Thank you and well done to this train manager!

items.title: £105 to park for 12mins at Durham?
items.review_text:
£105 to park for 12mins at Durham?

The parking app failed to scan my number plate on the way out after dropping my daughter off at the station. I paid £2.50, and alerted the parking team but now a week later, it says I have been parked for 7 days and owe them a huge £105.
They fail to respond to emails and have resorted to trading standards.

It’s the car for me from now on.

Customer services deny any responsibility and sent me this message 
—————
Thank you for contacting London North Eastern Railway regarding Durham Car Park. 
 
I am afraid this is not something we can help with here in the Contact Centre. 

Please can you email your query to parking(email address) and one of the team will get back to you accordingly.
———-
The app now says I owe £150.

Parking have as yet, failed to respond, and it’s the last time I will use the car park (which since they abolished free drop off parking is a complete disaster with pedestrians and cars all trying to pick up and drop off without incurring any costs)

items.title: Helpful efficient service highly recommended
items.review_text: Recently I was unable to travel due to illness.So at short notice I rang LNER and was quickly put through to a very helpful "real person" I enquired about a refund for my return journey which was promptly issued. Over all the representative was efficient kind and very polite.Thank you LNER I will of course be rebooking my tickets with you when I recover.

items.title: Train journey fiasco
items.review_text: Train cancelled the night before travel because of staff shortages. Got a train 30 minutes later from York to Grantham and it was absolutely packed, ended up standing in between carriages with 3 suitcases for 1 hour. Told i have to reserve a seat but don't understand why this matters when they can cancel a train and cram you in like a sardine when it suits them. Not even a fold down seat anymore. Every once in a while I get a train in the false hope things have improved only to have my positivity dashed. Be a few years before I waste my money on the train again.

items.title: Not great experiences
items.review_text: Not great experiences. Been on the LNER services twice, both times from London to Sheffield. Both times the staff apologised that the train was only 5 carriages, not 9 as it was supposed to be. The last time we had seats, but there was massive confusion regarding bookings not being honoured, and my wife lost her seat to someone who said they had booked it, then refused to move out again when it was announced the bookings had been cancelled. The train manager said she’s spoken to the manager of the next train, who had seats and we could swap trains. My wife, daughter and I headed for the exit, but were told it was too late to leave the train, so all had to stand in the doorway all the way to Sheffield, with other passengers crammed in. Zero for two with our experiences with LNER. We have one more trip back to London late next week - not confident it won’t be another disaster, and not looking forward to it.

items.title: Great team onboard and at the station
items.review_text: I had to move from my scheduled service, which was cancelled, from London Euston on Saturday,over to Kings Cross and an LNER service for a circuitous journey home to Lancashire. Station staff were helpful in identifying the route home for me. I was well looked after by the lovely team onboard the 1733 service to Leeds. The conductor, September, and the catering staff Tracy and Piotro are a credit to your company. Excellent customer service, lovely smiley happy people and brilliant at their jobs.

items.title: Good but table was dirty in first class
items.review_text:
I took the train from King's Cross to York on 10th November at 18:18 in first class.

The service was good. The servers are friendly and efficient and generous with the food and drinks.

I chose the vegetarian curry - it was very small but the taste was okay.

The only negative was that the table in first class had not been cleared from previous people eating meals when the train left King's Cross. They did come soon after departure to clean up but it gave a poor impression. The table should be cleared before passengers board the train, not after it has departed.

items.title: They sell more tickets than the number…
items.review_text:
They sell more tickets than the number of seats you find on the train.
Had to stand for almost 3 hours on the London to Edinburgh train. Ticket cost £87.
.... and I was not alone. In our coach more than 20 people had no seats. 
Extremely unfair.
I also have pain in my leg because of sciatica and it made my journey even more difficult. This company should think about the well-being of passengers as well not just the profit they can make by selling tickets for an already fully booked train or at least warn them that there are  no seats available and offer tickets at a lower price as a 'stand by'before payment.
Even though I requested a seat number as seat reservation is mandatory I didn't get one, I got' a counted place'. It wasn't even a last minute booking. 
Unbelievable! Please don't sell tickets if you cannot offer a seat. Think about the passengers!

items.title: LNER staff Gerard and Awais were amazing!
items.review_text: Gerard and his team were amazing. So kind in putting me at ease and helping me  in making my  connection which was scheduled to be a matter of  a few minutes between  arrival at Stevenage and connection with Thameslink for Gatwick. Special thanks to Gerard and Awais for looking after me so well and ensuring I got the connection with their sssistance. Very special staff, so caring and attentive. It made my day. Thank you.

items.title: Irresponsible and unethical company, pathetic services
items.review_text:
I have booked a return ticket from London Euston to Birmingham New Street for 3rd October 2023. But there was a strike actions on my local train line, and therefore I am unable to get to London Euston and take the train to Birmingham and back that day. I have requested for a refund on the 28 September 2023, it took this company more than 10 days to review this matter. On 8th October 2023 I checked my LNER app, it said that my case has been cancelled, with no email received to explain why my case has been cancelled. They simply just don't care about their customers!

I was unable to take the train that day due to strike actions of those train unions. I am the sufferer who couldn't travel according to plan. But this company certainly don't look after their customers. The service they provided is purely pathetic and it is the worst of all train companies. I have certainly booked many tickets with this company. But because of the way they are handling this matter.  Going forward I will no longer book any train tickets with them. This company is obviously a ridiculously irresponsible company with no ethics.

items.title: Slow train but well compensated
items.review_text:
Had train journey from Kings Cross to Edinburgh and back with LNER. Was pleasant (although air conditioning was malfunctioning slightly).
But, significantly, it took longer than expected, by around 30 to 90 minutes. 
So the reason for the positive review: i have been compensated for cost of tickets within 2 weeks from date of travel with minimal difficulty

items.title: LNER Customer Services…
items.review_text: Just had to ring LNER Customer Services for the second time within the last 4 weeks (different reasons). All I can say is what a fantastic service they have. No waiting, straight through and spoke to the most helpful, no quibble representatives.

items.title: Terrible Service Terrible Customer Service
items.review_text:
Booked well in advance and paid just shy of £600 to go from Durham to London RTN. Evening before I see a notification on my phone that the train has been cancelled due to lack of staff. Contacted customer service and told there were no seats on any train and that I should go to the station and wait to see what trains we could get on but no guarantee that we would actually be able to get on the train.
Offered a refund but told it would take up to 14 days to process (not acceptable). Cancelling travel arrangements screws up peoples plans and costs them, LNER need to accept this. Speaking to a friend about this and they told me the same happened to them approx 2 weeks earlier on the same train (10:30 from Durham to Kings X). This is obviously a known issue with LNER but they choose to still sell tickets and treat customers like cattle. However, LNER still managed to hike the price of first class tickets up to just under the 2k mark for the same journey - disgusting.
Ended up driving down and will never even consider using LNER again. Totally screwed up the weekend plans.

items.title: I am only giving them 2-stars because…
items.review_text:
I am only giving them 2-stars because their competitors are so dreadful they barely rate 1-star. I have been travelling between Edinburgh and Newcastle several times a week with them (and their forebears) for more than 10 years. 

They are often late, the guards are usually rude, and last night they kept us on a train for 3 hours, kicked us off when it was apparent we weren't going to be able to return to Edinburgh (not their fault, but...). All guards then completely disappeared, they closed their info booth and left 500 people standing there wondering what their options were. 

I was lucky in that I had a place to stay in Newcastle, but imagine you are a student travelling from London to Edinburgh and you are thrown out in Newcastle with no info or help. Genuinely shameful behaviour, and it was abundantly apparent that they were just waiting it out so they wouldn't have to give people other options.

I will still need to continue to travel with them, because the other options are even worse, but I can't recommend them at all.

items.title: I'm sorry but your customer service is…
items.review_text: I'm sorry but your customer service is not fit for purpose. I emailed 20th of May. I got the automated reply. I chased on the 3rd June, again automatic reply. I tweeted asking for a lead time for replies and the guy said just ring us ... No that defeats the object of emailing. So I have again chased today. Please remove the email facility if you can't or don't have the capacity to respond.

items.title: Incompetence Inc.
items.review_text:
Appalling company. 
The online booking system failed and no booking was made, but they took £179 anyway. And they can't tell me when I'll get my money back. 
I also tried to make a booking on the phone but that automatic system didn't work either. Worse still, the man in the sales team told me I was using the "wrong keypad" on my phone, and if I used the "other keypad" it would work. And just how many people have phones with two keypads? 
So I'll drive London to Edinburgh. Doesn't take much longer, and the petrol will cost about the same. The big plus is that when I buy petrol, I actually get some and can use it!!

items.title: We cancelled a trip within 24 hrs and…
items.review_text: We cancelled a trip within 24 hrs and couldnt get a refund back. I requested for at least a credit, but they are unable to give that either. My trip was for a family of 4 for 157 pounds. They could have at least given me a credit! I'm sure this happens to alot of people, what a money hungry company.

items.title: Thanks to the Tories train travel in…
items.review_text: Thanks to the Tories train travel in Britain is difficult, LNER, being state run, is the exception providing a generally good service under the circumstances. Parts of the network crippled by under investment resulting in delays but nowhere near as other TOCs.

items.title: I was provided with excellent service…
items.review_text: I was provided with excellent service from SIMON HARRISON who was a member of staff on the 16.33 train from London to Bradford on 23/9/23.  He was charming, polite and helpful and made the trip enjoyable. I wish more Train services offered this service. Thankyou

items.title: LNER lost property team is horrendous!!!
items.review_text:
’m completely appalled by the attitude and misconduct of the LNER customer service and lost property team. Last mont I lost my suitcase on a cross country train heading North that was picked up by LNER in York station, via missing X. I sent a confirmation email as well as a code for my suitcase which was a direct match, so I was pretty confident that it was my suitcase.
I called York before travelling, just to make sure and they confirmed they had my suitcase. I made a four hour journey from Bristol (on a strike day) and waited 40mins only to be told my suitcase was sent to ‘Newark’s north gate depot’. I was given a number to contact them that never worked, I was passed around from one customer personnel to another,only to be told 2 weeks later that my suitcase has been lost!!! When I tried to further enquire, they couldn’t give me any information about how the suitcase was lost? They couldn’t even let me speak to their manager!! I was just told the situation is being “escalated” haven’t received any updates and it’s been 10 days since. 
I am absolutely devastated as I’m only a healthcare medical student, I had my stethoscope, my laptop in there, and my placement portfolio.

items.title: Missed my flight
items.review_text: At Heathrow, I bought a ticket from Kings Cross to Lincoln. Got to Kings Cross and found out the train was cancelled. I'm not from England so I had to scramble to find my way there. Got to Newark and was forced to ride a coach. Heading back to Kings Cross, the train was delayed in Newark. This plus closed tube stations made me miss my flight back to Canada. I've been trying for the past month to get 'delay pay' and kept getting bounced between East Midlands Railway, LNER and National Rail. Is this the way to treat visitors?

items.title: LNER Staff Discriminate Based On Age
items.review_text:
A first class ticket does not give you anything extra.  Don't waste your money.  I've waited an entire month for a response after my formal complaint.

Upgraded ticket to first class as it was an early train and wanted breakfast before reaching work.  As I waited for the staff to offer food and drinks, the person skipped over me and offered the last bap to the person after me that boarded at the same time.  I then had to walk after them to find out if I could at least get a coffee or tea, they said they didn't have any hot water on the train, and were saving the remaining food "for those that need it".  As the person after me was older, I'm assuming they are only offering food to the older travellers.

I've put forward a formal complaint and asked for the upgrade refund on the 12 July, the day I travelled, and just received a response today, 11 August, from Maddison V.:

"Unfortunately, this is a complimentary service and is not included within the price of the ticket."

Biggest waste of money, terrible services, staff clearly discriminate as there is no other reason they skipped over me as if I was just an empty seat.

items.title: Excellent service from the LNER Team…
items.review_text: Excellent service from the LNER Team for our outbound and inbound journeys from Northumberland to London ! The food, drinks and snacks were excellent and the staff were helpful, friendly and nothing was a bother to them. I would highly recommend LNER and we will definitely be travelling with you again very soon. Well done 👍🏻

items.title: Brilliant help and support from an lner staff member today.
items.review_text:
I would like post another five star and thank you review for brilliant lner service today.
At Berwick Upon Tweed station my carriage on the cross country train was uncertain. I was in first class but as the train was in two sections it wasn't clear where to stand on the platform.
I asked the staff and one chap helped me. I explained my mobility wasn't good tonight after a long hike.
He assured me that he would not let the train go until he was absolutely certain I'd found my seat.
Sadly I don't always hey such consideration in what can be an unsympathetic world.
I am 6ft 4ins and the chap was taller than me. I don't know he name.
Please pass on my thanks for his support and assistance to the lner employee in question. I believe that we should pay tribute where its due.
Thanks again.

items.title: My Train was delayed by about an hour…
items.review_text: My Train was delayed by about an hour from NewcastleCentral, I asked an lner member of staff on the platform if i could board an alternative earlier train, said no, either buy another ticket or wait. Had to change trains at York, approached another member of staff on the platform, which train i could take, as I had already missed my connecting train, told me to ask her colleague as she was doing something else, seriously poor customer service.

items.title: Still no refund
items.review_text:
I completely understand that the customer service team is most likely under a lot of pressure, however, there either needs to be more consistency with their productivity or hire more staff.
