I have been chasing a refund from a journey that I took on the 21st of April. The last contact I had with the CS team was on the 9th of May and after chasing have just received an email today and their reply completely ignored all of my previous correspondence with the last CS agent I was speaking to and they didn’t even confirm that I had / will receive my refund. Really frustrating considering the amount of money I have spent on this train company over the last 2 years only to be met with poor customer service and numerous train cancellations & delays.

UPDATE:
After being directed to their contact line by their social team, I have to give CS agent Kieran credit as he managed to sort this issue out immediately. Very grateful he resolved this unnecessarily drawn-out problem so quickly and professionally! Wish I could just give him 5 stars. Thank you!

items.title: The best train operator around
items.review_text: The best train operator around! Their App is great, website good, timely reminders, offer you perks - slowly getting there with the first class product. Great work!

items.title: terrible company typical tory…
items.review_text:
terrible company typical tory privatistion would never have happened under british rail
and at least dick turpin wore a mask.

items.title: Outstanding Customer Service
items.review_text: I just wanted to give a shout out to Kate and Judith on the 2058 from Newcastle to Durham on 07/10/23, both of which are truly outstanding assets to LNER! Their personable and pleasant manner made our experience exceptional. They exemplify the best in customer service, and LNER is fortunate to have them on their team.

items.title: I contacted Ben at LNER Customer…
items.review_text: I contacted Ben at LNER Customer Services on 0345 722 5333 this morning to ask for his help with my refund for a cancelled train and he has sorted it within hours. Very well done Ben, your efforts are much appreciated.

items.title: First train delayed by over two hours
items.review_text: First train delayed by over two hours. Return journey excruciatingly uncomfortable. Church pews are more comfortable than these seats.

items.title: what train system runs this slowly
items.review_text: what train system runs this slowly. everthing is speed in transportation today. 6 1/2 hours london to Edinburgh. never again

items.title: Horrible management
items.review_text: Horrible management! I am traveling a lot but never saw such a bad service.Our train stopped about 1,5 hours due to accident and I understand that.But then train started to run and at New Castle station stopped.An operator said everyone had to leave a train.No suggestions what we had to do next.We are seniors and had a heavy luggage so it’s not easy for us to get in and out.No a single person was on the platform to explain what we suppose to do next.Then next train came in,we got in with our suitcases,but there were not any available seats.So we are we’re staying about 1,5 hrs in the train to get to Edinburgh.So we travelled about 8,5 hours instead of 4.I was dizzy and had swollen legs. Stay away from this line!

items.title: Excellent from start to finish our…
items.review_text: Excellent from start to finish our recent journey from King's X to Saltburn. Spent time in first class lounge with comfy seats,drinks and snacks. Half hour before our trip due we were told we could board. Lovely little lunch with drinks and snacks. Offered extra drinks many times.comfy seats and WiFi was great.

items.title: The one star is for a girl called Jen…
items.review_text:
The one star is for a girl called Jen that helped me today. This isn’t aimed at her! 

I have been trying to sort our tickets out for the last 24 hours and still not resolved. 
We were due to travel next Thursday to Edinburgh but unfortunately my dad has now got a crucial hosptial appointment which has meant we needed to move our tickets by a day either side of travel. 
Last night nobody on the phone or web would help us. 
Thismorning someone moved out travels to the correct day but down graded our tickets with no refund 

Finally we got through to Jen and her supervisor who helped us with our return journey but we lost connection 

Since then every one we have spoken to have said we shouldn’t have been allowed to change the ticket and we are now going to be stung for £900 to rebook! 

It’s absolutely appalling customer service with no empathy as to what your customers are already going through. 

Horrendous! I won’t ever be recommending you.

And please dont patronise me with a reply
Telling me to talk to your customer care line because there is no ‘care’ in their agenda at all

items.title: Terrible customer service
items.review_text:
Although our trip from London to Edinburgh was very good (1st class and hence the one star, which also had to be given), the “trip” today was  absolutely terrible. 

We had the train of 13.30 (first class again). Delay due to an incident had been issued almost immediately. Nothing we or LNER can do about it, so we patiently waited until further notice. We were given many updates and people of other trains were stuffed into the 13.30 service. After 4+ (!!!!!) hours of waiting, the service to Kings Cross was still cancelled, another train after us which was more empty was allowed to leave and we were moved to the next train which would be the last one to Kings Cross. This one was completely full (people, even elderly standing). Employees were anything but helpful. All saying we had to go to another person. When we said to one of the employees “you (LNER the company, not the employee herself) are making people crazy” (due to the constant unclarity of their statements), her very not helpful nor customer friendly reaction was “you people are making ME crazy”. After that I was yelled at to go into the available train which other LNER employees told us were full and we couldn’t go in. 

Completely understand that an incident is out of your control but the way customers were handled here was appalling.

items.title: A good booking process plus fair prices…
items.review_text: A good booking process plus fair prices from Doncaster to London...easy delay repay if needed and booked directly plus a small cashback to be used against future purchases...win win!

items.title: Nicest friendliest staff
items.review_text: I unfortunately got on the wrong train, and the first stop was York. The lady serving food and drinks was so so helpful, gutted I didn’t get her name, and helped me plan my journey back down south. She spoke to the train manager for me, and he sorted me out a return back to where I needed to go free of charge. The train manager mark was so helpful and kind about a honest genuine mistake. The mistake could’ve cost me £120 otherwise, and he also found me a seat up to York else I’d have been stood for 2 hours as the train was full. I finally got home but the experience was made so much better by these two. A credit to the company. I was so grateful

items.title: 1st class ticket 2nd class service.
items.review_text:
1st class return from Peterborough to Durham. Good service going out although 2 tickets purchased and we was not sat together. 
First would have liked to swap for an earlier train. Looking on the app it wanted an extra £440!!! For the train just an hour earlier! Either theirs space or not!? 
Returning the service was not what’s expected for the price. (£350 return!) 
It’s over 2 hour journey. Meal was offered and I chose the Cheese and Pickle Stottie (Roll) it was very dry and cold. No crisps available. Sweaty looking Apple tart offered. Ran out of Pepsi max. No hot drinks service until 15 mins before arriving at destination. 
If you pay considerably more for a 1st class service it needs to be 1st class. Not standard with a packed lunch thrown in.

items.title: It's a big thumbs up from me
items.review_text:
My wife and I have had several journeys this year on LNER and have found their service brilliant.
Decent prices when booked in advance
Ability to select seats .. very easily
Comfy too
It's a big thumbs up from us

items.title: Rail travel as it should be
items.review_text: We travelled along this line from Peterborough to York for a short break. From start to finish the staff, there and back, were excellent. Helpful and available. The train was on time, comfortable and clean. The hot food offerings in first class, very tasty. We always seem to expect the worst in the UK with rail ravel so this is a huge thank you for being exactly as it should be. It was a huge pleasure to travel by this line.

items.title: No way to run a transport system
items.review_text: Not the worst UK rail company but not that good. I travel every couple of months with LNER and for every other trip there is a problem. In my recent journey, there was an issue with the electric supply to the kitchen, and no hot food or drinks. Before that the train was delayed by over an hour. The upside is that the delay-repay system works well and I only end up paying for every other rail trip. But, this is no way to run a modern rail company.

items.title: 0n the 10 10 from Durham
items.review_text:
0n the 10 10 from Durham.  Our train from Durham at 9 10 was not running.  We had a bit hassle about the tickets on the train. Shame we weren’t told our train had been cancelled -  

However we jumped onto the next available train where we where really looked after by Jackie , thank goodness she was there to rescue our experience! 
 she put us at ease and made sure we where looked after by her & her team .

items.title: First class! Not what you would usually expect
items.review_text: Don’t waste your money on first class. The carriages are not significantly better, and the complimentary refreshments are dire. I avoided taking food on board, as I was expecting a lunch menu, and wine. They had horrible sandwiches, apple juice, tea or coffee. 187 ml  bottle of wine was £5! They have no menu, you have to guess what sandwiches they have. It’s like 1970 style sandwiches and fruit cake. The train is clean, the staff are friendly, but first class is not typical first class. Bring your own snacks!

items.title: They took my money for a train that was never going to run
items.review_text:
Booked a train through LNER website which was operated through Grand Central. GC cancelled the service days before we travelled and LNER never informed us. Staff at Doncaster said we need to buy another ticket which we could get a refund on as they said this wasn't our fault.

Over £100 later and we were on a train, standing all the way to London.

I try to get a refund for the tickets we were forced to buy and their customer service is simply a joke, either ignoring to hope you go away or just going round and round in circles.

Opened a case with the rail ombudsman who surprise surprise sided with LNER. We had a refund of our original tickets but we're still out of pocket being advised to buy more tickets which we would be refunded for.

Apparently LNER don't have a system they can let you know that a train has been cancelled almost a week before it was due to run but 'they are working on it', and it's all my fault, I should have checked before.....I did but couldn't get through to anybody when the train was missing off the departures.

No doubt they will either ignore this or blame Grand Central, but my contract wasn't with them, it was with LNER.

We travel to London on a monthly basis, it's often cheaper to drive which I will be doing from now on, won't travel with LNER or Grand Central again.

items.title: Dont believe the majority of reviews here
items.review_text: I have been travelling monthly from Durham to London Kings Cross for over two years, and I find the negative reviews about this route to be excessively harsh. In my experience, the trains are predominantly punctual. Opting for first-class travel, I've consistently received excellent service. The meals included in the ticket are delightful, and access to the first-class lounge at Kings Cross is a significant perk, offering a warm place to relax and complimentary beverages. However, there's room for improvement in comfort; the seats could be more comfortable, and the headrests are quite hard. Notably, other train operators using similar train models have softer headrests. Therefore, I suggest LNER consider upgrading to softer headrests for enhanced passenger comfort.

items.title: Shout out to Molly
items.review_text: Molly on the LNER Socials is an absolute asset to the company. She is always happy to assist, is personable, always very understanding and just a delight to deal with. Thank you again Molly, you’re amazing.

items.title: After spending £270 on a advanced…
items.review_text: After spending £270 on a advanced ticket, I submitted a request to the refund team and was told by the BOT it will take ten days to respond, they never responded in ten days and because  the travel date had passed ( before the ten days timed out) I couldn't change my ticket. This is just plain wrong and needs correcting - the BOT could have easily checked my details and made a recommendation based on the detail

items.title: Booked for First Class Service. Got Third Class Service
items.review_text:
What a dreadful journey. I paid for First Class travel as I have been on a special trip. 
So ten minutes out of King's Cross was given a cheese and pickle roll - all prepacked and very stodgy. That was it - that was my food offering for a 4.5 hour journey. Was told that the company which also does Ryanair catering - forgot to put food on the train!!! and it was happening all the time. Also if I wanted a gin and tonic - there might be a problem as they were running out of cans of tonic. There was no wifi. The seating was spacious. 
But take a tip - never book first class with LNER - it is not good value for money and you end up starving at your place of arrival. I recommend saving a lot of money booking standard class - and getting our own food at the station retail shops before boarding - you sure wont get any on the train. First class LNER travel - a pure rip-off

items.title: Delay Repay unpaid
items.review_text:
In the first half of last year I travelled with LNER a few times and one of those times my train was delayed a lot, meaning I was entitled to Delay Repay. I submitted the claim within 28 days and waited. After two months of nothing, I called LNER and the approx 25 minutes including hold time conversation with their CS team went something like this:

Me - "Hi, I want to check a Delay Repay claim, the reference is LNER-23xxxx-ABCD, I haven't been paid yet"
CS - "Yes, I've found that, let's have a look"
Me - "Can you tell me why it's not been paid?
CS - "I can't see anything on the system, but I'll get that sorted out for you... you can expect payment in 10 working days"

In the latter half of last year, I was able to rack up another three Delay Repay claims, all submitted according to their requirements. Did I get an email/letter saying that they were unable to pay my claim? No. Did they pay my claim? Also no. So I will have to call them again and waste even more of my time that I will never get back in order to chivvy them into action. 

As my family have reported similar with their Delay Repay claims and I have read dozens of reviews here with essentially the same comments, it seems that LNER have discovered that if they just sit on Delay Repay claims without paying them unless the customer calls in and asks where their money is, they will have a non-zero number of passengers give up their claim because due to life happening they are just too busy to follow it up. As a result, LNER will actually have to pay out less money than they would if they just paid each valid claim automatically as I have found other companies do.

I know LNER CS read these reviews and will probably insist that is not the case, but if that were so, why have I got 4 of 4 Delay Repay claims not paid, eh? I'm sure the Ombudsman would be interested to find out why... If any other LNER customers are reading this and you have had a similar experience, be sure to click the 'helpful' button below my review.

items.title: The train that never existed
items.review_text: We had little choice about the day we needed to travel. Booked a train knowing there was engineering works, due to take around 5 hours instead of 3. Booked first class to make it less stressful. A week or two before travel got emails about change of departure time so that we would arrive at the same time but depart 90 minutes later - thought great! On the day of travel, checked the LNER app and learned everything was set, no further changes, yet we couldn't find the train on the departure boards. Approached a ticket office, and were told with no hint or apology that the train we were moved onto never existed. She even implied that we were the problem, or had made a mistake. I can see why she wears a badge asking people not to abuse her. We were told to try to get on one later and see if the guard would let us. With a 2 year old to get to bed, the proposed arrival time was far later than we had planned. Even right until the departure time, the LNER app told us there was no problem. I find it unbelieveable that in 2023 LNER can book us onto a train that never existed, fail to tell us, fail to apologise when asked, or to make any commitment about getting us to our destination on another train. Once we were on the train, the manager said that the seat reservations system was not in operation but that people should try to stick to their booked seat, leading to very tense scenes and arguments between others. Paying us a 100% refund is not a fair solution, a 2, 3 or 400% refund would be more appropriate in this situation.

items.title: Great customer care
items.review_text: Although the trains dont always run on time the customer care is spot on. Really helpful when travelling with a young family.

items.title: Poor time keeping.
items.review_text:
I don't travel by train often.  
I brought the ticket through train line. 
It gave 7 minutes to transfer at Stoke-on-Trent.  
The train arrived 9 minutes late. 
No announcement was made.  
I missed the connecting train.  
I need to wait nearly an hour for the next train.  I'll be late for my meeting and it'll have knock on effects all day. 

Keep people updated!  A sorry mate doesn't really cut it.

items.title: Overall ridiculously overpriced
items.review_text:
Overall ridiculously overpriced. So many cancellations on a weekly basis. 
Ice cold coaches even outside temperatures is low.

items.title: Amazing bacon sandwiches!
items.review_text: Nice train, tasty bacon sandwiches! Train was a little bit crowded though, with some people standing.

items.title: another great journey
items.review_text: I had pretty much the same experience as last time I traveled with LNER. Clean train, clean toilet, friendly staff and no delays. I recommend

items.title: Trains either delayed or cancelled…
items.review_text: Trains either delayed or cancelled between York and London every week or staff are on strike. Overpriced and shocking service.

items.title: I don’t think I’ve ever had an LNER…
items.review_text: I don’t think I’ve ever had an LNER train be on time. The countless amount of connections I’ve missed is just awful. The staff on first class also treat people awful, they look down on me because I’m younger (22?!) and talk to me like I’m nothing. If I didn’t have to use LNER I wouldn’t.

items.title: Always had positive experiences but on…
items.review_text:
Always had positive experiences but on this occasion I had to contact LNER about a issue i experienced on my journey.   
Had a response to my query 5 days later and was very satisfied with their response and felt listened to and my query was resolved to a very high standard

items.title: No Food as Advertised even though we paid for First Class - Cancelled Train
items.review_text: We got to King Crossing in London a little early and learned that our 11:30am to Edinburgh was canceled. They told us to take another train that had people from three reservations on it. Standing room only for an hour even though we paid full price for first class tickets. We transferred to another train at our first stop and were told that because our train didn’t go to London they didn’t restock with food and that they would restock in Newcastle. No food for now. They restocked a little later but ran out of the sandwiches two cabins before they got to us. 6 hours and no food except crisps and biscuits. They did leave a menu on our table though, which just added insult to injury. No full menu available as advertised and nothing but sandwiches to start with and we didn’t event get that. The attendants basically told us that they ran out of food and all they could do was say sorry. I asked if we were going to “restock” again for the rest of the train and they said we were not. I guess we’re just supposed to not eat a real meal for 6 hours. Very poor service. It was also very hot on the train. I won’t make the mistake of giving Lner my money again. Lesson learned. Unless you love being frustrated and hungry, stay away from Lner!

items.title: I got charged a £10 admin fee to refund…
items.review_text: I got charged a £10 admin fee to refund a £14 ticket for a cancelled train. Absolutely robbery.

items.title: Lied about another services tickets not…
items.review_text: Lied about another services tickets not being valid (they were due to a strain cancellation earlier), meant I had to spend 2 hours waiting for the next train.

items.title: Disgusting treatment to a Family of three (two adults plus a…
items.review_text: Family of three (two adults plus a 7-year-old), today (Sunday 26/11/23) at the 20:05 train to Wakefield from Kings Cross we had the most disgusting experience one can ever imagine. We were originally had booked the 19:35 train to Wakefield from London Kings Cross. Both the notice board and the app said there was a delay so the train would leave at 19:47 instead. We went there a few minutes before 19:47 when the operator told us that the train left on time! He asked us to go to the ticket office to be issued new tickets for the 20:05 train which went relatively smoothly. The 20:05 train as one can imagine was quite full, because there were quite a few people like ourselves. We took seats at the first class because that was the only place we could find where we could sit all together as a family. The ticket man came shortly after, insisting categorically that we have to move and claiming that there are seats further to the front. I told him I would go check and come back. I did. There were only a few scattered single seats. It would have been impossible for us to sit next to our 7-year-old if we went there. The ticket man insisted we have to move no matter what I said; all reasonable things. It was the most disgusting, numb and inhuman thing I’ve been told. Not only it was a complete health and safety issue walking down the many carriages with my little one and all our stuff, with people sitting on the floor, with stuff all over the place blocking doors and passages, but we would also end up seating separately, which is unacceptable. An error which was completely theirs (notice board and app providing false information), cost us the safety of our journey and our sanity. LNER and specifically the ticket man on the 20:05 exhibited a horrible, unprofessional, numb, disgusting, indifferent, and inhumane behaviour. They need to train their stuff to handle such situations properly. Would they assume responsibility, if I had fallen down, trying to literally climb above people, luggage, and other sorts of obstacles to go get a seat on the front carriages just so that they can keep the first class seats empty for NO REASON?!?!?

items.title: Shame about the seats
items.review_text:
We recently travelled from London to Lincoln on one of LNER's new 'Azuma' trains.  First, the good news: the train departed on time and actually arrived early.  The train crew were polite and friendly, and unlike on many other trains there was ample room for our luggage.  On the whole, the 'Azuma' seems to be a decent enough train, if not up to the standards of equivalent European trains, but then it is a long time since the UK was a world leader in rail transport.   

However, what spoilt the journey for me were the hideously uncomfortable seats.  Granted, they do have more legroom than on some previous trains, but the whole experience was like sitting on a solid ironing board for 2 hours.  The journey was very uncomfortable, and despite being fairly fit for my age I had difficulty getting out of my seat on arrival at Lincoln, and I had cramp for a long time afterwards.  When I contacted LNER about this, they said that great care had been taken to design the seats as ergonomically as possible!  If this is the case, why do the First Class seats look so much more comfortable?

I would add that we had just returned from a European trip, during which we had travelled on a wide variety of trains.  On none of these did I experience any discomfort at all, even though some of the journeys were longer than the 2 hour LNER trip.

items.title: Bucket list
items.review_text: I fulfilled one item of the list,which was to have a ride on a fast .My self in a wheelchair and my girl PA set off from Scunthorpe to Doncaster changed and carried on to York and return.The help we received from station and train staff was first class they could not do enough for us .The train ride itself was fast and smooth. lt made my day .Thank you all including PA and friend.

items.title: Brilliant Service and Journeys.
items.review_text:
Brilliant service on our outward and return journeys from/to London/Kings Cross and Edinburgh/Waverley on 14 & 18 August 2023.
Booked in advance - best prices, seat selection and light refreshments included. Courteous staff and comfortable window seating, with train arriving a few minutes early in Edinburgh; but delayed by 51 minutes on the return due to trespassers on the line north of York - kept fully informed on the PA system (that's all you want, including being advised all trains at a stand).
And the next morning when I logged on to my computer, there was an email from LNER advising that due to late arrival we were due £101.80 compensation, which required one click - already now received.
Beats the hassle of airports/flying and the £40 compensation received following a tortuous application to a well known travel insurance company after our plane was forced to land in Bode, because a blizzard in Tromso prevented landing at our destination, resulting in an overnight delay and the loss of nearly a day in our 3 night holiday!
Thank you LNER - brilliant service and journeys.

items.title: Waited a while to get through but definitely worth it in the end, amazing customer service
items.review_text:
I wanted to reserve seats for 7 people but the website and app would only let me choose 4 (even though the drop-down menu went to 9), it suggested making 2 sets of reservations which isn't exactly helpful when you want to sit together 

Reluctantly I called expecting to be told "computer says no", I had to wait a while to get through but when I did Mary Watson went out of their way to help, making sure the seats the computer offered were all together then waiting on the phone until I'd received the email confirmation.

Mary was an absolute credit to LNER I hope the management team recognise this outstanding level of customer service and give Mary the praise and reward they deserve

items.title: Terrible Service, Standards Have Dropped
items.review_text:
This is their 1st class experience!!
Broken head rests, cold tea, worst bacon roll ever, rude staff😂😂

items.title: The wonderful guard called Karen
items.review_text: The wonderful guard called Karen, she could not be more helpful. Left my bag in the wrong train, helped it helping me get back, could not ask for more...a real treasure.

items.title: My experience with LNER has been fantastic
items.review_text:
I have limited experience with LNER as I often travel on a different line with a different operator due to my location. I do sometimes travel via London as the journey can be slightly faster albeit more expensive with more changes. I have done this for several years now and my experiences on LNER trains have always been good with nothing to complain about. Other operators I typically have to deal with overcrowded carriages, toilet issues and various other problems which I have not experienced on a LNER train.

I find it's usually when you have a problem and speak to customer service that the true nature of a company is revealed and where most train operators can be incredibly harsh and even in extenuating circumstances it can be troublesome to rectify the situation, I had an incredibly unfortunate event occur which meant I was unable to travel last year. I did not have a refundable ticket and was not entitled to a refund, however LNER upon hearing of the situation were happy on this occasion to show compassion in an unprecedented situation. I think this speaks volumes as to the type of company this is. I would not hesitate to recommend LNER and will be prioritising them in future even if it means going a bit out of my way!

items.title: Avoid! Use Trainline!
items.review_text: Wouldn’t ever use this company again. If they cancel your train you argue for a month for a refund and then when they tell you that they will give you compensation- they don’t. Then tell you that you are lying about any calls to you. Avoid! Avoid! Avoid!

items.title: False information given in Kings Cross forced £ 85 Charge!
items.review_text:
My train with Grand Central from King’s Cross to Doncaster was cancelled (departure 4.28 on the 27.07.23). The next grand central service was the 4.48 which would mean I miss my connection from Doncaster to Newcastle with LNER. (Left at 6.12 & the 4.48 grand central would get into Doncaster at 6.22).  I spoke to a member of LNER staff in the station and was told to get on the 4.30pm train which I would be joining in Doncaster anyway. 

Two staff members (Kay)Revenue protection officer  and Paulo Train manager insisted that the information I had been given from the member of staff at Kings Cross. (I didn’t get their name, I was rushing for my train straight from work with two heavy cases) was different to the information they were given. They showed me emails they received from LNER - which I had never been privy to. I have been charged £85.80 for a ticket from Kings Cross to Doncaster which in itself is daylight robbery. I use the train every two weeks to travel up north and the instances of cancellations, delays and strike action over the last two years are ridiculous. 

If I’ve gone from the information the member of staff has told me in King’s Cross to get on the 4.30 train. How can I be charged 85£ for getting on THE only train that allows me to make my connection.  You have the following clause in your T&C “However, if cancelled or delayed trains cause you to miss a connection, you are advised to ask a member of staff; in exceptional circumstances staff may endorse your ticket for travel on alternative routes”. How have I been charged so much with absolutely no consideration and empathy from LNER train staff? 

I would like a refund for the ticket they made me buy. Please get in touch with me about any further information.

items.title: Always late
items.review_text: Always late, delayed, cancelled, crammed or on strike. Please do better for your people and country

items.title: Avoid LNER's refund hell
items.review_text:
Do not purchase a ticket through LNER. They have the most appalling refund policy I have ever encountered.  While riding the service is fine, I would  strongly recommend booking through Trainline or another competitor in case  the ticket is cancelled or you need to change the ticket. They also charge £10, but at least the process is easy, uncomplicated, and they pay you the correct sum.

I purchased a £154.70 return from south east England to Scotland through the LNER app as I was offered a little discount and I thought I would try them. I was forced to change the date and time, which they say is fine, for a £10 fee and as long as you purchase a new ticket first. 

Even though neither set had been issued they demanded that I collect both sets of tickets, take photos of them, find booking codes for both tickets hidden amongst the emails that they had sent (that were not on the tickets themselves as one would imagine) and submit these in an online form. They then rejected the refund because the tickets on the older set of tickets had not been cut in half. All of this is information that they had generated and was designed to make it very difficult to claim the money they owed me.

On the third attempt I finally got a refund, but not for £144.70, as I should have received, but for £140.02. Apparently the extra £4.68 was an undisclosed and unagreed admin fee on top of the advertised £10 admin fee that they were already charging. The issue is pending with the Rail Ombudsman as I feel that, on principle, this is unacceptable behaviour.

I complained to the Rail Ombudsman about the "sludging" that they are evidently performing to try to acquire their customers money. Particularly as vulnerable customers will certainly not be able to navigate the paperwork minefield they create and will lose out. They were of no use at all and told me that this behaviour is out of scope.

I will never purchase a ticket through LNER again. Hopefully this will help you avoid the awful hassle that I have had.

items.title: Travel assistance
items.review_text: We traveled Darlington to Edinburgh and return with booked assistance I cannot praise the assistance staff  enough on time polite and helpful well done LNER

items.title: How this Train Manager made our day
items.review_text:
This was our first trip coming up from London to Harrogate together by train (given the missus prefers the discretionary travel by car) and we were immediately plagued with issues...

Poorly distributed services on tube lines (tube services not going through to King's Cross on scheduled times). Passengers blocking the closing doors. Guaranteed hot and humid weather.

So unsurprisingly, we missed our original train.

Of course we had flexible tickets, but how could I possibly convince the missus that trains were the ideal mode of transport? We had plans, that we'd now be late for, and I didn't want her driving home from North Yorkshire in the late evenings in future...

So we get on the next train heading in the same direction - exhausted and deceived. 

Up until the Train Manager, a slender man called Steve, asked us for our tickets. A pleasant smile, a thorough inspection of tickets, and wished us a pleasant journey - A true embodiment of great customer service.

Though shortly into our journey, we realised we packed the wrong food (surplus fajita filling, as opposed the fajitas themselves), and roared into laughter amidst the inconvenience.

But Steve picked up the bizzare laughter, and asked if everything seemed alright, and to no issue, we explained the circumstance...

...only for him to gladly come back with a basket of G&Ts and gluten-free brownies, stating they did have some wraps for fajitas if we wanted them. "Mistakes happen, and it's such an original story - I couldn't let you go hungry"

We smiled ear to ear knowing such a selfless and caring man, let alone one in the world of customer service, existed. It undoubtedly takes a special person to go out of their way to ensure that two random passengers in standard class have pleasant and enjoyable journey.

I've travelled on UK trains, throughout the country, for nearly a decade, getting a train on average once every two months. 

And this man, surpassed any experience. It's now safe to say, we'll be getting a train from London in future, especially a LNER. Let's just hope Steve's on the train too.

What a kind man.

(@LNER, the train was on 9th September LNER 12:35 KGX - LDS: commend this gentleman!)

items.title: L N E R  DISGUSTING SERVICE  AND AFTERSALES EVEN WORSE
items.review_text: We upgraded our seats on a journey from Durham to Edinburgh to first class and were told after boarding our train that they had forgotten to load any of the complimentary drinks or snacks onto the train, that was the full reason for doing the upgrade,  we wrote a complaint on 11th December to l n e r  as we were told by the stewardess and were told ee would receive answers within 10 days but have heard nothing, we also had a very bad experiance on return journey that night and L N E R have not bothered at all, i think this type of treating customers in this way is deplorable and people should be made to answer complaints. Especially being such a well known and huge company

items.title: What’s the point offer WIFI for clients…
items.review_text: What’s the point offer WIFI for clients in a train for long distance if it is not working?

items.title: Customer service at LNER (Brian Blakey)
items.review_text:
I recently had a somewhat frustrating experience with LNER and was on the verge of giving them a one-star rating. However, my perception of their service took a complete turnaround when I reached out to their customer service and had the pleasure of speaking with Brian Blakey.

From the moment I made the call, Brian demonstrated a level of professionalism and commitment to resolving my issues that truly impressed me. His demeanor was courteous and patient, and he actively listened to my concerns without rushing or interrupting me. This alone was a refreshing change from previous encounters I had with customer service representatives from various companies.

It is worth mentioning that hey are still trying to resolve the issue efficiently but because of professionals like Brian that I now have a renewed faith in LNER's commitment to customer satisfaction.

items.title: Disappointing customer service to support journey termination
items.review_text:
On Friday 1st December my train from London Kings Cross to Selby was severely delayed. Unfortunately, due to wires on the track we were stuck between Newark and Doncaster for approximately 3 hours. My 1 star review is not due to the delay, as the staff on the train did the best they could and ultimately the situation was outside of their control. 

The nature of my complaint is the terrible customer service we received when the train had to terminate at Doncaster. We were advised approximately two hours into the delay that our train would be terminated and that onward transport (bus or taxi) would be arranged to take us to our destinations. 

When we arrived at approximately 11:30pm there were no taxis or onward transport that had been organised. There was no process in which individuals were grouped into destinations or advised to wait inside until transport was sourced, instead, all passengers (including elderly and young children) were made to wait outside. There was no process in which people could get into a taxi and passengers were left to find out with each other which stations they needed to get to. Furthermore, the taxi firm that was allocated the onward transport disregarded passengers for Selby, with 6 taxis in a row taking passengers to Hull or Brough. At this time the outside temperature was -3. 
At 12.45am we still had not been allocated transport (after waiting outside in the sub-zero temperatures), despite raising to the taxi team, who then advised myself and three other passengers that they were being stood down. This left us without any transport and unable to book transport privately (myself and another passenger were contacting local companies and Uber, but were not getting these confirmed or were on other jobs).
We then proceeded to go to Platform 4, as were advised that some LNER staff were still there. I did not catch the name of the woman (blonde hair, approx. 35-45 years old) but she was not interested in our concerns and stated, out loud, that if any passenger came to 'kick off' that she would shut the door and remain in her office. She did ring a taxi, but could not confirm that this would definitely take us to Selby or let us know when it had arrived so we did not have to wait in the cold. This woman and her colleague remained in their office and did not return, to advise when any taxis had arrived or to check on the remaining passengers. 

We returned to the taxi pick-up point and, after some time (it was 1:50am at this point) a taxi turned up. When asked if they would take to Selby they initially refused until one of the passengers said that would pay double the fair and in cash. I did not get to Selby train station until 02:30am. 

I hope that LNER use this experience as a scenario for training, to ensure that all their customer facing staff are appropriately trained in these situations and have the initiative to ensure ongoing transport is organised effectively and efficiently, making sure that all passengers are safe at the very least.

items.title: Very good service
items.review_text: Very good service! I had a fast ride and the staff were really friendly. Honestly LNER is my favourite railway company.

items.title: utterly useless online facility for…
items.review_text: utterly useless online facility for attempting to reserve a seat on edinburgh to london train-system seized up time and time again-pay your CEO and execs less and spend it on your IT infrastructure-no excuse that too many customers trying to access it at once-is not fit for purpose like so many similar retail online setups

items.title: No problems so far
items.review_text: I've had a great experience on LNER trains so far, with no issues. The app is very good.

items.title: Forced to buy overpriced first class ticket, seat said available, next stop kicked off as it wasn't. More than double the price advertised on Trainline app - but due to slow wifi I couldn't order it
items.review_text:
I had to take an LNER service from Edinburgh to London instead of my original avanti west coast Glasgow to Euston. The train was packed, only one available seat on first class which I was charged £243 (despite having upgraded originally, my ticket was therefore not honoured. I had tried to buy the ticket on trainline for £116 but your wifi didnt work, tried to explain this to the ticket inspector who was extremely aggressive explaining that £116 was for an advanced ticket - I tried explaining that I knew that and I was trying to buy the ticket before the train departed, I was sat on the train for 10 minutes before the official departure time and the ticket was certainly available to buy, its just the wifi was so slow that I decided to just buy it through him directly,  but he didnt seem to understand and kept aggressively explaining how it was impossible to buy a ticket for this train because the train was moving... (as for why I hadnt bought a ticket earlier that is because I had been told my avanti west coat ticket would be honoured) I also didn't expect the train would have no available seats in standard class. My phone battery was also very low until I was able to charge it on the train - due to my original 930am train being cancelled and waiting until 14:30 to get a new train. 

Despite the seat being labelled available I had to move at the next stop as someone had booked after all. Please refund. My options where pay £243 or stand for 5 hours, and after already running around trying to catch trains that were cancelled by avanti all morning I just needed to sit down. The staff were no help and seemed really rude and uninterested. In the past when a train is unexpectedly full the rules on sitting in first class are relaxed, I didn't get any of the first class service but still paid £243, my original journey to London with avanti cost £23, and £243 is more than double the £116 if bought on trainline, which seems an insane price to charge - and for what exactly? The privilege of having a seat for a 5 hour journey and a tiny portion of food it seems.

items.title: Top class service
items.review_text: Top class service, Leeds to King’s Cross. Train manager Lyndsey, professionalism personified

items.title: The seats are torture
items.review_text: Are the Azuma trains the most uncomfortable in Europe? Even in 1st class

items.title: Nice modern train
items.review_text: Nice modern train! Azuma’ but the seat was SO uncomfortable! Really really bad!

items.title: We were late
items.review_text:
We were late, but not due to Lner. We got food, the people were lovely.
Thank you for being so kind.

items.title: Appalling
items.review_text: Appalling. No seats. Rude conductor. Absolute rubbish.

items.title: Train delayed by 34 mins
items.review_text: Train delayed by 34 mins but friendly staff made up for it.

items.title: Awful company and service
items.review_text: Awful company and service

items.title: I have been trying for the better part…
items.review_text:
I have been trying for the better part of 3 months to get the Delay Repay and Perks credits I am due. I have submitted numerous email complaints and have been promised action on a number of occasions but nothing has happened. My queries have also been passed to their “loyalty” team twice but I have heard nothing from them.
The cost of Advance tickets from Leeds to London also seems to have increased dramatically in recent months, even when bought a month or more in advance.
There’s no point in just saying contact customer services-I’ve been doing this for months.

items.title: I had missed the previous train I had…
items.review_text: I had missed the previous train I had booked to London due to a late connecting train. The officious ticket collector took real relish in charging me £160 for a brand new ticket, for a train that set off 20 minutes later.  LNER lost absolutely nothing by taking my money from my previous ticket, it’s such a scam to not even provide a discounted rate for a new ticket if your connecting train was late and you have to catch the next train. My journey to London has cost me £300, and to boot the ticket collector was quite obnoxious about it. Terrible customer service skills, and overall a very unpleasant experience with LNER

items.title: A series of negative experiences
items.review_text:
A series of negative experiences :
- a train that was 29.5 minutes late and the system does not even acknowledge there was any delay. The 29.5 minutes of course became over 30 minutes in reality but the operator deliberately tricks the arrival time so it is precisely within the limit.
-also uses unscrupulous advertisement practices when trying to sell railcards - when I purchased a wrong railcard and only found out later that I was tricked because the fine prints were not clear, I was told once it is bought the wrong one it can never be refunded nor even exchanged to the correct one.

items.title: 5 stars for Jai Lynch!
items.review_text:
1) I booked 2 advanced tickets from Edinburgh to Kings Cross for 21 May at 16:10  
2) Broken track between York and Doncaster resulted in my train being cancelled.
3) Advised by LNER representative at the station to get the 13:00 train, get the rail replacement coach from York to Doncaster and then pick up the train from there. 
4) Stopped at Newcastle for about 20/30 minutes. An announcement stated that the train was cancelled as they were unable to find a train driver. 
5) Got another train from Newcastle to get to Kings Cross, however this was packed with all the people from the cancelled train as well as the people already on the train - Stood in the hallway for over 5 hours, then got cramped as more people got on from York. Ended up sitting on the floor.

Understandable that things happen thats out of anyones control. Sent an email to customer service and spoke to someone on Twitter. LNER representative on twitter gave my a link for delays and I received a refund of 50% for both tickets. Received an email back from the customer service team and Jai Lynch sent a very personalised email apologising, they saw that I had already received a partial refund but they decided to give me the rest of my money back.
Can't thank them enough for listening and caring.  
I hope my review gets seen by Jai Lynch and they receive some recognition the company for being a GREAT customer service rep!

items.title: Still no refund for train delay.
items.review_text: My train was seriously delayed from Edinburgh to London. When I applied for a refund in May, I got an automated email saying there was an error. I contacted customer service to find out what was going on and I still haven't heard back, despite chasing them repeatedly. It is now June and I've had no refund or explanation. What waste of time.

items.title: Top class experience from top class staff.
items.review_text:
Really surprised at the negative reviews. I am travelling down to Newcastle from Glasgow and I am delighted with the First Class service and the quality of the accommodation. The staff could not be more friendly and helpful, and CarolAnne and Sobia in particular were so cheery and helpful It left you in a good mood all through the journey. Everyone I came into contact with, from the train Manager to the waiting staff were working as a team and gave a strong impression of loving their jobs.
Thank you LNER, I will be back. 😎🙏

user_profile.name: Mr Charles Robertson - BNI Glasgow & South Lanarks

items.title: First Class is just not worth it, don't waste your money
items.review_text: Very disappointing, paid a LOT of money for our first class return tickets Arbroath to King's Cross. Train wasn't particularly clean, on return the first class toilets were out of order so a long walk. Food has really declined in quality, although LNER's get out clause is that it is Complimentary" one wonders what you are paying all the money for. Some of the lady staff were lovely, others bordering on rude, especially the steward walking up the aisles shouting "anyone who got on at Newcastle wantin' fed" we sat across from a young New Zealand couple who were so excited in anticipation for the first class experience and left feeling very ripped off. This used to be such a good service, now I feel cheated. We won't be wasting our money again on this.

items.review_text: Avoid them with eny cost

Our flight was delayed, we sprinted across the station and made it to the train on the exact same minute of departure 7:36pm. The guy standing there had the time to say it is too late, not getting on now, and lock the door behind, would not let us on. This way they get to charge us double, these are the exemplary employees which will get the pay rises. Terrible service in a broken rail system. You are better off with any other means of transport wherever possible.

LNER to London King’s Cross via Waverley

items.title: well.LNER
items.review_text:
Appreciate the prompt response. I know I can claim compensation. if you check my record you will see that my train journeys are delayed/cancelled over 60 per cent of the time. how LNER remains financially viable defeats me based on the amount of compensation it has to pay out but it’s not a private enterprise so suppose it’s funded by the taxpayer. only once was a cancellation due to industrial action. I can accept the following - trespassers on the line, adverse weather, lines down, train blocking track, smashed windscreen, no driver which left me stranded at Spalding for 1.5 hours before I could return to Lincoln on my original outgoing train!!, carriage door not closing making train unsafe, no manager, no driver ( presumably due to short notice absence??) what I find difficult to accept is being advised no train crew with only 30 minutes notice - no mention of disruption on the screen - what disruption occurred on 27th May? it was supposed to be a normal day as the strike action was scheduled for 2nd, 3rd June?? surely LNER knew well in advance if they have sufficient staff on duty in the right locations. I note that the Leeds train was also cancelled for the same reason at the same time. my concern is that LNER continues to sell tickets for journeys they are unable to provide. the knock on effect is that people, such as myself, incur non refundable expenses for hotels, theatre tickets, etc. i book in advance to obtain affordable tickets - average refund for me is about £27 for cancelled journey. I have actually forfeited about £450 in bookings for hotels/theatres over the last year due to LNER not delivering a service. needless to say I no longer book theatre matinees and pay additional fee in case I have to cancel accommodation due to LNER not transporting me to London or anywhere else to offset enforced cancelled hotel expenses.  this is nothing to do with strike action as I know not to book on those dates. the staff I meet are usually excellent but the reliability of LNER is an embarrassment and passengers are treated with contempt. I get a text saying your train is cancelled so you need to find an alternative journey. it’s become the norm. that’s totally unacceptable. why do we put up with it?? i don’t want compensation - nothing compensates for being left stranded or having to squeeze into an overcrowded train and arriving home hours late.  i won’t be booking anymore journeys in the near future - it’s too stressful. 

well.LNER. what can I say. I travel regularly but it’s fingers crossed. latest was Saturday 27th. 19.06 cancelled with 30 minutes notice - no train crew???. why would I EVER book LNER again. good news is they refund promptly. I just want to book a train that actually travels. how can they not have enough train crew?? am i confident in LNER? well. I have lost so much money due to onward expenses - non refundable theatre/hotel tickets. train refund doesn’t even cover it. LNER rubbish but when you live in Lincoln not much choice. I managed to get home but 1 hour 30 minutes late and a change at Peterborough instead of direct - terrible service. I’m getting far too old for all this hassle.  not sure I want to book anymore journeys.

items.title: Travelled alone on the 1500 London…
items.review_text: Travelled alone on the 1500 London King’s Cross toEdinburgh on 28th May. 1st class service was amazing from the minute I entered the carriage. The staff make it - happy, caring and just very pleasant people, especially Hayley and Steve

items.title: A total chaos
items.review_text:
The train was late, so we did not have enough time to board on the right coach because the train was in a rush to leave the station, inside it was packed with standing passengers and it was a real challenge to get to my seat. Some people never made it to their seat. 
This happened because they had cancelled an earlier train and they literally "stuffed" the passengers in one train, so they would not spend money on another.
I believe this was against all health and safety regulations, that is it illegal and deserves investigation. 
For a very long journey from Nottingham to Edimburgh people never had the chance to go to toilet, have a drink or get to their luggage. If any emergency had occured in this train, nobody would be able to deal with it and people or pets would have died.
This is unacceptable, discriminative humiliating and intimidating for every passenger, because we do not travel for free, we pay an extreme price for train tickets , so we deserve a lot more dignity than they allow us.
Very disappointed. And this is not the first time. It is a disgrace for England, for English culture and perhaps for lner as well. But, maybe not for them, as they might not bother as profit is above all, right??

items.title: First class luxury travel
items.review_text: First class luxury travel. Unfortunately, LNER wouldn’t know the meaning of it if it smacked their executive board in the face. From over cooked bacon rolls for breakfast to over-crowded ‘cattle market’ travellers (simply not first or business class) travellers who are now attracted due to the lack of ticket scrutiny or low ticket prices. Maybe the LNER plan is to offer First Class to everyone; just it’s not First Class and as such should not be referenced as this. I’ve witnessed the demise of First Class over the past 3 decades; it’s no longer first class at all. It has now become upper standard class. No proper breakfast or dinner service. No silver service premium service. No menu of any worth for either time of the day either; it’s a shambles but the staff do their best. This service used to offer real first class rail travel (1990’s), unrivalled in Europe. Now, it’s a 125mph tuck shop and an utterly dreadful low class of experience.

items.title: Excellent service this morning from…
items.review_text: Excellent service this morning from Newcastle to Kings Cross. Very pleased and would love to use 1st class again on the return trip today if seats are available.

items.title: Rude and unkind controller
items.review_text: Rude and unkind controller, who should be fired, dirty seats and floors all for an extortionate price.

items.title: Best train operator in UK
items.review_text:
Best train operator in UK. Smart and comfortable trains.
LNER staff brilliant,friendly,helpful,polite and smartly turned out.
Travel with a Assistance Dog on all rail journeys, LNER look after us.
Negatives, personally I have none
Thank you LNER (Durham)

items.title: 1st class and offered an apple or orange as a meal
items.review_text: Took the train 1st class leeds to London for a 20th wedding anniversary weekend . 1st class lounge closed , no hot food on the train. The only thing that was offered is a apple,orange or a pot of yogurt.  If you provide or sell a 1st class ticket is make sure you can provide the service and if cannot you should have a equivalent.  The email was sent with a very poor reply. Not a great start to a wedding anniversary unfortunately . Would think again about trying to save for that 1st class service next time .

items.title: Computer says NO…
items.review_text: Son lost his railcard that i renewed from Wakefield Westgate on losing the card from station to home went back to see exactly same member Richard with receipt today 24hrs ago nothing he can do cant issue a new card cant refund my fee....spoken to desk who also cant do anything ....came home rang up helpline...again not a thing visit station.....strike because this is reason why country sucks no help at customer services yet taken my money

items.title: Expensive ticket - poor service
items.review_text:
Expensive ticket, lacking service.
The train operates a scan QR code to have drinks delivered to your seat. Tried this several times but wouldn’t work and queried this with staff who then announced the service was not available due to lack of staff.
Such a poor service for the cost.

items.title: LNER to Doncaster
items.review_text: The staff members on LNER are amazing and they always go the extra mile for customer service. The LNER Azuma's are fantastic trains with great levels of comfort, speed and reliability. The stations LNER manage are always well kept, clean and well signed. This ultimately means that my experience between London King's Cross and Doncaster was a very enjoyable experience and will recommend this train operator to anyone.

items.title: The Conductor onboard the train I was…
items.review_text:
The Conductor onboard the train I was on had a great attitude and the biggest smile on his face! So chatty & friendly too.

Shame we couldn't change our tickets for an earlier train to avoid sitting in KGX for AGESSSSSSS but apart from that it was great.

items.title: Might as well run a donkey ride service.
items.review_text: Might as well run a donkey ride service.

items.title: Possibly the worst customer service…
items.review_text:
Possibly the worst customer service ever.
Six weeks on from my delayed train, I'm still waiting for my refund. Been all around the houses trying to get someone competent, no luck. Rail ombudsman next. Totally incompetent.

items.title: Useless
items.review_text: Again they are inefficient and a waste of time . They cancel my train I apply for a refund   Then I find they cancelled my refund request ?? They reinstate it and now 4 days later they’ve cancelled it again !!! Absolutely useless ! In future I’ll just drive

items.title: Customer care at it's best!
items.review_text:
I would like to commend the service provided by LNER members of staff at Newark Northgate today. 

Our elderly Mum is recovering from an injury and short hospital stay and my family and I were bringing her home from Newark to Kings Cross. 

Firstly, the welcoming ticket staff member at the station asked if we required assistance and this was promptly followed by two of the Station Officers coming to the our aid almost immediately. They were wonderful and showed great inpersonable skills as they wisked away some of our suit cases and took care of everything from the platform to the train. 

The experience could have been quite different for our Mum as she was reluctant to travel home,given she is in recovery, and is currently in a wheelchair. 

The assistance on the train was just as exceptional with special thanks being extended to Farouk,the train Manager, on the 10.55 to London, who showed kindness and an excellent customer care approach. 

Thank you LNER,you have made our day! 

With gratitude, The Hurley - Chambers Family London

items.title: I have been emailing LNER since 20th…
items.review_text: I have been emailing LNER since 20th March to get a refund of my train ticket as I purchased an anytime ticket, but it excluded the train I was on.  I was unaware of this.  The guard said I needed to purchase another ticket which I did and sent evidence of this. I was told then to contact customer services and they would refund the original ticket.  I have emailed constantly and not had a courtesy of a reply only to the first one which I assume was automatic to say we will be back to you in ten days.  My reference was 23REYPSIBM.  I have tried calling no response and today when I called the contact centre is shut due to unforeseen circumstances.  So hard to get this resolved

items.title: Honestly the most uncomfortable journey…
items.review_text:
Honestly the most uncomfortable journey ever
The seats are made of ply. I've just travelled from London to Aberdeen and I am never doing it again
 I hurt everywhere.  

Other that is was ok

items.title: LNER website worst ever train booking experience.
items.review_text: LNER website, utterly appalling and totally unfit for purpose, no surprise lost contract, shambolic embarrassment service of highest order.

items.title: Delayed / Customer Service was shocking
items.review_text: Train was delayed, although the staff were friendly, I missed my connecting train and because it was bought through another website the 2 companies just keep pushing me back and forth. I tried speaking to an agent on the LNER chat and it keeps refusing and sending me in a loop hole, the customer service is shocking.

items.title: 10 May 1710 Peterborough to King's…
items.review_text: 10 May 1710 Peterborough to King's Cross  customer service above and beyond, amazing staff

items.title: Great 1st class service
items.review_text:
Travelled from Leeds to London with LNER. I can't recall what type of train it was. The ride was smooth and fast.

I travelled in 1st class and was surprised to get a hot lunch menu, plus constant snack and drinks service. The staff were superb.

The carriage could have been cleaner though. Plenty of messy seats with previous occupants crumbs.

items.title: Quick customer services
items.review_text: Unfortunately on the May 1st Bank Holiday there was a person hit by a train in London and this caused severe overcrowding on the London-Edinburgh service which I was catching from Peterborough. I had to stand for the entire journey for nearly 2.5 hours which was very uncomfortable, but the customer service team were quite quick to respond to my request for compensation and organised a refund for the journey under their Seat Guarantee scheme. Thank you.

items.title: I have very bad experience of using…
items.review_text: I have very bad experience of using lner flexi season ticket. Their phone  customer service and even their staff at station unable to clarify me how to use the lner smartcard.  Also after I lost the smartcard  which used for 1 day only they informed me I lost entire season ticket amount  I need to buy a new season ticket for me to travel on their train

items.title: I can’t fault LNER
items.review_text:
I can’t fault LNER. I’ve been travelling with them since they took over from Virgin. 

The staff are so wonderful, in particular Sharif from todays journey 1630 from Kings Cross to Durham. 

Thank you so much 💗

items.title: I have been trying to book tickets from London to Edinburgh
items.review_text: I have been trying to book tickets from London to Edinburgh for nearly 2 months online and after at least 20 attempts I have still failed.  Every time I get thrown out saying something has gone wrong but it doesn't tell me what.  I have phoned and eventually got through to a human being only to be told that I can't book tickets on the phone as far ahead as the end of July so I need to go back to doing it online where I should be able to book.  So I go back to online booking and still can't book - you guessed it 'oops - something's gone wrong'  Do you want passengers or not LNER?  This is really crazy.  All I want to do is book a ticket and I've wasted at least 2 hours in total and have still failed!

items.title: Poor Customer Service
items.review_text:
I waited for over 5 weeks to receive a Ticket Alert from LNER to find out their timetable for trains on 26th June.
It came yesterday. It is not a normal service. The journey involves getting on a bus from St Neots to Bedford. LNER should have warned me of this disruption and the extra 2 hours on this journey.
I first requested the Ticket Alert on 28th March 2023.

items.title: Poor service rude staff
items.review_text: Poor service, rude staff, stuffy cramped trains, trying to bring a bicycle on the train? Haha forget about it. Will avoid in the future.

items.title: Appalling
items.review_text:
Appalling, they offer you a first class upgrade on your booking through your account which proceeds to show an error message when you try and book it then you phone them up and no one has a clue what to do and offer no help whatsoever then hang up whilst you're speaking to them. Incredibly rude!


Just responding to the reply below. If we upgrade on the day we can't gurantee all 5 in our party will be sitting together or that we'll get the same price we have been quoted. This seems to be a reoccurring problem from speaking to your colleagues that they have no idea how to fix. It seems to be really misleading to offer something that people have no way of purchasing apart from on the day.   It's really poor service, i thought avanti was bad but LNER customer service are even worse.

items.title: Exceptional level of service
items.review_text: I received an exceptional level of service from passenger assistance as well as the onboard staff.

items.title: Appalling service
items.review_text:
I purchased a ticket to travel on the 18:33 train from London Kings Cross to Leeds. I travelled down to London the day preceding and got sick on the train, which lead to me being severely ill and spending the night in hospital. Once discharged, I travelled as quickly as I could to the station, explained to the lady at the booking desk that I wanted to get on the train leaving at 16:33 to get home as soon as I could, and she saw my hospital discharge letter and told me to go quick before I missed it (only 1 minute left before departure). I was then rudely accosted and treated like a criminal by your guard “Craig 1D22”, who wouldn’t even let me speak or explain why I was on the wrong train, just spoke over me and threatened me with legal action and fines. I showed him my hospital discharge letter and he just kept threatening me, saying “are you going to pay then” loudly over and over in my face. I burst into tears and just paid to get rid of him as he was starting to scare me. I’ve never been treated like this before and I’ve spent the whole journey home crying, I’m so so disgusted by how I’ve been treated.

I want my £67 refunding immediately, I had already paid for the journey so I don’t see how sitting on an empty seat 2 hours earlier is affecting your services or costing you money, it’s absolutely appalling to have charged me to do it, especially when I’m only travelling home early after spending the night in hospital.

items.title: a big change from last time we went
items.review_text: a big change from last time we went. travelled Leeds to Kings Cross. no delays or cancellations either way. service and food has gone up several levels - food was really good - full english on a train again! thought i'd never see this again. keep up the great work LNER

items.title: Azumas look sharp, but uncomfortable seats, choppy ride and narrow aisles.
items.review_text:
Took the 6:32am from York - Kings Cross.
First time on an Azuma. Train on time - bonus, boarded train and sat down on a very uncomfortable standard class seat with extremely light padding and poor ergonomics. Phone needed a charge and had to scramble under the seat to find the plug sockets, very strange design. Narrow carriage so no room for trolley service, delivery to your seat unavailable and I couldn't be bothered to go to the buffet car as the train was swaying from side to side every time it went over points or negotiated a camber in the track.
The design limitations resulting in the rough ride is a real and very annoying design flaw, as if you need the toilet and happen to flush it as it's going around a camber in the track, the jet of water spurts out of the toilet bowl and ends up all over the floor. Dangerous, unhygienic and unacceptable.
The staff on the train were friendly and the trip back was a little better as the table service was available, but at the not unsubstantial ticket price of £291 for a standard class day return, for spending 4 hours on an uncomfortable train I feel these trains are a step back from the much more comfortable class 90 225's. Not impressed.

items.title: Painless refund for delays
items.review_text: Train was very clean and staff professional and polite. Long journey >4 hours. Over 30min delay accumulated over the course of the journey due to various signal issues. Kept updated. Unlike many other railway companies, LNER made it completely painless to claim a partial refund with a one click response to an email the company sent just after the journey. Makes me much more likely to travel with them again.

items.title: Bad internet and the online food ordering
items.review_text:
The service company provides on the trains is quite behind current era. Even aeroplanes have better internet then lner trains. It interrupts all the time and speed is unusable. 
Also the service and the app for serving food is very hard to use.

items.title: Normally good, need to communicate changes better
items.review_text: Normally have a decent experience with LNER (not going to rant about delays and cancellations I've had with them as most of the time it has been beyond the control of LNER). I remember once a male staff member on a train from Newcastle to Edinburgh was so empathetic and helpful with me when I was distressed and I remember it to this day. Unfortunately they recently made some changes regarding claiming back credit if you didn't get your train. I used to find this super helpful because I travel a lot with LNER for work and work plans change a lot, so if I didn't get on a train as plans have changed I could claim it back in credit. They no longer do this anymore for advance (specific time) tickets. I'm not annoyed they implemented this change as I can adapt, I'm annoyed they didn't communicate the changes clearly e.g. an email which means I have wasted money on a train I couldn't catch and because I didn't know about the changes, I didn't think to change the date or time of the train as I thought I'd get the credit back.

items.title: Absolutely rubbish customer service
items.review_text:
Absolutely rubbish customer service! I have just spent the past twenty minutes on the phone being reconnected to different lines by their incompetent staff. Furthermore, I cannot alter a ticket that I have booked with them over the phone, as it has to be changed at a phone call station. 

The train that we got up from London, never had its toilets cleaned and there was hardly any food on it. 

I would honestly say, spend your money with a different rail company as these lot are a bunch of clowns! I will no longer be giving anymore of my money to them! 

Utterly disgusting treatment

items.title: Complete crap - standing all the way to Scotland
items.review_text: Complete crap. Not able to respond in an emergency situation when trains get cancelled and because of that get completely jam packed. All the way to Scotland. Can't wait to get full refund on this journey of over 4 hours standing.

items.title: Wilfully mislead to avoid paying out
items.review_text: Had to get a later train as my original one was cancelled. I put in a delay repay claim as the 2nd train was also delayed, and the total (including delay caused by the cancelled train) was meaning I was due some money back. I set all of that out in my claim but they only looked at the 2nd train delay. Not the total time I lost overall.

items.title: Do not use LNER …
items.review_text: My booked train at 6.53 was cancelled because Vandals had stolen some overhead lines. I was told to get the 7.13 train ... which was delayed due to no crew/and or hadn't left the depot .... this train arrived at 7.35 ... now we are sat outside Doncaster waiting for the lines to be checked ? I am now looking at over an hours delay before I get into King's Cross. Surely this could all have been sorted earlier ? Where was the mysterious train crew ? Why are we now on a journey that hasn't been checked ? Will I ever reach King's Cross ? I have given up getting to meetings in time even though I gave myself over an hour spare (and 2 supposed trains) and I have been charged over £110 for this privilege! Just simply appalling!

items.title: Grumpy Gary
items.review_text: I travel regularly with LNER and unfortunately today was the day I finally had a bad experience. Gary on the 12:30 service from London to Edinburgh is literally so rude not only to myself but to 3 other people around me and he made me cry. Absolutely vile attitude and spoke to me in such an aggressive manner. Not representative of the brand and not what I expect as a paying customer

items.title: Slow on service but willing to help for most of the agents
items.review_text: Always slow on the customer service but eventually someone will kindly help me. This time I was not awarded the 10% perk credit and they eventually gave me a coupon that is 10% of the ticket cost. Just in time before I have to book another ticket down to London.

items.title: Staff were incredible
items.review_text: Staff were incredible, nothing too much trouble, train clean and on time!

items.title: Every time ive travelled on the lner…
items.review_text: Every time ive travelled on the lner train to and from edinburgh to stevenage or kings cross in the past year theres been issues. Cancellations, delays and two trains worth of people packed into one with passengers forced to stand for hours. Ive just had to tell the whole train carriage and now anyone who reads trustpilot that i have a chronic pain condition in order to get my booked seat off another passenger so i can sit down. My previous train this morning an lner employee was aggressive towards me with no need. Disgusting service. Really makes it hard for people who need to travel south to have a good experience and its a long enough journey as is, especially for those of us who dont drive or cant fly so train is the only option. I went for lumo last time and I’ll be using them wherever possible from now on

items.title: Genuine, friendly people
items.review_text: I have spoken to three different members of staff this week in relation to a ticket change I was forced to make owing to childcare issues which were unforeseeable at the time of booking.  Each of the three staff members I spoke to were friendly, professional and showed genuine empathy. It was refreshing to speak to people who acted like humans instead of robots. My issue was resolved to my satisfaction and I would like to pass my gratitude on to the wonderful staff at LNER who helped me out.  Thank you, it was much appreciated.

items.title: Handling of time? Abysmal.
items.review_text:
Comfortable, but what's the point in comfort with stress?

Perhaps the worst case of poor handling on any public transit ive ever seen, everything goes **relatively** smoothly, albeit with a classic dose of problematic travellers. But all goes to pot outside of York. They announce we pull in soon, so up everyone gets and crams their bags into the doorway and gets off, right? Wrong. In that exact moment they decide to launch a  ticket inspection. And better yet. York has 20 minutes worth of delays going in!!!

So we're all crammed into this doorway while ticket inspectors are barging through the aisle and others are trying to get through and use the loo. And you announce that *soon* we'll be in York??? We spent 20 minutes jammed inside of a doorway until finally being told we are delayed. Couldve said it while we were all seated! And they still asked for our tickets while we were preparing to get off! Ha! 

Utterly crap handling of this service.

items.title: Not only has the train been delayed by…
items.review_text: Not only has the train been delayed by an extremely long time and makes me miss my next train but there’s also no communication what-so-ever and the time of arrival just keeps going up by 1-6 minutes at a time and has done for an hour, absolute joke

items.title: Wrong advice from LNER staff - £130 fine!
items.review_text:
UPDATE - Now LNER have replied to my 2 star review, saying I should appeal to their customer support. BUT I HAVE ALREADY APPEALED, and I was denied. How many times should I appeal?
ORIGINAL REVIEW: I was wrongly advised by some LNER staff to board a train without a valid ticket. The member of staff said 'don't buy a ticket just yet, you can sort it out with the inspector'.
This is what I did, and was issued a UFN for £135 (buying the ticket before hand would have been £45). 
I appealed, unsuccessfully.
I could have just bought the ticket before boarding, why did a member of LNER staff advised me not to??
I am a regular commuter, and was not expecting this treatment from LNER.

items.title: Parking nightmare
items.review_text: Parked in Durham to go to Edinburgh,it really wasn't clear that  you pay when you leave ,pay station didn't state this ,the app is useless and located me somewhere other than durham ,much better signage is needed,we almost missed out train and only caught it because we found a member of staff,far too stressful with 2 children

items.title: Don't travel if tall
items.review_text:
The standard class seats on LNER's Azuma trains are unbearable and cause severe back pain. If I do another long journey I would consider standing or sitting on the floor in the vestibule. I'm 6'2"
