Also the catering services are always limited in some way, I don't think there are ever deliveries to your seat which are advertised on the back of every seat in your face for the whole journey. Food trollies seem to be a thing of the past. They say this is due to staff shortages, I'd recommend hiring a couple of the 1.25 million unemployed people in the UK.

items.title: Newcastle Trip
items.review_text:
Returning from Newcastle after a weekend break, went into your ticket off at Newcastle Central station to get a ticket. I met Lisa, Customer Service Representative and First Aider, who was very helpful, warm, patient and polite and with an endearing smile. I do understand we tend not to flag up such experiences these days but prefer to emphasise on the bad ones. It is worth pouting out these wonderful experiences to encourage the Lisas we meet along the way. 

Lisa, you are wonderful. Keep doing the great work. People see and appreciate your sterling qualities.

items.title: Lee from customer service is a star
items.review_text:
I spoke to Lee from the Customer Service team on the phone today and I can’t thank him enough for his kindness and help. 

Was having an absolute mare of an afternoon and was at breaking point after missing my train. Lee was friendly, efficient, and professional but personable, and sorted me right out. Literally saved my evening and my weekend! 

Aside from the app & website being buggy every now and then, I’ve generally had really good experiences with LNER and it’s my train company of choice whenever I travel out of London.

items.title: Incredibly frustrating eat at your seat…
items.review_text:
Incredibly frustrating eat at your seat service that doesn't work and from searches hasn't for at least 2 years.

Don't offer a service if you cant make it work.

EDIT: I tried to checkout as a guest and was charged £6 before the website crashed and I got nothing.

Honestly stressed me right out on what was an otherwise pleasant trip.

The crew themselves were incredibly kind and helpful but that ordering website needs to go.

items.title: First class service despite a challenging day
items.review_text:
We booked First class to Edinburgh.  The comlimentary lounge was very good with free drinks and biscuits.  Once on the train the staff were very attentive with a choice of light snacks and drinks.  

For the return journey things were not quite so smooth.  The weather was very wintry.  Our train got cancelled with delays due to a broken rail.  During the journey there were further delays due to a train breakdown.  
Despite this the staff on board worked hard to keep us fully informed.  They also arranged a platform alteration at York so that those changing trains just had to cross the platform.  
We were advised quickly by text that a refund was due and this was processed smoothly within the stated time.  

On the whole a very good effort to recover from multiple train issues.

items.title: Brilliant service, great trains and staff
items.review_text:
The ticket inspector who was on the London to Edinburgh train on weds 15th Feb 2023, which left Newark at 12.46 was a credit to your company and worthy of a mention.
 He is amazing, so positive, happy and friendly, also super helpful with all the passengers even when there were problems. 

The train was perfectly punctual, the carriages were clean and a comfortable temperature. Seat reservations were working well. The at seat order service for food and drinks was quick and easy. 

Brilliant experience travelling on LNER from middle England to middle Scotland. Thanks.

items.title: I made a booking for a weekend away…
items.review_text:
I made a booking for a weekend away (from 6-9 January) in Skegness.  The trains were cancelled due to a rail strike.  I rebooked for 5-9 January.  That was also cancelled because of the rail strike.  I did not take the tickets from the machine at the station (surely that proves that I did not use them).  After nearly three months and many phone calls, voicebot circular routes and complaints, they are still holding on to my £94!
Refund now received ... Thank you ... today's news is a five star experience!. c

items.title: Berwick upon Tweed station has a first…
items.review_text: Berwick upon Tweed station has a first class lounge that is the shadow of what it was… no newspapers, coffee machine not working, TV is temperamental and turns on and off by itself…I do not know who is responsible of maintenance but it should be done immediately. Passengers pay good money to travel in First…

items.title: I just wanted to say how good the Passenger Assistance is
items.review_text: I just wanted to say how good the Passenger Assistance was yesterday - 22/03/2023. In particular Karl at Newark Northgate who went over and above to ensure I was well looked after.  The staff on the train were excellent also

items.title: Trains good, customer service slow
items.review_text: The trains are pretty good, usually on time etc. However their customer service appears dreadful. Emails are not responded to for literal months and refund requests are ignored way past their 10-day response time. I may pick someone else to travel with in the future based on these experiences

items.title: Company to the Third World Level
items.review_text:
This was the worst rail transport company I ever used, I went from Glasgow to London at Lomos and even the trains were more spacious. Today 19/03/23 Return of London in the train, which was supposed to arrive in Edinburg I time to catch the connection to Glasgow, to be home at 0030 I ended up home there were 2:00. And as a bad luck is not alone, the taxi's trip from Edinburgh to Glasgow was no better, I had to call Uber to go home, and the others who came in the same taxi driver went to leave them the house, here if if See the discrimination, just because I was not British. If I had arrived in time I had transportation home so I will present the invoice of Uber because I am not the other than the others, and I will want according to the law, the right to return 100% of the ticket value.
Finally this company is not at the Virgin level and so when you choose to travel, I prefer to use the cheapest plane that comes out and does not bring me problems. The government that delivers to private ones that will have fewer problems.
I want my money back, because in the final, I was discriminated against And they do not deserve consideration.

items.title: Is it possible to talk to a human? Only if you show great initiative
items.review_text:
Update- 21/3/23. A combination of a trust pilot review and finding an address on Facebook have led to the refund I was seeking. 
I still think that I would keep the score as it clearly has not been easy to make contact with LNER
I booked a return trip from London to Nottingham. London 13/3 Nottingham 16/3. Cancelled trip because of strike action. Immediate refund for 16/3 refused for 13/3. There is not easy to talk to a human and explain this was a return and the system is frustrating. I tried to complain using both a tablet and a PC. The complaint function doesn't submit. The chat bot doesn't like variation and I'm very frustrated.

items.title: this morning 09/03/2023 all train has…
items.review_text: this morning 09/03/2023 all train has been delayed because of the snow. when the train arrived Newcastle, i accidentally get on London north eastern railway, after that i realised this is wrong train my ticked is Lumo train company. then i buy new ticket. the staff man charge me new ticket £130, this is more expensive triple time compared to original price.

items.title: The best staff (humans) EVER! X
items.review_text: I recently travelled from London King’s Cross to Darlington with my very poorly daughter who had been in hospital in London unexpectedly. She was very weak and anxious and a lovely lady (I feel awful for forgetting her name but she used to be a police officer) helped me to get my daughter onto the train. Once onboard the staff had clearly communicated and everyone that passed us made an effort to ask how she was and if there was anything they could do! I felt so supported at a time when I was quite vulnerable and without question the staff went out of their way to help. I hope they get the recognition they deserve. Thank you from the worried mum on the train xx

items.title: Upgraded to first class. Last time I make that mistake.   and expected to…
items.review_text: Upgraded to first class and expected to be treated as a valued customer. Not at all. Dinner served as if they were doing me a favour and 1 beer in 1h 45. When I asked if further refreshments were available, I was told, only after the next station as this is the program. 1st class. Not so much!! Then they'll have the cheek to go on strike and expect the support of the public!

items.title: Paid 1st class but no food available
items.review_text:
Paid 1st class but no food available, no hot drinks. No meal. 
Poor lady Stewardess left apologizing.
Had to wait 30 mins to access 1st class lounge at Doncaster. Opened only when complaint made. Staff grumpy. A smile might have cracked her face!
Too little competition for good service

items.title: First Class - Don't think so
items.review_text: My wife and I booked first class return tickets with LNER from London to Leeds. Outgoing 16/02/23 and returning 19/02/23. Going was fine. Coming back we were issued with 3 separate tickets changing twice to get to Sheffield. The LNER employee at Leeds station was amazed that we had to do this as there are direct and fast trains from Leeds to Sheffield. Needless to say neither of these connecting trains had first class coaches. We are not in the first flush of youth and heaving cases on and off trains is not a happy memory. When we got to Sheffield we finally got on a train with a first class carriage and found our seats. Train departed and within five minutes there was an announcement saying there would be no food or drinks available as there was no HOST to serve us. Then we were informed that we could make our own way to the static trolley where on production of our first class tickets we could get some limited refreshments. My wife did this and came back saying the rest of the train was absolutely rammed with people and the trolley was not open and she was not attempting that experience again. So we paid for a first class experience on one train and we got 3 trains, no first class on two of them and no refreshments as promised and we had no food or drinks with us. Does not really match the way this service is advertised online. At no time were we told why we could not travel from Leeds to London directly or that we would not have any food or drinks despite the company having our details which they regularly use to tell me all about their great deals. Over a week ago I sent a complaint to LNER. about this shoddy service and to date there has been no acknowledgement or reply which is pretty poor customer service. When you pay for a service you expect, not unreasonably, to get it.

items.title: Insultingly small bacon roll
items.review_text:
Train left early, good job I made it in plenty of time. 
Ordered a bacon sandwich to my seat only to be presented with something that to be honest was down right insulting it would have barely filled the stomach of a new born baby. Not impressed. Only good thing was that the phone chargers worked unlike the megabus... bare minimum though really.

items.title: The best train provider in the UK
items.review_text: Travelled 1st class to and from Edinburgh/Peterborough on the Azuma. Such a great luxury train, and awesome service both journeys. The staff were great constantly offering hot and cold drinks, snacks, meals and rubbish collection. Trains were spot on on time. These bad reviewers need to try the other appauling train providers in the UK, LNER are definitely top by a long way on train quality and service. The only thing I would change is the lack of 2 seat options without people sitting opposite you at a table. The entire 1st class only has two pairs of 2 seats together that arn’t at a table of 4. On the return jouney those 4 seats face backwards which is a no for us, so we had to have a 4 seater table with strangers opposite us which took away the private feeling.

items.title: Utterly useless
items.review_text: Utterly useless. How is the service so poorly planned that you "catch up" with a slow local service? Having spent a week in Europe on trains, without 1 being even a minute late, it astounds me that the first train I use on returning to the UK arrives at my destination over 30 minutes late. Time for all the rail network to come back under public ownership.

items.title: Untrustworthy and rude
items.review_text:
My wife emailed LNER on 10/2/23 regarding a problem we'd had on a return journey from London the day before, part of which was asking why the app refused to let us look for tickets when there was still 20 minutes left before departure. After hearing nothing for 9 days she sent them a message via Twitter at around 18:30 on 23/2/23. She was connected to someone who seemed to have his attention elsewhere as his responses to her questions were taking an age;at one point my wife waited 8 minutes, and on asking if she was still connected still got no response. Eventually when they did reply it was to: "I work alongside our Customer Relations team, I can confirm that no refund would be due". So they don't work on that team, but know what their answer will be? My wife asked to speak to Customer Relations, at which point the person became very obstructive. After repeating the request several times he stated he would pass a message on to them.

Around 5 minutes later the phone rang and a chap introduced himself as being from Customer Relations. My wife asked, though, if he could speak to me, but was ignored and they continued speaking, saying that they agreed with the first person she's spoken with, and their policy was there would be no refund. Like that first person, this chap would not answer, either, why we could not book tickets before the train departed. My wife tried to explain what had occurred, only for the chap to go quiet, say nothing to acknowledge he was listening, and then, when she had finished, just repeated there would be no refund, as was their policy.
Feeling the Customer Relations chap didn't really want to help, my wife asked to speak to his manager and was told they would contact her within 24 hours. That was 3 days, and nothing.

If this is what LNER considers customer service, then I despair. But if they would actually like to prove they do want to help and contact us as promised, then we're still waiting...

UPDATE: further to the reply from LNER we received an email from the Customer Service Team that was nothing more than a copy and paste of the response from the Twitter reply. So we sent a response back, giving more details about what had happened and asked that they just look at the details rather than making a decision without all the facts. That was 2 weeks and 2 days ago and we have heard nothing. So clearly the initial response from LNER was typical - they just ignore you and have no interest at all in talking and showing a modicum of interest in what occurred.

items.title: Awful experience.
items.review_text:
Bought tickets 2 months in advance for 2 adults and 2 kids for London - Edinburgh.

Came on to the train and the train was far too overcrowded, got to our reserved seats and people were sitting on them.  After a heated discussion, they said they had the same seat number but funnily enough wouldn't show us their tickets when asked.

After speaking to an LNER employee; we were pretty much told to suck it up as he said LNER had overbooked the train and that we should find another seat (even though there were none available.) Ended up having to stand for 3 hours holding my sick 4-year-old son until all the football fans disembarked at Newcastle. Only then could we sit in our allocated seats after they had left.

You would think after spending almost £200 for tickets, you would think you would at least have a seat to sit on.

Shocking experience and will avoid using in future.

items.title: My experience is based on the poor…
items.review_text: My experience is based on the poor condition of the LNER class 800 and 801s. I hate that the customer service morons on the trains are just as thick as they are useless and on the Leeds services there is always problems with broken coffee machines and dysfunctional toilets. Every single class 800 and 801 on the London Kings X too Leeds services is always diabolical. The hiygene is poor. The toilets always smell of poo and the trains are never cleaned. The social media teams of all train operating companies in the UK are useless. The staff are rude. The trains are dirty. The catering is filthy dirty unwashed cups and crockery. The cleaning teams at Leeds station are lazy and I have walked onto several trains with filthy chairs covered in crumbs. The prices are expensive and whilst the East Coast Maineline staff have always had rods shoved up their butts since they dug into middle earth the good thing about predecessor East Coast Trains were the prices were appropriate and the points system unlike NECTAR which is touche was an awesome scheme save East Coast rewards was a decent price and allowed ECML managers NOT too put their head up their butts and con the disgruntled passengers out of money and the staff at Kings Cross are just so useless they are rude and unlike TFL do NOT help with queries and avaid maturity LNER are so expensive and the vegetarian and vegan food is always crap I have left several complaints about broken trolleys and dysfunctional toilets over the years but NOTHING is accepted by LNER LNER babble on into Eternity about manners but they are clearly NOT too be desired for customer service and information. It mames me extremely angry that LNER know nothing about their own fleet of trains they do NOT know when the class 91s are leaving ECML permanently dates and years or any MK4S. LNER are the rudest train operating company I have ever come accross and they are now worse than GNER who were owned by the sea containers from 1996 too 2007 in fact everything is so inconssisstant with LNER and what infuriates me is that the class 800s and 801s are diabolical they simply just dont work properly the trains are so unreliable and whilst I prefer the fabric seats too the horrible leather ones onboard the class 91's I prefer the reliability of the class 91 too the overrated class 800's the class 800's are physically weak they have got NO push pull power like their x class 43s did the trains are always having cracks and run more as a british train than English train despite having Japaneass technology although I am yet too learn the benefits of the class 800 family as they break into pieces extremely easily during crashes and emergencies and the buffet carriages and trolley at seat service is always broken meaning NO hot water and hot food and the class 800s do NOT have ebough space for luggage and capacity in fact the trains safety is a liability because I felt much safer on a crappy run down GNER valenta class 43 but one advantage GNER have over LNER is the law and order of the train operating company authority GNER were at least some what aware of what was going on where LNER even the most simple questions know nothing about their own company and the LNER representatives are a disgrace the onboard toilets on the extremely extremely MODERN CLASS 800 SERVICES are always blocked and covered in FAECES AND WASTE do LNER NOT have health and safety checks because their trains could really do with being drowned in ACIDIC VINEGAR for hours and the water and soap dispensers are terrible there is always food on chairs and the cleaning regimes are NOT long enough and lack of cleaning staff especially at barrbarrick Leeds station and the class 800s are replacing class 91s but out of the two class 91s are more reliable than 800s and the class 800s are alwaus having to stop in tje middle of nowhere its extrememy irritating.

items.title: Paid for a first class ticket and got…
items.review_text: Paid for a first class ticket and got third class service. Studiously ignored by stewards with long faces. Not sure why I bothered!

items.title: Awful.
items.review_text:
Awful.

No longer have the payment card and it’s near impossible to get my tickets. Why they can’t send them on a pdf I don’t know.

items.title: Just want to say a massive thank you to…
items.review_text: Just want to say a massive thank you to the train crews on LNER and in the customer services department, this is a business that apply's common sense when dealing with customers issues and is great at delivering a fantastic onboard experience, THANK YOU

items.title: Helpful staff but no information
items.review_text: At Kings Cross Station when my party went to barriers to access platform there were hundreds of people close to the barriers waiting, however no-one was being allowed through.  There was no information on boards or tannoy about why this was and never was in thr whole time I was there. Having heard my train called I tried to get through the crowd with my learning disabled adult son and 5 year old gran daughter, thankfully after 15 minutes and a lot of kind strangers (and some awful ones) the LNER staff member allowed us through. He informed us there was no room on my booked train, another staff member reiterated this both were pleasant and patient who knows how it must have been horrible for them too. LNER must get information to their customers who can make better choices, given the age of my granddaughter and my son I would have booked a room in a travel lodge and gone home on Saturday.

items.title: Open communication from the vrew on my…
items.review_text: Open communication from the vrew on my train about the delays. Service top notch in 1st class. Great service all around. Would use again

items.title: superb
items.review_text:
arranged to take a trip with LNER from Edinburgh to Newcastle and we had 2 wheelchair users.
Then the whole trip was reversed going from Newcaslte back up to Edinburgh 5 days later.
With both trips LNER were just amazing with their help and support.
Both journeys were fast, clean, quiet and totally flawless.
On the leg down we were slightly delayed but they made it all really easy and very much took the pressure off - even with an assurance that if we had missed the train due to airport delays they would have just put us on the next available train with no extra cost.
The staff were friendly and helpful and seeing their long red coats made me feel assured that everything would be ok.
Will definitely book with LNER again - they remind me of how good the railway used to be when I worked for BR in the 80's and 90's.

items.title: Ticket officer for prime minister
items.review_text: Me and my child travelled from London to Newcastle I was clearly an adult and had the correct ticket and my child was quite obviously a child with the correct ticket, the ticket officer did not believe my child was 14 and made me pay for a new adults ticket which cost me £102.75 he threatened me with British transport police and that I could lose my job if I “picked up a criminal record from this” absolutely shocking I won’t be using this train company anymore and I would ask for a refund but i probably won’t get one thanks LNER

items.title: This review is for the ticket office at…
items.review_text: This review is for the ticket office at Edinburgh Waverley. Top class service from ‘cashier 4’. Stations still need ticket offices.

items.title: Fantastic customer service
items.review_text: I had amazing customer service over the phone from a lovely and helpful member of staff called Karen. I'd bought an LNER ticket on Lumo.co.uk and needed to amend it. I had no luck requesting the amend directly with Lumo, despite speaking with two different representatives, so I called LNER for advice. Karen was kind enough to call Lumo on my behalf to discuss the situation with them, and came back to me with the advice I needed. I'll definitely go straight to LNER to buy my tickets from now on - very impressed. Thank you Karen :)

items.title: Amazing Customer Service
items.review_text:
I was having trouble booking a return ticket to visit my family in Northumberland for a birthday surprise for my grandson and within less than an hour of contacting them on Twitter, it was resolved and a very kind gesture offered too. The customer service was amazing and so easy. I have travelled the same journey last year and it was such a pleasant experience compared to our normal trains in the South ! Much better than an 8 hour drive too !
Thank you LNER

items.title: Newark to Grantham
items.review_text: Newark to Grantham. I will admit that I had no ticket as it was a last minute jump on the train job. The guy was trying to take payment on the platform at grantham but just as i went to pay with my card he had to get back on. Threatened to write me up next time with a 3 figure fine. Right o mate. I would never pay a fine and as for the ticket. A £10.50 single for an 11 minute journey. Had enough of these companies having my pants down. I've got all my tickets saved so I do pay when I use the train usually.read the reviews and leave a generic response

items.title: What 1st class???
items.review_text: So called 1st class experience was resticted to a tiny flapjack. Apparently the 1st class kitchen lost power but that didnt stop the economy catering car from carrying on (selling) with a full selection?! A joke!

items.title: A good journey
items.review_text: I travelled with LNER from London Kings Cross to Edinburgh and back in January. Both trains left on time and were not too busy. The seats were comfortable and had a good amount of leg room. During the return journey we ran into an issue with the track which delayed our arrival by 35 minutes but the delay repay was really easy - I received an email immediately after the journey which gave me a link to get a 50% refund. Overall I was very happy with the trip and would travel with LNER again. My only gripe was that the return train was quite hot.

items.title: LNER don't answer email complaints
items.review_text:
LNER don't answer email complaints. Below was sent on 17th January.

Hello,

I'm writing to complain about the awful experience I had in December with LNER.

Following a previous complaint, I was given first class COMP tickets by yourselves as compensation.

I booked a train from London to Darlington on 24th Dec, which was later cancelled. I rebooked for 23rd December and arrived at 4pm to ensure I had plenty of time. At around 5pm I found out that this second train was cancelled also. The following two trains were also cancelled, so I had to wait for three hours until another train became available.

Once i managed to get on this train, it was delayed as there was no train manager available. When we eventually set off it was so crowded I had to step over people to get to the toilet, as they were sitting on all the available floor space between the carriages.

I foolishly assumed that as I was travelling first class, food and drink would be provided. There was absolutely no catering service on the train (apart from one of your staff throwing a case of bottled water onto the carriage at a stop on the way up) As we headed into Darlington one of your staff offered me a cold sandwich, which was too little, and too late as I prepared to get off.

If you were hoping to create a good impression by giving me these COMP tickets, it had the absolute opposite effect. It was one of the most stressful journeys I've ever had to endure. Even the 'first class' service on the way back on the 27th was poor.

One of the worst train journeys I've ever experienced...

Martin

items.title: Exploiting customers not serving them
items.review_text:
Couldn’t be worse. Gave it 2 stars because 1 customer service employee actually listened to my complaint and helped me get my refund. 

Their system is faulty so check your tickets carefully. For some reason they don’t email you the tickets ;) they want you to have the physical tickets so mistakes are made easier and they can charge you extra. My printed tickets didn’t include my return journey, asked the officer to reprint them and he refused, I got on the train anyway (why shouldn’t I? I’ve paid!) and told the officer that I would get on the train, who in turn asked the train manager to do a ticket check and charge me instead. The train manager talked to me as if I was trying to get on the train without paying for it, without entertaining the possibility that a mistake might have been made on their system, extremely rude without cause, I just obliged and paid for the extra fee anyway, despite the unnecessary rudeness. 

To top that, they asked us to move from our coach to another coach due to some problem I didn’t understand and not many on the same coach did - their communications are not good. 

Had a couple of calls with the customer service. One of the good employees actually listened to me and helped me out. The rest, including the rude train manager, showed a consistent pattern of talking down to customers and exploiting them.

items.title: Excellent service
items.review_text: Excellent service. Travelled from Kings Cross to Edinburgh and back for the weekend with my dog, and the staff were so kind and accommodating. I was quite worried about travelling with my dog on such a long trip, but I needn't have worried. I paid for a First Class upgrade and it was well worth it- plentiful food and drink- and the full English on my way back was so good! Thanks LNER.

items.title: Absolutely poor service and aftersales
items.review_text: Absolutely poor service and aftersales! Our train from Peterborough to Kings Cross was delayed which I understand sometimes these things can't be helped but because another train was cancelled, it meant our train was packed and people had used our reserved seats. They refused to move when I asked and we were unable to locate any staff as we couldn't move through the carriages to check due to the number of people on the train. I was travelling with my elderly mother in law and aunt, as well as my disabled cousin, who all had to stand for the entire 50 minute journey. My 3 children ended up sat on the floor next to the toilet! I wasn't happy but assumed I would be able to claim on LNER's seat guarantee scheme, only to receive a response to say they wouldn't refund us as we were able to find alternative reserved seats (which I had already explained to them we weren't able to). Again, I understand some things are beyond LNER's control, such as the people that wouldn't vacate our seats but they could at least honour their seat guarantee scheme (which I had to make 16 separate claims for as we had SplitSave tickets for 8 of us). I make this journey frequently so I gave LNER a chance. Will stick to Thameslink and Great Northern now like I have previously. Never had issues with them

items.title: Two trips this weekend up to York…
items.review_text: Two trips this weekend up to York Friday and return today both in 1st class very busy train on Friday but staff were friendly and everyone got served and attended to back today much quieter but very friendly staff again also big plus both services arrived and departed on time so made all my connections work.

items.title: London to York. Lost bag
items.review_text: London to York. Train left on time and arrived on time. I stupidly left my bag on the service but was saved by a lovely lady working to dispatch trains. She called on to the next station, Darlington where they found my bag and put it into  lost property. I want to thank the lady at York for her prompt action, the LNER lost property guy who called me and the team at Darlington for their prompt actions.

items.title: Absolutely awful.
items.review_text: Absolutely awful.

items.title: Rude and dimissive staff guilty until…
items.review_text: Rude and dimissive staff guilty until proven innocent

items.title: Terrible service!!
items.review_text: Terrible service!!! 2 LNER workers have checked my tickets and sat me on their train confirming that the train is okay to take as I had a any time return ticket( I SPECIFICALLY FOUND A MEMBER OF STAFF ON THE TRAIN WHO CHECKED AND CONFIRMED MY TICKET!!!), few minutes before the end of the journey I was told that my ticket isn’t valid and I was made to pay £39. Stay away from LNER because If you are a little bit confused travelling, then their workers will just sit you on their train and make you pay for it. Totally scammed!

items.title: Update - WON'T RESPOND TO EMAILS
items.review_text:
Still haven't had any response from my email sent on 4th Jan 2023 despite sending a follow up email. Not good enough!!

UPDATE - Despite getting a reply from LNER social's team to this review and then emailing them. Still not heard anything back. Just shows they reply to your email to save face.

POOR CUSTOMER SERVICES

items.title: On 28th October LNER cancelled the 4pm…
items.review_text: On 28th October LNER cancelled the 4pm train from London Kings Cross to Berwick Upon Tweed, I had to pay an inflated £75.25 to upgrade to first class on the 18:00 train as there were no seats available on later services! I have written to complain and am YET TO RECEIVE A RESPONSE from my last email. I only ask to be reimbursed for the inflated price of the upgrade that I was forced to pay or stand up for almost 4 hours. LNER really need to sort out their Customer Services department and stop ignoring complaints in the hope that they go away.

items.title: Great service but i didn’t miss my…
items.review_text: Great service but i didn’t miss my train. Train was physically at the platform and was refused entry with 3 minutes to go. Disrupted the rest of my journey and no compensation given. Seat reservations is such a scam! You reserve a seat for someone to sit in your place, no green lights to sit and as your journey is in progress someone can book the seat your are sat in?! For a journey over 3 hours i dont want to be disturbed and have to move. Not a thought through process, all it does is annoy people.

items.title: ‘Perks’
items.review_text: As I travel the length of the country on a weekly basis, I was given a QR code within the app to use the First Class Lounge as a ‘perk’.  Somewhere buried in the small print was a condition it could be used once, though it remained visible in the app appearing to be valid.  On arrival at King’s Cross I was denied entry to the Lounge and the way I was spoken to was just dreadful.  If the intention of the ‘perk’ was to make me feel valued, it has failed.  I spend thousands on LNER, and feel completely let down.

items.title: Delayed Delay Repay
items.review_text: On 05/12/22 I was booked to travel to Newcastle from York at 0954 returning at 1626. I purchased return tickets for my daughter and myself. Unfortunately the train was delayed from York for approximately 30 mins due to the theft of signal cables which caused untold chaos on the King's Cross to Edinburgh line.  On the return journey the train was delayed for over 60 mins. I was sent an automated delay repay for the tickets I purchased  for my daughter but not the tickets for myself?  I had to make a claim for my tickets on 06/12/22, there is no way to check the progress of my claim on the website? In fact it is not even possible to check that a claim has been made.  It is now over 6 weeks and the "chat bot" is totally useless, I have asked to chat with a person and was cut off. I have sent 2 emails which have not been answered.  Bring back Virgin Trains website it was 100% better and you could even speak to a very helpful person, not a bot that cannot answer a simple question, totally and utterly frustrating.

items.title: Disastrous organisation.
items.review_text: Their trains are disgusting. The carpets are completely worn through. The seats have absolutely no spring to them at all. Toilets out of order. Will never travel with this joke of a TOC again.

items.title: A brilliant company who honours the…
items.review_text:
A brilliant company who honours the cancelled tickets of other terrible providers. Always reliable obviously some delays are inevitable but being reasonable they offer a brilliant service. 
I am a transpenine season ticket holder, purely because there is not an option to do so for LNER between darlington and York, but if LNER want my 350 pounds a month i spend on transpenine for a service that most of the time LNER provide please contact!

items.title: Every time we book a train there’s…
items.review_text:
Every time we book a train there’s either cancellations or disruptions. We go with you 10-20 times a year and it’s hopeless. 

So disappointed with the service. 

You also can’t rebook even though you’ve cancelled our train. Get a better system asap

items.title: Shocking service
items.review_text:
Shocking service, as always.

Well the service is consistent, awful.
I have used LNER and always poor service, so normally use Hill Trains, however this morning 17th January the timing was critical so booked LNER Retford to KX.
Booked 1st class!!, -4 outside and freezing !, offers one cup of tea, the lady serving is yelling everyone, you can only have a drink if you have just boarded, OMG, the compartment M is half empty.
To top it off a guy takes the cup at 8.28 while the train is stood because a broken down train ahead, we are already 45 minutes late, be great to have an hot drink for passengers, the irony is in standard class you can orders at seat, and can get a drink delivered, clearly you pay, however just paid £30.00 Premium to  have in a word Cattle Class.
The staff were awful across the journey.
Maybe worth Hill trains, training the staff!!!, 

LNER -  it was your service that was from retford to KX due in at 8.30 on 17th Jan.

This was delayed, there is an whole additional story.

items.title: Lovely Experience!
items.review_text: Travelling up to York from London KX on your 15.25 service to Middlesbrough. Can I just say how comfortable this is and both the Train Manager and Catering Manager (Vicky) have been superb and could not have made me feel more at home! Bravo!!

items.title: Shambolic
items.review_text:
Firstly, they cancelled my return journey. Having to still travel, I noticed whilst travelling back from London on the same scheduled day, but with an alternative operator, that my cancelled train was still travelling  can only think they overbooked it.

Secondly, 1 month on from submitting a delay repay claim for my outward journey that was late by an hour - they have still to respond - having contacted them 3 times. Totally shambolic company.

Just to add. You will see LNER responded to this post and committed to looking into the issue. They did, apologised and still remains unresolved. Unbelievable.

UPDATED FOLLOWING A PROTRACTED AND UNRESOLVED CASE

AVOID LNER LIKE THE PLAGUE

Thank you for getting in touch with us at London North Eastern Railway. 

 

We are sorry to hear thatyou might have not received the refund as of yet.

 

To get this sorted out as quickly as possible, please be advised that the payment was raised from our end on the 17th January taking 14 business days to be received by you. If up to present day you still have not received this, please reply to this email with your bank statement where the refund was being refunded and we will look further into this for you.

 

At LNER, we appreciate all the feedback we receive. It helps us to deliver a safe, reliable and high-quality service. Unfortunately, things sometimes go wrong, but please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience.  

 

Thank you for travelling with us and we look forward to taking you on more journeys in the future. 

 

We’d really appreciate your feedback on your experience with LNER. Please click the link below to answer a few quick questions that’ll help us work out what we’re doing right and what we need to work on.

THEY ARE NOT ACCEPTING THEY HAVE NOT REFUNDED AND WILL KNOW THEMSELVES THAT THEY HAVENT. IN THIS WORLD OF BANKING SECURITY... ASKING YOU TO SEND YOUR STATEMENT AS PROOF OF NON PAYMENT IS INCREDULOUS AND BIZARRE!!!!!!

I GAVE THEM MY PHONE NUMBER ON MANY OCCASSIONS AND THEY HAVENT CALLED

items.title: Spoiled
items.review_text: Trains are meant to be relaxing. Not LNER! They constantly bombard you with repetitive computer-generated loud intrusive announcements, significantly more than any other train company. Not just listing every forthcoming stop at every station, but welcoming passengers twice per station, telling the destination twice and the next stop twice.  Repeat again at the next station 15 minutes later. Sometimes the manager comes on to repeat it yet again. Then unlike every other train company, they constantly announce the See it-Say it slogan.  Every stop.  The signs aren't good enough, nor are the first 100 times they tell you where the train is going.   Not considerate at all of neuro-diverse people or those that just want to relax. And you just get fobbed off with nonsense if you tell them.

items.title: Non-responsive email address with no other means of submitting a delay reimbursement claim
items.review_text:
My train was 42 minutes delayed
I requested a reimbursement of half the cost of the ticket (as is in their T&Cs)
My request was denied, they've asked for me to email more information which I have done so but they have not replied

items.title: Great Journey.
items.review_text:
We travelled LNER first time. Our journey was from London King Cross to Edinburgh. Train departed on time, it was very clean and tidy.
On board shop offered snacks, hot and cold drinks.
Rubbish collector was coming regularly throughout the journey. It was good experience.

items.title: The delayed train Edinburgh 27 Dec 2022 at 17.30
items.review_text: The train departing Edinburgh at 17.30;delayed, arrived kings cross at 11.30 pm over 90 mins late. LNER have rejected my compensation claim saying the service wasn't delayed. I was on a busy train with other passengers, I didn't imagine it.

items.title: Lack of customer service
items.review_text: I had to cancel a ticket and rebook my journey for another date in early December, and have been waiting for confirmation of my refund ever since. I've sent several emails and also tried the chat function (which was not helpful) but have had no response at all. Disappointing.

items.title: Untrustworthy, greedy company.
items.review_text: I’ve been traveling with a LNER for a few years and for the most part it’s been satisfactory, up until the past few months. I’ve had 4 journeys canceled and was told that I wasn’t eligible for a refund,  I was also stranded in Newcastle (due to line issues) for a night, the LNER staff told us that we could pay for a taxi or stay in a hotel for the evening and claim the money back (up to a max of £200), however this was also refused. From now on I’ll be traveling by air and staying away from rail as much as possible.

items.title: Travel provided on a strike day - that’s what I call superb customer service
items.review_text:
We travelled from Newcastle to York for a family weekend get together on Friday 16th December 2022.
We were incredibly disappointed to see that the Rail Unions had chosen that day to strike and thought we might have to cancel our trip - the first one we had been able to arrange for 3 years due to covid, etc. 
However LNER we’re amazing and ran a reduced timetable for that day enabling us to travel as planned.
Thank you so much for ensuring your passengers could travel on a strike day, which is so much more than some other companies did.

items.title: Useless Seat Reservations
items.review_text: The train guard cannot even get us seats. LOL. And they found seats separate for me and my child. LOL. And the customer services told me no compensation because separate seats solution is something they offered.

items.title: Cancelled train with no warning
items.review_text:
Morning train from Aberdeen to King's Cross cancelled with no warning (Advance Single). Tried to get a different service but was turned away at Aberdeen station because the ticket worked only with LNER and not Scotland Rail. Then told that there would be a bus replacement for that train (07:52). The bus replacement left two minutes late, and the bus driver coasted through Edinburgh, meaning myself and a number of other passengers missed the same train (It was cancelled from Aberdeen due to staff shortage but still was running from Edinburgh) and had to catch a train which took 40 minutes longer. Plus I have to speak to GWR to let them know I need a different train. 
Thanks for nothing LNER

items.title: Such a rubbish company
items.review_text:
Such a rubbish company. Claiming compensation on their website is ridiculously tricky, asking for loads of information that is difficult to find if you had etickets from trainline that are no longer viewable. Doesn't tell you to make claims for each individual passenger separately until after you've submitted said claim.
You already messed up hence me having to claim compensation, why do you feel the need to compound my stress with your horrible website?

items.title: Terrible experience
items.review_text:
I used one of their trains to get from Doncaster to London Kings Cross, was possible the worst train ride I’ve ever experienced in my life. 

I reserved a seat, only to find out that the seat had been taken by a snob whose train had been cancelled so they felt like they had the divine right to take my seat. The staff on the train basically told me to shut up and find a seat somewhere else. 

Couldn’t find a seat, so I had to resort to sitting on the floor accompanied by other travellers whose seats were also taken from them. I had to sit on a cramped disgusting floor for 2 hours I was left feeling mentally exhausted after the trip. 

Then on a separate train ride on the way home I had some luggage stolen (in piece of jewellery). The staff were not very helpful and mocked me for losing it. 

I contacted LNER after the trip to try and receive some form of compensation or a refund. They got back to me requesting further details, I obliged and they didn’t respond to my email. 

Disgusting train line with horrible staff. Would not recommend.

items.title: stuck with no food and no warning
items.review_text:
Paid extra money for a first class ticket as it is Christmas, so we could eat some food on the train and not have no worry about buying food before hand. They announce on board that there will be no catering service so we’re now on the train for 2 and a half hours with no food. 
Could they not have announced somehow before hand?

items.title: I understand every experience varies on…
items.review_text: I understand every experience varies on the rail network these but our Leeds to London First Class trip was faultless. Friendly staff, nice food & comfy carriages.

items.title: Very sad experience
items.review_text: I had to pay twice for a ticket from London to Edinburgh and they never refunded me, this is very unfair. Next time I travel I will use a plane if you continue paying me for 2 tickets.this is very sad experience.next time I book tickets in advance with Rayaner for only £12.it is completely ripped of

items.title: Aaron - train manager and Diane - attendant
items.review_text: Aaron - train manager and Diane were absolutely lovely and provided fantastic service. Very professional and made my day about a million times better. Many thanks to the Xmas cheer!

items.title: Cancelled seat reservations on the…
items.review_text:
Cancelled seat reservations on the train so we had to stand in the middle of the aisle for 3 hours from London to Newcastle. Cancelled an 11:30 train and let the people from that train onto the 12:30, as they got on first all
Of the 12:30 bookings were made to stand. Absolute shambles. It was also 30 minutes late.

items.title: They could not have done any better.
items.review_text: They have been getting a hard time recently. I had a fabulous journey with them booked in advanced first class service very reasonably priced and very worth it. Staff were lovely and trip to London was great food delicious even though I have dietary requirements. Unfortunately my return journey was cancelled but the refund process could not have been simpler. I also stand united with the strikers, they deserve better.

items.title: Travel to Edingburgh from Peterborough…
items.review_text: Travel to Edingburgh from Peterborough on 11/12/22. Booked on 10-52. Arrived at station to be told that train had been cancelled. I had a booking for a 1st Class seat and service. Also told that there would be unreserved seats in a certain 1st class carriage. Boarded the train to find absolute carnage. No seats people standing and train overcrowded. When at Peterborough, also told the train had broken down the night before and LNER new this but did not send any txts to inform people of this. No catering, no seat and staff on the train had no idea what to do. Newcastle train cleared and seat and some food provided. What a shocking and unprofessional service and LNER new as tge train had broken down the night before!! Really a cheap circus charging people 1st class service.

items.title: Horrendous service!
items.review_text: Probably the worst train service in the world and an embarrassment to anyone from the UK. What must visiting foreigners think? We, who live here, come to expect it, because LNER continuously give a rubbish service. I’ve travelled the world on many train services and LNER has to be the worst. When travelling in 1st class, don’t expect 1st class service. They won’t even bring a cup of tea. They’re a disgrace!

items.title: Uncomfortable seating!
items.review_text: Train on time, onboard service fine BUT the first class seats are so uncomfortable - wrong shape for average height people and absolutely no lumbar support - result -  two days of back ache and a numb leg following return trip from Newark to Newcastle. I would advise people to carry some type of lumbar support with them.

items.title: RUBBISH
items.review_text:
Not for the first time, LNER have cancelled a train
Now I have to get another train which will be full of those poor people like me who have been dumped - LNER do not care
The website is useless - cannot connect or log in
If you try to get a refund nothing happens
I am fed up with this company - I have no option as I need to get from London to Grantham regularly

items.title: Mobility challenges!
items.review_text: I have a first class staff pass as a dependent of a retired railway employee. To be able to have the food option during long distance travel we need to obtain a voucher from the cafe bar. With the current train layout this can be perhaps 5 entire coaches from coach M. I have significant mobility issues and can not do this, and the catering crew and train manager are unable to take the money. I felt embarrassed and then furious on my last journey travelling alone. I don’t need assistance boarding the train but mobilising 5 carriages when it is moving and busy is simply impossible. Surely a pre payment scheme for this voucher can be introduced via the app? Happy to pay!  No response from LNER so far despite contacting them twice.

items.title: Zero customer service
items.review_text: 30 mins late. No communication with passengers! How are passengers supposed to plan ahead when you won’t communicate with them! First class fee paid last class service received!

items.title: Late trains and lack of food and…
items.review_text: Late trains and lack of food and alcohol on 1st class service from Edinburgh to London. Very poor.

items.title: Lee at the Cafe Bar!!
items.review_text: Lee, on the London to Leeds train was really nice, he was running the cafe bar, hope to deal with him again!

items.title: Shocking Service in Every Aspect
items.review_text:
Shocking Service in Every Aspect.

I have been travelling with this company for 2yrs. It's a nightmare. You plan work, meetings, but this train company 70% of the time fails to get you anywhere on time. I find 50% of the male workers are on a power trip, rude, aggressive even. Due to strikes I can't make follow up meetings, so intial meetings beforehand have been cancelled. They have refused to refund tickets because apparently the strikes have not disrupted or cancelled my plans. As my initial meeting were not on strike days. They fail to understand people running businesses have follow up meetings. Which happen to be on strike days. I have lost so much business because of the strikes. The strikes are causing a hugely negetaive ripple effect throughout my whole business.  This company constantly gives incorrect refunds when they do refund. Their app is mess. Everything is driven & made difficult to rip the customer off. They want more money I just want to get paid.  The delay and repay doesn't work. They ignore emails, cut phone chat off. Vincent H I am talking to you - Condescending customer service. Telling me you haven't disrputed my business. I would rather drive 5 hours to london than ever take another train with this company.

items.title: Just a fantastic service from Passenger…
items.review_text: Just a fantastic service from Passenger Assistance, starting at King's Cross to final destination in Goole.  My sister had a huge case after Xmas shopping in London and needed help with luggage.  They went above and beyond expectations and made her journey so enjoyable instead of very very stressful.

items.title: We travelled home from London to…edinburgh
items.review_text:
We travelled home from London to Edinburgh on Sunday 20th November and had booked seat reservations.  All reservations were cancelled.  We had to stand for the entire journey.  The train was also over 30 minutes late.
I applied for for compensation of £158 
and was told we would receive this within 14 days.  15 days later we have received £39.

items.title: An unpleasant experience
items.review_text:
I rarely travel by train so I'm not familiar with the way things work, and got very little help from LNER.
First off booking (online). I chose the cheapest fare available - £80 Leeds to Hook (Hampshire).
However, when I got to the payment page, the fare was £112.
Very little information was given and passengers have to hang around the station until the platform number is announced 5 minutes before the train leaves, so there's a mad stampede.
There was food available (from a trolly) but no prices. I guess if you need to ask the price, you can't afford. Needless to say very few passengers had food or drink. 
The biggest problem though was the lack of information throughout the journey (including 3 changes on the way). 
I guess none of this will matter to regular rail travellers, who are famailiar with the routine.
I can only give two stars. Simply for getting me to my destination, on time.
I would only travel this way if I had no alternative.
An unpleasant experience.

items.title: Excellent experience - LNER Thank you.
items.review_text: Booked a trip to Edinburgh and travelled on LNER Azuma both outbound and inbound journeys.  Although the outbound train was 42-44 mins late due to safety checks on the tracks, I can honestly say that I will not hesitate to use this service again! The staff aboard both journeys were amazing! They were all professional and polite, very hard working, nothing was too much trouble! Our journeys were King’s Cross to Edinburgh 2nd Dec (Peterborough scheduled at 1819) and Edinburgh to Kings Cross 1100hrs 4 Dec.  Please convey our utmost thanks to the staff on both journeys- staff as good and as happy as they all were are very hard to find! We shall definitely use LNER again!! Thank you x

items.title: Evri would do better at getting you there on time
items.review_text: If you want to guarantee getting somewhere; take the hit on the wallet and hire a car rather than rely on these clowns to get you there. Constantly cancelling trains, seat reservations mean nothing. If you need to guarantee getting somewhere or back on time, stay well away.

items.title: Quite like it
items.review_text: Quite like it - there is room for improvement of course, not least there have been occasions where there’s a last minute problem with seat reservations, I usually book 1st class on the London-Peterborough leg of my journey to see my family, and feel well taken care of by the staff.

items.title: Absolutely scandalous company
items.review_text:
Scandalous company. The worst situation is when you get on a train and realize it's the wrong one; it's easy to do with the state of public transport in this country. The first ticket collector seemed very understanding, although I had to pay a ticket costing roughly £40 (the train wasn't full but as usual they won't be sympathetic). I also purchased a second ticket because the train would arrive later than my connecting train. However, the trainline app (also a steaming pile of dung) didn't process my payment for ongoing app issues using my phone. 

However, the second ticket collector was despicable, to say the least, very condescending and rude and used intimidation tactics against me. No customer service skills whatsoever. She didn't believe me when I said I had purchased a ticket and showed her my bank statement, which showed it had taken my money. 

Anyway, she reissued my ticket but, as usual, LNER or any service in the UK demands you to pay a highly inflated ticket price.

Luckily I'm moving overseas soon so I won't have to deal with this country's scandalous public transport system. At my wits' end with LNER, Trainline and the whole public transport system as it completely lacks any semblance of a service for people.

items.title: LEVELS above the northern service
items.review_text:
Train is so clean staff friendly 
Just got a off a northern train and transferred onto a lner 
And it was like stepping in paradise compared to the northern train 
Much better clean comfy much more leg room.

items.title: Honest review from regular customer
items.review_text: I regularly used this railway over the last 3 months and I give up with them. Their system is awful. There is almost always an issue with cancelled or late departures, so you can’t schedule anything important with confidence. On top of this, the refund gesture is calculated on a percentage that is insulting, hardly worth the energy it takes to claim. While they’ll take advantage of people by charging extortionate fees for new tickets if you’ve missed your train and have to get the following train 15 minutes later. I have no complaint of the staff. They’re only ever doing their job and are often excellent. But it’s not practical or economical to rely on this service.

items.title: Poor catering service.
items.review_text: Booked first class ticket. Catering service was extremely poor, staff were rushing and really took no notice of customers. They appeared more anxious to get ready for arriving at Kings Cross. Not sure what you pay the significant additional cost for such a third rate service.

items.title: We had a train booked from Leeds to…
items.review_text: We had a train booked from Leeds to London Kings Cross Friday 25th November at 11.45 then the next train was at capacity due to being two train fulls, we ended up on the 12.45 train which one of the kind staff members helped us with however that being said we had theatre tickets that cost us over £200.00 we did not make it due to the train being cancelled! Yes we can get a train refund but our theatre tickets were non refundable or changeable , we think this is very unfair considering it’s not our fault that we couldn’t make it on time it was due to a cancelled train! All we can get back is our train ticket which is disgusting service.

items.title: Wonderful staff
items.review_text:
My mother was taken ill on the train to Durham and the train had to stop. A wonderful station delivery manager called Ian Whittles saw her and was so kind and helpful. He also got us onto the next train. 
What a lovely person he is. If there were 10 stars I'd give him that.

items.title: On the 7:37 from kings cross to…
items.review_text: On the 7:37 from kings cross to Newcastle, the train manager was the most friendly and helpful member of staff I have ever experienced on a train. Smily and polite. I travel on trains many times a week and haven't been made to feel so welcomed as I was today :)

items.title: Exceptional customer service
items.review_text:
I was travelling on the 12 November 2022 from Kings Cross to Grantham. I was on the 14.35pm train . The train had to do an emergency stop just outside St Neots . The train Manager , James was straight on it advising that the train in front had hit an object . He came down the train reassuring us and confirmed to us (We had already seen it on our phones ) that in fact it was a person that had been hit . He confirmed to us that depending on the situation we could be stationery for some time . He continually kept us updated . We were  stationery for around 2.5 hours.  We were provided with drinks and snacks. Eventually he confirmed that we would be moving to the next station and would re- assess then . All the time either coming through the train asking if we had any questions and also on the tannoy . 

We eventually set off and he explained that we could claim our ticket money back and that for those who were travelling onwards they could use their tickets . Amazing customer service   Very supportive and knowledgeable. Deserves recognition .

items.title: I can't normally fault LNER at all
items.review_text:
I can't normally fault LNER at all.
They don't overbook trains (usually), you can reserve your seat, and they're generally reliable and on time. Unfortunately today their "eat at your seat" wasn't working, the toilet in carriage A was out of order, and after a certain stop the cafe in coach G was shut down due to staff shortages. Quite disappointing for one journey, but they're still a lot better than other trainlines.

items.title: Scammed out of £130
items.review_text: I paid £50 in advance for a ticket, hopped on the train and was charged an additional £80 because my ticket "was invalid" despite being valid. Complete scam and pissed off

items.title: Poor service
items.review_text: Really unhappy with the level of customer service. My train was cancelled due to the strikes. I was permitted to travel on a later train, but this did not take me to my planned destination. I also arrived an hour and a half late at an additional cost for the extra travel. I requested a refund from LNER as I did not receive the service I paid for. They have refused to provide a refund. This seems completely unfair given the circumstances

items.title: Rubbish App
items.review_text: Rubbish App, Rubbish Service. Tried to book return ticket app won't load return tickets..

items.title: Train got cancelled no direction from…
items.review_text: Train got cancelled no direction from staff all they said was taxis available, useless

items.title: Faultless customer service
items.review_text: I have been travelling with LNER for over a year now almost every weekend from London to Edinburgh. Every time I contacted customer service, they were excellent. They normally pick up the call quickly and are very helpful. For any significant delay, LNER reimburses you without any fuss and sometimes, they even send an email to inform you that you are entitled to one!

items.title: A big thanks to the train manager on…
items.review_text:
A big thanks to the train manager on the 0833 train from London KX to Leeds this morning (10/11/22) (I didn’t catch his name).

I had a long journey today with lots of luggage, so I was already apprehensive, but he made my day. 

As I approached the train I noticed he was saying good morning to all customers and welcoming them on the train - which is fantastic. As I said good morning to him, he kindly offered to help me with my luggage and store it safely for the journey. I accepted, and he wouldn’t let me carry it on, or off the train at the end. A credit to LNER.

Thank you.

items.title: Prepare for spam email you can't unsubscribe from
items.review_text: Beware.  Leave your email with these clowns and they will forever bombard you with spam.  I've tried unsubscribing half a dozen times now and it won't.  Junk.

items.title: Just a menu
items.review_text: I took the first class from Durham to Newcastle with lner and though there were menus there was nobody to serve . The excuse is that time is too short. But they could at least give a coffee or yoghurt. I will try cross country next time

items.title: Absolutely horrific experience
items.review_text: Absolutely horrific experience. I am with my disabled mother who has difficulty walking. I was about to get on the train and asked the train staff member if someone could help assist my mum who was walking towards us. He said no he couldn’t, he needed to set off. I said it would only take her a second to get onto the train. He said no and then got on the train and closed the doors. He then shouted get off the platform, I was so shocked and startled for a second. He then screamed at the top of his lungs “Get off the f**king platform”. The train then set off. I am really upset and have never been treated like this before, even by drunk members of the public. To be sworn at and screamed at by the level of anger and by a staff member of the service I have paid for. It is the first time my mother has been able to leave home for over two years before covid due to illness and we have had a lovely time in London but what a horrific way to end the trip. Why could we not get on the train? Are the staff not able to assist? I had both of our suitcases and my mother only needed a hand to help her step up onto the train. That was all. I am now having to pay for additional trains and we are both left shocked and if I am honest, shaken.

items.title: Excellent customer service via facebook
items.review_text: Needed to claim a refund on a ticket but online form does not allow for tickets that are still to be collected. Contacted LNER via facebook. Very quick response and they arranged for the refund to be made.

items.title: Edinburg train yesterday afternoon…
items.review_text: Edinburg train yesterday afternoon approximately 14.45 I boarded at Newark and the experience was wonderful! From being helped at the platform by a knowledgeable young man to being looked after with lovely drinks and snacks with very friendly and courteous staff ..made my day! Amazing experience

items.title: Have travelled on LNER 14 times this…
items.review_text:
Have travelled on LNER 14 times this year.
I have to say I have had very positive experiences. Trains have been clean and on time. Seats were relatively comfortable. Staff have been very friendly and helpful. 
When I travelled back from Durham on Monday 24th October, my train was delayed an hour and half due to train leaving depot late
The train conductor went into every carriage and explained the delay repay process and was very helpful. I think he went above and beyond his job. My refund was back in my account Wednesday morning.

items.title: No vegan options
items.review_text: Coach is comfortable. However, no vegan options when it comes to ordering food. All breakfast / sandwiches are meat or dairy based. It’s 2022, be more inclusive!

items.title: Another rough LNER journey
items.review_text: Another rough LNER journey. This time because Edinburgh to London train at 15.00 (on 27th Oct) cancelled due to not enough staff. That means two passenger loads piling onto the 3.30pm (two into one does not go). All seats reserved, but some had orange lights "seat may be reserved later". I asked what that meant and the reply was that others (or I) could book a seat reservation from the next stop. So I try seven times over the course of 90 mins, and the seat reservation LNER service just kept spooling and spooling. Not sure if it was due to lousy WiFi (simple text emails were taking 30 mins each to be sent) or a problem with the seat reservation service. Eventually gave up. Others boarding subsequently had managed to make new seat reservations, ousting those poor folk who thought they were safe. No tea and coffee in first class, and no hot food after Newcastle. Not blaming on board staff but clear disappointment with LNER management (again)

items.title: Train cancelled - forced to pay twice
items.review_text:
Train cancelled, staff advised to get on train that was just about to leave and swap. 

Inspector on train wouldn’t accept, even though the train and subsequent trains were cancelled and no option but to pay again.

items.title: LNER parking Grantham
items.review_text: Parked at LNER carpark Grantham end of August from Thursday mid morning to Tuesday mid afternoon. Which included £12 long weekend parking Fri - Monday.  I was charged £50 for 4 days 2 hours. Emailed them 30th August on the day of the charge. Attached my parking ticket receipt and proof of charge. Had automated email to say I would be contacted in 10 working days. I wasn't. Then finally received an email 18th October saying  I'd been overcharged by £38. I was reimbursed but, why did it take so long, is there a huge backlog of this happening to others?  I was given no explanation as to how it happened. Obviously a computer glitch. It has now really put me off using their carpark in future. Beware!

items.title: Best service ever
items.review_text: Best service ever. proud to travel with lner

items.title: Pathetic Internet....no point of wifi…
items.review_text: Pathetic Internet....no point of wifi connection it never connect...4g never work. Some staff does not even ask for food although they ask to others. No kur where the good service are.

items.title: Insanely badly designed toilets
items.review_text: Insanely badly designed toilets. What is wrong with an actual lock ?

items.title: Awful service
items.review_text: Awful service. There employees must be programmed to make peoples lives a misery. Any simple mistake they will completely rip you off with no attempt to help you out. If you can avoid this rail company do it.

items.title: Refused to issue refund for cancelled…
items.review_text: Refused to issue refund for cancelled journey due to strike action, issued credit instead and now informed that the credit will expire.  I'll take the car next time.

items.title: LNER overbooked and dirty
items.review_text: LNER always overbook their seats.  Bought a ticket from Newcastle to London weeks ago in a quiet coach.  When we arrived in Darlington I was kicked out of my seat by a couple claiming to have also booked that seat.  Understandably I was annoyed.  A kind man offered his seat as he was departing in York.  A group of chavs blasting chavvy music from Newcastle to London also graced our presence in the ‘ quiet coach drinking a bottle of pink gin each on the journey getting more obnoxious. When we were an hour away from London I looked over at them as they put their music up louder. One asked why are you looking at me. I explained I booked a quiet coach and you and your friends have been blasting music all the journey. I was subjected to a load of verbal abuse calling me a Karen.. seriously….he was the one who asked me why I was annoyed. Prior to that I sat and looked out of the window to zone out He then called me a racist word for an ‘Indian or Pakistani person’ bi@@c.  Btw I don’t condone racist comments and also I’m clearly white European but perhaps the bottle of gin he’d drank clouded his vision.  Other passengers apologised to me for this treatment. I wanted to move seats but the train was full. Wish I’d saved £100 and got the mega bus.  Oh and these chavs were apprehended at kings cross as I was leaving the station they claimed to have lost their ticket and were detained,  karma hey.

items.title: No WiFi at all... Can't load a simple image...
items.review_text: Since your WiFi can't load even one pixel. Why do you claim that you are offering it still in 2022? Because you include it to the value that you supposedly offer. It's borderline misleading. I wasn't able to work not even once while on your trains. This costs money to me and to businesses but we still pay full price and you claim that you offer this service. In 2022 every person has at least 1 device... why do we pay 2022 prices but we still travel with a 2001 service???

items.title: Dirty filthy carriages overpriced fares
items.review_text: Dirty filthy carriages, Having to sit in a seat with coffee and gum with rubbish on the floor from a fresh train really sucks. The ticket price is ridiculous and overpriced, Many of my European friends agree LNER trains are garbage. customer service is also garbage. LNER you suck!! your a joke.

items.title: I booked first class tickets to London…
items.review_text: I booked first class tickets to London as a birthday treat for my daughter and partner, part of travelling first class is the meals and drinks service it offers. On boarding the train they were informed there was no refreshments service, apparently they are not obliged to provide it , it is complimentary!! LNER you should at least inform passengers in advance, what exactly did I pay over a £100 a ticket for??

items.title: It mightn't be the Orient Express but LNER is pretty good
items.review_text: I travel from West Yorkshire to Leeds every week or two, so I'm constantly on and off LNER trains. I travel both economy and first class, depending on price. I think the reviews for them are a bit rough - probably because people get motivated by bad experiences to give reviews. Sure they're not as good as a lot of European train services, but they're fairly reliable (maybe not on Friday afternoons), staff are mostly great, sure the food isn't brilliant but it's got better, and they've got plugs, clean trains and all up do a pretty good job. And I've had no trouble getting refunds when trains have been cancelled.

items.title: Quick to make amends!
items.review_text: I always measure a company by it's actions when things go wrong. During the recent rail dispute LNER had to cancel our train from London to Leeds. They did, however, book us on the next available train. This was the following day. They then re-imbursed us our fare in the form of travel vouchers. We like LNER - their trains are always clean and the staff are friendly, good humoured and professional. Thank you LNER, we will be travelling with you again soon.

items.title: Poor service
items.review_text: Very expensive, how many times l made claims for cancelled trains etc...they don't give the money back even if they said ,is liar and the service bar is much better to get something from any station because sometimes they app doesn't work

items.title: LNER first class is the only way to travel
items.review_text:
I travelled on the 10.33 from King’s Cross to Wakefield this morning. I am an elderly lady who was travelling alone and the staff were so helpful and kind. I was helped with my luggage and seating and treated so well.
The food and drinks were excellent and served with a smile.
I cannot speak too highly of my very pleasant journey this morning.

items.title: Appalling customer service when you…
items.review_text:
Appalling customer service when you lodge a delay/cancellation request.
You might as well hit your head against a brick wall for all the notice LNER pay.
Sent them all documentation by recorded delivery which was signed for 7 weeks ago.
I have since followed up by email which was ignored except an acknowledgment of complaint.
I then escalated to formal complaint status which was similarly ignored.
Not even recorded as a complaint on my account.
Rail Ombudsman next week.
A shambles !!

items.title: Absolutely awful service refund wasn’t…
items.review_text: Absolutely awful service refund wasn’t given till and one month and 5 days kept calling day different staff saying different things. Would never recommend this service

items.title: I hope to never have to travel on LNER again, thankfully Grand Central and Hull are much better
items.review_text:
I travelled by train to London on 17th September 2022, the was the weekend of the Queen's funeral. I am heavily pregnant and was travelling with my toddler so this was a bit stressful, particularly as trains and stations were busier than usual. 

There were two trains leaving from Doncaster Platform 1 to Kings Cross within minutes of each other and unbeknown to myself, I had accidentally got on the wrong train. This was an honest mistake.

I was treated appallingly by the staff member when he pointed out I had boarded the wrong train. He initially told me I would need to pay over £100 then said he would charge £63.

I was told that if I did not pay he would get British Transport Police I believe this was said to intimidate me. He tried to put me under duress to make an immediate payment and he behaved in a confrontational manner, standing over me whilst I was seated with my young child.

When the train arrived in London two British Transport Police officers were waiting for me - this was upsetting for my young child and distressing and humiliating for me.  No arrest was made,the police acknowledged I was not trying to fare evade as I had a valid ticket and they accepted my explanation that I made a mistake by boarding the train (rather than my booked train which also departed from platform 1 six minutes later.) The officers advised  this was not an issue for them as I had not committed any criminal offence.The officers stated the worker could have exercised some ‘professional discretion’ and they advised me put in a complaint and appeal. Up until this point I was not even aware I could appeal.
 
 I am sure the police resources could have been put to better use elsewhere.

items.title: I have to ask, why on earth would anyone want to travel by train?
items.review_text: It has been over 40 years since I last ventured out on a train but never again, my wife and I had tickets for a show in London and decided to go by train, return tickets booked with LNER from Scunthorpe to Kings Cross via Doncaster for September 29th to October 1st. It is then announced that there would be a rail strike on October 1st. so I contacted LNER to see what contingency plans had been put in place to get us back after a short silence on the phone the call centre operative said they would not be providing any optional transport for our return (Hmmm. not happy). The cost of the show and hotel had cost a couple of thousand pounds so we couldn't just not go. I managed to book a couple of seats on a National Express coach to get us back to doncaster (no problems here) the first outbound leg by train was cancelled without notice (Scun to Don) which meant I had to get a family member to drive us to Doncaster. While on the platform at doncaster a train duly pulled in and I asked an LNER employee if this was the train that I needed to be on and her attitude was appalling as her only concern was to get the train out, we as passengers seemed to irk the woman, and so to cap it all no trains on Saturday October 1st, who cares we've got your money now. I have to ask, why on earth would anyone want to travel by train? What a disgrace.

items.title: First Class Seats are incredibly uncomfortable.
