items.review_text: I am sorry to say that first class seats are absolutely appalling, tilted(in a way to possibly give you a backache) and hard as rock. They are cramped. I am only 27 and had a backache following a 2-hour train journey. I adjusted the seat which didn’t help with the situation. It is such a pity that the first class seats used to be really comfortable. I understand that the company would like to make more profits and puts more seats in first class carriages. This however significantly reduced level of seat comfort unfortunately and perhaps loyal customers might purchase standard class rather than first class due to this issue.

items.title: Have used LNER a few times recently…
items.review_text: Have used LNER a few times recently Newcastle to Kings Cross. Service and timing fine but the reason we will probably not use again is because the seats are so uncomfortable. They are very hard and the angle of the back and headrest make it impossible to relax, let alone sleep. The poor upright design has probably been adopted to enable more seats to be put in the carriage. Whoever is responsible for the design should be made to travel in one for 3 hours and see how bad they are. Such a basic and essential element of travel - FAIL

items.title: Useless Company
items.review_text: LNER are probably the most useless company I have ever dealt with. They do not listen to your complaints or information provided to them. I have been trying to gain a refund, which they told me I was entitled to, for a cancelled train on 21st August. I’m still awaiting the correct compensation being reimbursed and it is now 30th September. They claim I paid for the journey with vouchers so would only be entitled to a voucher. This is not true. I’ve sent a screenshot of the card payment which has been ignored. Sadly they are the only operator who run a service on a route I use to visit family otherwise I would be avoiding them.

items.title: I went to catch my train to see that it…
items.review_text: I went to catch my train to see that it was a bus, half the train was missing, no notice and nothing, all reserved seats turned to not reserved, first come first sit policy started, costumers service rude and unhelpful,WiFi wasn't working, lumo, avanti and other trains are way better than this Lner the worst in the UK

items.title: Travelled 1st Class York to Edinburgh…
items.review_text:
Travelled 1st Class York to Edinburgh 0735 on 26 Sep returning on 1200 27 Sep.  Both trains were on time and clean and neither train was overly busy.

Train staff were really professional and polite and the food was of a really good standard.  So, on my return journey I was given a bottle of water, a glass of wine and a cup of coffee.  A packet of crisps, a small hot meal, which was lovely, and a lemon posset and two shortbread biscuits. 

Price was not too bad, but I have a railcard which helps.

items.title: Disruption
items.review_text:
As if life isn't bad enough as it is trying to get to London to see my mate who I haven't seen for over a year thanks to you bunch of going on strike you can't even be bothered to respond to Twitter without us the public you wouldn't have a job be grateful for what you're getting thanks for causing destruction affecting my mental health should've been travelling to Dartford on the 8th so thank you for disrupting my life


To the public not matter to you have not learnt to respond to peoples messages

items.title: Avoid at all costs. Please read.
items.review_text: I spoke to 4 staff members on my journey today. All were rude, inconsiderate and honestly a bit weird. Very unpleasant experience and left me feeling quite anxious for most of my journey. I don't often get trains and there were multiple delays which made transfers very stressful. I do not recommend.

items.title: Applied for delay claim which was…
items.review_text:
Applied for delay claim which was Infact the train was cancelled and I didn’t travel on the ticket and I applied for delay claim
On 11 September itself through the app and it’s been 22 September now ans I can’t see any case open but I had recieved the email
After lodging the claim but it’s like a scam as I can’t see any claim case in my account after login “ Case Acknowledgement - Ref: LNER-220911-CPVJ”. Still no news of the refund as I haven’t travelled either same day or next day as the scheduled train on 11 September was cancelled so it was usless to go next day train.. can you review this case reference is that is genuine or just a scam like other disappointing customers who suffer same as me?

items.title: 1st Class Pointless
items.review_text: Absolute waste of money paying for 1st class Aberdeen to Edinburgh. No food or drink. Excessive cost. Tired and out dated carriage.

items.title: Off Peak, no complaints
items.review_text: I travel quite often off peak with LNER. I've always found the service to be excellent. Trains generally run on time. If there has been any delay the LNER compensation request is easy to complete and payment is prompt. the Azuma trains are clean, the staffare polite and helpful. My family have even been upgraded when the train manager realised it was my wife's birthday. Such a contrast between this service and EMR, which is appalling.

items.title: Disgusting service
items.review_text: Disgusting service. Train was cancelled with no notice due to staff shortages. Applied for compensation, it’s been refused because I couldn’t say how long the cancelled train was delayed. Will look into claiming back through small claims court instead.

items.title: Paid for 1st class on the 6.10am out of…
items.review_text: Paid for 1st class on the 6.10am out of Peterborough purely to get some breakfast ahead of a busy day, only to be told nothing left. Staff on a free be sat in our seats, and the 1st class area is close to empty. Absolutely shocking service. If only there was an alternative!!!

items.title: Refund process awful!
items.review_text: I had booked a weekend away in Edinburgh with my Family in July, on the 11th the trains were delayed and I had put in for a delay refund that evening. 9 weeks later I am still waiting for the refund. I have sent statements across etc to prove it has never been sent to me. They do not care and just fob you off at every point! Useless service, they just hope you give up in chasing them!

items.title: Treated like mushrooms
items.review_text:
Treated like mushrooms.  

There is a dealy on the line between Peterborough and Grantham.

Every time we get an update from the staff, they just add the time from the last update to the expected delay.  The press mentioned that LNER were aware of the problem at 7am, well before I set off on my journey when I had the opportunity to take my car, but we were informed there would be a 20 min delay.  We are now on the train, and the current delay if 90 mins and only increasing. 

Either LNER don't have a clue or they just don't care.

I will be generous and go with dont have a clue.

UPDATE
Its getting worse.  The train we are on is now being cancelled and we are being kicked off at Doncaster.

Shihab, part of the LNER staff claims there is another train directly behind us.  He doesn't know what time we will now get to Leeds, he doesn't know if we can recover incidental costs as a result of the delays... Treated like mushrooms.

items.title: Very Impressive At Refunding
items.review_text:
We travelled as a couple from York to Portsmouth for a day out and unfortunately missed our connection from Kings Cross to York on our return. We managed to get to Leeds where a Taxi was provided back to York.
I then put a Delay Repay claim in as we were 4 hours late home due to a South Western Train breaking down causing our delay. Within a month I received the full amount of 139 Pounds back which is very impressive in my opinion. 
The trains itself are also nice as well, so although we had a bad return journey, it was made better by obtaining a full refund. Thank you LNER.

items.title: Helpful on the phone
items.review_text:
I called them up about changing my return travel date (which you can do very easily online) because i had printed e-tickets to travel out but no means of now printing an amended return. (I'm also a maverick that doesn't want a smartphone so it really had to be a physical ticket)  

I was hoping they would change my ticket for me on the phone and then give me a reference to collect tickets at the station. But it transpires that if you selected e-tickets on your original booking then e-tickets is what you'll get for any amendment too. Collecting tickets at the station (known as: Tickets on Departure) can't be done. I think this needs to change because you're making it harder for me when you don't have to. 

But that said the Geordie guy that i spoke to was really very sympathetic and helpful in suggesting the library to get my amended e-ticket printed, which i did. Thankyou.

items.title: Dirty, noisy, uncomfortable, a bad experience even when it works properly
items.review_text: On time and the staff are pleasant. But the trains have gone very downhill since I last travelled, since Lner took over from Virgin. First class seats are so uncomfortable, headrest that pushes your head forward so I ended up with a bad back. Not helped by the rock hard seat. Train was dirty and they've decorated in dark, grim colours. Biggest problem for me was the noise on board. No quiet coach these days, I was a mess by the time I left the train, it was traumatic for me. I didn't think the food could be worse than Virgin, but I was wrong!

items.title: Great service from Jonathan of Edinburgh
items.review_text:
We travelled to Edinburgh on 31 August on 9.00 train from Kings Cross. My two friends and I were looked after by a great team including Jonathan. He was delightful to us, really helpful not only with his service but his guidance in how to make our connection in Edinburgh. We only had 10 minutes to transfer and his advice was superb, clear and easy to understand. 
Thank you Jonathan.

items.title: Great service
items.review_text: Brilliant journey with LNER Wednesday 31st August.  Excellent service from professional and friendly staff at stations and on board. A really great experience. Love the AZUMA trains - very comfortable and very clean. Thankyou LNER.

items.title: Doesn't refund and hopes customer won't notice
items.review_text:
Was refunded by evoucher, went to use the evoucher which was no longer on my account.  
LNER said evoucher was cancelled and refund issued instead - except no money was refunded.
LNER said the refund was cancelled 'by mistake'.  
Now having to chase up as they obviously hoped I wouldn't notice. Disgusting behaviour.

items.title: Got train delayed 37 min from york to…
items.review_text: Got train delayed 37 min from york to newcastle, complained to them, as they saying you will get compensation if your train is more than 30min late, got reply from them that their records shows that train was late 29min, so I'm not entilted to any compensation, BUNCH OF LIERS

items.title: Forgot railcard got charged
items.review_text: Bought my ticket and got my armed forces discount but left my railcard on the ship. The jobsworth wouldn’t let it slide onboard even with a military I.d. Made me pay £40. Nice way to treat people about to leave for home for months at a time.

items.title: Bought a railcard, wouldn't replace when expired
items.review_text: Bought a railcard - it expired - LNER lost my details and wouldn't replace it like they are meant to. Now I have to buy a new railcard. Will not buy from LNER.

items.title: I’m so fed up with the regular…
items.review_text:
I’m so fed up with the regular cancellations and constant delays.  When you have to use service for work it has a significant impact. 

The price of tickets just adds to the misery.

items.title: 1st class catering poor, but excellent "one click delay repay"
items.review_text:
1st class very comfortable, and much more room. A slight caveat, choice of catering has gone right down hill. Hot menu is great, but recently, on my 10 trips with LNER, only once have I been served this. The rest has been their "light deli menu" with a really poor choice of sandwiches. Also, options in the first class lounges really limited.

On the flip side of all this, I absolutely love LNER's delay repay. Considering how much effort you have to go to with other companies. With LNER, if your train is delayed by more than 30 minutes, 10 minutes after getting to your destination, you get an email asking you if you want to receive your refund. Click the link, and the money is paid back usually within 24 hours. (Enable one click delay repay for this to happen on your LNER account).

items.title: Thought I would treat myself to 1st…
items.review_text:
Thought I would treat myself to 1st Class. Absolute waste of money. For an extra £70 I got 3 cups of tea, Proper oats overnight soaked - read golden syrup instant porridge with hot water😳
Used to be worth it when traveling edinburgh to kings cross with Virgin - LNER pretty crap all round - so many staff grumpy - guys if you don’t want to do your job - please leave the train at the next station!!

items.title: I left my luggage this morning on train…
items.review_text: I left my luggage this morning on train and contacted the staff present at Leeds station and she immediately start calling to sort it. I got my luggage back at Wakefield as I was travelling in next train to London.  What a service by staff and lesson learned by me.

items.title: Recently had to change a ticket for a…
items.review_text:
Recently had to change a ticket for a trip and they assisted me with that and I was refunded within the week. Excellent customer service! The best I’ve ever had to deal with and will always be trying to use them when travelling in the future!

Our newly booked train was 1st Class and they go above and beyond to make it worth while - would highly recommend!

items.title: Be Warned - Breakfast/Brunch Menu Now Ends at 9.00am
items.review_text: No bacon rolls on the 10.00am train to Aberdeen any more. Really LNER? It is on your breakfast/brunch menu. When do you think brunch is?! Strangely, I don't want to eat a meat pie at 10.00am in the morning. Is this, perhaps, a cut back due to loss of revenue from all the strike action?

items.title: Thanks guys
items.review_text: Monday August 22nd - 10:28 Edinburgh to Aberdeen. I had a very pleasant and comfortable journey thanks to the kind of staff you would always hope to have on such a journey. They were all very welcoming, attentive, efficient and friendly. A lady sitting opposite needed a little more support than usual but nothing was too much trouble. Thanks guys for the kind of service you should be able to “record for training purposes”!

items.title: Considering the UK is well known for…
items.review_text: Considering the UK is well known for it's awful train service. You would think Lner's refund process would be a lot easier and clearly marked.

items.title: Always late or cancelled, no refunds
items.review_text:
Always late or cancelled, never refunds.
Just now train was delayed of hundreds of people cause one member of staff was late. Apparently 100s of people have to suffer and lose time for someone who is not punctual. Say 300 people on train. 300 x 20mins = 100 hours……
Terrible as always.

items.title: Very pleasantly surprised by an amazing…
items.review_text: Very pleasantly surprised by an amazing service from London to Edinburgh on 14th August travelling first class. Beverage services were frequent throughout the journey. Food was pretty reasonable although limited selection (Sunday service). Seats were comfortable and plenty leg room. Decent wifi and easy acess charging points. Easily comparable to the old Virgin East coast service.

items.title: Cancelled Train & Extra Charges For Their Mistake
items.review_text:
LNER cancelled our original return journey from Edinburgh to Kings Cross, and offered either a refund or the option to rebook to the next train. We had to pay an extra £48 for the next service and couldn’t get seats together as a group of 5. We boarded the train approximately 30 minutes before departure and went to our booked seats only for there to be a tannoy 5 minutes before departure announcing that seat reservations were no longer valid, despite them having cost more than an unreserved seat, and passengers could sit anywhere. 

LNER have not responded to our complaint or request to be refunded the extra money we had to pay for a later service due to their poor planning following industrial action they had been noticed of weeks before (our train was the day after).

items.title: Appalling - assaulted and LNER couldn’t care less!
items.review_text:
Appalling; I was physically assaulted by a drunk male passenger on my journey on an LNER train. My elderly mother who has a disability was verbally abused by one of his companions. The Guard did nothing; British transport police were worse than useless. Contacted LNER and this was the response; 

Thank you for contacting LNER on 10/08/2022
 
After reviewing your correspondence, we have determined  are responsible for your experience. We have forwarded on all the relevant details so that their Customer Services can investigate and respond to you accordingly.
 
If you would like to contact them directly, please find the details below:
 
 Thanks again for contacting LNER.
 
And that was their “resolution”…
Do NOT travel with this company if you want to be safe!

items.title: Making a terrible trip better. Thank you
items.review_text: We had a massive delay of more than 4 hours on a trip from London to Edinburgh. Then a six hour train journey on a jam packed train. We finally arrived early morning. With no more onward journeys LNER offered me and the other 50 odd customers taxis and hotels and further refunded my ticket. The staff were helpful and extremely polite. Thank you LNER for outstanding customer service.

items.title: No organisation what's the point in booking a seat
items.review_text: My daughter booked us a seat to kings cross to take my grandson to london zoo. This was his 1st trip on a train and what a shambles it was. Arrived at the station at 1730 for our 1748 return train when it arrived was told the previous train tickets was valid on this one.so then the stampede began. I cannot believe how ignorant people can be could not get a seat and was in the corridor where the carriages join up with my 6 year old grandson and 7 month pregnant daughter. At this point we could not move either way and my daughter got very panicky about how full it was she sat on the floor and started to cry. Next an announcement came over that we could go on another train less full on another platform so got off to then be pushed out of the way by people getting on this train my 6 year old grandson and pregnant daughters are so upset there's no organisation whatsoever  We then had a technical fault delaying the train and 2 stops due to congestion so arrived at our station at 2050 what a traumatic and stressful experience that has put us all off travelling by train what's the point in booking a seat.

items.title: Lner sent me an alert today for advance…
items.review_text:
Lner sent me an alert today for advance tickets.
Newcastle to london for November saying now available to purchase. Went onto their site ,tried to order, answer not yet available,would you like us to alert you when available.
There’s a hole in my bucket dear Liza

items.title: Our trip with LNER was wonderful on 12…
items.review_text: Our trip with LNER was wonderful on 12 Aug 22 from Peterborough to Newcastle.  I has arranged passenger assist which I had never used before.  First they got in touch with me right away regarding my needs and special requests.  Originally we could not book seats together when I looked at the seat map but they were able to get us seats together by the time of our trip.  We  didn't expect that. In the station itself, I was escorted to the waiting room then the passenger assist staff came back when it was time to meet my train.  They helped with a ramp on the train and were very friendly.  Getting off the train, a staff member met us at the door of the train with a wheelchair, which I was glad to have as there was quite a bit of walking.  Since the staff member was just about to quit for the day, she even wheeled me to my hotel across the street.  Amazing service! The trip from Newcastle to Peterborough was wonderful until we got to Grantham.  Again, we had great seats together and the hot meal was quite good.  We were seated where the door to the disabled toilet was very obvious.  One suggestion, put a notice on the door to not start anything until the passenger is certain the door is closed all the way.  Several times men got themselves in position before the door was closed,  we could not see anything fortunately.  Also, put a notice on the walls of all the toilets for the men to put the seat down.  Several times I had to put the seat down and there was only toilet tissue not paper towels to touch the seat with.  The trip was wonderful until we got to Grantham.  All the trains going south were cancelled at this point due to a overhead wire issue, for which we don't fault the train company.  We were given assistance off the train then it was up to us to make arrangements.  Fortunately we were only one stop away and a taxi was already arranged so it came and got us at Grantham.  We were told we would gave a refund for our disrupted trip. Overall, we are extremely pleased with LNER and will use them again. The overhead wire issue just past our final destination was just bad luck.

items.title: A sad lack of customer service.
items.review_text:
I assume as a result of the train strike ending on 25th June, my advanced booked 09:40 Inverness to Kings Cross train on June 26th was cancelled.

I opened a case with LNER for Delay/Repay two days later on 28th June.

Other than the automated email response, I only received one email from LNER (on 10th July). This was to request a copy of my ticket that I am sure I had already provided when I first opened the delay/repay request. I then sent additional emails over time seeking an update. I heard nothing back!

On 12th August, I opened a new case with LNER via email asking what was happening with my existing case. Again, I got the automated email response providing the new case number.

Today, 17th August, I was notified by PAYPAL that LNER had refunded the cost of my ticket.

I have yet to receive any additional emails from LNER.

I don't regard this as satisfactory customer service.

items.title: Mixed opinion on lner
items.review_text: Mixed opinion on lner. I had booked a return journey from Edinburgh to filey which meant two connections (Lner to york then catch another two not lner) so my journey down was pretty OK (for someone with severe anxiety and travelling alone) however, 10 minutes from York Station and the train stops! Well that's me upto ninety from then on in, faulty overhead wires hanging had us sitting there in spitting distance of my stop for 3 hours. The lady i was meeting had to drive to york station as id missed all my connections. Then some eejit came running down the train telling us we're all getting sent back to Edinburgh...holy hell that's me doing a full on lioness with a headache from Satan's spell book. Took a total panic attack and was trying to get off anyway I could. Train manager (debbie) I think her name was, came got me and my bag and moved me to first class and explained that we were still going to york. Phew!! Crisis averted...hmm I think not. Gets off in york picks up what I went for and because of the 3 hour delay I had to get straight back on the return train...which was rammed like a scene from a really crappy 80s concert. I had to sit on the floor with my dog (very large, strong dog) between the doors all the way back to Edinburgh despite booking a seat, with a table so the dog could go under. Absolutely furious at that tbh. Had to get up and haul the dog from one side to another repeatedly as folk wanting a bottle of water or just a nosey. For someone who never leaves the house because of appalling anxiety this journey for me was most definitely the worst experience I've had and one I will never repeat. I don't care if I wake up in London, drunk with no clothes on...I'll just move there. I'm still waiting on my refund two weeks later...£131.20 to sit on a dirty floor?! Great to get my money back but where is it??? The Mixed opinion I mentioned is due to the staff, the train manager was fab and a chap not working that day (for lner) but travelling in first class sat down with me to help calm me down he was even so good as to walk me right through york Station to meet the person I was down to see. He was great and helped me tremendously. So the journey = 👎but the staff = ⭐️

items.title: God awful service
items.review_text: God awful service

items.title: What great service travelled from…
items.review_text: What great service travelled from Edinburgh to London on 12 August train was over an hour late due to a broken rail but one click of the mouse and fare refunded today Sunday 14 August. Compare this to Chiltern Railways asked for a refund due to industrial action 3 weeks ago had to print and post tickets to Scotland I am still waiting for my refund. Which Company would you choose.

items.title: We were booked on the 14.05 from Kings…
items.review_text:
We were booked on the 14.05 from Kings Cross to Leeds on the 11th Aug.  The train stopped not long after we left the station.   It eventually started again but we then realised that there was a problem and the air conditioning was not working for the rest of the 2 hour journey.  The staff provided some water but this was not cold.   The experience was not great when the weather was so hot.   What was so amusing was whilst we were waiting for our next train in Leeds the same train loaded up with new passengers and set back off to London knowing the air conditioning was not working……

Very poor service.

items.title: l had booked a seat from the North…
items.review_text: l had booked a seat from the North of England to London kings cross in April 2022 on LNER azuma train and l got on the train in Harrogate and all was well until when we got to Doncaster a man got on the train and sat Infront of me but he had put too much perfume so l decided to move to another seat.two blokes occupied my seat and l sat on a different seat.by the time we got to Retford a girl came and said am on her seat and l could not ask those two blokes to move.l had to move up the train and l found 2 seats but l could not fit properly with my bags .l couldn't wait to get to London as the journey was so uncomfortable.l was so happy when the train got to london.but l advise people to seat on their booked seats especially when the train is travelling towards london.l blame the guy who had put too much perfume for making me move from my seat.

items.title: Had to put a one star as there's no…
items.review_text: Had to put a one star as there's no option for a minus star.   Misleading  money grabbing and awful customer service .  They should be barred from operating !

items.title: The food for app was not working even…
items.review_text: The food for app was not working even though  it was advertised very poor

items.title: Pay money for the quieter coach and…
items.review_text:
Pay money for the quieter coach and there’s been nothing but Shouting kids running up and down. What’s the point in paying money to sit here if people are not gonna follow the rules of the train a bit of a  joke really had this all the way from Doncaster to Leeds. 

Never again will I use this service unless these issues get sorted immediately

items.title: Exemplary service by catering staff on LNER train
items.review_text:
Travelled from London Kings Cross to Edinburgh with my toddler granddaughter - catering staff (Sam, manager) went above and beyond when I was unable to order a cup of tea to my seat.  Not only did he give me sandwiches, crisps and a Diet Coke as a very kind gesture, he later appeared at my seat with a cup of tea and a packet of biscuits - what a kind and thoughtful man and a credit to LNER, along with his colleague, who was equally thoughtful.  
Train was also on time and carriage was clean and comfortable.

items.title: Train late 106 minutes!
items.review_text:
Train late 106 minutes!
2 tickets 2 passengers ordered from trainline 
Got refund for 1 ticket almost 1 month later
everything provided by email
LNER-220711-CKKW: Resolution
Don’t believe in them Refund

items.title: Hot food non-existent, vegetarians will not survive
items.review_text:
Writing to complain about your train service London to Newcastle on 7pm Friday 29th July and 3.55 return on Sunday 31st July. There is nothing first class about travelling first class!

On both occasions we did not buy food having checked your menu. On Friday we were told there was no hot food on board. Then told you only had egg sandwiches for vegetarians. I assume you realise that most vegetarians these days don’t eat eggs? Then told to give the buffet car a shot - again only non egg choice was not possible as you were not doing hot sandwiches. Can’t believe the comment from your staff that food is not part of the fare and is complimentary so don’t expect it!!!!!! What exactly am I paying for then? If I’d known i advance I would have bought the food at KX. Instead we starved

Return trip was no better. Egg sandwiches again. Shameful. Starving again. Why as first paying passenger should I have to clear tables and brush down seats which are littered in food?

items.title: lner is alright
items.review_text:
i've travelled with lner between london and leeds a couple of times.

first time on 18th march in standard but in first class with a seatfrog upgrade for the train back to london. i booked the 1003 which would normally be an intercity 225 but that was swapped out for an azuma which meant unreserved seating throughout the entire train. for the train back home, i booked the 1545 which was a 10-car azuma.

second time was on 20th april and with seatfrog upgrades for both directions. the northbound train was the 1033 and was an intercity 225 as planned! the southbound train was the 1415 which was an azuma that had started at harrogate

third time was on 11th may and no seatfrog upgrades were used. northbound in first class and southbound in standard. my original northbound train, the 1003 was cancelled due to vandalism in the st neots area so i had to travel on the 1033 which was an azuma with unreserved seating throughout the entire train. the train was packed, even in first class. thankfully there was one solo seat available so i took that. food was alright. smashed avocado on toast with poached egg. the journey back home was on the 1645 which was an intercity 225. no seatfrog upgrades as first class had been sold out but standard was still good enough.

fourth time on 1st july and i booked the 1003 and 1515 services. the 1003 was once again swapped from a 225 to an azuma. i had the "full lner" which had bacon, egg, sausage, hash brown and tomato. it would normally include baked beans as well but i requested baked beans to be removed as i am allergic to baked beans. on the 1515, i had sheperdess chicken and for dessert, i had the lemon and rhubarb meringue pie.

fifth time was on 21st july on the 1603 northbound and 1945 southbound train services which were thankfully intercity 225 sets as planned. onboard the 1603, i had roasted scottish salmon and the lemon and rhubarb meringue pie while on the 1945, i had a ham and cheese ciabatta, prosecco, bottle of water and twix for £12.10. the meal deal was £6 while the prosecco itself was £6.10

would i recommend lner again? yes but only on the intercity 225 sets that operate between london and york/leeds! the azuma sets are alright in standard but better in first class! the intercity 225s are comfortable in both standard and first. if you want the "dine" menu onboard lner's intercity 225, it is available on the following:
0715 leeds to london
0656 skipton to london
1003 london to leeds
1033 london to leeds
1603 london to leeds
1703 london to leeds
the 225 group has diagrams of intercity 225 services that lner uses, not just the 1003 london to leeds and 1245 leeds to london services. search for "225 group diagrams" on google
this is subject to change...

items.title: Azuma trains are mostly good........... and just a little bit 'bad'.
items.review_text: We travelled from London to Edinburgh on one of the new-fangled Azuma trains.  They look the part, sleek and stylish on the outside.  Inside, the seats were a little on the hard side and being slightly above average in height and, ahem, waist size, the seats proved just a little bit tight.  The train was completely packed; nonetheless, our two reserved seats were there empty as expected and there was just about enough room for us to stash our four mid-sized rucksacks on the overhead racks.  The ride was generally very smooth although the many curves north of Darlington were a little interesting!  The staff on board were really polite and welcoming, as were the staff at the barriers at Kings Cross. Perhaps when the Azumas go for their first upgrade/refurbishment (2029?), or even beforehand based on customer experience after 3 years of being in service (!!!!!!), LNER could upgrade the seats with a little more padding?  All in all, a pleasant journey.

items.title: Very impressed by the speed money was…
items.review_text:
Very impressed by the speed money was returned to my account for cancellations due to industrial action.

Money was back within 3 days for both tickets.

items.title: I reserved a seat online and booked in…
items.review_text: I reserved a seat online and booked in advance and was expecting a straightforward journey. Paying almost s£200 to sit on the floor next to a door and having to move at every single stop (with three bags) for others to exit and enter all the way from London to Edinburgh is not, in my experience, value for money. I am appalled and had the worst journey I could have imagined. My connecting train was late and therefore my reservation seat was null and void. For the cost of a ticket there should be a system where reservations after connecting train delays are secured so customers on earlier bookings have somewhere to sit if and when things go wrong. Especially when it is not within the customers control. Appalled. Drive if you can - or take a coach. At least you’ll be able to sit down.

items.title: Delay repay for Paper Tickets.
items.review_text:
Delay repay for Paper Tickets.

If I haven't collected my tickets the automated process offers a quick refund, no issues.

If you have paper tickets they appear to not honour the refund scheme.  I posted in several tickets, only to be told they ALL got lost in the post somehow.  

So I started emailing pictures of them, as advised. Only to not even have a reply.  This has been going on for several months, so I cannot understand how anyone gets a refund.

items.title: I would like to thank all the staff on…
items.review_text: I would like to thank all the staff on the 1400 from Kings Cross to Arbroath today. I get this service twice a year and no complaints. Outstanding. Kept up to date. Late going down late coming back. Not their fault. Thanks again

items.title: Customer Service Call Centre
items.review_text:
We’ve just spoken to the LNER call centre with reference to changing the day of travel that we’d booked due to the strikes on 13th August. I was expecting to be fobbed off with them saying I’d be better off going on the website.
My wife and I had the real privilege of speaking with Louise. There was nothing this lady was not prepared to do for us. If I’d asked to have jam on it, she’d of delivered !
Louise, I hope this review is seen by you  or at least shared with you from your employer as I know businesses look at trustpilot. 
You are an absolute credit to LNER. They are so lucky to have you representing them on the phone, especially at this period of time with the strikes. Thank you so much for your help this evening (Thursday 28th July)..

items.title: I have used the east coast mainline…
items.review_text:
I have used the east coast mainline whilst it was Virgin trains, as for many other private ventures during its tenure in the 30 years I have been an adult.  LNER is no different.  My train was delayed nearly 2 hours, yet my flights were on time getting back to the final stretch to the north east.  Sadly my expectations of trains in the UK is very low so to be offered a refund was nice.  Customers were giving the staff some really nasty abuse which is unacceptable when I waited patiently for a LNER train to get back home.  However what annoys me is when you ask for a refund and go through the forms online (a simple process thankyou!) and they say please wait up to 10 working days for a response for your refund.  It is now been over a month and not even a email to say we are very busy you will be contacted as soon as possible.  This is the problem communication is lacking.  I had to go and type in my case reference: LNER-220628-BRFD  into mr robot live chat (with a computer)!

and it says it has been sent to the relevant train provider - not helpful! could someone explain what's happening? "relevant train provider" that would be LNER! …some communication would be great on this matter, thank you.

items.title: Greedy
items.review_text: Absolutely disgusted that you have to pay extra to travel on a different train due to industrial action. Have some compassion will you. See a chance to make a quick buck and boy do you take it. In future - I'll drive.

items.title: I left my wallet on a train travelling…
items.review_text: I left my wallet on a train travelling from Edinburgh to London Kings Cross. I realised whilst on the platform at Northallerton, I approached an LNER station manager (Stephen Green) and he was an absolute legend. Called the train manager on my behalf, found the wallet and managed to get them to drop it into the lost property at Kings Cross so I could collect it on my return to London the next day as it was my end destination. Stephen even missed his train whilst we waited for the train manager to confirm they'd found my wallet. Was a great interaction with someone who genuinely just wanted to help.

items.title: Rip off parking charges at Grantham station
items.review_text: Rip off parking charges at Grantham station, £12 per day. Charges are not clear, apparently off peak reduced parking fees doesn’t include bank holidays. If you park on bank holiday you get charged the peak week day amount.  Payments for parking are calculated as you leave the car park, that’s when they give you the ‘nasty surprise’. Oh and when you complain they tell you they rip off all their customers in this way and expect any appeal to take weeks. There’s a nice NCP car park near by, that charges less, only £5.95 per day and has a clear parking policy, my recommendation is use that car park.

items.title: Desperate or not?
items.review_text: We had booked the Lner from kings cross. We arrived at the station 30 mins b4 departure time 5.18 pm and was not advised of the platform number until just after departure time. We then rushed to the train, worried that it would depart b4 we got there. We boarded the train, then informed there would be a delay. There was a 37 mins delay, due to the driver having to catch a train to take over our train. We were all informed we would receive 50% compensation. It ruined our trip plus we missed our evening connection. Very stressful. Would I travel with LNER again? No.

items.title: Disappointing experience
items.review_text: Disappointing experience. Waverley to London on East Coast Rail and Virgin used to be an experience to enjoy First Class.  Comfortable seats, could actually reserve a seat and great attitude and ok food.  LNER feels like it’s Soviet era Russian train - First Class has hard uncomfortable seats, no luggage racks, poor carriage ventilation, terrible food and poor staff attitude.  Feels like the Gulags. What has happened to enjoying rail journeys - London Transport take note!  We are paying good money and expect First Class Service this is worse than airline Economy class!

items.title: What a shambles of a company and the…
items.review_text: What a shambles of a company and the employees they actually cause more trouble than their was in the fist place stay away from London trains lier usless company usless employees s simple as that

items.title: Cheap uncomfortable
items.review_text: Garbage, rubbish infrastructure, uncomfortable seats, oddly designed toilets, cold, poorly lit and generally a sense if being short changed. Staff trying very hard to compensate and very professional.

items.title: Journey delayed because of heatwave
items.review_text: Journey delayed because of heatwave. Kept informed all the way. Got immediate and full refund for journey. Very impressed.

items.title: We used LNER 4 times in 3 days from…
items.review_text: We used LNER 4 times in 3 days from Peterborough to London in the first class. The staff was super nice, food and drinks too. All services were on time. But a very annoying things kept happening - people walking throughout the train including via 1st class and food preparation places to disembark quickly at their Station. This made our journey very stressful, having paid for first class tickets found that people standing in the corridors for a good part of the journey. We think this should not be encouraged.

items.title: Great hi-tec trains. Lo-tec service.
items.review_text:
Great hi-tec trains. Lovely work wear glossy uniforms. But same lo-tec appalling service.

Train connection from Peterborough to York was a beautiful looking Azuma vehicle. The shape of the future Unfortunately, it was dangerously overcrowded. Passengers sat in the aisles. And all travelling at 125 mph?

Return train even more interesting. The train started at York, was late there and got progressively later. 

We missed connection at Peterborough. 

"Whispering Bob Harris" on announcements. Nobody could hear a thing!

Great technology. Badly managed. Bring back one state owned railway that owns all trains and tracks.

Stop this shambolic pretence of competition between service providers that provide appalling customer service.

items.title: Absolute shambles!!
items.review_text: Absolute shambles!!! Arrived at kings cross as I do everyday a train was delayed said head to plat03 for Stevenage …. So I did… asked woman on train … nope first stop is Peterborough! So I go to ask LNER staff…. Next one 45 mins later! Walk back to main booking hall!! Announcement next train to Stevenage leaving from platform 3 now!! So I run!! I’m 30 degrees heat only to find a barrier up!! Too late he said LNER staff have not got a clue what is going on!! I work for TFL this is absolute shambles

items.title: Helpful shift manager's
items.review_text: I wanted to extend my thanks to shift managers Lindsey and Emma  at kings cross Station Wefor assisting me when I had issues with my journey on Monday because of change of train timings. They were both very helpful and accommodating. I really appreciated their efforts to make sure my journey was as smooth as possible.

items.title: This is one of the most crap trains I…
items.review_text: This is one of the most crap trains I have ever been on they cancelled my first train at the last minute and THEN they make us move About 6 times if you need to get to London take something else as this is the most horrendous  train I have ever been on it also have over price food NEVER COME ON THESE TRAINS UNLESS TOU WANT TO BE TIRED AND FEELING LIKE ABSOLUTE CRAP AFTER

items.title: Absolute horror show from LNER…
items.review_text: Absolute horror show from LNER yesterday. The midday service from kings x to Inverness on 11/7/22 was travel service at its very worst. Held up several times which can happen however dangerously overcrowded train. Kids sitting in aisles. Lady on buffet cart from London to Newcastle was extremely ignorant. Train manager a disgrace. Countless lies over the tannoy. No honesty at all. Train was due at Inverness at 8. 10 before it made Edinburgh. No toilet paper to wipe my 2 girls with from 4pm. One bottle of water to share amongst 6. 2 minutes notice train was terminating at Edinburgh. Manager announcemed he would arrange alternative transportation for people going past Edinburgh. He then stayed in the train for an hour till the platform clear so no questions to answer. Pensioners and families with no idea how to get home or where to seek help. This company is not fit to run a raffle and the train manager was at best utterly incompetent at worst a danger to life. Hang your head in shame LNER

items.title: Rubbish
items.review_text: Rubbish, train from London mysteriously broken again - Peterborough problems again as well, no information given, al trains full, or cancelled LNER you are a shambles just awful

items.title: LNER Newcastle Station staff
items.review_text:
We were travelling from Edinburgh to Newcastle. 
Everything was going well. 
Train clean,fast, and on time. 
But we were keen to drama, so we firgot the backpack in the train....with passports, cards... sock and horror.
Fortunately,  the LNER customer service staff, help us to sort the issue.
They were very professionals and kind and engaged. 
Thanks indeed to all staff and specially to Lisa.
Excellent service.

items.title: Just got off the train from York to…
items.review_text: Just got off the train from York to Newcastle although the train was delayed getting into Newcastle the team that served us in 1st class were brilliant

items.title: Had more than one hour delay on our…
items.review_text: Had more than one hour delay on our trip from London to Edinburgh. We requested a refund due to the delay and received a reply that the ticket will be fully refunded within 2 weeks. I have been waiting for 4 weeks now and have not received any refund. Emails were also not answered anymore. I cannot recommend to travel with this company.

items.title: Amazing Staff
items.review_text: I was on an early morning Sunday service from Peterborough to York, and the train ended up being delayed for 20 minutes or so at the station due to a brake problem; no fault of the crew. I had a tight connection to make and it would’ve been stressful, but the customer attendant in the cafe bar made it so much better; Aftab is an absolute legend; humble amusing and kind. He made this simple almost disastrous train journey memorable for the the right reasons. This is a recurring theme with LNER. Every staff member I meet and talk to are absolutely lovely. Do be respectful with them, they’ll all go the extra mile with you.

items.title: Great service, good communication
items.review_text: The train from London to Edinburgh was on time and all staff were very friendly. The toilets were clean and the train manager was very communicative during a 10 minute delay due to an issue on the track ahead affecting all train companies. A great experience - thank you.

items.title: Terrible
items.review_text: Terrible. Customer service purport to get back to you within 10 working days which is pathetic. Impossible to reschedule trains without paying for new tickets altogether, and to top things off the seats we had reserved were not reserved due to a myriad of cancellations apparently. Absolute joke of a train line.

items.title: Absolutely outstanding!
items.review_text:
Where do I start? On Saturday 2nd July it was my first time in First Class for LNER. For a 30 minute trip (Newcastle to Darlington) it cost me £17.60 (2x 15 year olds). That totals out to £8.75 per person. Which I believe is an outstanding value for money. The train was quiet and smooth and fast (Coach L). Catering was offered swiftly with Friendly staff. The snacks also came round which was amazing. For 30 minutes as a short journey I would not expect much. However, LNER went above and beyond to make it that bit better! Upon arrival in Darlington we went to the first class lounge. The lounge was a very relaxing place to rest for 30 minutes. There was one slight problem… the hot drinks machine was not working. But for me that was not a problem at all. (I’m sure LNER are responsible enough to fix it quickly). So would I recommend the extra money for this trip? Yes I certainly would because LNER also do their absolute best and it’s clear! It’s a nice way to have a quick chill! 
On the other hand LNER also were outstanding with how fast they were with the Refunds. I brought One too many tickets to Darlington. So, LNER have this really easy one click refund system. First thing this morning, I have an email saying that the refund Is on its way. No hassle at all problem free. Well done and thank you to LNER for making all of this possible. 

Outstanding!

items.title: We made a mistake when booking our…
items.review_text:
We made a mistake when booking our tickets and didn’t realise until the day of travel, the LNER lounge in Leeds sorted it immediately without hesitation. 

Exercise service thank you for such a speedy resolution, which unfortunately doesn’t seem to the the norm these days.

items.title: Due to strike action and subsequent…
items.review_text: Due to strike action and subsequent cancellations our journey was delayed by 5 hrs and 25 mins. We were delighted to be met by train host Jonathan on the Edinburgh to York route, his delightful attitude, attention to detail and humour absolutely made our trip a memorable and wonderful experience, every train should have a Jonathan, absolute asset to LNER. Lesley & Carol

items.title: Industrial strike
items.review_text: Workers went on strike against the company. So yeah, screw the company for screwing me up. Screw the government too.

items.title: So expensive. Not worth the price.
items.review_text:
The train tickets are expensive and you can’t book an open return ticket without spending hundred of pounds. 
I requested a window seat and got put on a seat without windows. It’s very claustrophobic. 
I wouldn’t recommend this Trainline. If you can get to your destination any other way then I’d suggest you do so. The service is terrible.

items.title: Sadly I cannot put 0 stars
items.review_text:
Sadly I cannot put 0 stars

Bought 1st class return ticket on LNER Edinburgh to Aberdeen. 4/6/22
I surveyed the grubby carriage in which I was sat and couldn’t quite believe that this is what passes for first class these days - worn, tired looking seats covered in grim grey vinyl, dirty carpets, crumbs on the floor etc. customer asked staff if they could remove rubbish off tables and she was promptly told “place in the bin there and there pointing”.

We pull out of Edinburgh and my mind switches towards food, and how I had read on the website, hot food and drinks...but 30 minutes into a 3 hour journey, before we have even made a stop, we are told that they have “run out” of hot food and only have 2 sandwiches, egg or Tuna? 

Customer behind myself advised he only had 1 tea from London and it was now Edinburgh. More people making comments but Staff not even bothered. 

Thank god my journey ended.

I called C/S due to emergency I had to enquire about changing station on return.  SADLY passed onto female who said “read small print, terms and conditions and put down phone”

I STUPIDLY booked another 1st class from Dundee to Edinburgh hoping first train was just a one off. Absolutely not, still abysmal, same issue, awful carriage, just different staff. No food, did get 1 drink though. 

One the worst travel experiences in a long long time. Save yourself the hassle and either fly up, or get the cheapest possible ticket you can in standard class then at least you don’t feel like you are being royally screwed. 

A prerequisite on getting a job with LNER and not just on their trains, is to have attended the Vinnie Jones Charm school.

There has to be better than this. 

Lner you supply misinformation on your website, carriages do not look as they do, food definitely not served or offered as advertised. SHAME ON YOU.

AVOID

items.title: Awful customer service.
items.review_text: Awful customer service.

items.title: More pain than gain
items.review_text:
We had quite busy Long Weekend in Edinburgh and on the journey back to London we learned Liner cancelled our seat reservations without any notice.
So me, my wife and 7 year old boy were left standing between the seats for almost 5hour journey!!! 
And it's after a busy holiday with mountain climbing and etc. With burning feet and so on
A torture for your money... Nothing else.
Cannot recommend these (have no words how to call them). 
Not reliable.
Roll on snare drums. Curtains.

items.title: Fantastic staff, wonderful experience, child-friendly
items.review_text:
The trains are clean, comfortable and have all the mod cons including food to your table QR and phone/laptop chargers.

The staff are lovely too. The lady at the ticket barrier at Newcastle Station, Michael, Stephen and Peter on the 8.01 Newcastle to Kings Cross train.  All were so lovely to my little ones who are a bit rowdy when they are excited!

The train was delayed for a short while but not the fault of the staff. Animals on the line.

This is the second time I've travelled on LNER and with or without kids the staff do everything they can to make your journey a pleasant one.

items.title: Travelled from Berwick upon tweed to…
items.review_text: Travelled from Berwick upon tweed to London kings cross 2 couples train was 12 minutes past 10 timewise spot on we travelled first class not very impressed no 1 approached us till half 11 to b told there was no breakfast left and the rest of the day menu very limited just as well we had our own food but to pay a service which you don’t recieve don’t if that’s just the normal totally different sevice returning on 31st of may left kings cross at 13.00 and staff could not be more attentive and must give a special mention to Elaine which she informed us it was only her second day on her own excellent customer service wishing her all the best in her future career.

items.title: Terrible and embarrassed for my…
items.review_text: Terrible and embarrassed for my colleagues who I recommended to, first class journey not at all, coudnt get drinks told next station no one came back, got one beer and asked for wine never got it. Food came never got a fork had to wash another customer fork to eat my cold dinner. Not worth first class status never again first class don’t bother waste of time and then because I complained on their Facebook they blocked me.

items.title: Always super helpful
items.review_text: Always super helpful, friendly staff. Great with understanding situations that are out of passengers control and helping where possible. Great twitter CS too!

items.title: Travelled on LNER 17.30hrs from…
items.review_text: Travelled on LNER 17.30hrs from Edinburgh to Newcastle First Class on Sunday 29th May. Have always had a positive experience in the past but very disappointed with this journey. Train very busy and only 2 staff serving in First Class. Not enough cups to offer hot drinks! Not everything on the menu was available and the toasted teacake I'd ordered (my only order) was given to me just before arriving in Newcastle (not blaming the 2 staff as they were rushed off their feet). When given a bottle of sparkling water I had to ask for a glass. No toilet paper in the loo and after putting soap on my hands, found there was no water!! Please improve your on board service LNER.

items.title: I have to praise the staff at the…
items.review_text: I have to praise the staff at the customer services desk at the wonderful Berwick upon tweed station. We had a family drama leaving us with no choice but to add a child to are already booked tickets. The girls at the station were exceptional and went above and beyond to help us add to a booking... The whole journey with LNER from start to finish - staff were brilliant thank you.

items.title: Overall service below poor
items.review_text: Overall service below poor

items.title: Great customer service and response
items.review_text: Train was delayed due to technical issue. Announced upon arrival that compensation may be due and to check website, did so and discovered I was due 100% refund, made claim through simple process and 3 days later they confirmed I would get all my money back, shame I didn't go first class.  Excellent performance and much better that my cancelled BA flight who 5 days later I've heard nothing.

items.title: Always reliable
items.review_text: Always reliable, well nearly, very clean, frequent and plenty of staff if you have a query. 1st class is a real bonus and not much more - just like a decent airline really with food and drink served free at your seat. The new Japaneese trains are rubbish compared to the old Brit made ones but all companies seem to have to have them now due to some gov't decision so no escaping their paddingless seating whoever you travel with. Apart from the annoying TV news displays at the ends its such a relaxing way to travel and watch the landscape pass by.

items.title: Aleks Vuletic is superstar
items.review_text: Aleks Vuletic is superstar, nothing too much trouble, give this man a pay rise!

items.title: £64.50 for a booked seat from Dundee to…
items.review_text: £64.50 for a booked seat from Dundee to Portsmouth including the Tube. Can’t go wrong, train on time, staff polite, bargain!

items.title: Reserved 2 seatsin the quiet…
items.review_text: Reserved 2 seats in the quiet coach.Train turns up no coach tannoy shouts smaller train no reservations just grab a seat where ever rugby scrum to leeds from kings cross; complain to LNER and they just say you got a seat somewhere didn't you ???

items.title: Terrible service
items.review_text: Terrible service. Train ticket machines don’t work. Website doesn’t work. You need to enter a booking reference in order to book a ticket, but can’t get a booking reference because you can’t book a ticket without a booking reference. Idiotic. No one at the information stand at the train station with a large queue. Massive queue for the Ticket desk and more than half the desks don’t have anyone working behind them.

items.title: Paid to travel first class from…
items.review_text: Paid to travel first class from Inverness to London.  Very disappointed and certainly would never pay extra for first class again.  Seats very uncomfortable, space limited, staff rude and food choice poor and literally thrown in front of you.  The contrast with Eurostar Standard Premier is unbelievable.  On Eurostar staff are polite and welcoming and the food is served on a tray and much better quality.  No idea how LNER can justify the high prices they charge for first class.  It would not take that much to improve the service.

items.title: A massive Thank You to York LNER staff
items.review_text: A massive Thank You to all the staff at York on Monday after my daughter got on the wrong train in Newcastle and missed her connection.  A member of staff spoke to the guard on another service and let her on.  She suffers from learning difficulties so it was a huge relief when she phoned me.  Well Done LNER staff!

items.title: So my London to Edinburgh was roughly…
items.review_text:
So my London to Edinburgh was roughly on time until just outside Waverley. Half an hour later we were still there. 35 minutes late. I had to do a call on the platform instead of from my hotel.
I wrote to lner who told me that there was a train occupying our platform. Ho hum, a train at a station..... pretty frustrating. West Coast is much more reliable in my experience. Avoid lner.

items.title: Uncomfortable seating in 1st class and…
items.review_text: Uncomfortable seating in 1st class and lack of choices on the menu

items.title: Hands down the best TOC in the country
items.review_text: Hands down the best TOC in the country. Lovely trains and frequent services to the places you actually want to visit. First class offerings are superb and even in standard class, the experience is great. I couldn't think of a better company to travel with, they're the perfect example of how a service should be ran. Choose these if they're an option!

items.title: Positives for 1st travel:
items.review_text:
Positives for 1st travel:
Seatfrog offer competitively priced upgrades for first class vs GWER etc.
Their App is good, with cashback etc.
Auto refund for train delay.
Food quality on Azuma trains quite good.
Even when not using their app, refund process is quick and simple for delays.
Power sockets positioned well for working and personally like the tray layout for working on the train.
Found staff always to be nice.

Improvements:
Very mixed bag on service in first class. As teetotal not interested in alcohol, but regular tea and soft drinks dependent on individual staff members.
Seats are not the most comfortable in Azuma First but reasonable.
I wouldn't pay for the 1st upgrade on the non-Azuma deli service, which is poor.
Portion sizes are small and would prefer slightly larger portions rather than packs of crisps etc. 


Used them about 5-6 times in the last 2 months and would give them a solid 4 stars.

items.title: Everytime I've had the pleasure of…
items.review_text: Everytime I've had the pleasure of traveling with LNER it's been nothing but smooth; trains are rarely delayed, the staff have always been polite and helpful, and the trains are well kept and modern.

items.title: aggressive, rude, staff every time
items.review_text: everytime I travel with them staff are rude, aggressive and nasty, never again, Avanti is always a positive experience, no thanks ! no matter how fast

items.title: First class isn't what it used to be
items.review_text:
A few times each year I join the Kings Cross to Inverness train at York. I have done this since it was run by Virgin, GNER and now LNER. My last journey, just a week ago, I booked standard class and used the Seatfrog app to upgrade the return journey to first class.

There are positives. The train staff were helpful and communicative, particularly when we were held for an hour due to a rail defect. The delay repay was seamless too: received an email to confirm I'd like to claim, clicked the link and then a few days later the money was in the bank. The leg room in standard class is great but not all is rosy.
The advance ticket price was excellent thanks to me checking constantly and being ready as they were added.

The negatives. I've never had an issue with my back on any long journey by car, train or plane. I found the seats on the Azuma in standard class are thin and uncomfortable, my back was aching well before we reached our destination. The seats aren't much better in first class but the recline seems to make the difference. Leg room in first is no better than standard, particularly if you're at a table.
Part of the first class experience, and you would have though partly justifying the hike in cost, used to be the food and drink. That service has been run down. The food options are mixed but what I found was that the advertised dish menu for this service was replaced with the cheaper looking deli menu. Some items were unavailable and some were so limited that they'd run out before we were few stops beyond Inverness. The food and drink is now rationed. My journey was for 6 hours which meant one item from the breakfast menu which could be a single satsuma, apple of pastry. I opted for what seemed more substantial, a ciabatta. The only option other than tea and coffee was a single bottle of water.
The lunch menu came into force much later into the journey and comprised a sandwich or wrap, a bag of crisps and a single drink. The only option in between those "meals" was tea or coffee.
I had a much better menu on the standard journey on the way up - one that I'd made up myself with the help of Pret and M&S.

I wish I hadn't paid for first class on the return, the extra cost wasn't reflected in the benefits it offered. I'll bring a support pillow for the next time I travel in standard :-)

items.title: Edinburgh to London journey
items.review_text: Edinburgh to London (York change over) journey, not enough seats for people on board. Stood outside the toilets amongst many other passengers, packed in and falling into each other for 2.5 hours until arriving at York. Unable to use WC, full to the top with urine, flush not working, urine spilling over the top. I understand these are busy times but felt very unsafe and undignified.

items.title: We’ve traveled from Leeds to Aberdeen…
items.review_text: We’ve traveled from Leeds to Aberdeen and our hostess from Newcastle (Jackie with the red hair) has been absolutely phenomenal!!! Her customer service is next level! She’s such an absolute asset to the team and made us feel welcome from the start of our journey xxx thank you Jackie

items.title: Rude customer service team at London Kings Cross
items.review_text: Finding our 12.09 train from London kings cross to Newcastle had been cancelled we naturally sought the advice of the information desk at the station. I was met with the most rude condescending man. My question to the man was “ I was booked on a lumo train, can I use a different company for my onward journey”. I was met with “madam do you want to get home …. Then listen to what I am telling you”. It was in such a rude fashion. I asked him why he had such an attitude. As a midwife matron I know how to handle a difficult patient. But this man spoke to me like a was dirt on his shoe. I do recognise working Easter Sunday isn’t nice but I was all smiley and lovely and pleasant. However the team on the platform that helped us get a train were fantastic. They were thorough and calming, organised and methodical. There were x3 gentleman and a lady and they were simply fantastic. Thank you team. Sorry your colleague at the info desk let you down.

items.title: A huge thank you to LNER staff and great service
items.review_text: My journey with LNER was absolutely amazing! After the eventful afternoon I had with getting on the wrong train, my anxiety going sky high and being somewhere I had never even heard of before let alone been! I was given a warm welcome onto LNER, I was allowed into first class with my baby and pram to save me running all the way to the other end of the train in a panic before it left, I was offered food and drinks, and plenty of help with absolutely anything. I would like to give a huge amount of credit and a massive thank you to a lovely lady with the most kind heart especially who works with LNER, I did not catch her name but she helped me onto the train with my pram and suitcase, she was constantly making sure I was okay and even offered to hold my little one for 5 mins to give me a break and calm myself down, she deserves a lot more than just a thank you! She has honestly made my journey feel comfortable and safe, so a big well done to her! 😊😊

items.title: Absolutely fantastic
items.review_text: Absolutely fantastic. After a nightmare journey across London (travelling with a friend with a broken leg, and a taxi driver who didn't care at all) we missed the London-Inverness train by 6 minutes. The staff at King's Cross restored our faith in humanity: kind, empathetic and practical - our tickets were changed and we were helped, first into the lounge, then onto the next direct train: thank you Mike, Jack and Peter. Train staff were equally kind and cheerful. I'll travel this line again, anytime.

items.title: Poor customer service
items.review_text: Poor customer service, staff not helpful or sympathetic. Sat in a queue for over am hour online to chat to someone and had to constantly wiggle the screen so I didn't get disconnected. There are plenty of other travel options from Scotland to London (including other train providers) and I'd encourage you to explore these first.

items.title: Missed our booked train from Kings…
items.review_text: Missed our booked train from Kings Cross to Montrose this afternoon due to delays on the South Western Line routes. LNER changed our tickets without any trouble and we were on our way within half an hour. Have found all the staff friendly and helpful and the trains clean.

items.title: I loved this train company!
items.review_text: I loved this train company and the Azumas. The first Class lounge was clean and the hot chocolate’s and the crisps are very nice. Staff on board with friendly and the food they bought us was amazing. Also great value only £9 extra to go first class then standard. Great experience.

items.title: Ive been using the East Coast Line for…
items.review_text: Ive been using the East Coast Line for the best part of 30 years, and this is the best its ever been. Virgin was a complete rip off when they ran it, ECML was getting there, but LNER have managed to show public ownership coupled with direction and a culture that has staff being cheerful works. I find station staff are always helpful and polite and the train crew are just superb. Trains are clean, and any delays are always communicated to passengers. Great work LNER.

items.title: Got the 12.25pm from Newcastle to…
items.review_text: Got the 12.25pm from Newcastle to London the train was spotless however the toilets were filthy sadly lots toilets closed and the staff seemed to be uninterested when I mentioned it

items.title: Don't you dare to ask any questions
items.review_text: Train cancelled. When I asked what to do next I was told to rebook my sit. The website was down so I've asked some other member of staff what to do. They told me to get any train. When I told them that all sits are booked they said they all will be because of the delay. No help at all from the staff they were shocked that I've asked them to help me! They should be trained better. Wouldn't recommend at all

items.title: I received first class service
items.review_text: Did a return journey Darlington to Edinburgh a couple of weekends ago and received fantastic service from the team on both journeys. I have been busy and forgot to post but coming on here today I was so surprised at the poor reviews? Well, all I can say is I received first class service in first class. Drinks and food brought to us timely, offered refills etc and the staff were lovely. The train was quiet and very clean and both journeys on time and easy.

items.title: Cake time
items.review_text: Crap service(litrally),the toilets not checked on trip and I unfortunately went for a poo,there was no tp and as I write im not sure if I can look at my hands the same again. #ptsd - dundee shegggers

items.title: Customer service that will make you smile because it’s so bad
items.review_text:
Comical customer service. Conflicting information regarding refunds, somehow can take up to 28 days for this, are we living in the dark ages?

Rude agents on the phone, chat agents that can’t even send a confirmation email. All round shocker of an experience

items.title: The online paperwork for compensation…
items.review_text: The online paperwork for compensation for  delayed or cancelled trains is made extremely complex and convoluted ,making it almost impossible to process any sort of claim.If you finally do get a 'form' sent for a claim, then there is nothing received back from the company by way of confirmation   and no way of tracing your claim. Yet again a company that could once be relied on and trusted to follow fair standards ,now reduced to being substandard.

items.title: Currently on the Edinburgh to York…
items.review_text: Currently on the Edinburgh to York 12oclock train with a gang off lads with a blaster on full blast drinking singing,lnerstaff don't care absolute shambles

items.title: Murky ticketing structure and poor customer service
items.review_text:
Pre purchased tickets tried to make changes. Multiple calls to customer service. Impossible to get through. 

The ticketing types are opaque and impossible to understand. Clearly done so that you end up buying ones which aren’t changeable or aren’t valid on all types of trains.

items.title: Abysmal
items.review_text: Abysmal. I bought two tickets, my friend accidentally signed out at the station with the wrong one, and as a result I was threatened by a rude and hostile staff member with legal proceedings unless I paid an additional £80 on the spot. Utterly shambolic, cynical, money-grubbing business.

items.title: Grumpy! Grumpy! Grumpy!
items.review_text: The first class service onboard the 08H32 12/03/22 from Aviemore to Edinburgh was miserable. Grumpy! Grumpy! Grumpy! Couldn't have been less helpful. A crew change at Edinburgh and the difference was outstanding all the way back to Kings Cross, London.

items.title: Absolutely terrible service from…
items.review_text: Absolutely terrible service from Peterborough to Darlington. Paid nearly £300 for 2 adults and a child to stand for whole journey. Was so cramped with people standing very claustrophobic. People sitting in door ways etc. Partners broken foot kicked that many times she was crying in pain. Even a lovely lner worker brought her a bottle of water so she could take some pain killers. Emailed lner they asked for some information, information sent and heard nothing since. Terrible service

items.title: A bad situation well handled by staff
items.review_text:
1802 from York to London Kings Cross.
Upgraded to First Class, excellent service, comfortable seats, good food. 
Our carriage was half First Class and the other half was standard with doors dividing in the middle. Unfortunately there was a group of drunken lads in the other half of the carriage, they were told a few times to quieten down and given plenty of chances but in the end the Train Manager decided to eject them from the train at Stevenage. He refused to let the train depart until they had left the train which did cause a 10 minute delay but this was the right thing to do and well handled as they were causing disturbance to other passengers. I was impressed that the train manager had the confidence to take on these drunken passengers!

items.title: Poorly designed website
items.review_text: Poorly designed website, tried to sign up for ticket alert for return journey after website indicated tickets not available - alert not available stating tickets were available. Logged out automatically so had to repeat all details while trying again. No alerts if one part of journey can be booked

items.title: LNER Azuma First Class — Wonderful
items.review_text: I rode an LNER Azuma from Leeds to London on 2 March. Got a cheap First Class ticket and was amazed and delighted with the onboard service — free food and drink was totally unexpected. Friendly staff, three passes with the drinks trolley. I know something about transport catering and service quality, because I led the food and beverage team at a major U.S. airline, and more broadly have been traveling all over the world for more than 50 years. I know quality when I see it. Well done, LNER.

items.title: I got off the train at the wrong stop…
items.review_text: I got off the train at the wrong stop by accident not sure what spoke to a customer service booth and spoke to D. Wilkie who was a massive help and got me on anothe train with a customer ticket endorsement. If it wasn't for her I am not sure what I would of done to get back to Newcastle from York. She was fantastic.

items.title: Durham to Cheltenham Spa
items.review_text:
I used the LNER service to get from Durham to Cheltenham Spa, the seats, its best to know that there are no tables available, unless you want to yse first class

You are also not guaranteed a window seat, on the way back we didn't have a window, which made the 5 hour journey very sluggish 

Staff were however very friendly, the trolley for food could have come down the train more often

items.title: Awful service
items.review_text:
Awful service. 
Parked vehicle at an LNER station and was charged but not even for my own vehicle. A charge of £75, sent an email to their customer service and received an email from Charlotte who clearly didn't read any of the information I provided to her the best part of it took 11 days to get a reply however their website states it takes 28days for a refund to be completed. Halfway there and I've got so much as to them requesting the same information I've already sent. Gets better as we go to raise a complaint you also have to email them patronizing really that all the service is provided on emails and it doesn't even seem like it is responded to. Might as well put a monkey behind a computer and you'd get more sense out of them. I want my money back. AWFUL SERVICE

items.title: Helpful LNER Staff to the Rescue
items.review_text:
11.30 approx. Wednesday 2nd March 2022, Newcastle Central Station:
Feeling quite upset because my TransPennine train was late so that I missed my LNER London  connection. But LNER staff were just wonderful - so pleasant and so helpful.  Two female staff on ticket barrier, two female staff on Platform 3 and a male member of staff (with a beard) in the Ticket Office. All were at pains to solve my difficulty and they did! I’m writing this review on the 11.58 LNER train from Newcastle to Kings Cross. My ‘grand day out’ and timed museum visit saved. Hope you read this. Hope your bosses know who you are.   Many thanks.

items.title: 5 stars for LNER and Eddie the Train Manager
items.review_text: A lovely journey from Edinburgh to York today Tuesday 1 March 2022 made all the more stress free by Eddie The Train Manager. Thank you for your help today in getting an upgrade for my sister and son for their LNER journey later in the week. My sister has suffered a recent bereavement and is a bit anxious about her upcoming journey. Eddie has gone above and beyond to ensure she will be catered for . A great employee and such an asset to LNER. Thank you so much .

items.title: Excellent service from Dan and Donna
items.review_text:
Excellent service from Dan and Donna
Excellent service from Dan and Donna on my one of my trains from Nuneaton to Durham. The second part of my journey the trains were full and although I had reserved a seat I couldn’t get to it with having a 2 year old and a 9 month old. I was sat in the walkway between carriages (near door) and a LNER service member (Donna) had asked if I had a seat and how far I was going so I told her and she worked her magic, next Dan came and said he would move me and my two little ones to 1st class. It was calm and quiet and my two little ones and I were treated well and made to feel comfortable. I thank both team members you are truly wonderful ☺️

items.title: Rip off pricing
items.review_text:
I was looking to travel from Arbroath to London Kings Cross in first class midweek in May. LNER's website quoted £277. If I split the ticket in Edinburgh (same train), the total price falls by a mere £176 or 63% and it would indicate that LNER would be pocketing over £200 to allow me to travel from Arbroath to Edinburgh and onto London on a single ticket.

Savvy travellers will find the work around, but the website provides no guidance about this scam. Looks like a rip off to me.

items.title: The Seats
