items.review_text: On time, smooth, quiet, enough space, but the SEATS! OMG medieval torture. I have never had a problem with train seats before, but these ones…… After an hour and a half sitting down, I was in real pain. And I don’t have a with my back.

items.title: 16:12 Sunday 27 Feb service from…
items.review_text: 16:12 Sunday 27 Feb service from berwick  First class seats double booked.  Told train manager would sort at Newcastle.  Bo sign or sound of train manager till Doncaster when announcement that he at rear of train.  Cleverly the train is two trains with no connection so half the train presumably has no train manager.  Meanwhile fortunately grabbed some food before uork..since then standing room only means it's unsafe to serve anything.  Fantastic value for money the first class rail tickets...not

items.title: Expensive, crowded and cramped.
items.review_text:
Expensive, overcrowded, trains. 
Airline seats barely big enough for a laptops. Large numbers of people standing - on a slow service to London due to engineering work. 

The best of British? What a load of rubbish.

items.title: Bad experience
items.review_text:
Bad experience, accident occurred and I missed train after choosing not to travel through storm. Had to payout an extra £72 on top of the £100 racked up in unusable tickets. 

Staff seemed amoral and barely showed a  shred of decency whilst overcharging me.

items.title: We enjoyed a wonderful and comfortable…
items.review_text: We enjoyed a wonderful and comfortable journey with LNER this weekend. Staff were helpful and attentive, and the catering in First Class was superb!

items.title: One small train replacing 3 longer ones
items.review_text:
One small train replacing 3 longer trains. Really, really busy. Lots of people stood.
Train stool in Leeds (on way to Edinburgh) for over 15 minutes waiting for a driver from another one of its services.

items.title: Excellent customer service but disappointing comfort and catering
items.review_text: Travelled on a number of LNER trains over a very stormy few days (Storm Dudley, Storm Eunice) and we were very impressed with the level of information and care the company provided for customers, and their determination to run trains and get people to their destinations unless it became unsafe.  We are more used to Scotrail cancelling services as soon as any adverse weather is forecast.  There were plenty of staff at the stations we used (York, Darlington, Newcastle) ready and keen to help us.  This was really appreciated as we were travelling with children.  The main downside to our trips was the catering onboard.  This was generally poor and there were technical problems with coffee machines on two journeys and with the payment system on another.  There doesn't appear to be any trolley service on any train and the choice at the tiny buffet is disappointing, but again the staff did their best and were very professional.  Otherwise the service was good though we too really noticed the rock hard seats on the Azumas that seem to be a major disappointment for many customers.

items.title: Travelled first class from Leuchars to…
items.review_text: Travelled first class from Leuchars to Newcastle….staff on the whole were great but they must have been disappointed and a bit ashamed of the products and lack of them and also how often they were “allowed” to offer them to their clients.  LNER are needing to reflect and learn from their predecessors Virgin…..now that was a company that offered quality and service!

items.title: Never use Lner
items.review_text:
Never, ever consider taking Lnar train to Edinburgh (or anywhere if you have a choice).
Since we’ve decided to go to Scotland over the half term, we thought we’d give train a go… Biggest mistake. Firstly our train from Kings Cross was cancelled and we were advised to get on another one and hour later, which ended up filling it right up to the point that some passengers couldn’t even get seats… We also had to change in York, which just added to the misery and the arrival was delayed nearly 2 hours…
Then on our return trip, despite of leaving on time for some reasons we incurred nearly 2 hours delay and had to re-book a cab, which was supposed to take us home, causing us additional expenses… 
After this experience we just keep asking ourself what got into us to ever consider Lner as a good alternative to a flight (despite being warned by others)…

items.title: Lner need to up their game.
items.review_text: I regularly commute on an lner line and there terrible at communicating anything. The Trainline app indicates platform 8, when you open that page it says platform 6. When you read the sides of the train they don't say it's where you're going. The internal displays say the same as outside but they don't update until it start moving. If you didn't ask a member of staff you'd have 0 chance. I just watched some 15 people miss this train. It also doesn't help that all train companies lner included refuse to entre a realist delay time. The train kept reading as departed then at a different platform repeatedly. Chances are if you tried to find out what happened using any available method you'd miss your train. Not that the train companies care...

items.title: Bad experience.
items.review_text: Normally I enjoy travelling with lner. However,  today I'm disappointed. I booked in advance as usually and my preference is always forward.  They gave me a backwards seat.  I hate it as it gives me headache and makes my journey unpleasant.  I contacted customer service. Waste of time.

items.title: Just wanted to say a big thankyou to…
items.review_text:
Just wanted to say a big thankyou to LNER today 
So helpful to my daughter after a terrible day yesterday due to unfortunate travel delays with TFL..
Thankyou LNER brilliant customer service

items.title: Only train company in the uk that can…
items.review_text: Only train company in the uk that can do first class. Perfect service each time. All other train companies should take note.

items.title: Lner accessibility
items.review_text: I have used azuma northeastern and southern and southeastern I am disabled and use a wheelchair Ryan at lner has been amazing sorting out staff and ramps in place to assist me. At a number of stations. Thank you

items.title: Myself and my wife went first class…
items.review_text:
Myself and my wife went first class from London to Edinburgh and the service and the quality of the food was absolutely shocking. They did not have some of the food advertised on the menu.

All that was on offer was a disgusting chick pea wrap. The crisps they give out taste as if they came out a old soggy sock. 

Won’t be travelling with them again

items.title: My wife and I booked first class seats…
items.review_text: My wife and I booked first class seats to London. Three staff members on duty. Offered one drink then ignored no second drink no snacks. If that is now the norm then there should be many redundancies as the number of staff they have doing nothing is overkill.

items.title: Travel experience onboard was ok…
items.review_text: Travel experience onboard was ok although cleanliness was below what I was expecting.  Ticket pricing far too high though especially if they are trying to entice customers back after the pandemic [having fewer packed trains doesn't cut it!].

items.title: Disabled travel
items.review_text: I have just travelled from Peterborough to York and back with LNER  and was very impressed with the service I received.   This is the first time I have travelled by train for about 8 years, as I now have to use a wheelchair to get around and assumed that travelling by train would be difficult.  However from the helpful booking office staff to the platform staff who helped me on and off the train at both ends, the  service was exceptional and I wouldn't hesitate to travel with them again.

items.title: Utterly disappointed with LNER
items.review_text:
Utterly disappointed with LNER. I was travelling to Edinburgh from Newcastle on 29/01/22 at 8:49. We were stuck at Berwick Upon Tweed for 6 hours. At 4 o'clock eventually we managed to get out of there to go back to Newcastle. We were stuck there from 10 in the morning until 4pm in the afternoon.

I believe that the coach was arranged by another company Trainline Express to be exact as your representatives were talking about staying in a hotel there for the night. Your representative was also encouraging us to get the train back to Newcastle or south, but I had business to attend to.

As a result of all this i missed a business flight I had to Birmingham from Edinburgh. 

I expect to get a full refund for my train tickets as well as reimbursement for my flights which cost me money as I could not attend my business meeting. 
I attach the tickets. 

We are having these back and forth emails asking for information with people getting back to me after 5 days asking stuff I already have provided. Promising refunds but if you don't get it in 14 working days let us know so you can wait another 5 working days to get a respond to your email and 14 working days to get the money back. Just do your job already.

items.title: Edinburgh First Class Lounge Experience
items.review_text:
Edinburgh First Class Lounge Experience.

On 7 February I took the 10:42 LNER service from Newcastle to Edinburgh to meet up with my daughter for a day out in the city.
Having arrived in Waverley Station at around 12:11 I headed to the First Class Lounge to wait for my daughter who was due to arrive from Leuchars at 12:25.  We had decided to meet up in the Edinburgh First Class lounge as we were both travelling with first class tickets.  I have travelled to Edinburgh quite often in recent times and normally buy a first class ticket due to the perk of being able to use the lounge for arrival and departure which I find makes the journey more convivial.
However, today, when I attempted to enter the lounge, the lady at the desk (initial K) told me, in a rather brusque fashion, that the lounge was at full capacity.  A sign to that effect was also stuck on the glass panel in front of where she was seated. I accepted this at face value. I asked if i could sit down on one of the five chairs by the front desk but was told it was only for handicapped customers. I therefore went outside and waited by the side of the entrance door for my daughter’s arrival.  

A minute or so later a lady with a large suitcase walked into the Lounge. I expected to see her walk straight out again as no one had exited the lounge since I had been refused entry and it therefore must have remained at full capacity. I was consequently very surprised when I saw she was completing the track and trace procedures and was then allowed to enter.  

While considering what I had just seen occurring I saw two people leave the lounge so I walked back in, pointed at the 2 people who had left and asked if I could now enter.  The attendant,  nodded and after having checked my ticket instructed me to scan the track and trace bar code. Her attitude was less than professional.
In the lounge I looked around and counted only 10 people seated inside. The lounge looked rather empty and I began to wonder at the now seemingly incongruous “at full capacity” statement with which I had initially been met. 
10 minutes or so later 2 more people left the lounge without any fresh customers appearing and then a few minutes after that my daughter called me on my mobile to say she wasn’t able to come up to the lounge as the lady at the desk had indicated that the lounge was full by tapping the full capacity sign stuck on the glass panel  in front of her.
I therefore went down to meet my daughter outside.   On my way out I spoke with K informing her that there had been only 10 people inside the lounge including me and that I had seen 2 of those leave shortly before my daughter tried  to enter.  This did not appear to have any interest to K who told me that she has other things to do (not sure what she meant by that comment).  This was not the response I had anticipated and fell rather short of the customer service that one might expect of a First Class Lounge attendant. At this point I told her that I would write to customer service about this experience to which  she, in a challenging voice, said “go ahead…go ahead”.
I do not know if this level of service and rather rude behaviour on K’s part is an isolated incident brought on by external factors or if it is more a normal state of affairs.

It may be that the lounge in these Covid times does in fact have a formal reduced capacity for safety’s sake -  although 10 customers does seem a rather small number given it’s size - in which case a displayed notice to that effect would go some way towards explaining the situation to those being turned away should the attendant on duty not wish to pass that information on to customers in person.

On the other hand, if there is no actual formal “10 persons maximum” limit policy in effect one wonders why the front desk staff implemented such a limit on that day.

While I do not have any direct evidence of  bias I would also point out that my daughter and I are of Asian extraction while the lady who was allowed to enter the lounge immediately after I had been turned away was not (as were all the other customers I saw inside the lounge).  I am therefore at a loss as to why I was denied entry and that lady was allowed in. I feel that my experience should not go  unnoticed and would appreciate clarification on LNER present policy regarding lounge capacity and confirmation that my initial denial of entry and subsequently that of my daughter were in fact due to  reasons other than our ethnicity.

I have sent photos and videos of the lounge along with my above comments to LNER customer service’s email.

15 Feb 2022,  received reply from LNER Customer Service (sent email to them on 7 Feb).  Their reply is a long winded email of what essentially said 'thank you, we received your feedback and we'll handle it.  Sorry for your experience but we can't tell you anything else (not even the lounge capacity numbers)'.  Very disappointing.

items.title: The high review number of stars is due…
items.review_text: The high review number of stars is due to the high level of service from troops on ground despite all the work LNER put in to take money but not supply services,we like to travel first class when we travel for a bit of luxury but first class lounges are ridiculous on Leeds you can have free coffee but no cups train arrived before cups BTW  Edinburgh you can't even get in thanks to "covid restrictions " surely these services should not be advertised if you cant provide them.

items.title: I am on the lner 2000hrs train from…
items.review_text:
I am on the lner 2000hrs train from Edinburgh to Newcastle 5th feb and as usual your staff on this route are absolutely superb courteous and very helpful especially your guy on the refreshments kiosk who really helped me realising I had a disability (new hip). All your staff are really friendly and helpful whenever I make the journey from Newcastle to Edinburgh or return. I have worked on transport since 1989 (Nexus Tyne and Wear) and your staff are by far the best I have ever witnessed. Please pass on my thanks to all your staff especially the refreshments guy. I hope these staff are appreciated because they really are the best.
Kind regards
Christopher Mcguinness
Nexus Ferry.

items.title: Thanks Joanne!
items.review_text: Wonderful staff, very helpful accommodating a pram on a busy carriage. Joanne on the 12:18 from Peterborough was fantastic going above and beyond! Thanks!

items.title: The worst train company in history
items.review_text: The worst train company in history. I predicted to my family that they’d cancel our train last night, at the very last minute… and they did. Then, they rebooked our seats onto a carriage that didn’t exist. Then, they waited until the last minute to tell us the train was diverted, causing us to have to book more car parking time at £7, to avoid a huge fine. The person walking the train was also useless at any advice

items.title: In safe hands!
items.review_text: Travelled yesterday, from Glasgow to Huntingdon, following the storm damage that wreaked havoc in many areas and paralysed the East Coast Intercity route.  Therefore this required a bus service from Edinburgh to Newcastle, followed by a further bus journey to York.  Thereafter a train onwards to Doncaster, by which time there were no further train services available and was taxied home arriving at 1.30am.  Throughout my journey I was provided with the highest level of customer service and friendliness by every member of the LNER team.  My case being carried, escorted to buses and in Doncaster two members of staff wouldn’t go home until a taxi had been arranged for me.  The service provided in circumstances out with LNER’s control, was excellent and distinguishes this company above the rest.

items.title: The website made the booking very…
items.review_text: The website made the booking very difficult. We got to the point of choosing seats and it showed an error code. Tried several times and always got an error so we gave up and went to bed.  Tried again the following morning and found the seat prices had increased and again tried to choose seats and got error code again. Then tried again and seats had sold out.  We wondered if they were holding our reserved seats even though we’d not paid yet so called LNER for help. We were told seats had sold out only first class left which was an addition £100. The person we spoke to didn’t know if it was the seats we had ‘reserved’ that was making the train full and could only offer a later train or first class. So we said we’d have the later train as the hotel was already booked and we didn’t have a choice. Again we tried to reserve seats and the representative couldn’t sit 3 of us next to each other despite there being seat availability for this to happen? So we gave up again and tried ourselves 5 minutes later and the original seats were then available. However because the system did not allow us to book last night we have ended up paying more.  Very poor online booking system and looks like it’s stating an error when in fact this is potentially because a chosen seat is not available. This has cost us money.

items.title: Staff
items.review_text:
Asked a member of staff if they have a set of fork/ knife for lunch I bought at the station and was told “ no “ yet 2 minutes later he brings a bag of sandwich with a wooden set of cutlery to a passenger across. Would not think that giving a set of wooden fork is prohibited to anyone who doesn't purchase food on the train.
Please look into this....)

items.title: Travelled to London and back in…
items.review_text:
Travelled to London and back in November- seating on the Azuma trains are very hard and uncomfortable for a 4 1/2 hour train trip - older trains were much better.
Thank you for replying but I totally disagree.  I was in first class and to be honest stood for the last half hour of our return trip because my back was stiff and painful - have you tried sitting In these seats on a long journey?  Ergonomically designed they may be but they only recline about 2 inches, also a bit of padding in them wouldn’t go amiss!

items.title: Delay Claim LNER-220112-BEBT
items.review_text:
Update: Paid today, so it's taken from 12 Dec to 2 Feb - but thank you!

Reponse to below. Dear Jake, despite what you say below it's still been several weeks and now I'm supposed to waste even more of my time on the phone(?) Would it not be good customer service practice to have possibly chased this from your side and perhaps stem some of these atrocious reviews? It is unacceptable how long people seem to have to wait for this Delay to Pay procedure....  

We booked through Lumo, lovely train and pleasant staff. The return was via LNER from KX on 12 Dec 21 which was significantly delayed. We applied for compensation via Lumo who then referred it to LNER. I have basically been fighting this ever since. I've now had to download and send copies of my tickets 3 times. Lumo and LNER obviously haven't got it together yet and I'm left frustrated as hell and still no compensation since 12 Dec!!! Absolutely appalling. If you claim be aware how long winded and frustrating this could be and I believe its a delaying tactic so that you just give up in the end.. Shocking customer services and I don't know who to book with next time, Lumo and have the same problems in the future or direct with LNER!!!...

items.title: We delay you then don't repay you (28th working day)
items.review_text:
LNER-211112-BDCE - Your Update

The delay repay team are missing crucial words from their title. They should be 'We delay you then don't repay you' team...catchy and appropriate all at the same time
Email below

14 working days from the 10th December was the 4th Jan - today is the 28th working day. ZERO reply from the 'We delay you then don't repay you' team

Shambles

LNER-211112-BDCE - Your Update
Inbox


Fri, Dec 10, 2021, 8:35 AM

to Neal

Dear Mr Clementis



Thank you for getting in touch with us at London North Eastern Railway.



We are sorry to hear that your journey was affected by delays to our service and appreciate that it can affect your day.



We’ve taken a look at your case and are pleased to inform you that a PayPal payment to the value of £121.60 has been raised and will be with you in the next 14 working days.

items.title: Smashing
items.review_text: Smashing, my first train trip in yonks ... On time, clean, two people on my carriage. Smooth, fast, great (free) WiFi so I could work throughout, friendly staff. Got a table with power socket. Everything you could possibly need and just 1hr 50 from London to York.  Impressive.  Thank you!

items.title: Have been super impressed with…
items.review_text: Have been super impressed with LNER...85 year old frail mum with passenger assist needs treated so well by friendly and caring staff (travelling Newcastle to Kings X), clean, quiet and smooth trains, refund process when train late automatically notified and credited, staff on telephone couldn’t have been more helpful. Prices very reasonable on website (1st and 2nd class off peak ). Completely understand when delays happen and are outside the company’s control...too often we don’t give credit when it’s due and I want to extend well deserved thanks from a satisfied customer.

items.title: Never again ,doesn't even deserve one star
items.review_text: I bought a first class ticket but recieved 3rd  class service.  The waiter came to me an hour later just to say they don't have any food other then crisp  tea and apple. I mean seriously ,you charged me  140  pounds now you tell me you don't have first class food How do they justify this deception.

items.title: LNER staff were extremely rude on the…
items.review_text:
LNER staff were extremely rude on the platform. Shouted at my partner and spoke to him as if he was stupid. There were no signs to say that you weren't allowed on the platform. 

Really rude! We weren't the only ones going to the platform but he made a point of shouting at my partner for it

items.title: Can't fault LNER
items.review_text:
Used LNER numerous times and I have nothing but good things to say about them. Only suffered one delay (30 mins) and this was when the train was forced to stop mid journey due to a problem with the overhead lines further along the track. Always get my reserved seat and the LNER Perks is also a great idea as you can use it to get money off future journeys.

2 days ago I booked a return journey from Newcastle to Kings X. On completing my booking I realised I'd made a mistake and had booked the wrong train for my outbound journey so I had to book another outbound journey separately. At this point I didn't realise there was an option to amend my booking. Even though it was 100% my error I placed a request for a refund for my origional outbound journey and less than 48 hours later I've received an email saying my request has been approved, much to my surprise and delight. That's excellent customer service and its also the same level of service I've received whilst travelling on their trains. Great service.

items.title: Delay repay is a scam
items.review_text:
Delay repay is a scam. They don't repay you for delayed journeys, claims go ignored and customer service is non existent. Also ticket prices are very expensive, it is much cheaper to drive than to catch one of their trains.

To Cameron's response. I finally got repaid after 2 months and about 20 follow up emails to which customer services only responded to one to say "we've processed this so please stop contacting us". Charming

items.title: I have arrived 2 hours early at kings…
items.review_text: I have arrived 2 hours early at kings cross station in London to be sure I'm on time. I was expecting to get to edingburgh using lumo train. My train was due at 14:36. The information screen showed at the start " platform 4 " so we proceeded to stated station while it changed midway to " platform 7 " so naturally. We proceeded to that number instead. Turned out. We entered the wrong train and our lumo train heading to edingburgh left. I've spoke to the staff at kings cross from Lner and they said they can't help since it's lumos fault for showing the wrong platform information. While kings cross Staff blamed us claiming that were lying about it, for some reason. I was adviced to contact lumo directly about this issue as I wanted a refund for my tickets since I got misleaded, Lumo got back to me following my complain of missed train and as it turned out. KINGS CROSS IS OPERATED AND RUN BY LNER. So yes, it looked like a scheme so that people have to pay more money for train and end up going with lner, and now it turns out that its true.

items.title: I am reasonably happy with them.
items.review_text: I am reasonably happy with them.

items.title: Morons
items.review_text:
Ffs. Typical s-c-u-m-b-a-g recruiters, they've closed an ad 10 days earlier than the listed date. Extremely slow website taking forever to load, and of course, no contact details to be able to speak to someone. Companies like this should be banned from recruiting.

Edit: To the reply which said "this may not be the best tone to have to a company that you want to be employed by in the future" - well what makes you think I'd want to work for a company that won't even let me contact them? Recruitment works both ways.

items.title: Absolutely disgusting!!!
items.review_text: Absolutely disgusting!!!! I spend thousands of pounds every year travelling up and down the country! For the military and all because my rail card was out of date 2021 December! The bloke on the train 1400 London kings cross to darlington LNER was very very rude! I have just had to pay £94.95 + the £47.15!!!!!! Services are disgusting! Need more respect!

items.title: No refund for cancelled train
items.review_text: Booked with LNER for my trip from Edinburgh back to London on the 31st of October 2021. I found out at Edinburgh station that the train got cancelled. It would've been nice to receive an e-mail or any sort of notification about that, but anyway... I've been trying to get my money back ever since, with no success unfortunately. You can't reach them over the phone and they take about 3 weeks to answer to your e-mails. Customer service is basically non-existent.

items.title: False advertising
items.review_text: Advertised refunds before 6pm day before travel. Trying to issue credit notes just like Ryan Air after amending the advertised policy and applying it retrospectively.

items.title: Dangerous practices put lives at risk!
items.review_text:
This pertains to the 17:00 LNER Kings Cross to Durham 21st November, which I feel so strongly about as it put people's lives at risk and saw some seriously devious and underhand practices by LNER!

To keep this as brief as possible: 

LNER took on board ALL of the cancelled Grand Central passengers without telling their own passengers meaning the train would be full before boarding commenced.

LNER did not update the wallboards during this time to say which platform we were to use. 

LNER put out an announcement, 15 minutes prior to departure advising passengers to go to Euston station to seek alternative travel...I suspect this was an afterthought having realised your own train was already full and you had nowhere to put your own paying customers so wanted to buy some time and divert people away to deal with their complaints at a later time. 

LNER kept crowds of people at the platform barriers (the boards had still not been updated, it was just pure luck we'd found the right one!) preventing access until they knew which platform we were to go to. People were becoming impatient jumping the barriers at this point.
 
LNER opened the barriers without telling people which platform to go to, resulting in the hoard of people rushing through the barriers. This is how crushing injuries come about! (did the recent Travis Scott concert not teach you anything?!) This was disgustingly dangerous for those of us with small children. 

LNER kept passengers at another barrier to the platform (again, pure luck we'd found the right one as no-one had told us which to go to!) and were asking for Edinburgh only passengers only to board. I suspect this was because you knew the train was full and could not accommodate those travelling to stations along the way, so only wanted the few passengers who were travelling to the end destination. 

LNER eventually allowed all passengers to board at the last minute, but unsurprisingly the train was indeed full with Grand Central passengers in the seats which had been purchased by LNER customers. 

LNER did nothing to promote social distancing or adhere to any Covid19 guidelines by cramming as many people as possible in each car. It was so full, people were lying on the floors in the areas between cars. 

The journey back was nothing short of horrific due to having to remove passengers from our reserved seats, the inability to socially distance and being stuck with a group of disruptive/drunk females. 

This was of course all put to LNER as a complaint which they offered a full refund + compensation. However, they have since reneged on the compensation and are now ignoring me. 

Shameful. 

LNER, if you do read this and feel compelled to do your best corporate copy/paste in an attempt to discredit anything I've highlighted, please go ahead, I dare you. Alternatively, the complaint ref is: LNER-211122-BCTP - Make it right.

items.title: Excellent compensation process for cancellation due to storm
items.review_text:
5-stars not in relation to the train service (because never managed to board), but their compensation policy.

Bought two tickets from Edinburgh to London, but trains were cancelled for three days due to a bad storm. After getting advise from LNER staff that they will compensate for accommodation, we stayed in Edinburgh for another three nights. 

Eventually, LNER compensated for hotel and train back to London as promised. Hassle-free claim process, just had to submit receipts and bank account details. Didn’t need to argue or anything.

items.title: Thank you to Newcastle Central Travel Office staff
items.review_text: Thank you to all the staff at Newcastle Central travel office.  They have been so helpful, patient and thorough in dealing with all my enquiries and bookings during 2021.  I really appreciate their help! Much better than phone or online!

items.title: ABSOLUTELY DO NOT USE
items.review_text:
ABSOLUTELY DO NOT USE. ISSUED ME A REFUND IN E VOUCHERS. IVE USED A TRAIN ABOUT 5 TIMES IN THE LAST 10 YEARS SO IM LITERALLY NEVER GOING TO USE THIS, SO IVE GOT AN E VOUCHER FOR £177.20 THAT IM NEVER GOING TO USE AND JUST TO MAKE IT BETTER, THE VOUCHER EXPIRES IN 12 MONTHS. 

DESPICABLE COMPANY POLICIES AVOID AVOID AVOID!!!!!!!!!

items.title: Terrible service.
items.review_text: My second time using LNER as a return journey between Aberdeen and Peterborough. Both times big delays. This time traveling with 3 kids on a crowded train, no information, got off at Newcastle to be told to go on the next train to Edinburgh. At Edinburgh told abruptly by LNER staff at the platform that there was no room on the train and to go to the bus. Very confusing as we didn't know where to go, same as other passengers. Finally on bus, noisy journey, people drinking, singing, no masks. My daughter got covered in someone's lager. Was a terrible journey. 4 hours late to Aberdeen, missed the last bus and had to get a taxi home. Total stress and around £40 out of pocket for taxis and extra meals etc. Tried to claim compensation since August. Still nothing. Tried twice to fill the form, been in huge phone queues, tried twitter but no reply. What a terrible company indeed.

items.title: All I can say is amazing
items.review_text: All I can say is amazing. The staff on my journey to Doncaster were fabulous. The steward on my way back was wonderful. I will definitely travel first class again. Fabulous staff .

items.title: York to Maidenhead journey
items.review_text: York to Maidenhead journey.  Pre booked seats however after my young child became ill we took the slightly earlier train to be RUDELY thrown off and dumped at Doncaster.  The earlier train carriage was empty yet they deemed their actions appropriate.  Spoke to the platform manager who’s service skills were non existent however a fellow colleague completely sympathised and took us to first class lounge to wait with my child for the train 25 mins later.  On getting on the next train our seats were taken.  When pointing out that we wanted our seats an equally uncivil train manager (Darren)  told us the train was empty and to crack on with the seats that we occupied dispute them not being our booked seats.  Would highly recommend training across the board at the managerial level.  A suit and shocking customer service skills does not maketh the man! Would rather take a bus going forward !!! Shocking .

items.title: Fantastic service on our family trip…
items.review_text: Fantastic service on our family trip today!!!

items.title: Suffering rough fellow passengers
items.review_text: Travelling from Wakefield to London Kings Cross, excellent first class, I enjoyed the service. Travelling from Kings Cross to Wakefield had to endure loud, noisy, rough couple from Doncaster who bragged they had only paid standard but were refusing to move from first class. They were served three times by food trolley no question about them not wearing a mask for the whole journey, well yes they had to drink their cans of Strongbow Cider , and let the baby scream it’s head off. The guard passed them three times yet never checked their ticked or asked them to wear a mask. They would not be intelligent enough use trust pilot but hopefully LNER read this and know I will reconsider my journey next time

items.title: Id choose Lumo next time
items.review_text: Id choose Lumo next time. Went with Lumo to Edinburgh, Lner back to kings Cross days apart. Asked for forward facing window seat, got backwards isle. WiFi is shocking, can't even play a YouTube vid. Lumo WiFi isn't much better but you get a large selection of shows and recent movie releases you can stream without any buffering. Seats on lner azuma are more uncomfortable than lumo too, toilets were filthy and no paper. That is all without the thus far 30 minute delay.

items.title: Travelled 1st Class from Newcastle to…
items.review_text: Travelled 1st Class from Newcastle to York and back again. Both trains were immaculate and on time. Lovely spacious comfortable seats and friendly efficient staff. Going we were offered tea, coffee, water and a bacon roll. Returning we had a choice but opted for beef and piccalilli sandwich with crisps and a chocolate mousse. Absolutely delicious. Really can't understand the negative reviews as LNER were superb from start to finish and I cannot wait to travel with them again. If you want pure comfort go 1st class.

items.title: Don’t take an LNER train
items.review_text:
Reserved seats that weren’t reserved as people where sitting in them that refused to move. They had reserved seats and people were sitting in theirs. Train was packed and clearly oversold. We stood for 50mins, luckily I got a seat for my 78 yr old Mam.
Uncomfortable, noisy, packed so I would not recommend the train I wish I’d taken the car!

items.title: Far from First Class
items.review_text:
My message to LNER and their inadequate reply! Totally shocking and disappointing! 

I need to let you know how disappointed I have found my journey on your train today. Its my husbands 50th birthday weekend and I treated him to a first class train trip. It is anything but first class. We boarded the 8am train at kings cross to Edb. The team that took over at Newcastle are just plain rude. One team member openly sniffing and grunting her way through drink service. The hot choc and hot food offering has run out. We were rudely told at 11 am that as we got on a kings cross we were not allowed anything more to eat or others would go without.  Nor would they be serving alcohol as they dont have time. Last week I traveled first class with Avanti to Glasgow. Their service was truly first class and I naively thought we would be treated to the same wonderful service. I was wrong. Lner could learn a few things from Avanti about what a first class service should offer. But most of all Im disappointed for my husband. A 50th birthday weekend should be special and this has certainly not got our weekend off to the best start.

LNER reply:
Very sorry to hear that, Susan. I hope you enjoy your weekend and that we can do better on your return. ^AB

items.title: Perfect passenger assistance…
items.review_text: I booked passenger assistance arrival/departure (four days later) on behalf of my elderly sister who has particular health needs. At Glasgow there was no one to meet us but the brilliant staff communicated our needs, waited with us and ensured we were safely transported on the 'buggy' that deposited us near the taxi rank. On the return journey, we arrived at the station early, were given a warm place to wait and transported to our carriage when the train arrived. Fantastic service on both occasions. On arrival home at Doncaster an employee offered us assistance by taking my sister's arm, carrying her case and was just generally incredibly helpful and good humored. I never used these services before as had no need for them but think it's excellent that they are available for people who require them.  I must also say that the staff, particularly on the outward journey, were exceptional. We had been allocated single seats which were not suitable so moved to an available table which was indicated to us. A female member of staff carried our cases to the new carriage. We enjoyed the drinks on offer and the food, although nothing special and no hot food available, was perfectly adequate. I thought the teamwork and camaraderie between staff was lovely to see and hear. They certainly made our journey very comfortable and actually it would not have been possible without the assistance we received.  So on behalf of my sister and myself a massive thank you to all involved for your kindness, consideration and efforts in reassuring us and just enabling us to make this special trip to see our relatives in Glasgow. Merry Christmas to you all!!

items.title: First class? Forget it!
items.review_text: Just completing my journey so a good time to review. Where do I start. Connection was late yet again but as LNER told me the last time I travelled, despite them selling me the ticket, it is not their problem. First class rammed to full. People in wrong seats and not their issue to sort, delayed en route by 20 mins. First class from Edinburgh to London now consists of a bacon roll (nice enough) a cold tea and they don’t do sweeteners, 2 drinks, 1 snack and demanded their glasses back 40 mins before we arrived. Not good value or service any more. Please bring back Virgin as LNER are just poor at decent service

items.title: Cancelled my train despite the fact…
items.review_text: Cancelled my train despite the fact that bad weather was several days previously meaning they had no contingency plan and were unable to respond to the problem. An LNER employee lied to my face about access to a platform and whether an alternative train had already left the station.

items.title: Terrible customer service
items.review_text:
Just had an awful journey from Heathrow but topped off by terrible customer service at the barrier.
Every other train company would apply some common sense but not LNER

user_profile.name: J you are really good N

items.title: Sat on the floor from York to London…
items.review_text: Sat on the floor from York to London because this company is completely incapable of putting their heads together to provide the service their customers over pay for! Just a suggestion, if there is a reduced service over the Christmas Bank Holiday.. Maybe send more than 5 carriages every couple of hours to ensure that people get the seat that they paid for. Absolute shambles!! Just as well Lner are ensuring customer safety through the pandemic by forcing them to practically sit on top of each other.

items.title: Thives comes to mind take money off…
items.review_text: Thives comes to mind take money off card offered proof from bank REFUSED no ticket unable to travel to very important interview

items.title: Never again
items.review_text: Trains all cancelled due to storm,stranded in Newcastle,staff shrugging their shoulders couldn't give two hoots eventually they put on coaches after customers were getting angry.Very poor customer service.

items.title: Train and platform staff were so…
items.review_text: Train and platform staff were so helpful on my journey from Edinburgh to york. The on-train snack service was also great, ordered online and delivered to my seat in less than 10mins. As good if  it better than flying

items.title: FIRST CLASS ... REALLY??
items.review_text: We paid £414 for 2 people First Class return Kings Cross to Edinburgh expecting food and a decent glass of wine. WRONG!! Bacon rolls and panini's ran out 30 minutes after leaving Kings Cross so we were offered a sandwich, crisps OR something from the bakery ie a pan au chocolat or similar.  Later on we were offered a really cheap glass of wine or beer. Absolutely awful. How can LNER call this First Class? Never again.

items.title: Delay Repay? Good Luck with That!
items.review_text:
21st Nov '21, 19:35 train from London Kings Cross to Leeds left approx 20:30. Went to claim on the 'Delay Repay' service (longer than 30' entitles you to compensation apparently) they denied the train was delayed more than 30'. 
Recommend you take a picture of the departure board to avoid the implication you are lying about their crummy service if you have a claim.

items.title: I had to cancel my debit card
items.review_text: I had to cancel my debit card due to fraudulent activity, and as I had used the card for my train tickets I thought I should inform Lner as I had to use my card to pick up my tickets at the station, you would of thought they will just simply email me my tickets or I could just pick them up at the station. I was kept waiting 2 hours on the phone before I got through to an assistant, he said we can’t send you your tickets as there waiting in the machine, so all we can do is send you a voucher, but he said the tickets have doubled in price, but we can only issue you the voucher for the price of your tickets but we will give you an extra £100 to help you out. But he had attached the voucher to my old card so I still couldn’t print the tickets as the voucher was attached to the cancelled card. I think it is a disgrace the way they handled my situation all they had to do was send me the tickets rip off total rip off, but now my husband had Covid so I’ve claimed a refund and I am Ill my self so can’t go anyway. But please note do not choose to pick your tickets up at the station have them emailed or posted, because if you lose or cancel your card they will not help you, but just use the situation to get more money out of you I will never book Lner again.

items.title: Please don’t kill the pigeons at York…
items.review_text: Please don’t kill the pigeons at York station. A company with no regard for animal welfare is unlikely to care about the well-being of their staff or customers.

items.title: Due to disruption in travel from…
items.review_text: Due to disruption in travel from Edinburgh to Newcastle weekend comm 26thNov myself and my party of 4 arrived at Edinburgh Waverley station on Monday 28th after for our train was cancelled on Sunday 27th just like to Thank LNER staff for their excellent organisation, we were well informed on where to go we had a long wait for our transport however we were supplied with sandwiches water and hot drinks, then were escorted onto a train to Newcastle, well Done LNER ABSOLUTELY BRILLIANT SERVICE AND EXCELLENT STAFF TO GIVE ALL PASSENGERS SUPPORT XX

items.title: Excellent service
items.review_text:
Excellent service 
We travelled from London to Darlington 1st clas
Even though delays because of weather 
Ray our server was brilliant a real pleasure to talk to as a customer 
Would definitely recommend 1st class

items.title: Travelled 1st class.
items.review_text: Travelled 1st class.. Edinburgh to London 9th Nov 2021 and returned 12th Nov . Seats were OK.  Headrest covers were dirty. The staff were pleasant enough. The food...Well that's another story. The CEO wants to try the ciabatta. Cheese/ tomato and mushroom. Sounds quite decent. A warm soggy slimy mushroom filled peice of pasty bread was my take. One bite and in the bin it went same for my husband. Tea and coffee/ water etc offered here and there. A brownie and some crisps. Well it was a mouthful of each. Later came the bacon roll. I don't like tomato nor brown sauce, so I had a dry  uninteresting roll with salty bacon to keep me going with my mouthful of brownie and 2 mouthfuls of crisps for my breakfast. Then there was lunch. Whatever happend to just a cheese and tomato sandwich or ham and mustard. I explained I didn't like any of them so I was handed 2 pkts crisps and a brownie. One pitiful glass of wine was all that time allowed. They took their time in bringing that out. On the return journey that was a different matter. We had the sense to buy sandwiches beforehand. Declined offerings of the slimey ciabatta and dry roll and again the sandwiches. But I did get 2 packets of crisps. I asked the staff member what else can you do as I don't like any of them. Again I was handed the 2 packs of crisps !! For some reason the trolleys were more frequent in this service and wine was offered more than coming down. Toilets were dirty. I came back out. I think they ended up closing it off. Why on earth do they not have someone on board to tend to such ? Given the amount of people that use the facility. There were people using the service who clearly never paid for 1st class. A lady boarded with a booked seat ticket and the woman and her daughter who were clearly fare dodgers and kept jumping about different seats  just looked away. The poor woman said I will go and see if I can get a seat elsewhere.  I feel this is something that should be looked at in great detail. The ticket examiner just shouts tickets from blah blah.....so if you sit there and act like you've been on the train for ages and have paid full price you get away with it. Which is infuriating if you have paid a couple of hundred pounds. I think LNER Should stop with your existing excuse for food just serve what people can actually eat. It will save you money if nothing else. Offer butter with the bacon roll as I binned the entire roll and ate the 2 medallions of bacon. I am aware I am just one person and my opinion is not that of a majority. Taking it back to "family favourites" I am sure will save a lot of waste and money. Be more thorough in checking tickets and ensure your customers are in their paid seats. I felt so sorry for the woman as she had a member of staff help her to the train. Obviously didn't want confrontation.  Walked on struggling with her luggage. Perhaps more visibility from the on board train manager would help in these situations. Put a poster up if someone is In your seat or you have an issue call....the on-board train manager on.. blah blah.  If you travel 1st class ...take your own food or eat well before you board. It was a good service as in ran to time. Staff were pleasant. Rubbish was lifted constantly. Another suggestion would be to sanitise the tables. Door buttons and handles. This is just a simple spray. The amount of people in and out of the coaches deems this necessary in my opinion.

items.title: Spent the day in London watching…
items.review_text: Spent the day in London watching Newcastle on my return home after an awful day of getting battered, I simply just wanted to return home at kings cross I ask Claire (from the revenue team) a train guard who thinks she owns the company what platform my Grand central train is on, Claire could of been a nice lady and said I’m not sure am I’m not very good at my job and don’t have any people skills, what did Claire do you ask? She takes my ticket from myself and says that’s receipt not a physical ticket, as I explained my friend has got the other tickets I’m going to see him on the train just needed the platform she advised me I will not be travelling until I buy a ticket although I had already spent £120, and simply wanted to get home after advising this she showed little to no empathy and actually tried to get me kicked out the station even the security guard where baffled by her and just done it to keep her happy, they told me to get on the next train after she goes which I didn’t and got on for free as nobody even checked the tickets, there is nice people who work for LNER but unfortunately to have a job as a ticket guard is very powerful to powerful for the likes of this lady. I’d like to say very very bad things about this lady however she clearly lives a very miserable life therefore I will just wish her every success and hopefully she will improve her customer service and not actually try and ruin people’s life. All the best Claire you clown.

items.title: Absolutely wonderful service in first…
items.review_text: Absolutely wonderful service in first class.

items.title: Fantastic LNER staff 👍😘
items.review_text: Just travelled from Durham to Wakefield on LNER in the wake of storm Arwen. Many trains running late and cancelled but lots of LNER staff in evidence at all main stations, giving clear advice very cheerfully despite the freezing cold. The staff in the ticket office at Durham were brilliant. Thank you all, you made a difficult day much better

items.title: Very bad service
items.review_text: Booked tickets with reserved seats from Peterborough to London and booked the tickets months ahead of the journey. Could not sit in our seats on the inbound and outbound journey because our seats had been double booked so had to stand and people were already in our seats. I complained to LNER and the guy on the phone was useless but told me if I emailed I would be refunded. I emailed, the person who replied gave me a pathetic apology and no mention of refund. I emailed back telling her the discussion I'd had on the phone with an advisor but she ignored my email. I emailed her again and she ignored that too. I have emailed them again to now complain about the poor level of customer service. I'm waiting on their response but I can't imagine it will be worth the wait. My traveling options to London are limited by train but I will absolutely avoid LNER in the future if I can.

items.title: So many bad reviews on here regarding…
items.review_text:
So many bad reviews on here regarding LNER, I will add mine.
Got delayed coming back from Newcastle , advised to go through delay relay to claim , Claimed, which was over a month ago, nothing , nada, zilch, have been in touch via live chat , twitter, because calling them is a joke, unless you have a lot of time to kill, put a day aside.
Apparently their default answer via live chat , twitter , they have resolved by issusing replacement vouchers etc, but they dont know when they were printed and when they were posted , hence the need to get in touch

items.title: If I could leave zero star I would!
items.review_text:
If I could leave zero star I would!
Communicating with LNER is a shambles. I am still waiting a refund I am entitled to from August and its now November. In that time they have responded to my emails.......Once!

Add to that dirty first class carriages, rude staff, ran out of food to offer in 1st class, accused my kids of not paying for a ticket just because they are kids and badly managed chaos at kings cross when a train was cancelled. (we are not all fare dodgers LNER.... but you are refund dodgers!)

items.title: Utterly Shambolic Service
items.review_text:
Utterly shambolic service. My train has been delayed or cancelled at least 3 times in 3 weeks and I only travel 3 times per week. We're constantly being told that we should use public transport to help the environment, but it's really no wonder that most people won't until services are improved. I may well be at risk of losing my job, but hey, at least I'm doing my bit to reduce pollution, right? Thanks LNER!👍

Update - after boarding my original train, we were told it had a fault and this journey was being cancelled and the next train would arrive in half an hour. This was a complete lie as the next train was only due 50 minutes later, and was also delayed, so arrived 1 hour and 8 minutes after my original train should have departed.

items.title: Excellent
items.review_text: Just travelled first class return Newark/Kings Cross & really couldn't fault LNER. Clean train, on time, lovely friendly staff & very nice food & wine! The use of the first class lounge at KC was a definite bonus, with clean loos & unlimited tea, coffee & snacks. Very happy with our trip - thanks LNER!!

items.title: Impossible people!
items.review_text: Really upset with the communication I have received from LNER with regards to my travel. I was asked to send photo evidence of the issue which I did, but they clearly didn’t look at or read the information. They just recited their T&Cs back at me as though I can’t read this on the website. They didn’t listen to the complaint and I was wrongly fined just over £100 for being on ‘the wrong train’. I was only on this train because I believed my ticket allowed it. Very disappointed to not have my clear evidence looked at.

items.title: Currently on train in “First Class”…
items.review_text:
Currently on train in “First Class” carriage, with half an hour to go to London.
I paid extra as I’m travelling home late, so that I could have a nice comfortable journey and enjoy some food and some wine maybe. This was always the case when I have travelled first class in the past.
On boarding at Newcastle, I thought I had the wrong carriage. It was packed. A big group of noisy drunk guys with bottles of wine and it looked just like standard class.
The seats are very uncomfortable, hard and no more leg room than standard. Awkwardly placed headrests mean you can’t sit back fully in the seat.  The toilet was dirty with no soap.
The train staff came round with cold and hot drinks trolleys. On the third time I asked if there was no food this at this time at night. (Politely). The man said “there is, you must have been asleep”. I said “i haven’t been asleep,  just unsure if I have to actually ask for food?” He said there is food I have been around. I said I had seen him and he had a hot drinks trolley and he offered hot drinks .. then he reached into the drawer of his trolley and chucked a sandwich on the table. I asked him what it was, because I’m vegetarian. He took it back and threw a different one on the table..
So, this isn’t what I was expecting having paid for First class! 
This was meant to be a treat for me. But I’m left feeling like I wasted my money and received a poor service.

items.title: Worst train journey of my entire life
items.review_text: Worst train journey of my entire life. Safe to say LNER cannot organise a pizz-up in a brewery. Don’t know what David Horne gets paid but it’s probably too much

items.title: Highly recommend.
items.review_text: Travelled many many time between my home and University. Never had any issues, resonably priced if booked in advance.

items.title: Trains been unreliable
items.review_text: I have caught this train on 3 different occasions and 2 weeks ago that's had issues on the track and I was delayed by 6hrs and today I have caught the train again and I have had the same issue and I'm so angry about it I won't be catching any train again has lost my business.

items.title: A con to get you to upgrade to 1st class
items.review_text:
The new Azuma train has got to be the most uncomfortable way to travel. The seats, which I can only presume are just upholstered slabs of stone; will leave you with backache for the foreseeable future and if you like a foot rest you’re going to be out of luck. My seat mate has decided next time a pool lilo or camping mat will be the only way to survive the London to Edinburgh trip. 
Goes without saying really but I’d of given 0 stars if it was possible. 
#IMissVirginRail #IsThisAMatter4TheTransportPolice #SeeItSayItSortIt

items.title: Peterborough to Edinburgh
items.review_text: Travelled on the 16th October from Peterborough to Edinburgh should have arrived in Edinburgh at 16.25train did not arrive until 18.25. But they claim the train was on time not by my watch. I was travelling with my 89 year old mother and son, nightmare of a journey.

items.title: Aggressive Male staff member who enjoys causing upset
items.review_text:
Horrible aggressive, smug, male staff member on a York to London train service today. Humiliated me and induced a panic attack. I am formally complaining and have appealed a petty fine that I really should not have been given. It felt like this man genuinely thrived off my distress and the weird power trip. Unsettling. Ruined my day and caused significant upset. He also made a point to lean over me without a face covering which made me feel very uncomfortable.


Update: fine dropped. 👏

items.title: LNER First Class not really
items.review_text:
LNER First Class. Travelled from the Highlands to London on Monday 
Just don’t di it buy a standard ticket and do something else with the money. You will get a Luke warm coffee or two  and a biscuit or two and a Luke warm bacon roll or a very economy sandwich. You won’t notice any other difference rock hard seats no leg room

I have travelled this line for 40 years I am not looking through rose tinted glasses with fake fond memories other providers had issues but they didn’t just sell the same product for twice the price with a free coffee biscuit and budget sandwich. I hot about a fivers benefit for £100 plus benefit. The staff are fantastic they deserve better

items.title: What a star
items.review_text:
I was travelling with LNER .
I went into 1st class lounge
at kings cross. The staff especially Godwin was such a star. I explained that I had no battery in phone eg tickets  he was a gentleman  and lent me his own charger. What a wonderful man.

items.title: Shut the doors before I could board the…
items.review_text:
Shut the doors before I could board the correct coach even though I waited an hour for their late train. 

They're another vile capitalist outfit who treat customers like cattle and have zero compassion for people.

items.title: Weeks and weeks of chasing but no…
items.review_text: Weeks and weeks of chasing but no response.

items.title: Fantastic LNER staff
items.review_text:
Can’t fault LNER 
MY daughter’s train cancelled due to falling tree in heavy winds. Not a  fault of LNER. My daughter and partner caught a train one hour later and were travelling with a young baby in a pram and 3 huge cases. I asked Tracey in Durham where their coach A would be so I could help them. She then asked a lovely young girl called Molly to help me with their luggage. What fabulous two ladies. They couldn’t be more helpful, friendly and genuine about helping customers. They were both so cold standing out on the platform on a miserable day but no one would notice because of their cheery demeanour. Thank you both so very much. LNER staff always helpful in my opinion. Xx

items.title: I only gave them one star because you…
items.review_text:
I only gave them one star because you have to... 15:30 from London King's Cross to Edinburgh cancelled - rude couldn't care less staff couldn't help and were too busy chatting to each other. Got on the 16:00 - no seat reservations, overcrowded and a woeful service in first class. Booted off at Newcastle with no warning and no explanation and yet again staff just didn't seem to know anything...
       I just don't get how you think you can treat customers so poorly. Ah yes... zero competition. You should be embarrassed but I doubt you care...

items.title: Brilliant staff kind and caring
items.review_text:
Brilliant staff, my old dad was returning from a trip to London to Darlington and due to a tree coming down on the track outside of Peterborough the train was delayed.
Dad doesn’t have a phone and has lung disease and my mum and I were concerned for his well-being.
We contacted the online chat and asked if someone would do a welfare check.  To dads surprise a lovely lady from LNER visited him at his seat to make sure he was ok and if he needed anything.  They kept us informed of his onward journey and put our minds at ease.  They went above and beyond from Brenda on the online chat to the train manager and lady who went to see Dad.  Thank you all

items.title: Very expensive
items.review_text:
Every time I get a train with this line Its not a nice experience, staff are rude, and the offices and their responses are even worse 
Bad experience all round 
And very pricey

items.title: Absolutely disgusted with LNER ,had a…
items.review_text: Absolutely disgusted with LNER ,had a really bad experience with the passenger assistance and was let down really badly in Edinburgh, no show to help me then got a lot of attitude from the guy who was to help me when he eventually appeared when it was to late.he was rude. unhelpful and couldn't care less. Put complaint in and as expected they took his side even though there would have been cctv footage to prove what I said,plus back up on computer that he lied also about what assistance i needed. long story short. Doesn't matter if ur right or let down by them,they stick together and ur complaint means nothing.

items.title: Travelled from Edinburgh to York
items.review_text: Travelled from Edinburgh to York. I was seated in backward facing seat when I specifically requested forward facing. Going backwards makes me feel sick. The train was delayed by 20mins causing me miss my connecting train to New Pudsey which resulted in an extra hour wait added to my already long and tiring journey. Will not be using this service again.

items.title: East Coast LNER 1st Class Experience
items.review_text:
As a frequent traveller pre covid on Virgin West coast to London from Scotland I was intrigued how my experience of LNER East Coast would go. On the plus side, the staff on the train couldn't have been nicer and we were well looked after. What does let the service down is the annoying seat and table design which can really irritate on a 4-5 hour journey. The headrests are too big which force you into a very upright position. I found it best to remove the head rest and use it as a much needed additional armrest.
The seats are also pretty thin for long distance travel and the hard plastic trim around the table edge is actually painful on wrists and arms. Just a woeful design that should be addressed by LNER. 
Still, the West Coast experience has been totally trashed by Avanti so choices are limited these days.

items.title: London to Edinburgh IF YOU CAN CALL IT FIRST CLASS
items.review_text:
Made reservations to travel first class to only find they had changed the train and not added our carriage. Spoke  to staff who said if anyone comes on at next stop they will find us seats. At next stop it was mayhem as lots of reservations and not enough seats. The staff was good as a chocolate teapot and said it wasn’t their fault and they couldn’t do anything 

My partner is in a cast and had to stand up from Peterborough 

Two out of 3 of us found a seat only to be asked at northgate to be moved again 😡

Could not understand why seat reservations were not transferred or sorted before departure 

Shocking staff, shocking service, shame  on you LNER, I hope the new budget train provides better service than you at least we don’t have to use this shocking service and judging by a lot of people on board they felt the same

items.title: Crammed together on shortened train
items.review_text: Took the 18:02 from York to Kings cross on 22 October, they have a shorter train than planned and my seat reservation not honored. Normally this wouldn’t be too bad but we are now all crammed in less carriages and no social distancing, it feels really unsafe. I will be looking at other options next time.

items.title: Travelled Edinburgh to Kings Cross…
items.review_text:
Travelled Edinburgh to Kings Cross First Class return x 4 people.
No issues going down other other than first class lounge closed in Edinburgh.
Coming back, the staff on our train were absolutely brilliant, particularly the young girl from York - its the staff that can make up any shortfalls and these guys did a great job.

items.title: Well this is a very mixed review...
items.review_text: Well this is a very mixed review.... Journey from Edinburgh to London was amazing. Excellent services, clean toilet with toilet paper, seats for everyone to sit. Just as you'd expect. However the return journey was the exact opposite..... Not enough seats, overcrowded very noisy train. The refreshments carriage ran out of all the basics, water ect. Filthy toilets, no toilet paper, definitely no social distancing rules. It was a very unpleasant experience on the return journey in comparison to the journey down. Also charged me twice for my food order. Wouldn't be so bad if it had been edable.

items.title: Absolute joke stopping for crew changes…
items.review_text: Absolute joke stopping for crew changes half stock of food and drinks which are pathetic any way. Breakfast is either porridge or a f sausage roll. Savour snacks is a packed of crisps - it’s unbelievable how any idiot can design a service that basically says to clients: got not idea ... eat f chips you losers!!!

items.title: Hello I am traveling to Kings Cross to…
items.review_text: Hello I am traveling to Kings Cross to Piterborough with 20:03 in Couch K  .i am so happy my and my family the clening is perfect floor tables toilet we apreciate the service for the team cleaning to Kings Cross for Atalian Servest I give to them 10 star.thank you..for nice train Azuma for Lener for staff thank you for hard job.10 star.

items.title: Class act
items.review_text: These guys have never let me down. Customer service of the first order!

items.title: One of the few more helpful train…
items.review_text: One of the few more helpful train companies. Easy to use app too.

items.title: Twin tickets travesty.
items.review_text:
First time booking a train since shielding and felt pretty worried about the whole thing. The LNER website is tricky to use on a mobile - lots of jumping about/ crashing/ not being able to read text properly. Very frustrating but I liked that you could reserve seats easily so I persisted. 

After filling in the details to book my ticket and painstakingly checking it, I pressed the payment button to complete the transaction. The thing crashed and the website said there was a technical fault. 

I had enough of it by then so I booked on with another train provider with no problems whatsoever. Problem solved - or so I thought. 

Later tonight, I got an email saying LNER has taken payment after all and issued tickets. argggh! So I now have two sets of tickets for the same journey! And at £80 quid a go, it isn’t cheap. 

I am waiting to hear back from them to see if they will refund me my money as I have two sets of tickets for the same journey which I wouldn’t obviously have if their website had worked properly. Am now pretty grumpy about the whole thing but holding out hope that it can be sorted out promptly. 

Will update on progress here.

12/10/2021 - Contacted them again via the chat function and they issued a full refund straight away! Was expecting a difficult and lengthy process but LNER sorted it all out very efficiently. So have to change my original one star rating to five stars. Very pleasantly surprised by how they dealt with the problem. Thank you and well done LNER.

items.title: Travelled from Edinburgh to London
items.review_text: Travelled from Edinburgh to London.  Very happy with our seat reservation, train was very clean and comfortable.  What really made our trip was the staff - very helpful and friendly! Prompt departure and arrived on time.  Will be using your services again.  Thank you!

items.title: Reservations-the complete opposite of what was booked
items.review_text:
Absolutely unbelievable but the seat reservations on our trip to London were the complete opposite of what was booked on the LNER website a full 2 months before our  journeys on 1st & 3rd of October. We booked forward facing seats, at a table in the quiet coach. What we got was rear facing dual seats, no table with just 5 inches of window to look out of, in a very noisy coach with screaming children on both journeys.
The one star is too good for LNER.

items.title: Not the best LNER
items.review_text: Not the best LNER - seat reservations not working in both directions and people in my seat with a reservation for the same seats on the way back. Can't imagine the administrative and actual horror once it's as busy as usual. Will make sure to avoid

items.title: No encouragement at all for passengers…
items.review_text:
No encouragement at all for passengers to wear masks.

On the 09:15 Leeds - Kings Cross, 2nd October - train was packed, reservations lights above the seats not working so many people confused about seating.

We are not out of pandemic, and would much prefer some wording and encouragement for passengers to wear masks.

Avoid

items.title: Short formations but friendly services
items.review_text: Travelled with LNER on the 1235 London Kings Cross to Leeds. When I booked the website was showing as a 10 car service, upon arriving at Kings cross was informed that the service is only 5 carriages long. Boarding commenced 20 minutes prior to departure. Got on board and the train manager announced there was no reservations on this service as it was only a 5 car service not a 10, which was a good job as someone else had same seat reservations, seats had been doubled booked, this combined with being short formed and services to Leeds been cut to hourly meant that all seats were taken. We departed Kings Cross to Leeds on time and the journey was smooth enough. Went up to the cafe bar to grab a coffee and the coffee is quite nice, staff were friendly enough. Over heard staff saying that this happens on a regular basis with them cutting services to 5 carriages and on most journeys the services are packed with not enough seats, they also went into mention that this service was quiet. Arrived into Leeds on time. Overall the experience was normal to say the least, friendly staff and on time arrival was nice, but the lack of carriages and short forming would make me think twice about using them again, specially as it sounds like a regular occurrence.

items.title: Amazing customer service
items.review_text: Thank you so much to the two employees at kings cross station who have helped me enormously this evening. Diana, on the train platform in the station, and Tom P, in the ticket office. You have helped me more than you could imagine and you kindness means alot. Thank you, Inesa.

items.title: lner first class travel
items.review_text: Travelled first class from Newcastle upon Tyne  to York and back, no covid measures on board. people standing in the aisles chatting etc. Enjoyed individual seats and extra space. Food and drinks terrible - I just wanted tea and a biscuit, waited ages for a hot drink and only offered a sandwich - no choice at all.

items.title: Train from Edinburgh to York 30 minutes…
items.review_text: LNER Train from Edinburgh to York 30 minutes late no reason or apology  train not cleaned and Wi-Fi not working shambles avanti west coast next time

items.title: Very helpful staff
items.review_text: Very good service, extremely helpful staff. I'd like to single out Jez, who was so kind and helpful in retrieving my lost bag. Thank you!

items.title: Make sure you have plenty of free time…
items.review_text: Make sure you have plenty of free time if you try to ring LNER. Having held on the 'phone for over an hour I finally got through, only to be told I had the wrong number! Then waited a further half an hour on the new number. Finally spoke to someone who told me they would call me back with an answer to my query - I'm still waiting 2 days later.

items.title: Not impressed
items.review_text: I have to say that I am not impressed with the first class service LNER. The extra space was nice, but the food and drinks menu was extremely limited and on a whole, I don't feel that the service justifies the price.

items.title: Avoid lner at all costs
items.review_text:
Just arrived back at kings cross from a journey from Edinburgh with LNER.
The train was FILTHY.. clearly had not been cleaned since the last passengers had got off ( where is the protective spray and clean we hear so much about) the toilets are something out of a horror film. No one is monitoring them.
No social distancing as full capacity & no one wearing masks.
Apparently a issue with supplier so no cold drinks and hot food on board a 5 hour journey.
I will never ever waste my money with this train service again! Avoid at all costs.
Not covid secure at all! So worrying.
Don’t book with them!

items.title: Rude and miserable staff onboard the…
items.review_text: Rude and miserable staff onboard the train. No hot food or hot drinks. Journey was fine. Need to improve on customer service onboard.

items.title: Well managed, no complaints
items.review_text: I travelled on LNER Azuma on 26 Aug 2021. I found that the company was very well managed. Pleased with seating comfort, I was particularly satisfied with the catering in carriage B that day. No fuss at All, just got on and my journey was exceptionally good.

items.title: Unreliable, Unhelpful
items.review_text:
Wouldn't let me get on my train even though I arrived on time with a ticket, and the train I booked after that went to the wrong platform and I missed that one. 
The staff didn't seem to know anything when I asked them where the train was supposed to be.

items.title: I was travelling from London to Lincoln…
items.review_text: I was travelling from London to Lincoln with a change at Peterborough.  We set off 3 mins late, no explanation, we were running really slow, again no explanation and suffice to say although there was a 10min window to catch my transfer, I missed it by 2 minutes landing at Peterborough at 1820 instead of 1808. An hour wait in Peterborough to get the next train to Lincoln after a 0515 start is not great.  Keep people updated, we can live track and there was no warning, I would have got a different train from London. I won't be using LNER again!

items.title: Kings X to Aberdeen
items.review_text:
Kings X to Aberdeen.  First Class seats.  The train was busy but we had an excellent journey both ways.  The staff were very friendly.  Food was plain and freshly made.

Customer service was excellent.

items.title: Lack of sanitation
items.review_text:
We took the train from Newcastle to Aberdeen and all this way there was no water to wash you hands in the toilet ! ( also no toilet roll) 
Not even a bottle of hand sanitizer ! We are in a global pandemic in which we are encouraged to be safe and sanitation is very important and no water in a toilet on a very busy train on a Sunday is not acceptable in my eyes .

items.title: 4/9 carriages, always delayed, seat reservations don’t exist
items.review_text: Always delayed and brings only half of the coaches. Seat reservations mean nothing. First class means nothing. Due to their service often consisting of fewer carriages, pre-paid train tickets for a seat will get you a standing place if you’re lucky. The only good thing is the delay repay compensation. Definitely fly instead

items.title: The train arrived on time so that was…
items.review_text: The train arrived on time so that was good. I went first class which might be worth it if you are a solo traveller wanting a solo seat. If you are a couple sitting together don't bother going first class; go standard and use the money saved to have a nice picnic and decent booze. Can honestly say I miss Virgin... even the LNER company before them were miles better than the miserly lot running the service now.

items.title: Well managed, no fuss.
items.review_text: Train was delayed by half an hour - before I’d even got off the train they had sent me a refund for 50% of my ticket price and an email apologising. I didn’t have to do anything! Can be pricey but well worth buying if they have a sale or deal on - comfy seats too! X

items.title: Terrible customer service
items.review_text:
Terrible customer service - we had super offpeak tickets and the ticket collector made us get off at the next stop due to our tickets saying a different time.
Also charged us another fare for the journey we did take.
We then had to wait at a station in the middle of nowhere for an hour for the next train.

items.title: Terrible customer service and way of…
items.review_text: Terrible customer service and way of dealing with clients. I paid a ticket online and I thought that like every company on this planet I just needed to show the eticket or ticket reference. No, they need me to print the ticket beforehand. So not only I paid £80 for a ticket online, but I also had to pay for another £80 ticket on the train because the staff argued I could then ask for a refund since I didn't print it. Also the way of approaching me was not professional and arrogant. I hope they will at least refund me the ticket, if not I will be sure to write another review.

items.title: Bike spaces - LNER from York to Edinburgh 1st Sep…
items.review_text:
LNER from York to Edinburgh 1st Sep 2021 - 18.55

Bike spaces are tiny, just be aware of this when using LNER Azuma trains.  If you are bike packing or have a larger bike frame you could have difficulty.

items.title: A Train company you can communicate with
items.review_text:
Fantastic service - Lost tickets for travelling today. managed to online chat with someone ( Louise H) within a minute of requesting this morning who gave me the help and support required in enabling me to still make my journey.
