I use trains a lot and have always thought LNER are good - but the service i got today was EXCEPTIONAL which is why i am leaving my very first review on this site 
THANK YOU VERY MUCH.

items.title: ***This review is written during COVID…
items.review_text:
***This review is written during COVID PANDEMIC***

Absolutely terrible. Had to stand in overcrowded train from Edinburg to London. No seat booking or social distancing offered. There were many empty seats in 1st class carriages but they wouldn’t upgrade us and EVEN asked us to leave first class vestibule and move to standard class vestibule that was completely overcrowded. Absolutely terrible service. Complete disrespect and greed for overbooking the train especially during Covid pandemic.

items.title: Abysmal
items.review_text: Abysmal. First class lounge at Kings X had no working coffee machine, no newspapers, and was generally grotty. Cheap and nasty. The first class carriage to and from Edinburgh was packed both ways. Leg room dreadful and seat comfort poor. Catering quality dire. This is an utter disgrace bearing in mind what we pay. I simply can’t describe how bad this is, especially since it’s such a long journey.

items.title: Clean and comfortable.
items.review_text: Travelled 1st class on LNER from Kings X to Leeds this afternoon. The train left on time and arrived in Leeds at the expected time. The carriage was clean and comfortable. Alan and James the train hosts were brilliant. Very welcoming, friendly and attentive. We could not have asked for a better journey. The conductor was also a very pleasant man. Would highly recommend LNER and 1st class travel.

items.title: The live chat is rarely available
items.review_text: The live chat is rarely available, although, the time of the live chat is Mon-Sun 8 am-10 pm. Also, the perks are literally not working as I am waiting for around £15 since the beginning of July 2021. Probably this company is very good, but only on paper when seeking gov funds.

items.title: Just awful
items.review_text: Having spent a large sum on first class tickets from Newark to London, we arrived to find that the 11 carriage train had been reduced to 5 with no prior contact. As a result my daughter and I had to stand for some time until some people got off and were then not seated anywhere near each other. I am finding it nigh on impossible to complain and get any refund for my ticket.

items.title: Abysmal first class
items.review_text: Paid for first class and got … worse than standard class? Uncomfortable seats, crowded carriage. Toilet a complete disgrace with paper and urine all over floor. The catering staff told us we weren’t allowed a lunch sandwich as we’d had a bacon roll 3 hours earlier. They then got off the train and there was no catering available for the remaining 2.5 hours. If we’d known there would be no food we’d have brought food onto the train. The WiFi also did not work. Absolutely no point paying extra for first class. Next time I’ll fly or go down the west coast, despite it taking longer.

items.title: Absolutely horrific service
items.review_text: Absolutely horrific service. Never board one of these trains if you can. I would rather drag my bleeding lower body to leeds from London than travel with this service again

items.title: Edinburgh Waverley 1st Class Lounge
items.review_text: I see from previous reviews, that 11 days on the first class lounge at Edinburgh Waverley still has no refreshments whatsoever and the toilet is still out of order. What a waste of my money!

items.title: Inexplicably rude and aggressive staff
items.review_text: My rail card had expired, which I had not noticed prior to boarding.  Staff treated me as if I were either an animal or a criminal.  Rude from the outset, aggressive, threatening and discriminatory.  Worse, I wrote to the managing director and sent this by recorded delivery - and I still have not had the courtesy of a response.

items.title: No more excuses LNER.
items.review_text:
Room temp wine. No ice “due to Covid” ??? 

Microwaved plastic cheese sandwich. One of the worst food items I’ve ever been served anywhere in the world. It’s diabolical. 

LNER, its time to take a little pride in what you do. I’ll be bringing a packed lunch on First class until further notice.

items.title: VIP Treatment
items.review_text: Kevin and his colleague were amazing today.  I missed my second train after having to stop for several hours at Victoria, and they carried my luggage to the ticket office and helped me onto the next train. They also arranged for help carrying my luggage at my destination as I couldn't really carry it much further. I was silly enough to have joint hypermobility take heavy bags. Thank you!

items.title: Worse company in terms of staff…
items.review_text: Worse company in terms of staff customer service skills. Absolutely rude staffs in most stations, not friendly, not helpful, frowning their faces at you for asking a question like you owe them. Guards on trains are a disgrace. Rating them 1 out of 5 is even a high score, they should be on minus.

items.title: LNER Azuma Worst Train Service in the World
items.review_text: Just experienced the worst ever first class train service in the world, Trains unclean and catering service is just appalling. Food ordered, did not turn up, complained to be told it was all gone. Staff rude and unhelpful. This is what happens when you nationalise an industry, people have no ownership and do just not care.  Terrible will never use again. I can fly for the same price.

items.title: GET A GRIP LNER!
items.review_text: Again further to my earlier review still not resolved.  Whenever you contactvthem you get issued a new reference rather than following throught with one reference to an outcome.  There is only so long Covid can be blamed.  Now they are not even responding.  Yes it's only £9.40 but not about that now it's about Customer Service!

items.title: First Class Lounge (allegedly)-Edinburgh Waverley
items.review_text: Re: LNER First Class Lounge - Edinburgh Waverley. Complete waste of time. We were early so thought we’d go into the lounge for a coffee and comfy chair and wait for the train. The girl on reception was completely disinterested, there were NO refreshments at all, one of the toilets wasn’t working, none of the phone chargers worked and we couldn’t get into the lounge Wi-Fi. I know there’s been a pandemic but what’s dangerous about putting out stuff to make our own drinks, and a few packets of crisps and biscuits. They managed it at Kings Cross! It just felt as if no-one could be bothered.

items.title: Disappointing experience
items.review_text: Pretty disappointed by experience in LNER first class. Comfortable seats in modern clean carriage. However, complimentary food and drinks were limited. Sandwiches or snacks only, and choice of red wine, white wine or beer. When I asked for a top up of wine (I had only been given a small amount in the first place), I was told the trolley would be round after Newcastle, some 50 minutes away. Had been looking forward to a bit of luxury in first class, and got a second rate offering.

items.title: Such a positive experience with LNER
items.review_text: Such a positive experience with LNER. Travelled to and from London/Edinburgh and it was great. Plenty of space, sockets to charge laptop, and (pretty good, FREE) Wifi. Very friendly staff. Couldn't fault them.

items.title: I booked two first class tickets to…
items.review_text:
I booked two first class tickets to London and needed to cancel due to covid restrictions causing the event to cancel.
I requested a refund and was advised I needed to return the tickets which I did.
Then I was told that I needed to send confirmation that the event I was attending was cancelled : agian I did this.
Then I was told the request had been refused, to which i disputed this and was then told I would be issues a full refund.
Then I recieved a further email saying that the refund would not now take place !
Hours on the phone and too many emails to mention, awful service, lies and non refund it sight !!!
Terrible company :(

items.title: Bye bye social distancing
items.review_text:
A rail company, what's to like?

Let's be honest. Train delayed and its a 1 star experience. 

But scratch beneath the surface.

LNER try, they really do. Their best asset is the staff. The vast majority work hard to do their best.

Hamstrung by managers who sell the myth that everything is perfect. It isn't 

Yes sitting in your free first class seat on a quiet train and it's as good as rail travel can.

But on a packed weekend train in standard,  with arguments over seat reservations...

In this covid era  trains are spotless. Well done the cleaners.

Fellow passengers less so.

Weekend off peak trains are busy. Get used to having your social distancing removed and to be surrounded by those without masks.

Peak trains slightly better but forget the myth that you will have social distancing and everyone is masked.

For some that will be a positive in its own right, but from observation even those sans mask appear to like the seat next to them empty.

I don't think people are ready to sit next to a stranger for hours on end at the moment (Aug 21).

That being said, it going to happen.

Fares, get an advance fare and you will save a bit albeit at the expense of flexibility.  Flexible tickets will cost an arm and leg, but remember that's largely the result of a government who believe railway needs to pay its way

items.title: Two staff worked their socks off
items.review_text: The staff were limited in numbers by staff sickness, but the two crew on the 1120 Edinburgh to King's Cross couldn't have been more productive. They fed us and offered us all drinks and food regularly. Thank you.

items.title: Brilliant
items.review_text:
We used LNER kings cross to Edinburgh.

The journey was on time and we really appreciate the family ticket that makes it more affordable to visit with children.

Smooth journey, no problems but ways.

Recommended

items.title: Well I didn’t expect the Orient…
items.review_text: Well I didn’t expect the Orient Express, but , having paid for first class, I did expect a modicum of Comfort. But the experience was far from pleasurable. My seat didn’t recline and was hard and cramped. Then the food. Could someone inform the catering staff that toasted ciabatta sandwiches are not meant to be soggy and cold. No tea as the boiler had broken. A truly horrible experience and SUCH a disappointing start to a holiday

items.title: Reservations often cancelled
items.review_text: Was good, but now it is far too common for reserved seats to be cancelled. Always frustrating to find a random person sat in my seat and end up standing 😠

items.title: Prices gone sky high, service gone lower than dirt.
items.review_text:
LNER’s shamefully poor service has been causing nothing but grief lately. Having to travel between Leeds and London quite frequently, I have the misfortune of using this service on regular basis. Nine out of ten times an email is sent out shortly before the upcoming trip, telling me that they have decided to remove some of the coaches and my seat reservations are now useless. When contacting customer care, they very calmly advise to take ANY seat on the trin without a problem. I followed their advice once and, on the trip back from London I was moved TWICE at different stations by people waving their tickets at me. I was going home from doctor’s appointment and was in a lot of discomfort and pain and would have loved to be left alone. No luck! 
 IF one chooses to amend the journey instead, to “secure” a seat reservation, LNER has taken upon themselves to extract even more money from people who have already paid far too much for a simple trip that is constantly being messed around with. The amendment can be done on the phone for no charge; however, the new amended journey “ticket” will surely cause more trouble during the journey.  I spent quite some time proving to the gentleman checking my ticket (showing the emails and the PDF ticket), that I was not hitching a free ride and the new ticket was, in fact, sent by their own customer care. He looked unconvinced and marched off looking furious. What can I say? 

Update 25th August: my last trip to London proved to be the most chaotic yet. NO seating reservation was made (even though requested) from Leeds to Doncaster and the train from Doncaster to London was the train of misery. It appeared that they have sold tickets to fill 9 coaches, however the actual train had only 5. They have already hit rock bottom with their disregard for their customers.  Avoid at all costs! I’ll be moving back to London just to avoid being forced to use this service. Horrid!!!

items.title: Poor service in first class
items.review_text: Poor service in first class. No healthy food option. Only allowed one pan au chocolate on a 5 hour journey. Just high fat / sugar options. At 10 am I choose a pan au chocolate then not allowed anything else ! This was not explained to us. I could have had biscuits crisps or cake  but not hot sandwich! Why?

items.title: I wouldn't give 1 star if l had an…
items.review_text:
I wouldn't give 1 star if l had an option!, l needed to ask a question about a journey l was making from York to Sheffield, l was on the customer service phone number 03457225333 for 48 mins without getting a response so had to hang up. 
I got to york station and still needed an answer to the question so went into the information/ticket centre. Only 2 serving out of the 4 kiosks ( totally inadequate for a busy station) and 7 in the queue l stood there 11mins in which time 2 people in infront of me had given up and left the queue l finally got to the counter and asked my question about my return journey, I then heard swearing and looked around to see about 15 people in the queue! and 2 people walking out of it!. So l asked the price of my journey, and asked if l could pay on the train (thinking l would get out of there quicker and help the poor people still in the queue, but l was told if l paid on the train it would cost me more WHY!!!!!!, Same company same journey what a rip off. GET THE TRAINS UNDER ONE COMPANY, SAME TIMETABLE, SAME PRICES WEATHER YOU BOOK ONLINE OR PAY ON THE TRAIN AND STOP THIS RIP OFF AND TOTAL CONFUSION THAT IS THE CURRENT SYSTEM.

items.title: Regular travelers from Edinburgh to…
items.review_text:
Regular travelers from Edinburgh to London, the staff on Lner make the journey. A special mention to Yvonne on the 15:00 king X to edin 31/7 for making us welcome and the train being something to look forward to! 
Thanks!

items.title: Not impressed
items.review_text: Not impressed! Going to Harrogate from London Kings Cross, I paid £35 to upgrade to first class in order to get some work done and have some dinner. The Wi-fi onboard was not working for the entirety of the journey. Then the conductor let other people sit in first class with standard tickets because they said they were getting off soon. An hour later, they were still there and were given snacks and drinks! Not sure why I bothered paying to upgrade. I upgraded again on the return journey, which was better, but I was charged £45 instead of £35 and my journey was shorter, as I was going from Harrogate to Stevenage. Will try to avoid LNER in future.

items.title: Mixed experiences, First class catering needs improvement
items.review_text:
Travelled four times in July 21 on LNER services all in first class and each time was a bit of a mixed experience. First journey from London to York was pleasant enough and on time. Seats are not as comfortable as the old trains and I also found that you could feel every bump on the track (made worse by the hard seats) much more than previously so obviously the suspension is not as solid/robust as the older stock. Catering service was ok on this first train but nothing more than a sandwich, crisps and biscuits with tea, coffee, wine, water and I think they had an ale also.

On the second trip from York to Edinburgh a few days later it was the exact same catering offer, but staff seemed to come round more often on this train to offer refreshments.

From Edinburgh to York service was appalling. Train was busy and people were in our seats although they did move when we boarded (but tables obviously not wiped clean). Catering service was non existent not even water offered until about 30 mins from our stop. Train was also 30 minutes late although they later claimed it was 29 minutes late to avoid any delay repay! When I contacted LNER about the service and delay on this train after the journey they really didn't claim any responsibility.

Fourth journey from York back to London was same food offering although was surprised that the introduction of a bacon roll suddenly appeared on this service. I've also noticed that staff are keen to 'close everything up' far too early upon getting close to London (i.e. 45-60 minutes out), presumably so they can all be first off the train. Also the train we were originally booked on they had changed and so email from LNER said we could book seat reservation on any service that day however on board it felt like an interrogation from ticket inspector as to why we were not travelling on the train booked and he asked me to to prove the email sent!  

Overall very mixed experience with some journeys better than others. Appreciate things have changed in Covid times but first class catering and service really needs improving.

items.title: Do not waste your money with LNER
items.review_text:
Complete waste of time and money 
2 first class journeys, no lemonade available on either, no hot food available on first. On second, took my food order, then came back and said they’d run out but gave the same thing I ordered to people who ordered after me. Never again will I travel with LNER

items.title: Considering I frequently travel with…
items.review_text:
Considering I frequently travel with LNER, the service today was shocking.
Not only did the coach arrive into Waverley 4 coaches short, no seat reservations and a load of people standing in the carriages due to lack of seats….so much for Health & Safety during a pandemic - this was on 1st and standard class. Due to the volume of people, no 1st class service from Newcastle - what do the expensive 1st class tickets actually qualify you for these days
Poor poor service LNER

items.title: This review is based on my first trip…
items.review_text: This review is based on my first trip with LNER since they took over the East Coast line from Virgin. I have to say that sadly this service (1st Class business passenger) is a shadow of what Virgin offered both in the way of staff friendliness, menu (extremely boring and poor), wifi very poor especially as I am in need of stable connection for business and seats are small and uncomfortable unlike the virgin first class carriage. Overall very disappointed and you cannot blame COVID for these observations as adherence to protocol was the only thing that was right.

items.title: Poor judgment over covid rules.
items.review_text: In a time when everyone need to work together to combat covid I don’t understand how a company who claim to have any standards would decide to disregard public health advice when operating their trains. My experience perviously has been satisfactory to good with only issues being poorly stocked refreshments on some early trains, which is not a big deal really.  But with this decision, even if it’s overturned, I will be avoiding booking any trains in the future as public health advice published by the government is not something that should be taken lightly.

items.title: Social distancing - ZERO
items.review_text: LNER is operating its services under “English guidance”, which means that passengers can now be seated next to each other even if their journey begins in Scotland. Scotland is different to England, with 1m social distancing still in place in all indoor public spaces including public transport.

items.title: London to Edinburgh, Return
items.review_text:
London to Edinburgh

Our reserved seats had been taken by a group who refused to move to their own seats becuase they needed to sit together as they were the from same "household". On complaining to a staff member, he thought this was an appropriate excuse for this group to sit in our reserved seats. We had to question how this made any sense! 

Edinburgh to London

The "Quiter Coach" is not at all quite..

items.title: Hungry and Thirsty in First Class!
items.review_text:
I have travelled first class from Edinburgh to Kings Cross on a few ocassions and mainly when it was Virgin. Virgin offered loads of food and drink when I travelled with them previously, and I wrongly assumed that LNER would follow suit. 
The new seats on the Azuma train just aren’t as comfortable as the leather seats previously on Virgin First.
I was however, more disappointed in the lack of food and drink offered on my 5+ hour journey. I was offered one bacon roll and a diet coke for my entire trip. My other journeys in the past I have had multiple hot food and snacks and plentiful refills of beverages which made the extra expense good value.
I’m sure LNER will blame “COVID” at their lack of hospitality, but my suspicion is that it’s a great excuse to give sub-standard service but still charge all the money!
Fingers crossed Virgin come back to serve the London to Scotland line again soon!

items.title: I'd like to know something
items.review_text:
I'd like to know something. If I buy a 'Anytime' ticket, which means I can travel on any train on the route I am taking. What gives LNER the right to say I can't unless I have a seat reservation?
If you insist on seat reservations, stop selling 'Anytime' tickets. It is tantamount to a scam.

items.title: NOT ACCEPTABLE
Double booked seats and no staff around…
items.review_text: Double booked seats and no staff around to help.  Happened to us and also seats next to us despite lner saying this doesn't happen

items.title: Nice to see good customer service
items.review_text: Just a quick review, Sat on the King's Cross to Edinburgh, came to check tickets and the young lady opposite me was on the wrong train and got quite distressed, Stuart the person checking the ticket handled it so so well and calmed her down, explained the route and sorted her tickets, even wrote on her ticket to explain the situation. Refreshing to see someone help.

items.title: Bloody awful
items.review_text:
Bloody awful! Edinburgh to London- delayed at York for an hour. First class catering cuisine comprised one bog standard sandwich and some wine. Poor show - come back Virgin or Avanti!

Will travel by West coast line in the future- longer but much enhanced cuisine. Avoid LNER !

items.title: The doors did not open at my stop
items.review_text: I booked a train ticket from Wakefield to Leeds with an anytime return. When it came to returning home, I was disappointed when the train stopped for a literal minute but the doors did not open despite the stop being highlighted and even brought up, meaning I ended up in Doncaster and then had to wait to get back to where I am supposed to be. I'm sad to say that I will not be using your service again, what a waste of time.

items.title: The seats are rock hard very…
items.review_text: The seats are rock hard very uncomfortable journey won’t book with them again

items.title: DO NOT TRAVEL WITH LNER THEY CHARGE EXTRA…
items.review_text: Got a train from London on an off peak open return. The whole ticket including journey to and from cost £36. There was no indication to what trains were off peak and not so got on one with my open return. Once on the man attempted to charge me an extra £60 for only part of my journey because the train wasn’t off peak yet there was no way of knowing this. Absolutely fuming. Poor communication and customer service skills on LNERs part. Do not travel with them.

items.title: First class
items.review_text: Had to cancel our trip to London due to unforeseen hospital appointment, requested a refund on train tickets, got refund within couple days. Thank you LNER. Wonderful service.

items.title: Thank you very much LEONA .For helping…
items.review_text: Thank you very much LEONA .For helping us and making us comfortable .liner you guys rocks .excellent customer service 👍👍👍👍👍

items.title: Sorry not praising but very annoyed
items.review_text: Sorry not praising but very annoyed - booked first class and the staff took their break and were chatting very loudly behind me and I was trying to work I asked if they could be quiet as I was trying to work and was told this isnt the quiet carriage. I then asked if it was normal for staff to take their break in 1st class and they looked rather angry but then moved. Also coffee ran out as first class was served last....

items.title: My wife is on the 9.00am train from…
items.review_text: My wife is on the 9.00am train from Edinburgh to London.  As they promote that the seating is socially distant am afraid this is not the case. After leaving Newcastle someone rocked up and sat beside my wife saying that someone was on her seat. This left my wife raging as she shouldn't have anyone beside her. There was no staff around yo say anything. Eventually the lady moved but she wasn't happy about it. Also having booked her seat in the supposedly quiet coach she said it is noisier than any train sh has been on. Now we regularly use Lner to travel up and down to see family in London but after today we might consider using other modes of transport. Even though we booked in August we might be changing our mind. Regards @glennyboy847

items.title: They sell the seats more than once
items.review_text:
My train was cancelled & was told to go to ticket office to a get a reservation for the next available train. Someone already had a ticket for that seat - after having to change seats few times I eventually refused to change again & told the person they need to talk to LNER. Great start to UK rail travel!

Then to be called a liar by LNER is the icing on the cake! It’s such a shambles, you are told to reserve a seat before you travel & on the train your told to sit anywhere because the tickets and seats system is not in use.

items.title: Was charged again for a train journey I…
items.review_text: Was charged again for a train journey I boarded the only train that showed the correct departure time. I raised this with the appeals team who were agressive they made me feel like I was a criminal and needed to pay immediately even though the notice gives 28 days. I was upset that they had failed to hear what I was trying to say and how processes could be improved going forward. I raised this with the customer service team who ignored me completely. You have to repeat yourself only for staff to ignore all points raised. Terrible customer care and will not use this company in future

items.title: Exceeded expectations by a mile
items.review_text:
Brilliant! 

My daughter and I took the train, first class from Kings Cross to Edinburgh today.  Having frequented the Virgin first class many times I had fairly low expectations which were significantly exceeded.

Staff were warm, welcoming, engaging and funny.  WiFi actually worked for the entire journey too!

Seats & seating arrangements
- All passengers were spaced appropriately and socially distanced 
- seats were clean & comfortable 
- windows were clean and there were plenty of spaces for luggage 

Food & Drink service 
- first class trolleys came round every 15-20 minutes with reminders between that the bar car was open 
- there was no shortage of anything and so no disappointments 
- I loved that the bar car now has an ‘order from your seat’ option meaning less people walking around 
- food was good - sandwiches actually tasted like sandwiches :-) 
- cold drinks were actually cold and tea was piping hot and served with a ‘watch out, it’s hot’ warning 

Toilets & cleaning 
- toilets were clean and regularly cleaned throughout the journey 
- between each trolley service there was a member of staff who came round to pick up any rubbish and clean anything which needed cleaning.  This included the toilets which were genuinely sparkling.  

What a great service and at a good price too.  We will be back!

items.title: LNER are not remotely covid safe
items.review_text:
LNER are not providing covid safe transportation. They ignore un-masked drunk people sitting in seats they have not booked. The staff choose to ignore this by just walking past even after complaints are made and reports to the BTP are made for intimidation.

Edit after response: Staff did not approach the drunk people to advise face coverings  (probably, and I’d understand, for fear of repercussions). Staff also ignored the blocking of aisles, as previously stated BTP were contacted but didn’t arrive within even an hour. The fact remains there was no intervention, support or assistance provided by LNER for those of us who follow the rules. Given the rules of sitting where you book changing seats is not exactly an option.

items.title: Quiet Coach - Waste of time
items.review_text: Why book tickets for the Quiet coach when there is nobody enforcing this message. People on phones constantly. Absolutely disgusting. Every guard ignores anyone using phones. Why ?????? What is the point of the Quiet Coach ? Looking for alternative travel routes to London after 20 years  travelling on the East Coast line.

items.title: ‘Relaxing restrictions before most people fully vaccinated
items.review_text:
Edited - the return ticket was from London to Leeds and was definitely booked with LNER. I then bought another ticket at considerable cost last minute with Avanti.) 

I had a ticket booked for London to Manchester, I noticed it was completely sold out surprisingly on a Monday afternoon, so I called LNER to ask about their safety measures. I was told all window seats would be occupied and other restrictions had been relaxed because ‘it can’t continue forever’. No-one wants it to continue but relaxing restrictions when a third wave is on the cards is idiotic. I didn’t take that train and will never be spending money with lner again.

items.title: I have been working with the railways…
items.review_text:
I have been working with the railways for 11 years with a well recognized train company just like LNER and my experience by their "Apparent Revenue Officer A***" on July 03 from Peterborough to London just won't go away! With my Lanyard and Staff ID around my neck and children with tickets, I was told to STILL pay £127 for tickets ALTHOUGH, I was given permission to board LNER Train from Peterborough to Lindon. Question: LNER, is it because of commission why this staff member acted so mean towards another individual who ALSO works with an express train company? LNER, are you aware of the humiliation that your staff member had done to another individual who works within the railway? I was lead to walk the breadth of your train with your RO in search of her own colleague who said I can use the train for work and even after pointing out the individual to her, I was still told to pay £127.

LNER, by compulsory, I have to take your train to Peterborough tomorrow and I am dreadful of this humiliation repeating. I will do a special prayer in hoping that I wont see uour RO (Anne/Ann) and I hope the commission from the £127 goes a long way for her.

Peace!

items.title: First class.....Disappointed
items.review_text: I had to book a first class ticket from York to Kings Cross as no standard seats available. What a rip off ! Over 100.00 for an area that I don't believe the seating was any better (I had a single seat). I had more space when I was in standard because of social distancing! The service wasn't all that and the choice of food (roll, crisps and drink) certainly wasn't 1st class! Whilst I appreciate we are in a pandemic, I find it appalling you can offer 1st class seats at those prices when there is nothing first class about it! I was desperate for a ticket thus why I had to book 1st class but I won't be again and I certainly wouldn't recommend at those prices! The service was ok but again not what I was expecting. Disappointed to say the least. Save your money! Don't go first class.

items.title: Excellent service from Peterborough…
items.review_text: Excellent service from Peterborough platform staff when train to Newcastle delayed and they helped me get new seat and cycle reservation on next train north.

items.title: Horribly badly designed seats and bland unhealthy catering
items.review_text:
My first experience of traveling on an Azuma train - cattle class between London Kings Cross and York - was very disappointing.
The seats are very uncomfortable, which I assumed was a personal issue until a frequent traveller friend , who travels First Class, told me it is a design issue with all Azuma seating.
The choice of refreshments was also very limited, unhealthy and boring.
On the plus side the train was punctual.

items.title: Absolutely shocking
items.review_text:
Honestly why doe this company even have a licence .Truly shocking service 

Been up to North east on business twice in last two weeks and it’s been a misery both times thanks to LNER .

Weekend before last (bank holiday )took 8 hours to get from Middlesbrough to London .No information from the staff who had no idea what was going on .My ticket cost 134 pounds and I’m still waiting for a refund ,no surprises there 

This week the train from kings cross ran ten minutes late .They announce the platform at the last minute hence a huge unsafe rush to get on .

They insist you book a seat for safety but the website constantly crashes which makes it impossible  .I got on anyway and it was empty .Now running over 30 minutes late due to breakdown and barely past York .From reading other accounts it’s the norm .Disgraceful

items.title: Amazing customer service
items.review_text: Amazing customer service - I’ve used LNER for years and today at kings cross, I was blessed with great customer service from a lady called Nicoleta. I missed my train by 1 minute due to overground delays. She was very understanding and did everything she could to avoid me having to wait 6 hours until the next available train. She found me a cancellation and I was on the next train within 20 minutes, thank you!! Highly recommend this service.

items.title: High prices with the lowest service
items.review_text: High prices with the lowest service. Cant even get a cup of tea in First class!! No crisps on offer due to "Covid". Liars using a pandemic to justify truly awful service

items.title: Garbage - sold out trains with barely any passengers
items.review_text: Completely useless. They have seat restrictions in place due to covid but almost all their trains are running empty even when marked as "sold out", making the trains unbookable for people who are able to travel. Utter trash of a company and a perfect example of why UK trains are abysmal and would be better run by monkeys hammering at keyboards.

items.title: Below average
items.review_text: Bad wireless, poor choice of food, useless toilets. So nah.

items.title: Waiting for refund from unused tickets…
items.review_text: Waiting for refund from unused tickets due to circumstances changed, was advised 10 days to process, 3 weeks later no refund.  Have emailed and phoned no joy all say is will come back on.  When checking on liner account case had been cancelled nit heard a word back when queried this. Will not be using these again till refund processed

items.title: The Worst There Is
items.review_text:
What a truly horrific company - being a regular Traveller from London to Newcastle I appreciate there are delays (95% of my journeys so far this year) and I accept that. However the most recent issue yesterday took it to a whole new level - everyone asked to leave the train at Peterborough (several hours from London) with no assistance to get back - no coaches, buses, guidance etc., - The response from the LNER staff was ‘Nothing to do with us, speak to station staff’ (There wasn’t any to speak to), the response from LNER social media was ‘No assistance to get back due to it being bank holiday and no, we won’t reimburse for any expenses’ - the result was a £200+ cab ride home.

Bring back Virgin Trains - the one thing they had going for them was BRILLIANT customer service something which seems to have bypassed LNER

items.title: Very rude staff
items.review_text: Very rude staff. As a continuous customer, I believe I deserve better treatment - staff extremely unprofessional and rude. I will ensure I do not use this company for any future travel.

items.title: A pleasure to travel with
items.review_text: It’s not often I have a need to utilise this service, but by all means I’d love to travel as much as possible with these guys when I do.

items.title: Journey from Dundee
items.review_text: The train and journey was comfortable and enjoyable. When I boarded the train a member of your team looked straight at me and said "hello doll".I have worked in customer service for many years and it is not really appropriate to speak to people this way.If I was a doll I would not have been travelling on your train in the first place!I hope this puts a smile on your faces when you read it and thankyou for getting me home.

items.title: door to door North Allerton to Deptford in 3 hours, fantastic service and very comfortable journey
items.review_text: Was so impressed with the transition from Virgin trains and have had nothing but good experiences with LNER since.  I, like a lot of people this year have been more anxious than usual travelling by train.  I travelled up north last weekend on Grand Central in 1st class, no catering but a pleasant enough journey.  I then booked another last minute cheap deal for a 1st class ticket with LNER to return to London.  The next day it was all over national news channels not to travel as cracks were found in a new model of trains and services were severely disrupted.  I called the LNER customer support and received honest and empathetic advise from their staff.  After confirming on the phone that the train I had booked on would still be running, I decided to travel and boarded the train at North Allerton.  Almost immediately after finding my seat I was received by very professional staff and given food drinks and a variety of snacks.  The train wasn't overcrowded and I broke a personal speed record - from boarding the train, to opening my flat door (Deptford) in bang on 3 hours!  Can't ask for much more from a train operator, I'm looking forward to my next journey with you!

items.title: I have been unfortunate enough to HAVE…
items.review_text:
I have been unfortunate enough to HAVE to travel by train several times over the last few weeks, and even more unfortunate that I have NO choice but to travel with LNER!
Apart from the fact that they have almost trippled fares since the last few days/end of April, the service on board is way beyond a joke - actually, it's mostly non-existent  !
My last journey from London to Edinburgh on Saturday 1st May 2021 had NO catering service for the entire journey  !
A strange yet stupid announcement saying it was because catering staff didn't turn up on that particular trains South bound journey at Newcastle, so, LNER would have had plenty of time to arrange someone for the trains departure from King's Cross  !
Now on my Edinburgh to Kings Cross this morning, 17th May 2021, there's a very limited catering service aboard this service, NO announcement saying so, although there was one leaving Edinburgh saying there was drinks and snacks available, so I tried using the Lets eat at your seat app, but I got a message saying they are NOT accepting orders just now, BUT the cafe in coach G is open if you want to make your way there, so I did, which was several carriages away, only to be very grumpily spoken to by a man standing behind the counter, looking bored, NO face mask on, folded arms resting on the counter, I asked for a latte, he very grumpily says, we're closed !
Yet the shutter was open, he was standing there, but refused to sell me a coffee, ssys it's because we're changing staff at Newcastle, I asked how long will that be, he says about 15- 20 minutes, so WHY wouldn't he serve me, WHY wasn't there any announcement to say it was closed  !
LNER provide such a really bad and pathetic service, yet, if you want to travel by train, you have no choice 
My advice is,look for alternative options  🤬

items.title: A company mistreating staff is the…
items.review_text: A company mistreating staff is the lowest form of a company. I can and will not be a part of this. Therefore no more London North Eastern Railway.

items.title: Appalling customer service
items.review_text: Appalling customer service

items.title: Go woke go broke
items.review_text:
Go woke go broke

Man or woman . Full stop

items.title: Five star handling
items.review_text: Five star handling of a one star technical issue (so, 4 stars here). I booked a return ticket to London to give to a friend, and after payment on the lner.co.uk website the tickets came out the wrong way round (return from London). No amendment possible, could only cancel (within 2 hours of booking) and then rebook with potential £10 handling fee. After messaging these details on Facebook messenger (from link on LNER website) an operator facilitated the refund and waived any charge. Given the miseries inflicted on consumers by other web-based businesses and applications (Cashplus for example), this was a welcome, efficient and polite surprise. Thanks LNER

items.title: Fabulous service from LNER
items.review_text: Fabulous service from LNER - down to KX from the north in First, back in Standard. Immaculately clean, cleaner regularly up and down wiping tables etc, comfy seats, refreshments delivered to your seat in first or ordered by app / collected from the buffet in the back. No alcohol obviously at the mo! Superb staff! Train from KX was cancelled but the staff put us on a slightly earlier train with no fuss and no bother! Refunded within the hour for the cancelled train but not necessary as we still travelled! However, thank you LNER and we will def use you again as first choice from the north!

items.title: Train was lovely, not fair to staff
items.review_text:
Train was lovely, pretty immaculate and spacious with friendly staff.
My only concern is that the poor chap on the food bar was on his own having to take orders at the bar plus there's a delivery service so passengers can order on their phone and have food and drinks delivered. LNER head office need to rethink for the health, safety and stress levels of its staff as it's simply not fair to expect someone to do a job that requires at least three people!

items.title: Rudest customer service ever.
items.review_text: Rudest customer service ever.

items.title: Good service on way to London
items.review_text: Good service on way to London. Train clean and on time. Really regular. Wish it was cheaper.

items.title: Very rude inspectors
items.review_text: Very rude inspectors, try to find every little excuse to charge you.

items.title: Best train operator in the country right now
items.review_text: Probably the best train journey I've had in the UK - both ways between York & kings cross trains were very clean, free WiFi a big plus so I could work on board & staff very helpful. Definitely will use the train again with these guys rather than drive.

items.title: My favourite Train Operating Company
items.review_text: My favourite Train Operating Company - friendliest staff :)

items.title: Cheating on arrival time
items.review_text:
The 11.50 Train from London to York yesterday arrived over 31 minutes late - I took a photo as soon as I stepped off the train of the departure board as evidence. I was denied a refund as they said the train was 29 minutes late - how convenient but also a lie. They have no evidence to prove their claim whereas I have, but despite this they are still trying to pretend that the late train was 29 minutes late.....bean counting at its worst, cheating to save a few quid.   
I am now pursuing this through the ombudsman but should not need to.

items.title: Dodgey App
items.review_text: I bought a 1st class advance ticket, then looked at the weather and thought timings might be a bit tight. So looked on app for costs of changing ticket, the app made me buy a new ticket before could refund existing ticket. So I did for a Train 2 hours later. They said could not process refund so I use original ticket and asked for the new one to be refunded as this was bought by using a mid leading app. They refused so paid twice for 1 journey, distance selling and online good practice don’t seem to apply to this organisation. Look at alternative providers as this is simply theft.

items.title: I met the friendliest operative of this…
items.review_text: I met the friendliest operative of this company in Kings Cross station and he was genuinely the most helpful and friendly man I have ever come across. He made my day and managed to get me on an earlier train home than I had originally booked so that I didn’t have to wait around in the cold while everything was closed for covid! So grateful! Thanks Simon!!

items.title: Great customer service!!
items.review_text: Great customer service!!! I had to cancel my journey because of the covid lockdown restrictions, and I got a full refund in the form of a voucher. It took about 2 minutes of help chat, and the administrator was very helpful and friendly!

items.title: ONCE AGAIN THANK YOU  for quick refund
items.review_text:
ONCE AGAIN THANK YOU  for quick refund 
due to lockdown needed to change journey home .
Easy booked new journey then claimed refund for original ticket . REFUNDED in less than I WEEK 
Great service

items.title: Fantastic customer service
items.review_text: Fantastic customer service! I had to cancel my train tickets last minute due to the Covid Tier 4 restrictions, and my refund was processed promptly. Thank you!

items.title: Today 13 December 2020
items.review_text: Today 13 December 2020, the platform for the train to Cambridge from London King’s cross was announced at 6:41 pl for a departure at 6:44pm. I was waiting for the train near the platform 9 but it was announced at platform 8 (King’s cross station) which let me three minutes to get in the the train. I was walking fast and one of the gate was opened, some people used it and it was normally faster, when I was about to Walt through the gate  a black employee close it looking between the two me. It was a voluntary action from his side, no apologies, no words to explain his actions but just an  aggressive look from his part. As I was about to miss the train I simply open the gate with my ticket as I did not want to miss my train from this back ticket checker.

items.title: Rip off. Avoid LNER at all costs
items.review_text: Bought a return 1st Class ticket for £150 between London and Newcastle. A few days before i travelled govt guidelines changed re covid.  On the advice of LNER is was told not to travel  only to be told i will not be getting a refund. Rip off.

items.title: A company that simply doesn't care about their customers
items.review_text: A company that only cares about their profits and provides terrible customer service. They really shouldn't have been awarded the rail contract for the Eastern Line. Needs a complete overhaul at how they handle customer care and the overall customer experience. A mix of very good staff but also very poorly trained individuals.

items.title: Staff do not know the rules of travel…
items.review_text:
Staff do not know the rules of travel and cannot advise on ticket types. You can book a seat free of charge without the need to buy a ticket, what's the point?
If you change to an earlier train you get recharged in the train at an extortionate price even though you checked with Lner station staff before boarding that tour ticket is valid. Absolutely appalling service.

items.title: Seats very uncomfortable?Staff were…
items.review_text: Seats very uncomfortable?Staff were excellent but found it disgraceful that after driving from Greece I couldn't even chill out and have a couple of beers on the final stage of my journey

items.title: A comany that cannot have tickets on…
items.review_text: A comany that cannot have tickets on sale with now less than 3 weeks to travel blaming everyone else. It is all a scam to ensure they then can much higher prices for the tri to KC as they will claim short notice etc although they ar enot releasing tickets. This is what haens when you give franchises to companies and also subsidy them with massive taxpayers money but cannot offer a service AT ALL as you cannot buy tickets. But of course the corporate manta of 'ticket alerts' is all they quote-not actually SELL tickets for the days. All of you complain to the RDG about this company and this scam they are trying to slpi to passengers- hiked rices claiming all short notice. do what you are supposed to do release and sell tickets in good times for passengers not withold them till virtually the travelling day leaving passengers with no options to buy their money grabbing scam.

items.title: Theft from train
items.review_text:
My daughter has just travelled from Edinburgh to London. On a train with limited amounts of people LNER can’t even protect people’s luggage properly.
Her case and the guys behind stolen from the train.
If you have the misfortune to travel this route make sure you watch your bags as clearly LNER don’t and even worse show little concern when something is stolen.

items.title: Concluded my issue satisfactorily 100%
items.review_text: I had an issue with Rail Travel Vouchers issued by LNER, and whilst they initially declined to rectify the problem, unprompted by me I was a few days later V pleasantly surprised to have the matter fully resolved by them, to my complete satisfaction.  LNER seem a fair minded company if you are courteous and reasonable with them.

items.title: Severe delays and no compensation
items.review_text: Severe delays and no compensation. Kept their delay to 28 minutes so as to avoid paying compensation to customers (minimum 30min) totally unacceptable

items.title: A Million Thank You's to LNER this…
items.review_text:
A Million Thank You's to LNER this morning working with Grand Central Trains after my Train was cancelled.
Only received notification on account at 06:30am. Essential Working as  Complex Health Care Worker ,let me board there Trains ,showed my correct ID and sorted ticket to travel on LNER
Keep up the Tremendous work in this horrible situation you do  and Thank you to All #In This Together #Working Together ❤️

items.title: Complained about 1st class food, promised free tickets by Chairman’s Office, never arrived.
items.review_text:
Travelled first class Dec 19, London to York.  I’d planned my travel time to be able to partake in a hot meal as promised by their website for first class passengers. Very disappointed to be told they only had cold prepackaged sandwiches. No hot food at all.

I contacted them via their website to complain and the response was appalling.  Basically said I’d purchased a ticket that gave me a seat, any food and drink is a free amenity and not part of the ticket price which is ludicrous when they advertise the food and drink as part of the 1st class experience. 

I forwarded that response to the Chairman’s office and was contacted by an assistant in that office who wanted to speak on the phone. We had a good conversation and he said the original response was poor and he offered to send me two open first class vouchers to be used for any journey on LNER. 

Well they never came.  I sent a gentle nudging reminder in Feb 20 and he said he ensure they would be sent out.  Still never arrived.  Tried again in June, again he promised to send them out.  Still never arrived so I’ve given up.  

Shame they couldn’t actually follow up on what was promised as a resolution.

EDIT- Dec 20, out of the blue some free tickets arrived, presumably as a result of this review.  Resolved and only took a year!

items.title: Bad service
items.review_text: I boarded a train at Donnington  and the ticket warden said my ticket was invalid and there not much a can do but to purchase a new even but it was valid  And he was very rude towards me bad customer service  and it’s not the first time

items.title: LNER (like Scotrail/Abellio, Arriva,TransPennine Express) an absolute disgrace
items.review_text:
Search the  w w w  & peruse...'Apology after after Japanese train departs 20 seconds early & ponder' (as per BBC news reports)...Now ponder what follows...

{Had I not had my car, motorcycle & bicycles destroyed on both Yorkshire but notably Highland & Island Roads to hell, my kindly sister whom I had not travelled south from inverDeplorables to see post 24 08 17, being unable to drive let alone ride, may be might not have pre-booked a train ticket. Ordinarilly travelling on the coach which National Express abandoned as it had the rails, leaving but only dirty filthy StageCoach [CityLink] MegaBus, but I having been maimed if not crippled on ubiquitous enumerable potholes, loose chippings, aggregate, farmers muck, filth & animals that shouldn't be on the roads, were they too, like those uncivil servents Clownty Clowncil(or)s couldn't even manage that.

As it was. The train journey south was excellent. But a NIGHTMARE RETURN. Having   PRE-BOOKED   D I R E C T   T R A I N. One SHOULD NOT HAVE HAD TO PREAMUTRELY ALIGHT Not even for essential maintenance. This, at WAVERLEY, be pointed, with a grunt, belch & fart, hobble on to ever so empathetic HAYMARKET having left pathetic Waverley in excrutiating pain & discomfort. Where upon an ever so kindly man returning home to Montrose carried my bag in addition to those two he already had. Incredulously he wouldn't even let me purchase him a coffee, let alone pay him for his struggles, as we seriously made our way across Edinburgh thru the German Fair, but bought me one too.

My sister whom arranged as such should have upon pre-booking been FOREWARNED of as such thereby FACILITATE TRAVEL ON OTHER DAYS..

I was later advised LNER should have furnished a taxi?

As it was. The replacement TRAIN ARRIVED MORE THAN ONE HOUR LATE A inverA R S E H O L E S.

I should have arrived at a reasonable not unreasonable hour. Incomforrt & relaxed. Not stressed, in further discomfort & pain. Compounded by LNER.

Needless to say I'VE NOT BEEN BACK ON THE TRAINS SINCE. Back in the car when I should be back on two wheels.

I am perplexed as to why my experience of African & Latin Americsn rails & roads were far better in the 3rd world than 3rd rate 'United' Kingdumb of 'Great' Britain & Ulster, European 'Union'? Could it be lack of governmental subsidies?

And everytime I write to LNER, their AUTOMOTONS send automated responses and/or fob me off. Ostensibly purporting they cannot comprehend what I have wrote  & used to many brackets & puns?

When I should, a year later be looking forward to visiting my sister & nieces, I have foreboding.  Any wonder she whom would ordinarilly avoid inverMESS like c19 never once travelling to visit post 2005 other than to assist with relocation, now travels by 4×4 & not LNER.

And inverDEPLORABLES rail Station? As  D I S F U N C T I O N A L   as is dirty filthy ScotRail & notably LNER.

As is the CON{(ned)demned)sumer  liaison and/or aftercare(LESS).

This in total contrast to when my train broke down @ Peterborough (along the same line) in the late 1980's when then British Rail, was robbed and/or mugged at London Euston & signal failure at Milton Keynes caused me to miss my interview at the Foreign & Commonwealth Office Bletchley Park, but at least Mr Peter PARKER, the Chair of BR, as a gesture of goodwill, gave me an unlimited, free gratis return ticket to travel by train on BR. Strangely enough my one & only complaint with BR.

Lamentably since then I have had enumerable complaints with disfunctional deplorable privatised rail companies, whom ever their owners were and/or are. Notably Scotrail & former owners of this franchise, National Express (but not their coach company, whom no longer travel to inverDEPLORABLES, because of just that)  not exemplary Virgin whom I believe no longer run trains.

Now await overly, censorious Trust Pilot to remove it...'He who pays the piper calls the tune?' Old British Proverb.

Bring back (under invested) British Rail

items.title: Shame on you LN
items.review_text: I have an account with LNER and frequently travel to Edinburgh.  I have an advance ticket for next week but can't now travel.  The reason is Government advice - Can't stay with family now and are advised against unnecessary travel in that area.  LNER's stance on this is disgusting - I have paid 70 pounds. Can't rebook as not sure how long these measures will last.  I would have been happy with a voucher for future use.  To lose this money when I know longer have a job is insulting.  Shame on you LNER!

items.title: Government advises against travel but LNER won't offer full refund
items.review_text:
How can anyone have the confidence to travel with LNER? 

The Government advises of further restrictions to the point that people should avoid non-essential travel, yet LNER will only offer a full refund on certain ticket types. 

Surely in these times, travel should be as flexible as possible and charging a cancellation fee is simply a money making scheme.

items.title: Great trains
items.review_text:
We travelled on 15 October and cannot understand why people find the Azuma trains uncomfortable. We travelled from London to Edinburgh and found the trains were more comfortable in every way than the old trains and reached our destination feeling refreshed.
However there are 2 criticisms. First the luggage racks were too small. We virtually filled the only rack in our carriage with just two peoples luggage. We were lucky the trains were almost empty. Second storing bikes upright is impractical and is impossible for bikes with fat tyres. We had to wheel ours in which left part of the rear wheel sticking out. Because of the difficulty cramming the bikes in we got in other passengers way and were still putting them away when the train departed.
Clearly there should be a lot more storage space, which could be used to help space passengers if designed intelligently.
Finally I was surprised to see that the person working in the buffet was not protected by a screen despite having to stand very close to customers.
Updated 4September 2021. Travelled again and changed my mind there seemed to be enough luggage space, the seats although hard are very comfortable with plenty of leg room and we arrived on time much less tired than with the old intercity 125s or the west coast line. Helpful staff. The train was spotless.

items.title: Awful Azuma trains
items.review_text:
The new Azuma trains are positively the MOST uncomfortable seats I have Ever sat on not only on a train but on any form of transport !! 

The lighting is harsh bright white  and clinical. Unlike the warm lights on the old trains.  Just really unpleasant and gave me a headache. 

There’s more space but somehow you feel more exposed to other passengers. 

I wish it would tell you what type of train it was when you’re booking a ticket as I would avoid the Azuma at all costs!!!

items.title: I moved to Peterborough recently and I…
items.review_text:
I moved to Peterborough recently and I travel every day to work in London from Peterborough. I book my tickets in advance and with reserved seats.

The LNER staff are very rude and have no etiquettes whatsoever. They treat people and look down upon them as if they are doing a charity. I mostly take the 17:30 Train from Peterborough to London kings cross. As I have been frequently travelling to London for work from last one month I know their names too but I don’t want to defame them or be bad towards any one. Am sure if LNER wants to find out they can as I have given the Specific train time. 

I will look for the alternative mode of transport to London from now on. 
Hopefully no more LNER.

items.title: fantastic services love the new azuma’s…
items.review_text: fantastic services love the new azuma’s very modern and clean inside been on on LNER manytimes especially on thr new azuma got me there ontime and with fantastic meal services and staff were great

items.title: Got a train from York to Glasgow
items.review_text:
Got a train from York to Glasgow on the 27th of  September. Ticket bought online however QR code was not working.
Showed the ticket warden and was told I had done something dodgy-implying I was trying to get a free ride. Really rude woman with blonde hair. Will not be using the service again, no chance, felt ridiculed.

items.title: Seats not fit for purpose
items.review_text: Seats not fit for purpose. Upright and hard, they are possibly the most uncomfortable train seats you can get. Fit perhaps for a 30 minute commute, not a long distance train. Together with the stark white clinical style lighting, the overall experience is so so poor. Why are we so inadequate in the UK at designing and building decent trains??

items.title: Rail Cards not being checked on trains…
items.review_text:
Rail Cards not being checked on trains along with  tickets . Tickets only checked at exiting gates with a quick date check.Any wonder why LNER are losing money?..Any wonder why people are angry that they cannot get refunds on Railcard that cannot be used due to travel
 being essential only

items.title: 05:05am Leeds to Cambridge (26.09.20)…
items.review_text:
05:05am Leeds to Cambridge (26.09.20) LNER..the train manager jobsworth had his little power trip and wouldn't let me board an empty train with my bicycle despite there being bicycle spaces available.

There was no option to reserve bike spaces on booking.com and no ticket offices were open at that time. What was I supposed to do?

Jobsworth had the descretion to let me board the empty train but didn't. A decent human being would have allowed me onboard rather than be stranded but we live in an impersonal capitalist society with no common sense or compassion. Human circumstances mean nothing to these corporations and their lackeys.

items.title: LNER - What a dissapointment
items.review_text: My wife and I returned from a holiday in Scotland on the direct service from Inverness to Kings Cross last week and went 1st Class due to the length of the journey (8 hours).  We wish we hadn't bothered.  All LNER could offer was hot or cold drinks and small packs of biscuits/crisps.  It was not until I came home that I found the LNER website which said 'light refreshments'.  We needed to know this before starting the journey so that we could buy something on the station prior to leaving.  Also, with 3 crew changes of up to 3 staff, there was no 1st Class 'at table' service.  The staff were always at the far end of the galley passing the time away. On the way up to Glasgow, Avanti West Coast, X Country Trains, and whilst on our trip on the 'The Jacobite' all provided at least an 'at seat' 'hot snacks' service with a  'Gluten Free' alternative, and they did so with less staff! This only gets a 1* review because the trains were fast. We will think twice next time!

items.title: LNER absolutely failed in their…
items.review_text: LNER absolutely failed in their customer service today: hundreds of travellers could not social distance because the labelling system for carriages failed. I cannot believe that in 2020 a system to display a letter on an LED screen in a brand new Azuma train would not work. If there were minus stars, I would give them. Hang your head in shame LNER.

items.title: Great customer service
items.review_text:
Dear LnerManager
Sir/madam 

Here I am writing to put a light on a member of LNERS staff member Mr Hextor Fernandes excellent at his service . Very formal and polite ,greeted us well ,took care of our every need on the way to Newcastle yesterday (17/09/2020) 
We felt we were taken care of in every possible way.

Train was clean n tidy .signage was perfect . N overall the crew was on point . 

Definitely kudos to Hextor for making our journey better. Continue doing what your doing and good luck for your future endeavours.
(A big thank you Hextor ) see you soon again on LNER) 

Well done Team LNER .let’s keep each other safe

items.title: CYCLE STORAGE
items.review_text:
CYCLE STORAGE
4 of us travelled from London to Newcastle on fri11th sept and back from Berwick to Edinburgh on tues 15th sept. We were impressed by the train - smooth and fast travel with good social distancing. We did think that the guard should have gone through the train, as there was no one to check whether folk were wearing masks. 
However the cycle storage was the worst we have ever encountered!! It was extremely difficult to lift the cycles up and get them on the hooks provided. There was hardly room to squeeze two bikes in and no chance of shutting the door of the storage area once the cycles were in. Why was there a door there anyway?  Apparently there have been similar complaints by other cyclists, so we hope there will be a change soon.

items.title: If I could 0 stars i would
items.review_text: If I could 0 stars i would, the customer service team are shocking, may as well talk to a brick wall! I travelled a year ago, the train broke down i was late to my meeting, the trains were crowded so I claimed a refund. One year one, still no refund!

items.title: Utterly terrible
items.review_text: Utterly terrible. I would literally prefer to ride my bicycle than use these trains again. In one journey their ticket machine was broken, the doors didn't work on a train, and then the train broke down TWICE.

items.title: Travelling from London to Edinburgh
items.review_text: Travelling from London to. Edinburgh first class. What an utter waste of money. Don’t bother paying an exorbitant amount for no service whatsoever. First class lounge -  no refreshments! On the train - no refreshments after first twenty minutes for a five hour journey unless you want to walk to the middle of the train and pay of course!!! NO WI FI, no staff coming through to ask. Seats uncomfortable as they are very rigid and at a horrible angle. What a massive disappointment. So much for social distancing- everyone in our carriage is crammed at one end with lots of feee seats at the front part of the carriage. I will not be travelling LNER again if I can avoid it. It’s daylight robbery taking people’s money for no service. All dressed up as COVID avoidance measures. Really?? If you can  eat in a restaurant why not on a train?  Very poor  LNER.

items.title: What a complete waste of money…
items.review_text: What a complete waste of money travelling first class. No service whatsoever and using Covid as their excuse. Of course a better service is possible and still being Covid responsible. First of all the announcement being given out was completely incomprehensible, and we had no idea what service protocol was. We had to walk to another coach to collect a hot drink, bag of crisps and a biscuit. The first class fare didn’t even include a sandwich, all the way from Edinburgh to London , and was told we had to pay for this at the cafe at other end of train. A complete joke! They can’t offer first class fare a sandwich because of ‘Covid’ but the party of four males beside us defied the Face mask Rule and staff didn’t seem to care. Two metre rule also a joke as all the seats around us were occupied. Awful awful awful , never again . LNER get your act together.

items.title: Save your money.....fly
items.review_text: Travelled first class stevenage to Inverness! Only service was 5.minutes after getting on board. Bottle of water, small bag of crisps.... ..that was it for 8 hours!! Funnily enough due to Covid limited food being served...... BUT......you can PURCHASE sandwiches etc from the Cafe bar!!!!! Enhanced cleaning and hygiene???  in 8 hours one rubbish collection, one person wiping handles on back of seats. No tray wiping after passengers disembarked, toilets gross!! Well worth the premium for  first class NOT.......disgraceful.

items.title: 45 min delay only half ticket price back in compensation
items.review_text: First experience with LNER and was delayed 45 minutes departing from London Kings Cross to Leeds where I was supposed to get connecting trains up to see my family. Only received half the price of the ticket in compensation for the near hour delay, wow! Guess I should be grateful they eventually left the station, eh? Will think twice next time on taking up one of their offers. Fingers crossed my train home won't be delayed or cancelled!

items.title: Booked a first class ticket from…
items.review_text: Booked a first class ticket from Newcastle to London. Looking forward to breakfast as I hadn’t had time to eat, at seat breakfast is included in the price. An announcement is made that if you want food you have to go to the front of the train where I am told they. Are no longer serving breakfast “due to covid”. I can have a bag of crips, which I declined in disgust. What absolute nonsense. How is serving breakfast any more risky than getting the train or going to a shop, bar or restaurant? This is a cost saving measure dressed up as concern for public health. “Due to COVID” the new catch all excuse for crap service.

items.title: First class never again
items.review_text:
Lner Edinburgh to london kings cross at 10am First class.

Left absolutely shocked by the service in first class I dont even know where to start.

First no service having to go find a member of staff which was hard enough. 

I checked online to find that they are offering a limited menu.

So limited menu consisted of water orange juice tea coffee shortbread.
No hot food no soft drinks no alcohol.

When I got told to go to the cafe in the middle of the train I get their to be told there food menu consisted of packets of crisps as I was told very rudely by the member of staff it was because of the pandemic.

I'm sorry but if bars and restaurants are open up and down the country that is no excuse for what you are offering for the price of a first class ticket and to be told that all you can have on tour 5hr journey is a packet of crisps and a bottle of water.

Extremely angry with how I was   spoken too and the offering onboard.

Sadly to say left woefully disappointed in the quality, standards, choice and service on this trip and will definitely not be using LNER for my traveling again

items.title: Rude staff
items.review_text: Tickets are very over priced and staff are extremely rude. It’s hard to sit in your own seat reservation even when they state “seat reservations have been made for your safety to keep away from others during this time” So why am I sitting in a coach full of people when other coaches are empty!? However the ticket wardens do not care so people sit where they like, they only care about first class.

items.title: Edinburgh to London
items.review_text:
Edinburgh to London: Train left on time but that was the only good bit of the journey. 
First off the seats on the Azuma carriage are the worst I have ever sat on, very hard and uncomfortable, I had numb cheeks 30 mins into a 5hr 35 min journey. 
Refreshments closed not long into the journey, unable to get soft drinks or snacks. 
Toilets were dirty and after every stop we were reminded that Dave was the train manager although I might have been more irritable at this point due to pain, thirst and hunger.
I wont use this service again

items.title: New Azuma Trains
items.review_text: I booked ticket's on line to travel from Edinburgh to York with out fuss with #Covid19 there was lots of warning's for passenger's to ware face covering's the new Azuma trains are clean and bright with good lighting but sad that the seats are uncofertable not sure if I would want to travel from Edinburgh to London on the new Azuma train's

items.title: Uncomfortable
items.review_text: I catch a train up the east coast a couple of times a year. Recently i had the chance to try out the new azuma trains which i was looking forward to. My original plans changed due to covid but i was allowed a refund and rebooked with no issues, refund took a couple of weeks but they did warn me of this. Train was clean and on time, as per most places, there was little customer adherance to Covid rules despite regular announcements. But the seats, oh my god the seats. The designers previous job must have been torturing people. Hard, bolt upright, no support for lower back, however hard i tried it was impossible to get comfy. Did nobody actually try these seats out before putting them on their entire fleet of trains? I overheard others on the train saying similar things. The old train seating was far better, i use to catch these trains which were formerly virgin as i enjoyed the ride. That sadly is no longer the case and ill prob try one of the other operators.

items.title: Very uncomfortable seats
items.review_text: Very uncomfortable seats. Not designed for longer journeys. Announcements regarding face coverings were bordering on rude. By all means remind passengers about the rules but do it in an encouraging way rather than a threatening manner

items.title: 'Quiet' coach ruined by PA system
items.review_text: Does not seem to understand that when I want a quiet coach, I don't wanna hear their God awful PA system announcing the same automated, useless information every few minutes.

items.title: Overpriced & Underwhelmed: Expect little and you won't be disappointed.
items.review_text: LNER has made lamentable and, some might say, unforgivable and irresponsible lip-service adjustments to their Covid-conscious 'new world order' rail offering, if my trip of the 31st July 2020 is anything to go by. Mainly, this was illustrated by the fact that whatever is happening at the point of online ticket booking does not, in any shape or form, distribute tickets according to the 2metre (or even Im+, if we're going to get picky) rule. This is even more unacceptable when a stroll through the train once we were on our way, revealed some carriages with hardly any travellers in them at all. Some passengers were considerate and sensible enough to wear masks. Many were not. The odd tannoy announcement regarding face coverings coming late in the journey (the first ones failed to mention the mask protocal) simply comes across as token gesture and indifferent. One member of the crew passed speedily through the carriage enroute but seemed to be in a hurry. I guess if you pretend not to see a violation of mask-wearing instructions, then you can pretend it's just not happening. Also, it was incredibly hot and many were bemoaming the lack of air -conditioning. This may well have been a Covid-related health and safety issue thing, I suppose. In which case, at least have the common courtesy to let your customers know. In short, a horrible stressful experience.

items.title: Poor value and  VERY uncomfortable
items.review_text: I travel from the north east to London almost weekly for work. I’ve noticed the overall service declining over the past few years to the point that I now choose to drive the 5hr trip the majority of times!.....The final straw for me was the new Azuma trains, I honestly can’t understand how they got it so wrong; the seats are seriously uncomfortable, especially when travelling longer distances and the lighting is too bright to relax.....Can’t speak for 1st class as I can barely justify the cost of standard!

items.title: Azuma: not a pleasant experience
items.review_text: Travel regularly between Leeds and Doncaster (and occasionally further afield) with LNER almost always on an Azuma. These are LNER's supposed flagship trains (they also operate a small fleet of Class 91 locomotives with MK4 coaches dating from the early 90's) but I find the seats uncomfortable and the ride quality on a recent Leeds to London Kings Cross journey was very poor, especially between Peterborough and Huntingdon. They are also quite noisy in the seating areas, certainly nowhere near as quiet as HST's were (HST's were trains introduced in 1976/1978 and finally withdrawn from service late 2019).

items.title: 1000000% best train company ever
items.review_text: 1000000% best train company ever, polite And funny staff, clean trains and smooth journeys what more could you ask for, for those of you complaining about delays , LNER isn’t really delayed very much, especially compared to other company’s and most of the time it’s not there fault but Network rails. It’s brilliant and always whisks me into my dreams to Scotland and back, train company’s have it hard as it is and I know some company’s are just bad and ignorant but I know LNER will never let you down    Cough cough Tans pen Express take note!!

items.title: Absolute appauling attitude towards the disabled
items.review_text:
Attended Doncaster railway station yesterday as girlfriend has to be at Sheffield hospital for pre op assessment .
We both have mental health issues and learning difficulties .
They were only accepting card payments from behind the glass.
However there was 1 machine that would accept cash .
We couldn't understand the stuff that came on screen .
We asked 3 times for help and was refused help 3 times .
The woman behind the glass was rude and offensive when we explained we had mental health issues / learning difficulties .
She wound us up and mouthed off at us in front of a customer .
Yes I did lose my temper due to my illness . And even when I appolagised to her for getting angry due to her hateful attitude and her winding me up - 
even when I stated that the hospital wanted my girlfriend in ASAP for an emergency operation this vile company rep still refused to help .
I asked the rude vile rep woman behind the glass " IS THE CORONA VIRUS THAT DEADLY ? " SHE SAID YES ! I asked her why was she still breathing then ? 
She was rude and was lucky she was behind the glass . I just mouthed off and walked away .
Even the platform staff were rude .
Telling me not to worry about paying and just get on the train which drove away after I got to the doors that were close.
I asked a staff member on the platform for help she just chunted and walk away from us .
Then totally ignored us and walk straight past us on the way back as we were waiting to talk to her. 
Really disgraceful staff with an apauling attitude towards the disabled .
When I managed to get their phone number the woman I spoke to at the Station said the government has told them they are not allowed to even push a button on a machine " EVEN IF I PUT THE MONEY IN THE SLOT - TOLD HER WHAT I WANTED AND LEFT THE ROOM ! 
I know there's a mass panic with covid -19 but no other public company treats people with so much disgusting hateful attitude .
AND THE 3 PEOPLE BEHIND THE GLASS IN THE TICKET OFFICE " 2 RUDE WOMEN " AND A GUY WHO JUST STOOD THERE WHILE HIS MATE WOUND ME UP AND I LOST MY TEMPER WERE ALL WEARING RUBBER GLOVES ! 

I doubt that the Government has instructed any company to make disabled people feel like dirt ? 
Or treat them like dirt ! 
LNER WON'T EVEN HELP PEOPLE WITH MENTAL HEALTH ISSUES / LEARNING DIFFICULTIES GET THEIR TICKETS !
Perhaps they see the mentally ill as low life scum ?
Their attitude gave us that impression 
My girlfriend missed her important hospital appiontment

items.title: Fantastic response and payment of my…
