items.review_text: Fantastic response and payment of my refund due to the COVID-19 crisis. Simple, easy process and it was refunded without any charge within 5 days.

items.title: excellent customer care
items.review_text:
excellent customer care. They may be a little slow at times, but their ethic is unbeatable.
Their trains are not always on time, which is why some of the reviews may be not stellar, however, the company makes effort to satisfy their customers and make the extra mile.
Recently they even refunded advance tickets which I could not use because the COVID-19 lockdown. Other railway companies do not give a flying flamingo and they simply pocket the money.
When I could, I will always prefer them to travel: I know I can trust them.

items.title: Awful service and very unprofessional…
items.review_text: Awful service and very unprofessional and rude staff. Wouldn't recommend them to everyone, will always use other services from now on.

items.title: .no quibble with a refund due to…
items.review_text:
.no quibble with a refund due to covid-19 
Immediate refund unlike the Eurostar trying to steal money from people 
I love traveling on the Lner trains and never had any problems.

items.title: Poor service. Low standards.
items.review_text:
Monday morning 16th March and i am travelling on an Azuma to Leeds to be there for a morning meeting. What a mistake. A cup of lukewarm tea and no food. Staff shortages. All at full price first class.
Ive used the east coast route for years and they have done well in the past. This was shabby and the seats arent too comfortable on these trains either. The blurb boasts that these are their best trains yet. What a load of tosh.
Virgin knew how to run a proper train service, this line has become a waste of money. The 225s and 125s are much more comfortable and smooth riding. But most importantly, no food and no staff mean a dismal service. I find the quality on a full train is lacking too with food and staff cut backs. A poor service overall nowadays. They should be shamed for charging these farea, hotels wouldnt get away with it and many of them are nowhere near first class but they are all better than this. 
Absolutely shoddy.

items.title: I am writing this review purely on the…
items.review_text: I am writing this review purely on the excellent staff members on my recent trip!! I think it is important to recognise that some employees go out of their way to be fabulous and hope LNER award them!! So , thank you Red and Anto on the 18.02 from York to Grantham 11.03.20. So nice to have great friendly staff!!

items.title: Purchased a first class return ticket…
items.review_text: Purchased a first class return ticket to Hull.Service punctual,staff very attentive.This was on both journeys.Thoroughly enjoyed both trips.First class service.

items.title: We were one of the people that had our…
items.review_text: We were one of the people that had our flight cancelled by flybe and Lner & Cross Country trains got us home for free can't thank them enough so comfortable travel thank you once again

items.title: All routes ticket denied??
items.review_text: I bought a very large ticket from Wokingham to Spaulding £61. My ticket said "All routes permitted" low and behold when I got onto the connecting train from kings cross, the ticket guard told me that my ticket wasn't valid and I was asked to pay for a single from kings cross to Peterborough which was 37 pounds, the most expensive I've ever seen that journey. I couldn't pay and I was asked to pay a penalty until 2 extremely kind passengers offered to make up the 6 pound difference I was missing. I have never known my all routes ticket to be invalid on a train before. The ticket guard was only doing her job and was pleasant to speak to, and told me that LNER has the most uneccesary restrictions than any other service, why is this? I will take every opportunity to avoid your service at all costs. Awful. Sort it out.

items.title: Today I received an email from LNER…
items.review_text: Today I received an email from LNER asking me to update my Travel Buddy at 15:18pm 05/03/2020 and since I have a iPhone 5s I tried installing the New Travel Buddy App but I cannot do it because the new app says my mobile is incompatible for the New Travel Buddy App, then I tried to communicate with LNER via web chat and got someone called Adam he was no help he hung up on me after 2 minutes, so I tried again to install the New Travel Buddy App on my iPhone 5s and still got the old app, so thanks a bunch tech team now I will have to Book Train Tickets in person at my local station. The reason why I liked using the Travel Buddy app is because I have a Speech Impediment I cannot communicate verbally at all and it was great having that independence to do things for myself and now you have taken it away from me, oh you Tech Team are such a bunch of goons!

items.title: LNER Azuma First Class - less legroom, smaller tables, fewer seats
items.review_text:
I travelled from Newcastle to London Kings Cross on LNER today in First Class, in their Azuma train.  The First Class seats in the Azuma are noticeably closer together in terms of legroom - I estimate 20cm less legroom per seat.  The tables are also less deep, as a result.  If you are sitting opposite someone, you are constantly kicking each other.  LNER have also reduced the number of First seats from 128 to 101 - so the First Class carriages were very full.  (Standard class was not that full at all (they added 100 seats to Standard class.)  The new First class seats are also pretty firm to sit on.  
LNER should increase the legroom again. And also the number of seats.   
They have also reduced the size of the café bar by about 65% - it is now a joke.
The coffee machine was out of order; and they have de-programmed it from being able to produce espresso.  (Why would anyone do that?!)
The oven for First Class food also packed up. 
Not a great Azuma first time experience!!!

items.title: Quite means Quite!
items.review_text: Please can you put out announcements that if people sit in the QUITE carriage it means QUITE.they do this on other train lines Also train was delayed 2hrs ,not anyone's fault as person hit by train,but some helpful announcements would have helped as my train was suppose to be going to Harrogate ,but stopped at Leeds and we had to get a different train to harrogate.Would have been useful to tell us which platform to go to and ETA as wanted to let people meeting me in Harrogate.Small changes

items.title: I had a different experince from other…
items.review_text:
I had a different experince from other reviews and i didnt even find it average to be honest

If trustpilot wont remove this one

items.title: I should have known not to book LNER......
items.review_text:
I should have known not to book as last time was pretty dire so I suppose it’s my own fault. KingsX to Leeds 20.03. Twenty minutes late arriving so of course missed my connection to Skipton. The train guards kept apologising 1. Not enough seats 2. Not enough carriages 3. Sorry no hot drinks the boilers broken... it’s a new train!!! Even I felt sorry for them. It didn’t help that I was sitting next to a fairly pleasant drunken individual, mind you that could  happen on Eurostar!!
However my real gripe? Why when I book forward facing ( and table pls) do I always get rear facing and no table????

items.title: Would have given 0 stars if possible
items.review_text: Would have given 0 stars if possible.  Booked well in advance and paid £110 with reserved seats to stand all the way from Doncaster to London.  Carriages reduced from 10 to 5 with no warning and told by staff that this has happened every day for over a week.  Save your money and book the coach, you definitely get a seat that way. Though the train would be a treat. Horrible journey

items.title: Very disappointed!!
items.review_text:
Very disappointed!!! 

I waited 10 minutes on platform 0 at London King Cross the staff told me it was on platform 10. And the train pulled up on platform 0. So I rushed to get the train to Wakefield . And when I got, the train is hot, dirty, food everywhere on the carriage, and the food tasted horrible. 

Bring back Virgin Trains East Coast

items.title: Customer service has dropped terribly since it stopped being Virgin
items.review_text:
This used to be a good company to travel with when it was Virgin and I used to sing their praises. Since the take over the customer service has gone down and down. Too many incidents to count but these include dangerous practices whilst travelling (passengers kept at over 40C for 2 h+) and tickets advertised as being refundable not being refunded. Additionally they tell you cheaper tickets are not available on their website while you can buy them on other train companies websites (for the LNER service).

Customer services do not get back to you within the timelines advertised and sometimes just do not bother getting back to you at all. They now seem to be entirely run for the benefit of the staff, I wish there was another service I can travel on - if only we could have Virgin back again

items.title: LNER great service .
items.review_text: A lot is said about how bad the trains are but Ive  found LNER 1st class..  a great service with really nice staff and on time . Absolutely great. Will have to ditch the car more often .

items.title: I am traveling 1st class and was…
items.review_text: I am traveling 1st class and was refused breakfast because I am only taking a 47min journey and I was told they have to save the breakfast to others that are traveling further. Horrible service

items.title: Avoid it by all means
items.review_text: Avoid it by all means! The service represents a risk for passenger safety. Travelled from Peterborough to Leeds and back over the weekend. On both journeys, reservations were not honoured and had to stand 1,5 hour as trains were overcrowded due to having only 5 coaches instead of 10. The return train got almost cancelled at some point as some passengers in vestibules refused to leave the full train.

items.title: Awful experience every time I travel…
items.review_text:
Awful experience every time I travel with this company, always delays, always staff shortages. Staff in Leeds first class lounge are rude and spend more time speaking with each other than actually doing work. Used this service 6 times in a week, every train was delayed by 29 minutes. 3 hours of my week, which impacted 2 client meetings in the Process.
LNER sort your lives out.

items.title: Always overcrowded
items.review_text: Always overcrowded, overpriced for the service given. I’ve travelled on LNER train to Edinburgh from Kingscross and to York and Leeds for business. Each time the trains are overcrowded or delayed with people squashed and standing in the carriages. I’ve even had children sitting on one another’s laps and for the price of £120-£60 for a single uncomfortable journey with bad service from staff this is probably one of the worst train lines I’ve taken.

items.title: Seats extremely uncomfortable
items.review_text: Seats extremely uncomfortable. Just travelled from York to Edinburgh. LNER seats far superior. Carriages badly designed again compared to LNER.

items.title: First time on the new Azuma trains
items.review_text: First time on the new Azuma trains from Edinburgh to London. Went first class on southbound and it was good, apart from cold tea - but waiter replaced it when asked with nice hot coffee. The return journey was in standard class and seats better than old Virgin pendolina style seats if not as comfy as old East Coast trains. The coffee from trolley was hot but horrible and nothing like the coffee served on 1st Class - so can do better is the main message on catering.

items.title: Ahh the Joy's of the Private owned…
items.review_text:
Ahh the Joy's of the Private owned company's here in the UK.
They are crap and this one is no exception. 

After travelling twice with this company and having to stand up both times due to train delays and cancellations. 

But alas boys and girls this is all that we have. Our Great Governments have sold off all or most of our state run companies set up for the general public to line their own pockets...
Come the revolution...

items.title: Massively overpriced
items.review_text: Massively overpriced, train had rubbish all over the seats (first train of the day in fact so no excuses), no bins anywhere, seats horribly uncomfortable (shaped to force a hunched position if you are over five feet tall), everything dirty and damaged, announcements too quiet to hear, the screen in the carriage showing stops unrelated to current journey, heating set too high, delayed departure, train makes annoying sqeaky noises as it goes along.

items.title: AZUMA
items.review_text:
Did not know it was made up of two trains had to jump on first available coach.could not get to my booked seat fortunately found an empty one.what on earth is going on.
Seat was very hard and uncomfortable and the squab ended half way under my thigh cutting off the circulation,not good on a 2hr trip.
The only good thing was every window had a long overdue sun blind.
LNER you should hang your head in shame for allowing such an inferior and expensive upgrade to happen.
I am a regular traveller between York and KingsCross 
George smith

items.title: Horrendous journey and service every…
items.review_text: Horrendous journey and service every single time. The most recent journey ... No working toilets on a train all the way from Leeds to kings cross is disgusting on a brand new Azuma train. Breakfast served was yoghurt but there were no spoons available (?). And could barely walk through due to people standing in aisles. Also all info given at station was totally wrong. Previously delay repay was rejected as I was *only* 59 minutes delayed! Staff also a mixture of lovely and very very rude doesn’t feel right. If this is ‘nationalisation’ of railways then no thank you!

items.title: Received a full refund when I mucked up…
items.review_text: Received a full refund when I mucked up bookings online, having missed the train I booked. Customer Services extremely helpful and friendly.

items.title: Let The Train Cause The Strain
items.review_text:
En-route to Kings Cross from Dunbar, in Azuma First Class.

It just feels like Standard Class with headrests.

While these seats must have been tested out by R2-D2, for me personally, by far the biggest disappointment is the "floodlit" carriages: I'm not interested in going to dinner at the house of the numbskull that signed off on this carriage lighting - as they probably have arc lights for table lamps (they probably can't even spell "Ambience" without the use of the Oxford Dictionary).

On the design side of things, I don't believe they "missed the train" as far as enhancing the first-class travelling experience is concerned: I think they were well aware of what they were doing - sacrificing our bottoms for their bottom lines!

It's the West Coast line for me, for the foreseeable future - even although it entails me going "the wrong way" for 25 minutes to catch a Virgin Train.

I'd rather be sat on a fifty-year old "comparmentalised" train - a design still in operation with many continental European train companies - than this sterile, plastic, barn on (bumpy) wheels.

So disappointing .....

items.title: Poor seat comfort.
items.review_text:
You would think that improving seat comfort would be a top priority when spending billions on new trains. Not one bit of it. The Azuma seats in standard class are so hard and too upright giving me shoulder pains. Not much better in first class marrow offering where the front of the seat cuts of the blood supply to the legs and on the singe seats the metal table support digs in too.  The old seats are so much more comfortable.  

Who on earth signed these off as remotely acceptable?

items.title: Very disappointed with Azuma
items.review_text:
Like so many other reviewers, I was really looking forward to the arrival of the new Azuma trains. How very disappointing they have turned out to be.

Standard class is dreadful, the seats are SO uncomfortable, too upright and SO hard. The leg room is improved however, but you need this as you can't stop wriggling trying to get comfortable. The last journey I took was from Harrogate to London Kings Cross. The train arrived but with no external signage illuminated, so we were unable to tell which carriage we were boarding. Once on board, there were mixed opinions from other passengers about which carriage we were actually in, and as the seat reservations had failed to load up, we were unable to tell if we were in reserved seats or not. 

A trip to the toilet (large and clean) was spoiled as there was no water to wash my hands.

No trolley service throughout my trip.

First class accomodation is also a disappointment as the first class seats now feel more like the old standard class seats 'recycled !

On my last trip in first class there were no menus, so had to ask what food was available. I dont know if this a new cost cutting policy, or just a one of oversight ? 

Bring back the old trains please.

items.title: Great customer service at York station…
items.review_text: Great customer service at York station today. The ticket office staff are really excellent, always very helpful and get me the best tickets. It is a busy station with a lot of tourists and they always smile and do their best.

items.title: Used to like their old train seats
items.review_text:
Used to like their old trains, new Azuma trains look shiny but the seats are really, really bad.
Sitting in standard I can't lean back as the headrest is fixed and too low, the backrest creaks like a piece of cheap plastic and is incredibly hard.
Please just install the old seats in the new trains, they were so comfortable!
Nothing so sit in for 2 hours. Following advise of another traveler I sat on a newspaper on the floor which was more comfortable.

items.title: How come after having my train…
items.review_text: How come after having my train cancelled I managed to drive a car to my destination without incident. What a way to run a railway,pathetic!

items.title: LNER - let’s not engage reason. Shocking service
items.review_text:
Left hand and right hand completely disconnected. Shocking service. 
Family of 5. Tickets to return from Edinburgh heading south. Weather warning. Advised not to travel on the 9th (our return day).  Rang service as our train wasn’t showing or mentioned in reported delays/cancellations. Colleague said all trains heading south cancelled, 4 new trains put on. 11,12,1& 2pm. Go down you should get one. If not they will sort accommodation for this eve and travel out tomorrow. Get to station. All trains cancelled. Station closed. 1 poor female colleague fending off 100s of queries. Asked what is happening. She didn’t really know other than station closed and no trains. Come back tomorrow?  Asked about overnight. Said it’s not up to her to arrange my hotel!  Stood in rain with family of five. Hotels loving it wanting £300 plus for a room. No help from LNER. People saying Twitter saying one thing, website saying another and colleague at the gate saying even less. One thing for certain, all different messages. One would think the management could manage this situation better. Not looking forward to tomorrow as I expect even more chaos. Shocking service, shocking communication. Shocking LNER. Whilst I understand they cannot control the weather, surely they are big enough to establish some pre set contingencies. Bad Weather is not something new.  Read your passenger commitments/mission statement. Not one element applied to my plight.

items.title: We all know about the situation
items.review_text: We all know about the situation, so let's be fair and rate it with 3 stars... sometimes you just can't make a horse out of a donkey. We need to work on the structure, not only in London.

items.title: Outrageously expensive
items.review_text: Outrageously expensive. £260 for a return from Edinburgh to Kings Cross when you can fly for £80. It's almost laughable.

items.title: On the 18.33 LNER from Kings Cross
items.review_text: On the 18.33 LNER from Kings Cross, what a shambles! No seat reservations, making people stand in the aisles not the vestibules, health and safety apparently. Before we spend Billions on HS2 to shave 15 minutes off the London to Birmingham route. How about some proper investment in the general infrastructure!

items.title: They will not hesitate in ripping you…
items.review_text: They will not hesitate in ripping you off but on the flip side I have received refunds from them on multiple occasions for delays without problem

items.title: Theifs! AND MONNEY GRABBERS
items.review_text:
Theifs!! MONNY GRABBERS...!!!!
Wasn't allowed on the train as i didn't have a bicycle reservation when i really had. Missed connecting train... Refund procedure is a nightmare 1+ YEAR!!!!!!

items.title: THIEVES STAY WELL AWAY!!!
items.review_text: ABSOLUTE THIEVES!! I HAD A TICKET WHICH I BOUGHT ONLINE THE DAY PRIOR TO MY JOURNEY BUT UNFORTUNATELY DUE TO DELAYS ON THE LONDON UNDERGROUND I MISSED MY TRAIN. I WAS THEN ADVISED BY A STAFF MEMBER AT KINGS CROSS THAT I CAN USE MY TICKET TO TRAVEL ON ANOTHER TRAIN SO ASSUMING EVERYTHING WAS OK I DID SO. ONCE THE TICKET OFFICER CHECKED MY TICKET WAS ADVISED IT'S WRONG & CHARGED ME A FURTHER £137 FOR ANOTHER TICKET EVEN AFTER SHOWING HIM MY ORIGINAL TICKET. HE ALSO HAD THE COURTESY TO SAY THAT I HAVE CHARGED MY PHONE FOR FREE ON THE TRAIN (WHICH I FELT EMBARRASSED ABOUT)! THEY ARE REFUSING TO REFUND THE MONEY BACK AS THEY ARE GREEDY PIGS. LOOKING TO STEAL FROM INNOCENT PEOPLE LIKE US. WHEN I FINALLY GOT TO MY INTERCHANGE STATION I WAS FINALLY TOLD THAT THE CONNECTING TRAIN HAS BEEN CANCELLED & THAT THE NEXT TRAIN WAS IN AN HOUR SO MY WHOLE JOURNEY WAS A WASTE OF TIME & MONEY. I WILL NEVER RECOMMEND LNER TO ANYONE UNLESS YOU ARE WILLING TO PAY FOR 2 TICKETS. THEY HAVE ALSO BEEN REPORTED TO TRADING STANDARDS!!

items.title: Just awful .- like a badly run council
items.review_text:
Just awful .. poor customer service .. catering staff have more manners at a burger van... the attitude is what do you want .. well that's what it is .. take it or leave it 

Just appalling - like. A badly run council

items.title: Try and use a different operator if possible
items.review_text: I've travelled on a variety of trainlines and LNER ranks at the bottom for me. Poor service, expensive, not a great experience.

items.title: Shout out for the amazing service…
items.review_text: Shout out for the amazing service provided by Kelly at Durham train station this morning!  Found our selves in the awkward position of having pre booked  train tickets and the train had been cancelled with two children in tow.  Kelly quickly checked what service we could use our tickets on and guided us to where to wait in comfort.  When the train arrived she also guided us to which carriage had available seating and wished us bon Voyage on our way.  Cannot say how refreshing it was to have such excellent customer service will definitely be looking to book with lner next time.

items.title: We travelled Leeds
items.review_text: We travelled Leeds - Harrogate today, and the timing meant that we could ride on an Azuma. This was a big mistake as the seats in Standard Class are dreadful - we were glad to get off the train even after such a short journey. We won't be travelling with LNER again until they install proper seats. We shall travel by East Midlands Trains Leeds to London in future; the extra journey length is a small price to pay for at least a modicum of comfort.

items.title: LNER  The First Class Experience
items.review_text: Recently travelled on the new LNER Azuma trains London to Leeds 1st Class Found the Seating and environment of the new trains a great experience .People complain about comfort of the seating I found the comfortable enough compared with GWRs new seating in 1st class they are far more comfortable. The food and drinks served in 1 st class is great ,I had a tastey Beef stew and Yorkshire pudding and a little dessert . The service was great and value for money . The 1st class lounge at London King's Cross was great with newspaper and complimentary  drinks and snacks I recommend the Hot Chocolate and biscuits. I was on route to Bradford on this occasion changing at Leeds .The only slight dissatisfaction is that there isn't a more direct LNER direct services to Bradford as it's a great value for money place to stay with good selection of attractions and places to eat. Keep up the good work LNER.

items.title: Really not a good train
items.review_text: Really not a good train . Booked first class on our return journey from Inverness to Edinburgh nothing first class about it.  Very rattely train very uncomfortable nothing like the virgin train now called avanti.  Came up from Blackpool to Edinburgh on the avanti first class the difference is chalk and cheese no comparison  azuma looks as though it was made on a budget very dissappointed.

items.title: Only positive posts are allowed by LNER
items.review_text:
A copy of my messenger and FB conversation earlier today, all removed and I am now blocked by LNER 
Good afternoon, I’d just like to inform you of events that took place today. My son was traveling from Newcastle to Edinburgh, he arrives early for his train and goes to the platform given . A LNER train to Edinburgh arrives 5 minutes early, he understandably gets on
 , thinking it may stay in the station a few minutes. When the ticket collector comes around he gives him his ticket ..... apparently he is on the wrong LNER train, his is 5 minutes behind, this train is a DELAYED TRAIN which should have passed through Newcastle earlier.  Now the bewildering part , the 
collector then proceeds to make him pay 38 UK pounds for the journey, no option of getting off at the next station to get his train , no options at all , my son being very polite and not at all assertive PAYS !!! He is a student, he has to work a whole night till 3.30 am to earn that money and now is in Edinburgh without any money !!! Is this a win for LNER , is the collector rewarded , he must feel pretty pleased with himself???
 Reply 

Sorry to hear this Mark. However, your son did agree to the terms and conditions when buying his ticket to travel on that booked service and the onus is on the customer to ensure they board the correct train. ^KM
My reply 

If the board says platform number and your train arrives  going to the same destination,  a few minutes early , what would you think/do ???? How is he to know it’s the wrong train?
Reply 

The Departure Boards will confirm what train is on that platform, and announcements will be made on-board and at the station, Mark. ^KM
My reply 

Well we both know that is not always the case . Same train company, same platform, same destination... few minutes early, are you joking ??

So he had to pay twice to the same company for the same journey because your train was late ??
Reply 

If you're unhappy with this, you can contact Customer Services on 03457 225 333 or at customers@lner ^KM
We will , although judging by your attitude I’m not sure customer service is your business

items.title: On board service great but the Azuma…
items.review_text: On board service great but the Azuma first class seat is so uncomfortable. Can no one make a comfortable seat. After 45 minutes back pain, thankfully I got off. Wonderful return journey pulled by a proper train Durham Cathedral. Did anyone actually test the seats(ironing boards) before buying these trains?

items.title: Disgraceful update.
items.review_text: Absolutely shocking update to the train. The seats are wafer thin and totally uncomfortable. The carriage rattles and echoes as there is no carpet. The harsh bright lighting is clinical, not at all relaxing. The tannoy screeches. Minimal luggage space. All comfort has been ripped out. They are absolutely depressing and best avoided, especially on long journeys.

items.title: THE most uncomfortable journey I have…
items.review_text: THE most uncomfortable journey I have ever experienced. It is obvious that those at LNER responsible for choosing the new Azuma trains did not trial a journey in them. If they had they would realise that they are only suitable for short commute journeys as the cabins are cramped, seats are far too upright and first class is disappointingly no different to standard class. After discovering that the Azuma trains are used on the Kings Cross to Aberdeen I was utterly shocked; to force people to sit in what can only be described as a stress position for hours on end whilst asking them to pay for the pleasure is beyond unacceptable

items.title: Uncomfortable Seats, brutal ride
items.review_text: Seats and ride quality are horrendous. Impossible to work when being thrown about and the seats are only suitable for sub 30 minute journeys.

items.title: First journey on new LNER Azuma
items.review_text: First journey on new LNER Azuma, First Class Coach L. Hard ride, not as comfortable as old 225!!

items.title: Five star excelent service on train to…
items.review_text:
Five star excelent service on train to glasgow and very comfy 
Food exellent staff friendly on past 3 trips however the new azumas are same as fgw trains cheap uncomfortable  short distance should be only

Shame lner would not invest in new comfy seated trains keep the older units running i say and give customers a choice id travel old and comfort over azuma anyday

items.title: The seats on LNER's Azuma trains are…
items.review_text:
The seats on LNER's Azuma trains are quite simply the worst seats I've ever experienced on any mode of transport.

A concrete bench would be an improvement, as they at least don't have an idiotically designed back which tilts your forwards whilst providing no comfort.

items.title: Azuma trains ...
items.review_text: Azuma trains are much smoother to ride on however the poor quality hard seats makes for a very uncomfortable journey especially when its 3 hours long. That said the at seat service is excellent and there is much more space to work from compared to the older trains. Over all it's okay but comfort really let's the companys great service down.

items.title: Ghastly return journey on Azuma
items.review_text: Travelled York to Kings Cross first class in November & back second class in December. Seats are absolutely dire in both & staff had no ideas about where we should put our luggage on either journey. Going down, 71 year old husband had to lift 2 large heavy cases to head height. Coming back they had to be left by the exit doors along with 10 other cases( automated messages about leaving doors clear of little use as nowhere to put them. We did put them on the side that wouldn't be opened before we got off). Return journey unable to access any food as buffet car would only accept cash, no cards. Miserable journeys, not worth the money & the older trains were always more comfortable. The much vaunted arrival of Azuma is a PR disaster...did anyone actually try sitting on one on a journey before being ordered? I presume not....

items.title: azuma trains most uncomfortable journey ever
items.review_text:
Travelling on Azuma York to Kings Cross. 2 hours in and I’m taking painkillers for my back as the seats are so hard and uncomfortable. PS 6 hours later and back still aches!
Label on side of carriage where sockets used to be is only readable if you sit on neighbours seat, directing you to between seats label directing you under the seat to sockets you can only see with a mirror (I used my phone camera to find them), which you can only access if neighbour stands up, unless you want to get friendly with their thighs!
Am going to look at flights for future trips.

items.title: Terrible trains
items.review_text:
The Azuma trains are awful. The seats are rock hard and too upright and I can only manage about half an hour on them. In many cases I have chosen to sit on the floor in the vestibule as the carpet is more comfortable. The ride is rattly and the aircon noisy and too cold, it's like travelling in a tinny box. Far too little luggage space leading to cases blocking doors, gangways and seats at very busy times. The automated safety announcements are irritating. When two 5 car trains are coupled together you can't walk between them, causing issues with accessing the buffet or empty seats if you get on the busy set.

It is really difficult to find anything nice to say at all. They are basically glorified short-distance commuter trains running long distance services. Way more uncomfortable than a modern private car, coach or plane. This is not Inter-City quality, it's cheap and nasty travel at premium prices.

So disappointed that the East Coast route has been ruined by this tat. I'll drive whenever possible and would not recommend anyone I know to choose to travel on these trains.

items.title: Standard class disappointment
items.review_text: Standard class - uncomfortable seats- hard and upright. Luggage was overflowing. Toilets cramped. PowerPoint under seat means grappling around your neighbours legs - should be in the seat in front. Ride smooth and quieter but overall very disappointing.  left train with back pain- following a 3 hour journey. Reminiscent of Pacer train seats. Those going up to Aberdeen must be in agony.

items.title: Azumas, for better or for WORSE!…
items.review_text:
Many features of the Azuma train sets leave much to be desired. Numerous reviewers have castigated the comfort of the seats in first class. I strongly support these critics.  The seating layout is also unacceptable favouring single travellers and parties of 4 whilst leaving  couples to fight over the ONE table plus two facing seats per carriage. The toilets are dreadfully cramped and their facities poorly designed.  Noise levels and luggage facilities are both poor.
We have few criticisms of the service in first class and have had some very acceptable gastronomic offerings. 
It would be however good to see LNER own up to the mistakes they have made or have inherited rather than continually trumpeting that our lives will be transformed by their very poor new trains.

items.title: Dire and pathetic: never again
items.review_text:
I travelled first class on the 08:00 hours Edinburgh to London train on the 2nd January 2020. Prior to purchasing my ticket, I visited the LNER website because I know that the food offered to first class passengers is "complimentary" which lets LNER 'off the hook' should they fail to serve the advertised menu for any spurious reason.

The website stated that on 2nd January, I "would get the same great breakfast but only be offered sandwiches at any other time of the day" owing to the Christmas and New Year holiday.   As I was travelling on the 08:00 hours train, I expected to be served the full English Breakfast in accordance with the information advertised on the website.  Instead, I was offered a Turkey and Cranberry sandwich and was told that the supplies for breakfast had not been delivered. I informed the Attendant that I had been told by an LNER Senior Executive that supplies could be brought on board any train at either Newcastle or York so there was no excuse for just being offered a sandwich that had been left over from Christmas.  I was told that staff "would try to get some bacon rolls brought on to the train at Newcastle."  At Newcastle, bacon rolls were brought on the train. I am at a loss to understand why the full range of eggs, bacon, sausages, hash browns, baked beans and toast could not be delivered to the train at Newcastle so that customers could be served the advertised Full English Breakfast. I should imagine that the staff did not want to have the trouble of cooking breakfasts on board so they used the excuse of non availability supplies to explain the situation. Whoever is responsible for this chronic underperformance should now consider their position and their retention in LNER's service   

LNER serves first class passengers complimentary tea and coffee throughout the journey. The tea is lukewarm and not refreshing because it is served from a push top flask. The water for tea must be boiling.  By contrast, standard class passengers can buy tea from the buffet car at the correct temperature. Why pay for a first class ticket when you will receive inferior quality food and beverages to those offered to passengers in standard class? What a state of affairs! 

I travelled first Class on the 1200 hours London to Edinburgh train on the 7th January, 2020. The food offer, on this occasion, amounted to a few spoonfuls, (and I mean two spoonfuls) of stew with a shop bought Yorkshire pudding. There is no point in having a celebrity chef as "poster boy" for such a miserable meal.    

The seats on the new Azuma Trains are back breaking on a four hour 20 minute journey. Inadequate luggage storage facilities were a constant problem for the train crew to manage throughout the journey. First class passengers have no access to the standard class buffet car on the new Azuma Trains as the first class kitchen which serves poor quality food and lukewarm tea impedes passengers from walking the length of the train to purchase acceptable refreshments from the buffet counter.

items.title: Yesterday I was going on the train from…
items.review_text:
Yesterday I was going on the train from leeds to London...few minutes after setting off the train stopped due to an electrical fault...we waited for 3 hours and we missed our next train from st pancras to Amsterdam..nowhere to stay ..
Once we arrived to london we have been looked after very well by LNER..they took us to first class waiting lounge to relax while they booked a 4 stars hotel for us away 10 min walking...they also gave us a letter to give to Eurostar and we got a ticket free of charge for next day .we will also have a refund for our tickets..Big thank you to everyone who helped us especially Ray in London.. 👍

items.title: Terrible
items.review_text:
Terrible 
Booked a train on my birthday but the train line wasn’t working from Peterborough to kings cross all day on 14th Dec 

I missed my day out in London for my birthday and ended up going back home 

Filled form for refund but they only gave me and friends the outward journey and won’t refund us the return so I lost £30 x 8 tickets 

I will not use this train company again

items.title: Thank you to the staff on the 4.30…
items.review_text: Thank you to the staff on the 4.30 London to Edinburgh train this evening. Truly amazing help.

items.title: Hard seats
items.review_text:
I have a bad back (nursing!) and can’t even manage 30 minutes sitting on these seats. Other trains not a problem.
End up standing Newcastle to Darlington rather than sit on ironing board seat.

items.title: Seats on the Azuma trains very…
items.review_text: Seats on the Azuma trains very uncomfortable. I have to stand up frequently and walk about. A very unpleasant experience. Other than that not too bad.

items.title: New Azuma trains are a big…
items.review_text: New Azuma trains are a big disappointment (as others have said). Seats dreadfully hard - I brought my own foam seat pad thing with me today which has helped a bit. Also its noisy compared to modern trains in mainland Europe I've travelled on. What a shame.....

items.title: slow running call centre…
items.review_text:
I emailed LNER on 10/12 about a promotion that expired on 14/12  on which I had a query on the terms of the offer as their online terms were unclear.  

I finally got a reply on 30/12 hoping that I had solved the problem myself and booked some travel with them.  I had done neither.

One of the key aspects of running a train company is PUNCTUALITY.  Taking 20 days to answer a customer query is NOT punctual.  If LNER cannot run their call centre punctually no wonder their trains regularly run late.  

This shows a poor attitude to customer service.

items.title: Lner stop throttling tickets on your…
items.review_text: Lner stop throttling tickets on your app again... the ticket prices are 100% higher than last year and you are saying only 2 tickets available for the nexy 6 weeks on a train i have caught for 3 years now.. the passenger traffic is the same as it has been for 3 years and always availability sort it out this was same as last year

items.title: Azuma 1st Class - cheap and nasty
items.review_text:
My wife and I travelled the short distance from Darlington to Newcastle and having failed miserably to negotiate the automatic ticket machines queued Toby tickets at the counter. The microphone wasn’t working and I couldn’t hear a word the lady behind the counter was saying. Having missed one train while queuing we boarded the next which was completely full with people standing in corridors, aisles and anywhere they could. 
On arrival at Newcastle I went NBC to the ticket office to change my tickets to its class for the return fearing a repeat of the its journey with shopping. No allowance was made for not using the standard class return and had to pay the full single journey 1st class fare. Not a problem as it’s their rules. 
The return journey was on an Azuma and this was my first journey on one. 
Very disappointing. Not as comfortable as the 225 and looked cheap and like standard class. Whether this is because LNER have chosen a cheap level of trim I don’t know. 
No complementary wine due to ‘the festive season’ but you can buy it - what’s that all about. 
I shall avoid them until I have no choice.

items.title: 27th Dec 11.24 Leuchars to London.
items.review_text:
28th Dec 11.24 Leuchars to London.
Reservations system broken. All reserved seats bo longer reserved so my seat was taken. Had to stand all way to Edinburgh which took even longer as Haymarket closed. Long detour. Finally got my reserved seat after Edinburgh. Train still packed with no luggage space and people standing. Between coach A and G is not one single toilet in operation. Only one usable was filled to the brim and i mean overflowing with it! Utterly disgusting state, i could not use it at all. Worse than 3rd World service. Uncomfortable tiny seats make it even worse. I will never use LNER again worst experience on any train i have used anywhere in the world. Well done!

items.title: The new Azumas are a step backwards for LNER.
items.review_text: The new Azumas are cramped, uncomfortable and rough riding. They are a shadow of what the HST once was. The MK3 coaches of the HST set were some of the most comfortable and smooth riding coaches i’ve ever had the pleasure of riding in. LNER, take a note from Scotrail, bring back the HST, good old fashioned British Engineering!

items.title: awful.
items.review_text: awful.. Stevenage to Leeds Friday 27th Dec.. absolutely filthy at 12.30pm toilets windows floors inside and outside.  tickets were not cheap. broken parts of toilets.. general maintenance poor. Was only 5 minutes late which was a blessing or it would be no stars.

items.title: I really don't understand how anyone at…
items.review_text: I really don't understand how anyone at LNER (or Virgin at the time) could possibly have thought that the new AZUMA trains were a step forward as far as passenger comfort goes.  Yes, perhaps the technology that drives the train is more advanced but at the end of the day, you will still find yourself travelling along at the same speed of 125mph. Only now, you will be a lot more uncomfortable and feel like you're riding in a much cheaper, more plastic vehicle.  And that is not progress at all....

items.title: Not impressed with LNER Edinburgh to…
items.review_text: Not impressed with LNER Edinburgh to Peterborough service. Late both journeys

items.title: 1st Class Uncomfortable
items.review_text:
Have to agree with other reviews, in terms of seating, the Azuma 1st class experience is a step backwards. The seats themselves are not comfortable, certainly not as comfortable the leather seats they've replaced. But most frustrating is the cramped feel and reduced legroom. You would assume LNER are trying to maximise profits by squeezing in as many seats in as they can.

Used to look forward to my journeys up to Durham. If I'm uncomfortable in 1st I might as well be uncomfortable in standard and save myself the (significant) difference in fare. Or maybe fly. Such a shame.

items.title: Oh no - it's an Azuma...
items.review_text:
How is it that the English always manage to turn something that should be great, relaxing, and special, into something frustrating, uncomfortable, and overpriced?  Just travelled first class Edinburgh to York on one of the new Azuma trains and what a downgrade!  I love train travel, and choose it over anything else, but the new Azuma fails in every respect compared to the former Virgin first class service.  Rock hard, totally unsupportive seats, (and where is the leather that used to be standard in first class?), table too high to use either for eating or a laptop, no option on the single seats to move the table out of the way, and the toilet and handwashing facilities are a disaster - tiny broom cupboard space, and guaranteed to get water everywhere except down the plug - woeful, thoughtless design.  Was this train planned by a committee?  There is no flair, no comfort, no putting the passenger first or trying to make it feel special.  It's a bus.  It’s not even a luxury coach, and this is first class we are talking about!  It is all about ease of assembly, ease of maintenance and cost cutting.  And the meals?  A rock-hard bread roll masquerading as a pastry for breakfast or a yoghurt.    

THIS IS NOT FIRST-CLASS TRAVEL! It's barely third class and is probably actionable under the trade descriptions act!

I will plan my future trips to avoid the Azuma at all costs, using the older trains with proper first-class facilities rather than these failed look-alikes.  What a huge disappointment, and to think that we are going to be stuck with this mess for the next thirty years doesn’t bear thinking about.

items.title: Compensation agreed but no payment…
items.review_text:
Compensation agreed but no payment made.  Emailed to get an update - no reply received.  Phoned to follow up - waited 20 mins - no one answers.  Emailed to ask again - no reply to the email.  DM'd them on twitter - immediate answer, 'sorry' we have no access to that data base so can't help'.  'How about asking them to phone me' I DM'd back...but no answer that message. 

Any suggestions on what I should do next?

items.title: Too uncomfortable;  I’ll fly next time.
items.review_text: I love a train over a plane, but I was so uncomfortable Edinburgh to Peterbourgh that  next time I’ll drive or fly/drive.  I was in std class.   Truly awful seats.  I feel so sad.

items.title: Azuma hype is unfounded
items.review_text: The seats are very hard and uncomfortable, a big step backwards from the old stock. The table leg placement in 1st class restricts leg room and you end up sitting with your legs to the side which makes for an uncomfortable experience. LNER sold the Azuma trains are having more leg room and confort, unfortunately the truth is the opposite and the lack of recognition of the issues by LNER is worrying considering the plan to replace the old stock with Azuma trains

items.title: Disgusting customer service
items.review_text: Disgusting customer service. Never reply, never get your refund back. Don't buy from them. Waste of time and money. I can't believe this kind of service exists in UK.

items.title: Shocking Service!
items.review_text: Shocking Service!!  Had booked first class to London from Lincoln, arrived at the station to find that the service was cancelled and leaving from Newark.  They had provided coaches, but not enough time for the coaches to make it - so we paid an extra £24 for a taxi to Newark.  Seats in first class Azuma shocking, very hard and uncomfortable.  No food service or drinks service because they had forgotten????   On the way back had the Yorkshire Pudding with beef casserole,  the beef was inedible, undercooked and tough and cold!  The girls servicing disinterested and surly, not a smile or a please or thank you .  Bring back Virgin I say!!!!

items.title: Dreadful seats
items.review_text: Wonder if anyone tried the seats before they ordered them?  Thought not.

items.title: Shockingly bad seats
items.review_text: Wow, these seats on the new Azuma are so uncomfortable. I'm less than 2 hours into my journey and my back is absolute agony. Too hard, too upright, simply dreadful.

items.title: The train is great apart from the seats!
items.review_text: The new Azuma train is great apart from the seats! They are so uncomfortable, had a 2hr journey and really struggled with discomfort in my back, had to keep moving about.

items.title: Terrible service
items.review_text:
Terrible service. Apart from the train delay of 7ish mins, which is usual...

There are no power sockets on the train. Trying to work out why, I contacted customer service, who insisted that they were there. Then abruptly left the convo. 

This is a long distance train btw... not your usual regional one

items.title: Really awful staff
items.review_text: Really poor service me and a friend got in at York station travelling to Peterborough however we couldn’t find our tickets and we sitting separately, the guard charge my fiend full price £70 for the ticket and then asked me however we left our tickets at our hotel room in York, my card got declined and I was ready to accept the consequences and pay a fine or get off at the next station, the guard asked if we were travelling together I said no as I didn’t want them to ahve to pay however the guard went over to my firmed and said to then that the young boy said you’d buy his ticket for him even though I hadn’t really disgusted that a guard would do that and be so sly would not recommend travelling with them again if they treat customers that poorly

items.title: Uncomfortable Seats
items.review_text: Like others, I just want to add my opinion about how uncomfortable the Azuma seats are in 1st class. Just about ok for a short journey but after an hour, you're shuffling about because of the rock hard discomfort. Low cost airlines may have no legroom but they seem to be able to design a thin but reasonably comfortable seat - and that's not in 1st Class. Very poorly thought through, particularly as they're obviously easing prices upwards.

items.title: Went to York 1st class yesterday and it…
items.review_text: Went to York 1st class yesterday and it happened to be an Azuma. Only one seat by the door and no rack above the seat so coat went on the floor (all the luggage space was filled with suitcases). Every bump of the track was transmitted through the seat between Northallerton and Thirsk. The seat was very poor compared with the trains it is replacing. If I had been on the train for longer than half an hour I would have got cramp at the back of my legs where the seat was very hard at the front edge. All in all not a train I would ever choose to travel on so my journeys to York, Leeds and Newcastle from Darlington will avoid LNER in future. Oh yes and the carriage felt very cramped.

items.title: New Azuma 1st class is NOT worth the money
items.review_text: New Azuma 1st class is NOT worth the money, i travel weekly from London to York and whilst the old trains (HST) were dirty they were at least spacious and comfortable. The Azuma 1st class layout seems identical to standard but with the added extra of a crap sandwich. plus LNER are as often late as they are on time may as well go standard and save a little money or start crowdfunding for a York airport

items.title: Those Azuma seats!!!!!
items.review_text:
The Azuma seats are thin fabric, rock bloody hard and too narrow.  Sitting for over 4 hours is Purgatory!  Back to cheaper, comfier flying for me.

Oh, and usual 'no buffet between Edinburgh and Newcastle' trick...argh!

items.title: Tasha on the london to leeds train 2033…
items.review_text: Tasha on the london to leeds train 2033 on monday 9 dec. Was absolute delight. Friendly, warm and made the journey so much of a pleasure. What a great representative of the company.

items.title: I travel in 1st class every week...I am…
items.review_text:
I travel in 1st class every week...I am a big fan of the old HSL carriages and the Azuma 1st class is certainly a downgrade compared to what we have been used to for decades. The fabric on the seats is the main issue, the HSL carriages were leather whereas the Azuma carriages are trimmed with fabric which is already showing signs of wear and it is brand new!

The table also rises at the edge to meet the window, this is really poor design and results in spillages as people are not expecting a table not to be flat...lots of people are going to have damaged laptops over the lifetime of these carriages.

They are clean and spacious as you would expect from something brand new, but feels like a Japanese car...reliable but cheap inside.

Not an upgrade...I will still travel 1st class...but it is the end of the era, I suspect we will not see luxury as we saw on the HSL carriages again.

items.title: £120 single,  no breakfast, no refund...no hope!
items.review_text:
Old, tired  very expensive trains but was happy to pay for 1st class so i could get breakfast on the early train from Newcastle to Darlington.
No breakfast because the train didnt get its supplies in Newcastle...its a bit like a hotel saying the restaurant is closed because the chef forgot to get out of bed..... did I get a refund....no way.
Its clearly still run like British Rail...and god help us if it ever is re nationalsed...

items.title: Seats designed for tall men
items.review_text: Until I read these reviews I thought it was only me that found the seats were uncomfortable - and for me the first class seats are even worse than standard. Yes they are both hard and without sufficient padding, but in first they are definitely designed with 5ft 10in business men in mind. If I sit with my back against the back of the seat, my feet don't reach the floor !  I'm not tall but I'm not that short.  Sitting like that for 2 hours is B**** uncomfortable. Sure it;s nice to sit in a new clean train rather than an old one with threadbare carpets and stained chairs, but it could have been so much better. It least it's not GWR - there new trains are like a glorified sprinter train, cold and with grey lighting like the first energy saving bulbs !

items.title: INCREDIBLY UNCOMFORTABLE SEATS on AZUMA…
items.review_text: INCREDIBLY UNCOMFORTABLE SEATS on AZUMA trains. Who one earth thought that an absolute minimum of cushioning was good idea? After an hour they're downright painful. Same in both standard and first class. It shows a complete disregard for passenger comfort.

items.title: Incredibly uncomfortable seats
items.review_text: Incredibly uncomfortable  "ironing board" seats on their new trains.  Rock hard with no support or padding.  After about 10 minutes my whole back was literally numb.  They are so bad that I will have to look for alternative means of transport for any longer journeys.

items.title: Excellent
items.review_text: Excellent service on Azuma from Kings Cross to Lincoln; bang on time, friendly staff and train spotless. It’s really great that Lincoln now has all these extra direct services, well done LNER.

items.title: Azuma train is appalling
items.review_text: Azuma train is appalling. As a big public transport user who has been using the old fleet of trains used on East Midlands line and northern lines I was somewhat excited to use a new train. This is by far the most uncomfortable train I’ve ever been on, seats rock hard, train ride was like being in a rock hard suspension sports car and rubbing shoulders and legs with person next to me and the lights are like hospital lights. This added to the fact it was running late, again. I hope the new trains on East Midlands line are not like this. Good features are big overhead baggage and that’s about it. Gutted.

items.title: Embarrassing service
items.review_text:
1. Always late.
2. Awful customer service. 
3. Expensive.
4. New trains are too bright and very uncomfortable seats.

items.title: Not bad, but not great.
items.review_text:
I travel on LNER trains 2-3 times a week. They are ok, not bad but not great. 

The on board catering is often faulty, I’ve seen instances where they don’t have change and the card machine isn’t working. Very hot and miss, some services carry oat milk in the cafe car, others tell me oat milk is for 1st class passengers only. Some services have both a cafe car open and a trolley, others have one or the other. Very little for vegans to choose from. 

Seats on the new Azumas are like ironing boards, but the ride is less bouncy than the older trains. 

Their website for booking is often not able to offer weekend tickets until the last minute. 

Often on time, but regularly late. I’ve had refunds of nearly £200 this year due to late trains.

items.title: London to Leeds
items.review_text:
London to Leeds! Kicked me and my 80 yr old grandma off at Peterborough. We are sat here with no where warm to go and have to wait 3 hours to get home.
We had tickets but due to emergency situation we had to dash home 2 hours earlier than scheduled. A half empty train we could have stayed on and now my grandma is shivering on a platform miles from home. PAUL the train manager you are a horrible man with no compassion. Threatening me a 24 year old and my 80 year old grandma with arrest by the transport police if we didn’t get off. 

Everyone will know about this and the people sat around us were sticking up for us too. You are given yourself your 1 star review nobody else is.

items.title: So so so so soooooo bad
items.review_text: So so so so soooooo bad. You claim you trains are the fastest but your service NEVER shows up on time. It's appalling. How can you spend so much money on a service that does not deliver anywhere near the standards you advertised prior to the launch of LNER?

items.title: The new Azuma trains need to be sent to…
items.review_text: The new Azuma trains need to be sent to the dessert and buried for good , the most uncomfortable seats I’ve ever sat in, who come up with the design neck hurts , everything’s hard, if you’re on a long journey bring some pillows and a throw or something make it more pleasant , must have been a bunch of buffoons who designed it ,

items.title: Azuma Trains .The most uncomfortable train ever built
items.review_text:
I would give the new LNER Azuma Trains a 0 star rating if possible
Our first journey on The new Azuma Train  from Doncaster to Kings Cross today. The most uncomfortable journey we have ever had. 
Was the brief given to the designers to design the most uncomfortable to the travelling public as possible. The seats are hard and almost vertical  It his impossible to rest your head on the head rest without getting a crick in your neck. Arrived at Kings Cross with acute back ache and a stiff neck. We have more comfortable seats on our local commuter trains. The heating on the train was unsatisfactory we just had to keep our overcoats on. I walked the length of the train to find the conductor to complain  but not to  found. We travelled up on Grand. Central  A perfect journey On a comfortable train. We will make sure we avoid the new LNER Azuma trains at all costs

user_profile.name: cavid That was an excellent History lesson. smith

items.title: New Azuma trains are appalling
items.review_text: Used to be great, but has gone downhill over the years. A perfect example of why having a monopoly is a terrible idea. People are forced to use one service and let me tell you it’s appalling. I’ve travelled on these trains for over 15 years and I’ve seen them get worse and worse. New Azuma trains are a joke! No luggage car and one tiny luggage storage per carriage. Who thought this was ok? Clearly no one that has ever been on this particular route or maybe even on a train. Toilets that are AlWAYS dirty and run out of tissue and always have wet, dirty floors. New Azuma toilets are impossible for older people to open, and no were to change a baby that I saw on the whole train? Small uncomfortable seats with no room for belongings and plugs that you have to get to by feeling up your next door neighbours bum. Going to Edinburgh? Just fly it’s cheaper and more pleasant - and that’s saying something 😂 LNER are pure money grabbers with not a care for customers or their welfare because guess what? With a monopoly they don’t need to care.

items.title: Couldn't fault LNER Aberdeen to Edinburgh service
items.review_text: I really can't fault the Aberdeen to Edinburgh service of LNER, very much enjoyed a single First Class ticket at 8.10am from Stonehaven on the 19th November, great vegetarian breakfast, really friendly and attentive staff and really comfortable journey which arrived on time.

items.title: poor journey poor service
items.review_text:
Appalling train journey why allow to book tickets then let too many people on so there are no seats and people standing. 

No trolley service due to over crowding no food part way back. Won’t book again

items.title: Worst experience ever
items.review_text:
Worst experience ever . Complete waste of money booking First Class . On train up to Leeds doors weren’t working properly so carriage was freezing . Toilet doors wouldn’t lock . On train back journey taking nearly 4 hours instead of 2 . No heating and literally 1 drink offered during the entire journey . Food quality appalling - unappetising & unhealthy . 
Train was meant to be 9 carriages & only 5 turned up so carriage where I had my seat reservation didn’t even exist . 
I can’t wait to get off this train.....

items.title: On a crowded train 17.17 from London to…
items.review_text: On a crowded train 17.17 from London to Leeds - 30th November 2019 with no seat reservations and no identification on carriages, train manager is nowhere to be seen, only staff we have found are unconcerned rude and  unhelpful, absolutely shocking service

items.title: Untrustworthy
items.review_text:
After paying full price for a ticket, the train was entirely full, so I couldn’t get on. 

Getting on their next train, and explaining the situation, the ticket inspector showed no understanding or compromise, and gave me a fine which cost over £100 after their admin fees.

items.title: Doesn't feel like first class
items.review_text:
Doesn't feel like first class. Crowded, feeble menu and grumpy staff.
I will never use this service again unless its an emergency.

items.title: The worst customer service experience of any company I've dealt with
items.review_text: If you have the unfortunate need to contact their customer service team, be prepared for a ridiculously long wait, even for a simple thing like a Delay Repay claim submitted online. How they are allowed to get away with such shocking service is beyond me. For the prices paid for by annual season ticket holders like me, LNER need to urgently address their "customer service" and stop treating customers with such contempt.

items.title: Have you seen the alternatives?
items.review_text:
Living midway between Loughborough & Newark, I have the choice of travelling LNER or East Midlands Railways & I can tell you that in terms of First Class travel, LNER is head & shoulders above EMR in all areas.  In particular:
1. LNER from Newark to London is cheaper than Loughborough to London with EMR in nearly all cases.
2.  You can select a seat when you book with LNER, EMR you get allocated a seat.
3. The LNER station platforms are marked so you know where to stand for your carriage.  A litle thing but pretty basic & very useful.
4. The new LNER trains are a massive upgrade on anything EMR has.  For starters, they pull away from the station without constant jerking & slopping of coffee.
4. You can get a full breakfast on the morning LNER trains which isn't possible on EMR after 7.42am.
5. Afternoon LNER trains offer free hot & cold meals & drinks, including alcohol.  These have to be paid for on EMR & in general, food quality is better on LNER than EMR.
6. The LNER Kings Cross lounge is excellent when compared to the cramped EMR lounge at St Pancras.

In my experience, both services suffer from too many delays and cancellations but for me, LNER offers a substantially better service than the alternative EMR service which seems to be 10 years out of date.

items.title: David Horne LNER-0%
items.review_text:
David Horne LNER-0%
Christopher Garnett GNER 100%
Lets go back in time to 20 years when service were 100 times better.

items.title: Travelling on the 11.21 from Newark to…
items.review_text: Travelling on the 11.21 from Newark to King Cross on a special day out for my wife, so we are travelling first class. Train was 22 mins late. Then told that was no food apart from crisps due a power problem--but electriciry  on the train seemed fine. They started clearing away cups at 11.50 ish! I had to complain to get a second cup of tea! I was also told it was normal for them to close down after Newark, some 1hr 20 mins from  London. Ruined the day! Very poor service and what's the point  of first class!

items.title: LNER the cattle truck line.
items.review_text: On 7:00 am Kings Cross train from Peterborough, my reserved seat taken, train rammed full standing room only , not one train personnel forthcoming with apologies only puffed cheeks and indifference  , since they took over this line from Virgin we are treated as cattle , I believe the government has some control over this excuse for a service, they need raking out from top to bottom

items.title: “First Class” was appalling
items.review_text: “First Class” was appalling. Do not waste your money. On a 9 hour journey you are restricted to either breakfast OR lunch. You are not “entitled” (the actual word customer service and staff used) to both! The staff were in a terrible mood and I was informed that IF there was any surplus of filled rolls I may be lucky in scoring one (partner is vegan so was not impressed with the idea of an unwanted fish bun). The food options dreadful, and the service eye wateringly rude and abrupt. LNER you are putting your staff through hell and back messing with your clientele’s appetites. I will not use their service again unless some changes are made.

items.title: Don't even attempt to contact customer services
items.review_text: Don't even attempt to contact customer services. 4 times calling, 4 times on hold for over half an hour. Totally unacceptable. I had a simple question about my ticket that couldn't be answered anywhere on their FAQ page (believe me, I looked everywhere) but the only team that pick up the phone, miraculously is the sales team... Because they want your money of course. Shocking, never booking again or referring anybody to this service.

items.title: Truly awful response time to an issue…
items.review_text: Truly awful response time to an issue (2 months,4 phone calls and 6 emails, still unsolved), hour long waits on phone calls, pretty bad hold music.

items.title: It’s gone downhill since becoming LNER
items.review_text: It’s really gone downhill since being taken over from Virgin Trains. I always travel first class, and although the prices haven’t changed, there have been some cuts to the first class service - for example there used to be a choice of having breakfast or lunch on the 9.29 from Newcastle to London, and there used to be a bar trolley each way from around 11am. Now this is classed as a ‘breakfast service’. I’m currently travelling on a that train (which is delayed by 1 hour 30 mins so far, although there was a Delay Repay announcement, so at least that’s still available) and at about 12.20 I asked the coffee trolley attendant if the bar trolley was on the way, and the response was to say I could buy drinks from the bar, and even to try and upsell me champagne. I said isn’t except drinks to be included when I travel first class and the response was a raised eyebrow and a laugh between him and his colleague - another example of something that hasn’t changed I suppose - it’s never really been first class on these trains. I’m on a brand new Azuma, and have to say that at 6 foot 5, they really aren’t as comfortable as the older trains. Much prefer the open feel, better legroom and nicer upholstered seats. Just not impressed. I’ve always loved train travel, I even look forward to the journey, but I am going to look at flights for next time, after the last few experiences on LNER.

items.title: On the train now to Kings Cross
items.review_text: On the train now to Kings Cross. Disappointed to say the least. Seating very uncomfortable and temperature in carriage is very cool

items.title: LNER buddy app
items.review_text:
LNER buddy app. Suddenly stopped working.
Ticket bought as usual.
Not download into app wallet.
Couldn't sign in. No way could I get past sign in.
Tried to ring customer services..
After several attempts by phone ( 2 hours later) gave up. Also emailed 4 times 
Eventually drove to local station where they had an alternative number.  Not good enough  ... No explanation.

items.title: Perhaps I was lucky.
items.review_text:
I travelled recently between Edinburgh and Newark and York encompassing both weekday and weekend travel.
Some of the journeys were on the new Azuma (Class 800) trains, and to be fair I had no complaints.
All UK train journeys seem crowded nowadays, and mine were no exception, so the extra capacity the Azumas bring is welcome.
It is a pity LNER don't run services to and from Glasgow Central and Motherwell as it would allow travellers from the west of Scotland to access Edinburgh, Newcastle and York etc without changes or having to use the appalling Crosscountry trains.
If my experience of LNER was typical then as a DfT owned and operated service then roll on nationalisation!

items.title: Train And Travel Buff Review Of The London And North Eastern Railway Company - Not So Good Anymore
items.review_text:
I'll start off by sating I'm a train buff, so my review may be biased and in railways, I may overlook things that in other circumstances, I'd be irritated by.

The Standard Class Experience. (Intercity 225.)
Much on par with other high capacity haulers, like Virgin Trains West Coast, the level of comfort is practical and efficient but not always enjoyable, especially on a crowded train.

The First Class Experience. (Intercity 125 and 225.)
I was on the London Kings Cross To Aberdeen "Northern Lights" Intercity 125 Saturday service during some line works, so the journey was to take longer than usual. I had specifically made the trip to go on the trains, so I had very high expectations. During the 10 1/4 hour trip, the service was very good. They really take good care of their first class passengers. The seats are very comfortable and roomy but as a vegetarian, I would have preferred fabric seats, though I don't know if the leather was real. As far as seats go, the best I have found are East Midlands Railway HST seats, with huge springy (original?) MK3 first class seats. Comparing the level of service to East Midlands Railway, the weekend service is far superior with LNER: tea and coffee served at the table in real cups and a wide selection of snacks. I can't speak of Virgin Trains first class, as I haven't used them, yet. I also joined the "Highland Chieftain" on the Inverness to Kings Cross Sunday service during the trip, again with line disruption, the service was 10 1/4 hours but was thoroughly enjoyable. Intercity 225 seats are identical, thought the MK4 coach seems to handle the track better than the older MK3. Air pressure in tunnels and when passing trains is much better as well, though not as good as the Azuma's pressurised carriage.

Azuma, Class 800.
The Japan built Azuma or Class 800 is supposed to be the successor to the 30 year old Intercity 225 and 40 year old Intercity 125. As a devout fan of both of those classes, I don't look on the Azuma with much enthusiasm and the interior, though practical and efficient fails to deliver in terms of comfort. I am referring to the seats being rather firm. The trains themselves are reasonably aesthetic; comparable to the Pendolino, class 390 of Virgin Trains at the front/rear. The tops of the coaches and connections between lack aesthetics. They seem to handle the ruts and bumps of the track better than the carriages of the Intercity 125 or 225, which is great when walking at speed down the isle, trying to find the buffet bar. Apparently, the first class customers have complained about the seats but I find they're okay. Not as comfy as the Intercity 125 or 225 but okay. I don't know if I'd want to spend more than say five hours on them though. It's been touted that the Azuma is impervious to ear popping in tunnels but I still noticed.
What I find strange is that the early Shinkansen 0 Series (Japan built) have very comfy seats (there is one in York National Railway Museum, if you want to try them,) just as the original Intercity 125. Huge springy seats, some 6 inches deep to deal with the jumping of the carriage. Yet, these new trains have such a reduction in seat comfort.

Compared to East Midlands Railway.
Much better catering for first class customers. First Class seats better than EMR Meridian, class 222. Busier service than EMR, in general.

Compared to Virgin Trains West Coast.
Very much on par with the Pendolino. Not quite as many options as the Pendolino buffet bar but slightly better seats (Intercity 225.) Busy service, just like Virgin Trains.

Compared to Cross Country.
Somewhat superior to the Class 220/221 Voyager/Super Voyager in terms of comfort. Much better than the Class 170 Turbostar. Much better first class service. More crowded, in general.

Suggestions for Customers:
Bring your own cushion if using the Azuma, your backside will thank you ;)
Enjoy the Intercity 225 while they're still here, if you're lucky enough to get one.

I'll take one star off from my four star review for the poor customer service when I was trying to get a refund for a trip. Took them a second to get my money but over a month to get it back. So, better hope the train service doesn't screw up, like the did with me because if they owe the customer money, they make it hard to give it back.
The poor customer service put me off, so I probably won't use LNER again and now that booking a comfortable Intercity 225 is about as hit and miss as a Musket, there isn't any point for me to travel by train.

items.title: Thank you LNER train service.
items.review_text:
Thank you LNER train service.
What a wonderful service i received today, wonderful staff went out there way on the 10.30 train from Kingcross to Newcatle to make me as comfortable as possible, I am 37 weeks pregnant and got very uncomfortable on my journey. Without saying g anything staff noticed and moved me up to 1st class to finish my journey with more space to feel comfortable. Thank you very much for kindness.

items.title: Booked first class kings cross to…
items.review_text: Booked first class kings cross to Darlington. Train cancelled with no explanation and left to get home as best possible. No seats available until York due to mass overcrowding, never use this service again

items.title: What a terrible service
items.review_text:
What a terrible service, after booking first class to York on finding our seats the table hadn't been cleared of previous  mess and wasn't even wiped when they did clear way 10 mins from arriving York they decided to come round with drinks and food,

The
The return journey was even worse as they had
 no food coming back and was just as dirty tables not cleaned
The worst train journey we have ever had we ought to get refund.

items.title: Took me home free of charge after…
items.review_text: Took me home free of charge after virgin trains cancelled from Euston!!! Can’t fault!!!

items.title: Two journeys in 24 hours
items.review_text: Two journeys in 24 hours, on time, clean and the on board team had character which always helps on a long journey. Most of my travel is on Greater Anglia, their service doesn't compare unfortunately.

items.title: Shocking journey from London to Leeds
items.review_text:
Shocking journey from London to Leeds. The wrong train was provided, which happened to be smaller, so all reservations didn't apply. The train was way over crowded and everyone were displaced. I paid over £100, but I ended up standing for most of the journey. 
I will avoid in the future.
The train was the 14:33, from London Kings cross, 24th October

items.title: No food or drinks in first class from…
items.review_text: No food or drinks in first class from Edinburgh to Newcastle. Why?Evidently anyone travelling from Edinburgh is a second class passenger. Much worse than Virgin which was much worse than GNER. Gradually we see the lowering of standards across the board presumably to save money but with no better service. Rail travel has turned into a real pain once again

items.title: Taking a bike on an Azuma
items.review_text:
Was looking forward to trying out the new Azuma train taking my bike down to London. Unfortunately trying to hang my cycle in the locker proved exceptionally difficult and in the end the conductor just forced it in, locked the door and hoped for the best!

I'd also treated myself to a 1st Class seat and was disappointed how hard and uncomfortable the seats were. 

Apart from these grumbles the train was on time and the catering was good.

items.title: Extremely uncomfortable substandard rail service
items.review_text:
Not enoug seats, not enough legroom, not enough luggage room. Very uncomfortable seats (too hard with annoying bulge poking in the wrong spot in your back, Wifi not working, totally confusing and rubbish seat reservation system.

Doing a return trip from Inverness to York. Expected far better. A shadow of the service you used to get with Virgin. This LNER service is completely substandard and totally unsuitable for the long trip.

Most definately will not use this service again.

items.title: If you plan a spur of the moment trip…
items.review_text:
If you plan a spur of the moment trip expect to pay through the nose for their service. A one way ticket will cost between 60-80 quid at peak times, so add on a return and its over 100 for one person. (I thought we were supposed to be encouraging people to use public transport) 

If you book way in advance and im talking over a month you can get some really good off peak prices as little as 13 quid a journey. 

The new azuma is a nice train from the outside but I dont know what they were thinking with those seats. Uncomfortable and the back board is so hard. 

Not a bad journey for the right price but only if you plan 5-6 weeks a head.

items.title: AZUMA-WHAT A LETDOWN ! !
items.review_text: Currently on much delayed Azuma southwards to KingsCross-delay due fatality on line near Newark. Having boarded at Durham I cannot order breakfast ‘til after York, some 40 mins away. Seats might as well be Stockton-Darlington early wooden benches behind a 1st generation steam train. Some sort of electronic chime alarm every 7 seconds has been assailing our eardrums for nearly an hour and staff unable to reset it. As the LNER’s latest much hyped train set it is a serious disappointment and I dread the withdrawal of the older stock in which it was possible to fall asleep.
