Not on these seats nor with the chicken-shed overhead fluorescent lighting will it be possible to relax. Who signed-off on this substandard product of the 21st century? They should be sentenced to travel every day for months on the ECML in an Azuma and enjoy the numb bum sensation as reward for their efforts!!!

items.title: Welcome to our world
items.review_text:
Welcome to our world! We have had these crap trains on the GWR for a while now, but its nice to see that the satsuma trains are also as crap on the lner. Appalling seats, MI6 interrogation lights, toilets don't work, seat reservations don't work and sets constantly going faulty and out of service. The only consolation you people have on the east coast is you have buffets.

National Express must be quite busy now on the east coast, takes longer but the comfortable leather seats make up for it. 
With the debacle on the GWR with these crap trains you would of thought they would have done something better on the east coast. They haven't. But cheap crap is wonderful according to the accountants.

items.title: Appalling service
items.review_text: Appalling service, paid for a meal and they ran out before they got to me, toilets dirty and staff unhelpful.  Never again, flying was only £20 more expensive and much quicker!

items.title: Kings Cross to Leeds on new Azuma…
items.review_text: Kings Cross to Leeds on new Azuma train. Within an hour I was losing the feeling in my legs due to the uncomfortable rock hard seats.  Please can we have the old trains back.

items.title: Mediocre and still much to do
items.review_text:
As I write, I’m sitting in first class on the LNER Azuma service from London Kings Cross to Skipton. It’s the first time I’ve travelled on the new Azuma train - albeit I’ve travelled this route both in first and standard class for the last 20 years.

For my £159 one way fare (admittedly only booked 2 days before) I received:

1. One small, fairly poorly cooked meal (salmon in a sauce with some vegetables - my baby daughter wouldn’t have been full on it); 

2. A free G&T and a coke 

3. A hard, uncomfortable seat (the carriage was clean to be fair). 

4. A guard who watched me struggle to get my baby daughter in her pram on to the train and offered no help. No doubt your staff are told they can’t help unless they’ve had Manual Handling Regulations training and have signed a waiver because you’re scared of the insurance position were they, god forbid, to hurt themselves. I mean, 6 month old babies are HEAVY. I understand that some hairdressers are now warned about the danger of scissors too.

Is the extortionate price you charge your customers worth it? I think not. You’ve got so much more to do to justify the fare.

The only positive is that the rest of the train crew were very polite and helpful and seemed to work hard.

items.title: Rude unhelpful staff-
items.review_text: Rude unhelpful staff- we’ve been messed around for two days with train cancellations and changes but then they decide it’s fine for them to mess you around but if you dare to get a train earlier then on your ticket (so paid for just earlier) by accident and they’ll unceremoniously kick you off at the next station very rudely- terrible service- avoid at all costs! Expect you to accept their apologies but they won’t budge an inch for you

items.title: They take your money but don't bother sending tickets
items.review_text:
I was due to travel by Virgin Trains (now LNER) from London to Milton Keynes and bought advance return tickets from them online. I received a confirmation email saying that tickets would be with me in 2 hours.
No tickets arrived. I waited beyond the 2 hours .but still nothing arrived. This was now the evening only 1 day before travelling. I didn’t want to risk another error from Virgin/LNER so bought tickets on an alternative route. I contacted Virgin/LNER to ask for a refund only to be told that a £10 fee would be charged on each ticket. Given that I had paid for tickets which never even arrived this transaction felt more like theft.
The amount of money is not greatly significant but I am amazed that 
(a) I have since (2 months later!) been refused a refund and 
(b) I have not received any explanation at all for the tickets not being sent.

items.title: I used LNER for a period of 3 weeks and…
items.review_text: I used LNER for a period of 3 weeks and had numerous delays and a canceled train. I then contacted their customer services to secure a refund on these particular journeys only to jump through hoops without success or any reimbursement. Highly unimpressed and I will never use service again.

items.title: Can't fault their customer service
items.review_text:
Can't fault their customer service. Tried to book and choose seats and they confirmed the tickets, took payment and then cancelled and refunded me. When I went back on to rebook the price had increased so I rang up to complain. The poor lad on the phone sounded absolutely sick - apparently the lner and network rail systems were having trouble and we weren't the only ones. He told me to just rebook and the original price would be charged.  It happened exactly as promised.
We then got an email saying sorry and giving us a credit of the value of our booking plus £10.
I've now booked the outward journey (we were going to hire a car and drive) for free.  Yes there were hassles but this sort of recognition for it absolutely makes it easy to forget.

items.title: Train cancelled by LNER... No refund.
items.review_text: Train cancelled by LNER during power failure . Failed to get refund. Previous regular customer... no more. I'll fly from now on.

items.title: Scummy customers need dealing with...
items.review_text: Comfortable seats and ok service...sad that no complimentary alcoholic drinks are available. The score is poor due to customers who think it's ok to be loud, use phones, play music and generally behave like fools (I wanted to use a stronger adjective here) whilst decent people who have their children with them have to tolerate their total lack of respect and decent behaviour. My suggestion LNER.. get your staff to walk the floor and deal with these scumbags

items.title: This review is based solely on the…
items.review_text:
This review is based solely on the extremely uncomfortable seats on the new LNER Azuma trains and the rather peculiar response when I complained to customer services.
The seats are rock hard. Here's what CS pointed out. There is more leg room, wi fi and plug points for all. Also, apparently, the seats become MORE comfortable the longer the journey. This must be Japanese magic, sadly not working for me. Here I am again. I will complain again. In Japanese!

items.title: Rip off company
items.review_text: Rip off company, should be sued. Overcharging for train tickets all year round, late and delays constantly. Dont like their customer service via email though but most staff aboard are great. Cant say anything bad about the food, always good. Going to be flying from now on.

items.title: Refund application not clear and so…
items.review_text: Refund application not clear and so wasted £155 and took forever to reply to many emails

items.title: The staff put on a brave face and I…
items.review_text:
The staff put on a brave face and I feel sorry for them, so this is a 2 instead of 1 star review.

Firstly LNER line is so frequently late I've given up expecting to arrive on time, and it feels like a real bonus if it's less than 20min late into KGX.

The new azuma trains seem to achieved nothing except fewer toilets, and more technical problems : the reservations for the seats didn't 'download' to the train until an hour into the journey, so everyone had to live seats. The power plugs under there seats didn't work, no power : just like the old trains. But unlike the older train we now have harsh LED lighting In the ceiling which is permanently switched on inducing a headache-fuelled glow to unflatteringly play across the greasy angry faces of passengers queuing for the toilet. I would say toilet(s) but there was only one working in my 5 carriage stretch of the train. 1 toilet. 

The food trolley doesn't accept cards. 

The toilet are -of course- a mess when we pulled out of Edinburgh. Just like the virgin days. 

They hark on about it being Japanese. I've been on many trains in Japan and none of the trains offer this rich range of problems LNER manages to Conjour up. All in all, a poor job!

items.title: Absolute Disgrace!
items.review_text: Travelled on the Azuma from Edinburgh to London. No lackeys lifted me from the First Class Lounge at Waverley Station to my seat. Lunch was a mediocre affair, as the choice of wine was restricted. A 10 Year Beaujolais Nouveau was beyond the sommelier’s repertoire. The good lady’s Chardonnay was .5 degrees from chilled. Do not even get me started on the state of the alternative sugarally watter offered as compensation for this outrage. One must sympathise with a previous complainant regarding the sun getting in one’s eyes as we progressed through the countryside. It would take an effort of Herculean proportions to adjust the blind to restrict such sunshine permeating one’s eyes. On arrival at King’s Cross, we were 10 seconds late, which threw our schedule out, never to be recovered. Absolute scandal LNER ! Next time I will fly Ryanair to London. One cannot imagine any problems with such a venture.

items.title: Third time in two months travelling…
items.review_text: Third time in two months travelling with problems in Azuma. This time in first class, no food as there’s been an electrical fault. Waste of money. Travel standard class and bring sandwiches!

items.title: Non existent customer service.
items.review_text: Don't bother sending any emails to the customer service department. They'll just completely ignore them for months on end. I've sent emails about a missing delay repay, and about the awful experience of being stuck on an overheating train in August. This company doesn't give a crap about you.

items.title: Train delayed by 29 minutes
items.review_text: Train delayed by 29 minutes, refused to compensate because it was not 30 minutes. SHOCKING do yourself a favour and get a different operator or better yet coach! Awful and lost a customer for life.

items.title: Faulty booking system charged me double!
items.review_text: Due to a fault on the LNER website, when I booked 2 return tickets to London on 8th July this year, the system duplicated my booking and so I received tickets for 4 people and of course paid double the fare. The mistake only came to light when I went to collect my tickets and I was advised to phone LNER Customer Services. I did this and spoke to a very helpful woman who told me to post the tickets to her department and a refund would be issued within 14 working days. Why on earth do I have to wait all this time for my money (over £100) to be refunded when this was the fault of LNER? I sent the tickets by recorded delivery and, almost 2 weeks later, have not had any acknowledgment that they've been received. NOT IMPRESSED!

items.title: Due to power cuts was sat on train at…
items.review_text: Due to power cuts was sat on train at Peterborough for 2 hours on 11 August.  Submitted a delay and pay form but keep getting standard automated replies, "we are looking into this", "we will contact you in 10 days" bla bla...no actual reply or refund

items.title: Just ran the GNR
items.review_text: Just ran the GNR, LNER allowed me to get an earlier train back to London Kings Cross, (the 16.04)it was only an hour but saved me having to hang around , the service on the train was great ,  the young man that served me coffee and was so polite and friendly made such a pleasant change ... Thank you so much LNER.. for a fabulous end to a fabulous day 👍

items.title: No blinds/curtains.
items.review_text:
No blinds/curtains.
Why is there no blinds or curtains on your windows on trains? 
I had the sun shining in my eyes from Newcastle to London for 3 hours!

items.title: Forces the use of a terrible app with no paper backup
items.review_text: The journey itself was smooth but the very poor score is for the very poorly designed booking system that has no fallback, and one that forces the user to use the LNER app. The app refuses to sync and show my mobile ticket even with the help of the staff member at the station ticket office, and I was told there's no way to get a printed ticket instead, or use iPhone's passbook. What kind of craziness is this? It's the same booking, and no other train line would lock you in to one type of ticket. Eventually I was just told to show my email receipt to the security person at the turnstiles.

items.title: Lack of customer service
items.review_text: Send in a complaint in the middle of August and still have not had a response. Sent emails chasing it up which have gone ignored. Shouldn’t give a time frame if they can not stick to it. Terrible customer service.

items.title: Unhelpful TT
items.review_text: THE staff TT named Pamela from Newcastle to London was rude and had no empathy. You rather keep the machines in the trains to check tickets and provide a genuine information rather than a face which provides no information and not empathic at all.

items.title: Can't give it zero
items.review_text:
Can't give it zero! 8.21 York to King's X 6/9/19. First class!

NO HOT DRINKS!
NO BACON LEFT!
CHOICE OF FOOD ABYSMAL!
FIRST CLASS CARRIAGE WAS AT THE OPPOSITE END OF A VERY CROWDED TRAIN TO WHAT WAS INDICATED ON PLATFORM AT YORK.

At the moment they haven't got anything right!

items.title: Awful
items.review_text: Awful! Had to stand up for the entire journey from London to Edinburgh AND back! Late by at least an hour on the way there and 20mins on the way back. AVOID. Fly or the very least drive and enjoy your little road trip. God I hate trains.

items.title: Awful experience
items.review_text: Awful experience. Packed train with nowhere to sit (even on the floor). Expensive.

items.title: I was booked on the 6.30
items.review_text:
I was booked on the 6.30
London Kings Cross yesterday, bank holiday weekend & it was packed. On arrival checking my ticket for seat number realised I had no allocated seat that I had booked and received going down. 
I couldn’t get on the train as so many people at every door so ran with my large luggage and dog on a leash to 1st class and sat in the wheelchair space. 
The staff on this trip from Kings Cross to the changeover of a new crew were fantastic, so helpful and kind, given the situation on the train and the amount of people. Well done. 
My worry is  I had been issued the wrong return ticket and what situation I would have been in if they hadn’t been so.

items.title: I was traveling back from London King’s…
items.review_text: I was traveling back from London King’s Cross Station to York, I had been away for my 40th birthday and had a helium balloon attached to my suitcase. A lovely gentleman from LNER came and wished me happy birthday and had a lovely chat which was really thoughtful, we boarded the train home and the same gentleman came and found us on the train and asked us to go with him, he upgraded us to first class as a birthday gesture.  It was such a lovely thoughtful gesture and made me teary.  This gentleman is a credit to LNER he was so friendly and I just wish he could be recognised for this

items.title: Misery on rails
items.review_text: I have had the second worst train journey ever. They overbooked the train heavily, people are breathing down our necks and the air conditioning hasn’t worked for more than half the way. The train was delayed by an hour and we missed our fringe show. This is terrible and I’m never doing this again

items.title: Such a underwhelming experience where…
items.review_text: Such a underwhelming experience where you  greeted by carriages from the 70s. How can this even be possible with these truly exorbitant prices?  Has this really became a third world country backwards of anything you’ll see on the continent or are all profits going to shareholders? The shrill voice making unnecessary over announcements on the tannoy about keeping aisles unblocked, where to place tickets for inspection represents all that is wrong about this nanny state.  Shoehorned into a seat without a working plug, unable to charge my laptop or do any work. The incessant chatter of annoying Americans and upper class students from the home counties on their way to the Edinburgh Fringe makes for an unpleasant experience.

items.title: 55 mins delay and unusable Wi-Fi
items.review_text: 55 mins delay and unusable Wi-Fi

items.title: Over booked mess
items.review_text: Over booked, crowded, sitting on the floor most of the way from Peterborough to Edinburgh. Not worth the hassle. When I pay that much for a ticket, I expect a better service

items.title: My train was an hour late getting into…
items.review_text: My train was an hour late getting into London on 11th July from Eaglescliffe to Kings Cross and I missed my friend's funeral as a result.  I have complained, provided proof of my journey and my friend's funeral service and asked for a full refund which I am still waiting for despite making an initial claim on 31st July and receiving confirmation emails promising to deal with my claim within 10 working days Please advise soonest regarding when I will be fully refunded.

items.title: The trains are always dirty
items.review_text: The trains are always dirty, the service is average. When there are problems (and there are regularly) you arent treated as a human no updates, no food, no drink, no provision at all. Trying to get other forms of compensation is almost impossible despite them agreeing to it

items.title: The Azuma
items.review_text: If you don’t mind sitting on a seat as hard as a board for several hours, then this is the train for you!

items.title: We took our son first class on the…
items.review_text:
We took our son first class on the new Azuma.
Food was excellent. Could of done with more of drinks service but I would guess they do that at certain times of the journey. 
It was well worth th bit extra. 
Only downfall was the doors between first class and the rest kept opening. 
 But staff were excellent and the food was as well.

items.title: Ridiculous!
items.review_text: Very disappointed to board my train and discover that LNER are missing a carriage, sadly the one that held my seat reservation.  Despite numerous apologies from the onboard host, it really is not acceptable to cause complete chaos with a significant number of passengers attempting to find available seats. If I had any other alternative I would not be travelling with LNER again.

items.title: Terrible - use Grand Central instead
items.review_text: I would give this company 0 stars if possible. Trains are overbooked. Overpriced. Have to sit on the floor for every journey I’ve used with them (if I can some trains are so packed there is no floor space). Smelly. Rude staff. Always late and delayed. Never refunded back for delays.

items.title: 19RNX1PPTF Case Ref
items.review_text: I raised a refund request 19RNX1PPTF for tickets purchased on behalf of a friend who was taken seriously ill and unable to travel. I raised a refund case and 10 days elapsed without any response. I checked back on the website and saw that the case had been rejected so contacted the LNER helpline and discovered that the refund requests are outsourced and dealt with by a third party. I explained that my friend was diabetic and had been admitted into hospital with a serious condition and has been advised not to travel until he has stabilised but that I didn't have the necessary back up from his Doctor to support this. The LNER assistant was extremely helpful and understanding and provided some feedback on my case to the 3rd party refund agency. Fingers crossed this will now be refunded.

items.title: Lner is literally the worst train…
items.review_text: Lner is literally the worst train service. I get the train from London King’s X frequently to Edinburgh Waverley and the train is always delayed, in first class you can sometimes pay upwards of 100 pounds for a ticket and receive no food. The toilets are always disgusting and the flush never works. I would maybe be able to put up with all the crap services if the trains were not always delayed! I hate LNER

items.title: Cash Only Refreshments!?!
items.review_text: On the 16:03 from Kings Cross to Leeds on 08/08, I boarded at Peterborough and couldn’t wait for the refreshments cart to come around so I could get a coffee; I’d Been travelling since 6am. Unfortunately nobody told LNER it was 2019 and when I asked for a coffee I was told cash only! Wasn’t even offered a free coffee for the disappointment, poor service!

items.title: Absolutely a rip off
items.review_text: Absolutely a rip off, I had to change in Doncaster and I asked which platform to go, they told me platform 3A, I get on the train and they charged me100£ to London Kins cross!! I had already paid 95£ online for the ticket. Is not my problem if they have to stop a train before arriving!!

items.title: Completely ripped off by Azuma Trains!
items.review_text:
Completely ripped off by Azuma Trains!
I was travelling from Hull to King Cross changing at Doncaster.
At Doncaster we had to switch trains and after asking a guard which platform the London train was on he pointed to the platform and train waiting to depart. I rushed over to the train asking the guard if this was the London Train he explained it was and I showed him my ticket, he opened the door let me on and shortly after the train departed.
Following a conversation with a passenger  it was soon clear I was on the wrong train.
The guard shortly came around to check my tickets and informed me I was on the wrong train and would need to pay an additional £120 which was more than my original ticket! I had never even heard of Azuma trains and assumed it was the same as GNER.  
I explained this was highly unfair especially after the guard at the station had confirmed I was on the correct train.
My pleas fell on deaf ears and I was forced to leave my ID and will be sent a bill which I will be fighting tooth and nail! Surely the guard could have showed some leniency in these circumstances. Azuma trains do you think I purposely got on your train knowingly? There are way too many companies on these lines and it is really confusing which train is which. Creating confusion = rip off customers! 😡

items.title: Awful 1st class experience
items.review_text:
Where do I start? The sets are comfortable on the old style trains in 1st class but that's an end to the good points.
The food is abysmal. Hubby had a pork in cider option but discovered 2 huge lumps of pure fat mixed in with the 'meat'. I had sweet potato curry as there was only one pork option left (thank god) but it was equally uninspiring. Tasted like it came from the 'budget' range in a cheap supermarket microwave meal aisle.
I have discovered on Twitter that LNER have been shortlisted for a 'Caterer of the Year' award. Who the hell is giving the award? Have they ever actually TASTED the food? I don't think so. We were disappointed but could have possibly forgiven LNER for the food had it not been for the toilets!
2 toilets had 'out of order' signs on them and were locked. Another 2 toilets had no toilet paper or paper towels whatsoever and were totally blocked almost to the rims and stinking to high heaven. People had resorted to using red paper serviettes but still there was a floor swimming in urine and an awful stench of excrement. Highly unhygienic. 
I dread what tourists from other countries think when they experience these conditions on a first class ticket in Britain. It was an utter waste of money and we won't be doing it again.

items.title: On an Azuma train LKX to Leeds
items.review_text: On an Azuma train LKX to Leeds. The 1st class is a HUGE step back in comfort from the old trains. How can anyone at LNER think these seats are comfortable and appropriate for the hugely over inflated cost? Welcome to rubbish rail travel for the next 30 yrs. The reality is everyone would travel by plane if there was the option - it's cheaper, more reliable and more comfortable......

items.title: Just had my first trip on an azuma and…
items.review_text: Just had my first trip on an azuma and they are terrible compared to the old trains.  The seats are so hard it's like sitting on a board of wood.  I was in pain after 2 hours.  Was so glad I got an old train for the way home.  Did nobody test the seats out?

items.title: Avoid the new Azumas
items.review_text: Avoid the new Azumas as long as possible. First time on one today, 06:40 Leeds to KGX. No power in kitchen, on a brand new train???? So no Breakfast in First Class. Starving by time got to London, now extra expense buying one there. Keep the HST125s.

items.title: Criminal.
items.review_text:
Criminal.

They will charge, on average, 6x as much for a comparable train journey in Europe.

They willingly sell tickets at inflated prices for trains that are full and then refuse refunds if you can't get onto the train. 

The prices should be reduced by at least 80% to be reasonable.

items.title: #azuma #lner trains are rubbish!!!
items.review_text: #azuma #lner trains are rubbish!!!! I have travelled in first the last 5 yrs & new coach’s are a massive downgrade!!! Chairs are rock hard with a sandpaper covering, no space in btw the chairs for a Brompton now, chairs & tables are cramped. Menu is rarely delivered. Back to economy to save a bomb

items.title: Terrible
items.review_text: Terrible! Hot, overcrowded and overpriced.

items.title: LNER East Coast are rubbish!
items.review_text:
My wife has been visiting her sister down South. Today, August 1st, she was due to catch a train from Peterborough to York. She was then supposed to wait 15mins to catch another train from York to Leuchars in Scotland. She duly disembarked at York and then discovered that the train she was due to catch was running 75mins late. If she had known, she would have stayed on her original train up to Edinburgh and then caught a Scotrail train to Leuchars. Why did nobody in LNER have the brains to tell the guard that this situation had arisen? Joined up thinking and customer service this wasn't! See my title, LNER are rubbish!

Malcolm M. Mitchell
01334474612

items.title: I get back about 50% of my fares…
items.review_text: I get back about 50% of my fares through delay repay. I really prefer just to get to where I am going! My friends say I am jinxed. I put it down to the rail company, not being superstitious myself.

items.title: The LNER train service is so poor
items.review_text:
The LNER train service is so poor that it’s making me want to stop going to London all together. Its just too stressful travelling on the train. Delays every single time I go. Most of the trains are old and very dirty. It’s ridiculous how much the ticket prices are. Air travel is now cheaper and has far better customer service. I could fly to Barcelona for cheaper than a journey from Leeds to London. I find it so frustrating that there’s nothing passengers can do to change things or improve things. 

I travel to japan frequently for work and I see how good there train service is. It’s privatised but works so well. All the trains are spotlessly clean and always on time. Why doesn’t it work in the Uk? Maybe it’s because japan has more accountability in there society?

items.title: 10.15 Grantham to Kings Cross 28/7/19
items.review_text:
10.15 Grantham to Kings Cross 28/7/19
.Comfortable train but massively overheated. No Aircon on. Very hot and stuffy, not nice.

items.title: I was on a delayed train from King's…
items.review_text: I was on a delayed train from King's Cross to Stirling on Tuesday 23rd July due to a problem at Peterborough, can I thank the steward who was great when updating what was happening always cracked a joke and when passing through at other times he kept us happy, he was a champion. We were over 4hrs late and the only thing I can complain about was the four teenagers who drank and swore all the time plus smoking.... But I confronted them while nobody else did, I am 72yrs old, all I can say is to the scardy other passengers stand up for yourselves and your children who were with you.

items.title: Horrible experience
items.review_text: Horrible experience. Train cancelled, end up on another train, now with no seats, a newborn and 2 elderly people and sitting apart. Pathetic contingency plans for cancellations, will avoid in future.

items.title: Awful!
items.review_text: I've travelled on several Azuma trains since their recent launch and they're awful. The standard seats are much less comfortable than the older trains Azuma was meant to improve. The first class seats are obviously better than standard but the carriages are more crowded than the older trains, so there's much less personal space. I'm stuck on an immobile Azuma train as I write this review (a commonplace experience, as I commute between Leeds and London weekly). Despite today being the hottest day of the year so far (38 celciius) the air conditioning is faulty in this carriage. This is the return part of my journey - my outbound LNER train had faulty air-conditioning units in four of its carriages this morning. I accept that the hot weather has caused today's service delay; I don't accept the avoidable discomfort that the 'delay repay' scheme cannot compensate me for. Shoddy shoddy service and definitely not worth the advertising hype.

items.title: Worst train operator in the UK
items.review_text: Worst train operator in the UK. Trains are always cancelled and most are late.  You are herded like cattle and expected to stand for hours. In this recent hot weather they have cancelled 75% of their trains but will only let you get the nearest one to your that are running otherwise you have to buy a new ticket at a premium rate. I.e a £14 advance ticket will cost £90 if your train is cancelled and you want to get an earlier or later train that is not the nearest one to the one cancelled. Corbyn wants to Nationalise the railways well LNER are a nationalised railway and what a mess they are making. When are they going o privatise it again. make it soon please then we can get a decent service again

items.title: Travel today from York to Manchester…
items.review_text: Travel today from York to Manchester airport a CAOS. Completely understand that problems can happen and we are all subjected unpredictable situations but when you buy a ticket you need to AT LEAST count on the information and help from the staff. No other word to describe better the customer service than RUBBISH. No information, no help... absolutely not worth any money you pay (even if it is cheaper).

items.title: There are always good and bad people…
items.review_text: There are always good and bad people who provide you with the service they’re capable of. Had an extremely bad experience with your staff - Bridget, at the ticket counter in London Kings Cross. Surprisingly, her behaviour wasn’t consistently rude and dismissive towards all her customers so is it because I’m brown? Maybe! Horrible horrible service! I’ve been studying in UK for the past one year, made multiple journeys across Europe and never did I meet someone so completely horrid. However, I did meet much nicer and kinder staff who even though couldn’t help me were extremely polite and well mannered.

items.title: Staff rude
items.review_text: I usually travel to Scotland from Euston in virgin trains but lner we’re doing the best deal so change due to the long journey I go first class and my mum usually takes me up and at the virgin trains first class lounge my mum has always been allowed in to wait for me. I have just got to the first class lounge at lner and my mum has been turned away and also the man who turned her away had a really bad attitude and was rude will not be booking again.

items.title: First trip from Edinburgh to London
items.review_text:
First trip from Edinburgh to London and that was a bit of a hell on wheels (16.00, 12.07.19, coach C).
A drunk hen do and a small but even more drunk birthday party with a few blokes sat in coach C, with their noise drowning out everyone else on the coach for 1.5hrs until Newcastle. The only time LNER staff was seen giving them a warning was at the very beginning of the trip, whilst checking the tickets. For the rest of the trip they where swearing, shouting and getting increasingly intoxicated without any further warning from staff, and sadly no other passenger on the coach had the courage or authority to silence or detrain them.
As most of them left at Newcastle, the seats, the tables were covered in bottles, alcohol and other rubbish. Two families whose paid assigned seats from Newcastle were located in the middle of the mess, had to clean the whole place and dry the seats in order to start their trip - there were no alternative seats around.
Some from the 'ned' party were left behind on the train, as they did not manage to get off the train in time. So they spent the time till the next stop smoking on the train near the doors. Again, no staff to keep order.
For all the ads about "how amazing the LNER are whilst traveling to London", this was a joke...

items.title: Terrible customer service.
items.review_text: Terrible customer service from Christophe in the Edinburgh station.

items.title: Abysmal, but the crew is decent
items.review_text:
We reserved seats in coach for the two of us and our kids, 6 and 8, for the London King’s Cross to Edinburgh and had a very crappy travel experience. 
To be fair, the train before us had been cancelled, but apparently no one had either informed the passengers of that train or elected to do anything about it. Our train was packed so tightly that we couldn’t even get into our car and there was no staff around to do anything about it or direct the passengers. Again, to be fair, they had to change trains from electric to diesel so needed a new crew, but there was absolutely no one around to talk to. We and some others decided that we would go to the first class cars where someone would be sure to get things done, and we weren’t wrong. The poor crew there was apparently not supposed to be there any more but their company had done nothing about that either. The crew told us we couldn’t stand in the spaces between cars, but when we told them we had no other choice they left us alone. The train was delayed 40 minutes as they tried to change crews and the only advice we got from staff was “risk is part of life, try the 12 o’clock train!” There was no chance we were going anywhere that was even less of a guarantee, so we stayed put. We spent the next two hours with our young children between first class cars sitting on our luggage or standing, having to cram together to let people on and off. The only saving grace was a few staff members who gave our kids some of the first class snacks and explained to other crew why we were there, or otherwise left us alone. 
At one stop a gentlemen with some disabilities got on with difficulty only to find that his reserved first class seat and all others were taken. He ended up having to stand near us with his crutches and fell hard during a rough turn! Eventually he got a seat, but seriously, what the hell?!
Eventually the throngs thinned and we were able to make our way back to coach and found some seats together. The seats were nice enough but there was no air movement and it was definitely warm. No one ever came by in coach to pick up trash either. On the upside, the staff after changeover was very pleasant and fun, and prices for much needed drinks were reasonable for a train. 
Throughout the trip the train manager through the loud speaker kept announcing that we could put in for reimbursement due to late travel. That process was painful as well. You have to do each ticket individually (we had 4) with loads of information and it says it will save your information from one to the next. It doesn’t. There’s no commitment as to what the compensation will be either. I will try to edit this review when I see the results. 
All in all, LNER provided a crappy travel experience for many people that day. The only upside was a few of the staff members, so 2 stars.

items.title: So disappointed!
items.review_text: So disappointed, I paid 80£ for a ticket to, once on the train, find no available seats for a 3hours journey from London to Durham. It is a disrespect for passengers, including myself, who ended up sitting down on the floor by the toilets and had to stand up each time someone needed to use it,for anyone who had rubbish to throw in the bin (yes, yes because we were sitting right there) or for the trolly of snacks and refreshments (as if we are in a situation to treat ourselves with a snack) I have never seen such a situation, neither in the UK nor in any other country . Why do you sell tickets if you have no available seats? There should be a refund policy in cases like this. Thank you!

items.title: should not be happening in 2019   …
items.review_text: should not be happening in 2019    Train from Kings Cross to Aberdeen Mon 15th July what a disgrace to treat passengers to this ordeal Passengers standing in the passageways from Kings Cross as far as Edinburgh why allow this amount of passengers onto a train knowing they are going to block anyone even trying to get to a toilet or reach the food bar A total disgrace

items.title: We took a train on Sunday 14 July from…
items.review_text: We took a train on Sunday 14 July from York to Kings Cross and had booked our 4 seats. When we got on, 4 obstinate people were sitting in our seats and insisted that the booking system had broken and that they would not move, despite my proof. When we found some staff to support us, they put us in first class instead (as the train wasn't stopping until London by this time) and gave us sandwiches, cakes and tea. The staff acknowledged that these people had pinched our seats but chose to deal with it this way. They were very helpful and attentive - particularly the lady with the smart red uniform on the food trolley! - and we got to travel first class. Very nice!

items.title: Delay Repay
items.review_text: Our train was 40 mins late, which meant we missed our onward connection, bit annoying, however the on board team kept us up to date and we've received a part-refund via their Delay Repay.  Whole process of requesting refund was easy and quick.

items.title: Extremely overcrowded
items.review_text: Extremely overcrowded. £142 for standard class return from London to Newcastle on a Sunday. Couldn't reserve seat online - generic error message and no mention that all seats had been reserved. On the day, standing passangers were in physical contact for most of my 3 hours to Newcastle. No space to navigate to food coach or even the toilets. Obviously, ticket inspector couldn't come through either. Avoid if frail or travelling with young children. My worst ever long distance train experience anywhere in the world

items.title: Compared to CrossCountry LNER are…
items.review_text: Compared to CrossCountry LNER are amazing. Tickets can be expensive in first class but there are bargains to be had. You get a lot more for your money e.g. a meal, glass of wine, tea, coffee, snacks etc. The staff are visible and come around regularly. For the same money on CrossCountry you get coffee/tea/ soft drink and a biscuit. You are better in standard where you can buy something off the trolley. I’d go for LNER whenever possible.

items.title: What you can rely on for them not to…
items.review_text: What you can rely on for them not to give a monkeys about your or your plans or you

items.title: Never Again -- Over crowded nightmare!!
items.review_text: Over crowded, terrible food options, mediocre on-board service and this is in what is supposed to be 1st class. Worse train experience while traveling in the UK and Ireland. Definitely flying next time. Over 90 minutes late from Edinburgh to London. 1st class passengers standing in the isles for hours because of no seats. Never again LNER.

items.title: Not a good service
items.review_text: Not a good service, train very uncomfortable and food terrible, why I pay good money for a nightmare of a journey I really do not know, well I do know, there is no alternative....

items.title: Rude catering staff member- I did not…
items.review_text: Rude catering staff member- I did not pay over £150 to get treated like this. Callum, telling me 'You were very busy' loudly to your Australian Mates for my benefit and then making a disparaging remark shows you in a bad light. The attitude of some staff seems to have never changed in the 60 years I have travelled by train.

items.title: Dump the trains in graveyard
items.review_text:
Third world train quality that's always delayed or something breaks down. Disgusting toilets, dirty seats etc. Crazy over priced, people in Britain are getting ripped off. They belong in a train graveyard.
From reading the reviews seems like all the rubbish is normal. Should only pay £5 for journey because the quality of service is below bargain standard

items.title: Train journey Doncaster to London
items.review_text:
Train journey Doncaster to London - experienced late service due to other train breaking down, then our train  broke down leading to our train being cancelled. Luckily booked on plenty of time to get to our destination!
On the way  back, a family situation meant we had to get back home asap, was advised there was plenty of available places on earlier train but were expected to pay £120 for the privilege of changing our tickets for just a couple of hours! Could understand if it was different company or if train was busy but considering that wasn't the case could have easily have been sorted! Unfortunately we just couldn't afford the difference!

items.title: Fourth trip in June - utter Sh*te
items.review_text:
Fourth trip in June. First was first class to Nottingham with reserved seats. No seats actually reserved, had to stand. Return trip train was two hours delayed. Got on the train from Kings Cross to York, locomotive had broken had to change train - 30 min late and missed the session we wanted to attend at the university. Now sitting on the return currently running 45 late because a train in front has broken down in a carriage where the aircon has broken down - 30 degrees today.
Have I been just unlucky or is this normal, the othe reviews indicate the latter.  What a joke!

items.title: Really really disappointing
items.review_text: Really really disappointing. Not the service but the new lay out. Although the service was good, it couldn’t make up for the incredibly uncomfortable new seats. The new Hitachi design has meant smaller seat which are very hard catering to the Japanese market. Bring back the leather seats!

items.title: Not a comfortable journey
items.review_text: Not a comfortable journey

items.title: The New Azuma cost HOW MUCH!!!
items.review_text: I was I invited by LNER to comment on the New Azuma train. I travelled to Leeds on Friday the Air conditioner was not working they gave out some water but ran out so not all passengers received the water. They then delayed the train to get the air conditioner  sorted at Grantham, not a pleasant journey on very uncomfortable seats. I am now on my return journey no announcement until the train departed 15 minutes late due to faulty doors. I only caught my ongoing train by the skin of my teeth. To add insult to injury the toilets near my compartment were marked for staff only all in all not a pleasant experience and the seats are so close together and rigid there seems no cushioning at all I will be checking which train I will be travelling with in the future or maybe just take my car. I was really excited when I saw the train pulling into the station on Friday and thought this should be state of the art travel, what a disappointment. I am a very unhappy customer.

items.title: Pathetic service
items.review_text: Pathetic service, no space unless you've reserved a seat, had to stand all the way to York. Completely overcrowded.

items.title: Don’t Go 1st Class
items.review_text: I upgraded today to 1st from Peterborough to Kings Cross thinking I would get a hot breakfast. In fact I got a croissant and a cup of coffee as the journey was less than 60 minutes (in fact 55 minutes). Therefore no hot food. The waitress was clearly desperate to clear up and there was no offer of fruit juice or another cup of coffee. A bad waste of money

items.title: 13:30 from Kings Cross to Darlington…
items.review_text:
13:30 from Kings Cross to Darlington was cancelled
We rebooked to the 14:00
This train was delayed by about 25 minutes
When the boards in the hall of the station announced the track, we immediately went there to find out we were not getting access. The train left without us. We explained (among a whole bunch of other passengers) the track had not been announced without any effect.
Because the 14:00 was delayed so much, we also missed the 14:30.
Next one was the 15:00. We tried to book that one in the ticket office, but the employee could not do that. Did not explain why. We twisted an arm of another employee to tell us which track to go, to avoid the 14:00 train experience. We succeeded to board the train
Only to find out we were going to be charged another £18,05 each, because our tickets were only valid for train's that were cancelled (13:30), not announced on time (14:00) or missed because of the delay of the train that had not been announced (14:30). A great business model for LNER. And as one can read from the reviews here: it is a really bad company. This is just one more example.

items.title: Vegetarians bring your own food.
items.review_text: Just paid over £100 for a first class ticket on LNER. When the food service came round the only option for vegetarian was a ‘deli box’. This consisted of a 12 tasteless nachos, 4 olives and a ghastly tablespoon of sour cream sauce and a gritty cheese one. The train staff were ‘not allowed’ to get a vegetarian sandwich from standard class so I had to buy it myself. Wrote to LNER and as always, you get a preprepared, standardised response that completely ignores my complaint and directs me to their menu- hello, it’s the menu, or lack there of, I’m complaining about!!! The new menu is a perfect example of style over substance.

items.title: 55 pounds from Peterborough to Leeds to…
items.review_text:
55 pounds from Peterborough to Leeds to stand in a stairwell on a packed train is an absolute joke. 

This is not the 1950's anymore.

items.title: The 13.33 from King's X to Leeds was…
items.review_text: The 13.33 from King's X to Leeds was lifted from functional to fun by Adam, the train manager, with his witty announcements. It wasn't wasted Adam!

items.title: Great Caring Staff
items.review_text: Last Sunday (2nd June) we were away and there was a sudden bereavement back home. We had advance tickets from York to Durham for Monday with another company but because of the need of my partner to get home as soon as possible to he son the LNER staff at York (Steve) arranged for us to travel on your service, as it was already in the station, on Mondays tickets at no further cost. My partner and I cannot thank you enough, a really kind and caring gesture from great staff. I use the train quite often and will definitely use LNER whenever possible. Thank you very much!

items.title: Spacious trains with plenty of legroom
items.review_text: Spacious trains with plenty of legroom. Very clean, staff are polite. The trains are just all round comfortable to be in. Hugely important that we feel safe as a passenger, and I certainly did. Brilliant work LNER!

items.title: Hate to buck the trend guys
items.review_text:
Hate to buck the trend guys - but ... 

Typically it's human nature to only write bad reviews.  I'm trying hard to go against that trend so wanted to drop a word about recent engagement with customer services.

Specifically (LEON - i think the name was) was really helpful and answered all my questions.  Was a really great customer experience.

Regarding the trains, sure they're not great and many rail companies have inherited issues from previous generations.  I'm not trying to say everything is rosey but ... let's use this as an example.  Some complete muppet decided to shut down Leeds station the other day by "trespassing".  i.e. walking on the roof and threatening to top himself on the electric lines.

Result, LOADS of train delays, and all down to some fool who should have just had his cry for help elsewhere.  Train companies get blamed - no fair.

For sure there are other situations when they are at fault - then flame on.  In this case however my situation dealt with awesomely (sp.).

items.title: MOST TERRIBLE 3rd WORLD TRAIN TRAVEL…
items.review_text:
MOST TERRIBLE 3rd WORLD TRAIN TRAVEL EXPERIENCES!!! I MEAN, WHY NOT STRAP ME ON TOP OF THE OUTSIDE CARRIDGE ROOF WHY DON’T YOU!!! 

HOW RIDICULOUS TO THINK THAT I PAID EXTORTIONATE TICKET PRICES FOR A SEAT TOO!?! ABSOLUTELY ABHORRENT & DISGUSTING CUSTOMER SERVICE & TREATMENT!!!

EVER HEARD OF HEALTH & SAFTEY COMPLIANCE!?! 

NEVER EVER, EVER AGAIN!!!

WILL DRIVE!!!!

AVOID! AVOID! AVOID!!!

items.title: I am currently sitting on my baggage…
items.review_text:
I am currently sitting on my baggage between cars, as holder of two advanced
Purchased reserved tickets from York to London. 

Without notice, LNER cancelled the train I had reserved tickets for and suggested I get on another train and try and find a seat. I am not the only one now standing between cars. 

Sucks. The LNER personnel at the terminal seemed lackadaisical at best.

items.title: No Refund After 3 Months
items.review_text:
Ok, so three months ago I requested a refund. The money didn’t arrive after the stated time period so I called customer services. Jackie was helpful and said she’d email accounts and get the payment processed. She emailed me instead of accounts requesting the refund but I thought I had been CC’d in and actually thought what excellent customer service. A month later I called in again, no payment received (obviously) and I was told that every time I call in I reset the claim and it has to start again. I’ve patiently waited for three months in total now and I finally emailed my frustrations yesterday. I got a call
This evening saying they were going to ‘give me £40’ by means of an apology for what was clearly their mistake. My refund was £35. so in addition to that I thought that was fair. At the end of the call I confirmed the refund amount to be £75 and the guy laughed and said no it will be £40 in total so £5 for the inconvenience. I think that’s an insult for anyone who’s 3 emails deep and and 3 phone calls into a complaint where they are more than culpable.  I’m to expect the money in a further 21 days. I wait with little faith.

items.title: Horrible and distressing experience on…
items.review_text: Horrible and distressing experience on 1400 train from Edinburgh today. Deliberately rude and obstructive train manager who refused to assist clearly distressed passenger and threatened to throw her off the train when she asked for his name. No excuse for this type of behaviour, particularly when she was asking for help.

items.title: Absolutely shocked at the poor level of service
items.review_text:
Absolutely shocked at 2 members of staff today. The quality of service was just awful. Unbelievably rude with one lady ( train manager) putting her hand up to my face in a ' talk to the hand ' manor, without me saying one word to her. 3rd train manager ( a lovely man) went through what I had to do to be able to get on his earlier train. Actually costing £10 rather than a whole new ticket ( as per conversation with previous 2 - both women) who said i had to buy a new ticket costing £114 ' if i wanted to get on their train's. '. Thank you to this gentleman who was happy to help me. There were many empty seats on all 3 trains and certainly no need for me to wait another hour for my booked train. I was seated at a table for 4 alone all the way from Leeds to kings Cross.
Very upsetting experience for a lady travelling alone. Wished I'd driven my car and not listened to all the adverts on TV showing what a wonderful experience travelling by train can be.

items.title: Noisy first class coach.
items.review_text: We travelled from Edinburgh to York, the staff were very good and the train was clean and tidy my complaint was in our first class carriage we had 2 passengers  (1 across from me and 1 three seats behind me) who were on their mobile phones the full journey talking quite loud at times, a passenger from the first row of seats walked up about 10 rows to ask a woman to show some respect for the other passengers that is how loud she was talking. The journey was spoilt for all the other passengers because of 2 passengers who did not care about all the other first-class passengers. LNER must sort this out.

items.title: no Hot food as advertised
items.review_text: Advertised hot food buffet on service. Choice was a cheese and tomato flatbread with about a gram of filling or a cold mozzarella sandwich. On a long journey when you plan to eat en-route (despite the extortionate prices) a bit of decent food as advertised would have gone a long way

items.title: Travelled first class Glasgow to Kings…
items.review_text: Travelled first class Glasgow to Kings Cross.  Very attentive staff and an excellent breakfast.  Well done to all concerned.

items.title: Dreadful service
items.review_text: Dreadful service. Scot Rail let my son and his bike onto the train from Edinburgh to Dunbar no problem. He tried to return tonight as he had to get back, but was told by LNER he could not travel as the one bike was not booked on the 20 minute journey. He now cannot return until 10am TOMORROW. He was never told this. Lucky he had us to stay with but it could have been very different for another person. Will not use them again if I can avoid it.

items.title: I travel with lner 3 weekends a month…
items.review_text:
I travel with lner 3 weekends a month round trip from Edinburgh to Doncaster and I have to say that since the takeover from Virgin, I don't see any improvements. Prices are ridiculous, even in advance. The only positive thing I can say is that the food in first class it better. 

However today I was very rudely told by one older lady member of staff (as she tried to take away a full can of coke from me) that I had to drink it on the train. We had half an hour to go before my train arrived at it's destination at this point. She then put it back on the table, opened it and started to pour it into my cup! I pay for first class and that can of coke isn't coming out of her wage! Completely unacceptable behaviour from a member of staff!

items.title: I've had 2 fantastic experiences…
items.review_text:
I've had 2 fantastic experiences recently.
The first, my train was actually cancelled due to overhead line faults.. I paid £165 to get a taxi to Newark and the cost of my ticket was refunded to me, plus when I wrote to LNER they also refunded the total cost of my taxi...all within 3 weeks.
Today I travelled again from London to a Newark and I have to say the staff were absolutely fantastic.. particular shout out to Edward and Billy who went the extra mile and were exceptionally polite and helpful. 
All round top service.

items.title: Terrible customer service
items.review_text:
Why the customer service is so bad? 
Also:
Very expensive tickets! 
No toilet rolls in the toilet. 
Uncomfortable seats.  
Do not recommend!

items.title: Shambolic LNER
items.review_text:
I travelled 1st class to London and at Peterborough a train full of people arrived from a cancellation, was worse that a football express
I received the usual crap from LNER, they have no interest whatsoever in customer service and copy and paste an EMail reply
The staff on the Trains who serve the tea or coffee are pig ignorant, though I have always found the Guards to be fine
They must take the village clowns and tell them to lose their personalities then they get the job
Prices have rocketed since LNER took over the franchise, their Trains are at extortionate prices and you wonder what their plan is
In a word they are useless

items.title: I must have spoken to the same person…
items.review_text: I must have spoken to the same person as John below !! The delightful Jackie spoke as though I was trying her patience when I said I didn’t know I needed to go to a train station, print out my tickets to return then to the company as they had not advised this in the month I had been waiting for them to advise me on my refund. On hold 16 mins to be told I was being put through to someone else, after 6 more mins I hung up. It seems it’s the customer service that have extremely unpleasant service as the train staff are lovely

items.title: Absolutely terrible experience
items.review_text: Absolutely terrible experience. I have never been spoken to so rudely on the phone in my life. I tried to book tickets to Leeds for 18th April, and all of the tickets advertised on their website didn't actually exist. Then when I called, their staff were abusive and rude to me on the phone.

items.title: Good service
items.review_text: Good service, nice clean trains.

items.title: Truly awful - any excuse to extract more money
items.review_text:
Truly awful. Due to a family emergency had to take an earlier train - had a full price ticket on a half empty train but they wouldn't accept it and said we needed new tickets at the premium price they have for purchasing on the train.£180 later we had valid tickets.

I have just witnessed an inspector 'stinging' a poor young student for over £140 because he had left his rail card a home. He could prove he had an 18-25 rail card via his mail but the inspector refused to look at it.  Where is the common decency? The poor lad was nearly in tears as he couldn't afford it. The original ticket they said was void was just for £45 but they required £140. 

When will the regulators put a stop to this dynamic pricing with different prices on the train, on the internet and at the ticket office etc? It's time the regulators put a stop to this cynical profiteering.

items.title: Poor service
items.review_text: My train from York to Kings Cross was delayed by 40 minutes. My reserved first class seat was taken. Were staff interested? Not at all. Very poor customer service with staff members completely indifferent to passenger difficulties. One of the worse train journeys I’ve experienced. Not impressed whatsoever with LNER.

items.title: worst customer service
items.review_text: Have been trying to contact the customer service about the refund of the changed journey which was done more than 2 weeks ago. And have sent two customer request for follow up, and still no responses.

items.title: My worst train travel rip off experience
items.review_text: Bad experience today. Paid £82 for a return to London, had to buy it on a Transpennine Train as the station systems down, with my railcard. It was a super off peak, the conductor who sold it didn't know the,  conditions, and asking in London railways in the past I've been told peak was only in the morning. Took a train from KingsX to York, and was told my ticket was invalid after the train left, there was an inaudible announcement a few minutes before leaving which apparently mentioned off peak tickets, I didn't hear it.  Was charged over £200 for the revised ticket, told I could not use my railcard (LNER conductors cannot accept railcards apparently, only other train companies can) and this was the difference in price between what I paid.  It is extremely difficult to check the arcane rules for these tickets, information from station staff isn't consistent, and this train was no doubt purposefully set to leave at 1600 the start of the peak period.  I was shocked, and I will never travel on LNER again.  Even the staff on the train were embarrassed by what they were being asked to do, and passengers also recounted how their experience is also that it is impossible to be sure of what rules are attached to different tickets.  Thank you LNER for wrecking my trip.  But don't worry you won't have another opportunity to do so.

items.title: Terrible service. Most of the time it's late.
items.review_text: Most of the time I get the train it's late, toilets are not clean and it's packed with people. Journey to and from Peterborough - London kings cross

items.title: I took the Kingscross to Leeds train…
items.review_text:
I took the Kingscross to Leeds train this morning. What a great 1st class experience. The lounge staff were informative and friendly. Refreshments were plentiful and fresh.
The train was clean and spacious. Staff were friendly and the food was lovely. Thank you LNER

items.title: Same level as BA economy
items.review_text:
When I was booking my tickets, it was £25 more to go first class each way from Durham to kings Cross - I thought it’d be like at least business class on a plane, what a bloody joke.
I’ll be honest - the seats were miles apart (in a good way!) from what you get in standard class. The free WiFi just didn’t work though - on either leg of my journey.
The lounge was a joke - it had machine coffee, crisps, and a couple of sad looking apples. As someone on the keto diet, I literally couldn’t eat anything.
The food was acceptable on the way down - I had the full English but the portion sizes were tiny. On the way up, I figured the beef rendang curry might suit my dietary requirements - it came with literally 3 small cubes of beef, and 17 cubes of potato (yes I counted).
The staff were friendly to be fair, and it was nice to get free alcohol which I am currently drowning my sorrows with. Is it worth it for the £50 total I paid each way? Maybe. Is it worth it for the £100 premium each way LNER normally charge? No way in hell.

items.title: Not Great At All !
items.review_text: Not great at all. Cleanliness left a lot to be desired. Tables dirty and other passengers rubbish left on it. Staff not very helpful. Paid to go 1 st class and no electric sockets worked in the carriage. The explanation was that it was a dead carriage !!!  Not impressed. If dead carriage the very least they could have done is inform passengers at the start of the journey. Definitely not the service that Virgin provided.

items.title: I have one slight issue, but still great!
items.review_text: I have one slight issue, but apart from that, it’s an awesome service. The trains are quite slow and there was a 115 minute delay on our train because of a signalling problem. It didn’t matter that much since we didn’t need to be there for anything. But if you go onto the LNER website, you can write a letter for a full/partial refund if it’s over 30 min delay. Got a full refund for 2 people! It’s also houses lovely seats, and table seats are same price as normal seats! Train WiFi didn’t work well, but that’s not a problem if you have data. Plugs are also available! Great service overall! 9/10!!!

items.title: Since LNER took over from Virgin the…
items.review_text: Since LNER took over from Virgin the change regarding the cleanliness of trains is noticeable.  Yesterday I travelled from Peterborough to Glasgow and back again.  Every seat in my coach (There and back) was extremely dirty, covered in thick clumps of dust.  Haven't these guys heard of hoovering and if they have, how on earth can this be an acceptable standard of cleanliness, surely we are entitled to sit on clean seats, especially considering we need to pay to sit in these trains!  I even asked the guy serving drinks about the level of cleanliness, his response was to shrug his shoulders and moved on!  Whoever is in charge of cleaning really needs to get out of his/her office and go see what's happening on the trains for real!

items.title: Poor experience at the lounge
items.review_text: Poor experience at the lounge, tables not cleaned, coffee machines not working, not a member if staff in sight except the guy who checks the tickets.  Probably going to go off to Starbucks, much nicer experience and cheaper too.

items.title: Terrible company please for your own…AWFUL COMPANY
items.review_text: Terrible company please for your own sake do not travel with them

items.title: This is the worst train line
items.review_text: This is the worst train line, and government own, what a load of rubbish, they couldn’t plan and run a tap, let alone a train service, and they want use to use public transport, what a laugh

items.title: Disappointed
items.review_text: I have just travelled on the 7.24 from Grantham to Edinburgh.  I was very disappointed with the breakfast.  Having travelled first class I expected better.  I was asked what I wanted.  I said porridge.  That was it.  According to the web page I looked at yesterday I should have also had a choice of toast and or fruit as well.  So, I just got my porridge and that was it.  The tea also left a lot to the imagination.  It was very stewed and not very warm.  Poor show really 😕

items.title: Safety first
items.review_text: Travelling to London and there was a young girl traveling alone. The staff noticed she was alone and asked if she was being collected at kings cross. She said she was meeting her dad. 2 staff came back just before we arrived at kings cross and stayed with her until she was safely with her dad. What a lovely thing, this young girls safety was the most important thing to the staff. Well done LNER. Great to see.

items.title: Charged £112 for a single train ticket...
items.review_text: Charged £112 for a single train ticket from Leeds to London Kings cross whereas the cost of an open return was £115.

items.title: Extremely poor show today from Lner…
items.review_text: Extremely poor show today from Lner Kings Cross to Newcastle service in 1st Class. No ice available for drinks throughout the journey, ran out of sandwiches early with the promise of fresh stock at York. This did not happen. Bring back the Virgin service !!!!

items.title: How I miss Virgin East Coast !!
items.review_text: I have not been on a decent train from London KGX to Leeds since LNER replaced Virgin East Coast. Older less comfortable carriages and the prices are robbery, even with advance / early booking there are no more good value tickets. I am a regular traveller, and the trains do appear to be less busy, and I suspect people are making other arrangements, (frankly National Express begins to sound more attractive). I really miss Virgin on this route. LNER are awful at every level !

items.title: Ruthless outfit!
items.review_text: Absolute bunch of thieves! Charged an extra £70 on top of a £135 ticket due to boarding an empty 30 minutes earlier train. The prices are already extortionate so it shows the morals of the firm to feel the need to fleece me of even more money!

items.title: On a train route right now from…
items.review_text:
On a train route right now from Edinburgh to London.

We are stopped in the middle of nowhere with the only report that they don't know when we will start.

The train mechanics is in a really bad state. The train accelerates and deccelerates all the time without any reason. Either the train driver is inexperienced or the speed control is out of sync.

Additionally, the carriages jump up and down, thus I suspect the suspensions are worn out.

And this happens in the train line that connects two capitals of two nations...

items.title: First Class London to Edinburgh
items.review_text: First Class London to Edinburgh. Expensive. Dire wine. Evening ‘meal’ consists of either a £3 sandwich or a small plate of cold food. Door to the lobby jammed open so carriage cold. Value?

items.title: Travelled from Peterborough to…Edinburgh and return.
items.review_text: Travelled from Peterborough to Edinburgh on 21/13/2018 1st Class They ran out of food and apparently the oven to heat the food was not working.On the return trip 28/12/2018 the toilets in carriage L & M were out of order.The auto sliding door in carriage M was also out of order.Also given a chipped glass.On past trips in 1St class they ran out of fresh milk and didn't provide menus in 1st class. The state of the carriage floors was not up to a reasonable standard.I travel to Edinburgh monthly and have no option but to use LINER which has proved to be of an overall lower standard than when VIRGIN was operating the route.

items.title: Don't travel with LNER
items.review_text:
Worst journey ever. The train arrived
back in Kings Cross from Peterborough 90 minutes LATE. To make it worse, they cocked up my seating and booked me and another guy in the SAME SEAT, which meant I stood for the journey. No staff to be seen in any carriages. I went to first class looking for somebody to help but literally nobody was there!!!! I went into every carriage looking for somebody!!!
they overbooked the journey which meant half the carriages was standing and everybody's luggage was blocking the pathways. 
It's not the first time these fools have messed up our journey but it'll definitely be the last one!

items.title: Not a nice experience
items.review_text:
Travelled first class for the second time ever in my 57 years, as my first experience was so good.Oh my  goodness could not have been more different.Trolley service offered up water,Apple or banana at first.Asked for crisps as was expecting same sandwich , cake etc for lunch as last time.Two bags of crisps thrown onto the table.Yet to be offered a cup of coffee.Asked for a sandwich about an hour and a half into the journey, told "none on that train".Appeared 10 mins later with smoked salmon and still no drink.
Staff might be advised that "do you want anything" isn't really waiting etiquette.First class carriages were very quiet so not like they were rushed off their feet.
Carriage was also cold and no WiFi!

items.title: Horrible.
items.review_text: Travelled "1st Class". No-one greeting me as I boarded, supposed catering never showed up, no-one even checked my ticket. The one staff member I saw strolled past without even acknowledging my existence. To call this 1st Class is a little misleading. You're just paying extra for a bit more legroom and a (dirty) leather-esque seat. Good to see the price increases aren't just funding executive payrises(!)

items.title: Seamless and smooth journey
items.review_text:
So was travelling from LON to EDN over year end time and was bit nervous for taking trains because of cancellations and reschedules. But, I like the services and information provided by LNER. No complains as such and travel was on time. Their frequent updates before travel was upto the mark, on board snacks service was good and seat confirmation can be seen over the seat which gives visibility over seat allocation management. Though my coach ran out of toilet rolls so have to go to another coach. In terms of rating to give:
1. Departure/Arrival times: 9/10
2. Booking/Seat and updates: 10/10
3. Cleanliness: 8/10
4. On Board Services: 9/10
5. Staff friendliness/help: 8/10

Thanks.

items.title: ✨❤️LOVELY LISA & LUSHICIOUS LINSEY❤️✨
items.review_text:
✨❤️LOVELY LISA & LUSHICIOUS LINSEY❤️✨

✨Well ladies and gentlemen what can I say ??

❤️The service I have received today is IMPECCABLE. I felt compelled to write even though I haven’t even left the train 🚊..!!

✨From the moment I arrived at First Class Lounge at LNER from Donald greeting us to the delicious food offered in the lounge which was bright and airy and well presented.

❤️Upon boarding the train we have been given comfortable seats and sat with some lovely people. 

✨Linsey one of the hostesses is an absolute GEM she was so bright and colourful a GREAT BRAND ambassador wearing lipstick and hair colour to match the uniform. Linsey was really bubbly and I really appreciated the exceptional customer service she provided to me today ..!!

❤️Lisa also a hostess has also been SUPERB giving us light refreshments of peppermint ☕️ tea, water, yoghurts, fruit, eat natural bars and pain au chocolat. Lisa was so approachable and happy she clearly loves her job and this shines through.

✨The train itself is smart, clean and spacious. I love the fact there are plug sockets to charge your phone. 

❤️It’s great that the refreshments are complimentary and the ladies really go above and beyond ..!! This is something I really VALUE as I myself have my own customer focused business.

✨Lisa and Linsey have really enhanced my experience today in 1st class and I feel privileged to of met them and been a customer ..!!

❤️LNER your staff are such a credit to you and I really APPRECIATE the service provided to me today ..!!

✨I am utterly DELIGHTED I choose your company to travel to Edinburgh for my Birthday celebrations on NEW YEAR’s EVE ..!!

❤️Lots of Love & Abundant Appreciation 

✨Baker-Girl✨ ❤️🚊❤️✨xx

items.title: First class catering service is a farce
items.review_text: First class catering service is worse than patchy. Been on the train Kirkcaldy to Kings Cross for 3 hours and only one cup of tea offered. No real food available, trolley person threw a couple of packets of crisps in our direction.  No announcements. Appalling. Ignore the fancy promises on their website. You are paying for a nicer seat. That is all. Take your own food if you don't want to starve on a 5 hour journey.

items.title: The train was on time and fast
items.review_text: The train was on time and we had no problems getting seats, my only complaint is the ticket price was a little expensive thus given 4 instead of 5.

items.title: Offered us free travel from London to…
items.review_text: Offered us free travel from London to Inverness when Gatwick airport was closed due to drones flying overhead. Thanks so much, you've saved us thousands of pounds and allowed our Xmas holiday to still be possible.

items.title: Horrible customer service and staff…
items.review_text: Horrible customer service and staff unwilling to take any responsibility for their colleagues' action. I was given wrong information by a platform staff member and boarded the wrong train from Doncaster to London. The train manager forced me to buy a new ticket and threatened with the transport police. Avoid this trainline!

items.title: I travelled from York to Edinburgh the…
items.review_text: I travelled from York to Edinburgh the train was late and was really packed we found our seats but the overhead racks were full of other peoples stuff. We had one case and although I put in the rack it fell out twice not enough room. Not enough leg room.

items.title: Crap service
items.review_text: Crap service, late, missed connecting service due to late arrival. Staff were kurt, not particularly pleasent. Will not use this service again.  LNER doing noghing to get people to use punlic transport

items.title: Food awful
items.review_text:
Food awful, service awful, prices have doubled since LNER took over from Virgin. I paid £340 .50 for a return journey from  Kings Cross to Skipton 1st class,  previously would have cost around £140.

I believe Virgin run trains to Preston so consider alternative routes,.

items.title: Rude staff and dirty trains
items.review_text:
Staff are so rude, would be very chippy and unhelpful. 
The doors were broken and there was an unbearable smell coming from the loos into the carriage. 
Service was also delayed. Definitely gone downhill since Virgin and East Coast.

items.title: Paid £400 return to Edinburgh, but don’t expect an actual seat!
items.review_text: Paid £400 return to Edinburgh. Given reservations on way up, but for some reason not on way down. However system not working so all seats say they’re available, even though people have reservations. Travelling with two young kids, been chucked out of seats twice and only half way down. Train “manager” just shrugged shoulders and said it’ll only get busier. Who knew Ryanair could be made to look professional? You get an actual seat with them.

items.title: Poor customer service
items.review_text: They do treat customers incredibly badly, treating anyone who has made any mistake with tickets like a criminal. Really poor customer service

items.title: Travelled First Class with both LNER…
items.review_text: Travelled First Class with both LNER predecessors, East Coast  and Virgin East Coast. Never any problems. The last 3 journeys booked with LNER have failed to get us all the way to our destinations, due to late LNER trains and connections missed. First Class service has become so dire I shall no longer be using LNER. Staff attitude to passengers is a disgrace, they seem to think they are doing you a favour by allowing you on their train. Missed a connection at Kings Cross due to late train into Paddington (all tickets booked with LNER) all the LNER information man could tell me was that I had missed my train, he was so helpful he pointed to my ticket another 3 times and told me the same thing. The service I boarded, had about 4 people in my First Class coach, however only a cold drink and an egg sandwich and the bag of crisps was offered and that was the last we saw of the catering staff, they must have been busy, chatting I presume, as there was hardly anyone on the service and very little to do. Couldn't possibly revisit the passengers AGAIN. On a service to London had to order breakfast 3 times, due to the order being forgotten twice and then given to someone else. I shall be using Hull Trains or East Midlands services from now on. I can forgive breakdowns and equipment failures but RUDE LAZY INCONCIDERATE staff I cannot. The staff uniforms are now scruffy, ill fitting and in most cases dirty, usually a good indicator of what to expect from any service provider. If you have no choice but to use them don't waste your money on First Class.

items.title: Always always always late!!
items.review_text: Completely unreliable - quite often 10, 20 minutes late like it’s no big deal. Also the non-peak trains sometimes don’t appear to have working suspension - and the whole carriage is stoically trying to pretend they are happy sitting there with their tea slopping over the sides of the cup because the train is bouncing so much. This happens a lot on the later quieter trains, not so much on the busier commuter trains. What else? Well there’s the issue of feet on seats - happens much less in first class but I do see happening regularly  in Standard Class. Why don’t staff simply issue the culprit with a £50 on-the-spot fine? Very easy to do and most travellers hate feet on seats and would support this. It’s a no-brainer - just like the type of people who put their feet on seats!!

items.title: Huge thank you to Andy at Kings Cross…
items.review_text: Huge thank you to Andy at Kings Cross today. Missed my train by 1 minute due to a meeting at Bankside running over, he offered a good will gesture and got me on the next train to Peterborough so I'm only arriving 20 minutes later than planned! Outstanding customer service, 100x better than it's predecessor. Thanks Andy! Good customer service does still exist :)

items.title: First Class Catering
items.review_text:
Use LNER regularly between Stonehaven and London first class instead of flying.  Catering rules differ on each journey I have taken with lousy communication about how it works. Not exactly airline business meal service. More budget airline attitude at times.  Doesn't reflect the price. It could be so easy to communicate how often hot meals are served.
