Had one head of catering avoid me after first hot meal. I don't think it's too much to ask for a bit more on a 6 hour 40 min journey. So from my journeys this is what I have learnt:

1. If you take a breakfast on leaving Kings Cross you won't  get lunch. In fact you will be told you can't  have lunch because you had breakfast. The next hot meal service is available after Newcastle.

2. Toast is served in the mornings. Take this instead of the breakfast and you will get a hot lunch before Newcastle.

3. If the service gets disrupted then often catering will be limited depending on the nature of the disruption and where it occurred.

4. On weekends the food is generally more freely available.

Basically my advice is to ask the catering staff about the availability of hot food. It is not always clear and seems to vary. It would be better for Lner to just state or publish on their menu how often a hot snack is available. The crews that tavel between Edinburgh and Aberdeen are far more understanding of this issue.

items.title: Delighted with LNER service
items.review_text:
Immaculate train. Service most efficient - punctuality, staff, cleanliness etc. An amazing full English breakfast. Fresh and well cooked.  A special thank you to a member of staff called " Titani" who couldn't have been kinder to me and assisted another passenger who had inadvertently missed breakfast. 
I've not had a bad experience yet on LNER...I know... 🤞🤞
With thanks

items.title: Since LNER took over the East Coast…
items.review_text:
Since LNER took over the East Coast line,  every train I have been on has been late,  sometimes significantly so.
The WiFi connection has deteriorated a lot
There are often staff problems and the quality of the catering has gone downhill. 
Whilst most staff are pleasant and helpful,  there are increasing signs of sloppiness and disinterest from an increasing minority.

items.title: No seats on any train.
items.review_text: I booked a trip to London from Scotland in June to travel in October on LNER trains. I used Trainline and was able to book seats on the outbound journey but was told the inbound train was unreservable and there would be plenty vacant seats. When we arrived at Kings Cross to return to Scotland we found that this was not the case and almost all the seats were reserved . We tried to get a seat on three different trains to no avail. The ticket office were no help amd advised us that we should try to get a seat in first class and pay an upgrade . We eventually had to do this as we had visions of never getting a standard seat home. I have complained to LNER and Trainline and all they do is blame each other and are not interested in compensating. LNER won’t entertain a complaint because we didn’t have reserved seats.. THAT’S  BECAUSE THEY WOULDN’T LET US BOOK SEATS. Dreadful customer service that would have us try all day to get a train home. I will never book or travel LNER again and would advise people not to book a trip and believe that the advice that seats are unreservable . Give Trainline a wide berth as well as they are just as dismissive

items.title: Dirty cutlery on both train carriages…
items.review_text: Dirty cutlery on both train carriages we took. You don’t pay £100 to travel in what should have been a comfortable 4 hours and bit train ride to have to deal with dirty cutlery on top of having to change train due to disruptions on the track. I could have forgiven train changes and dirty cutlery if the customer service was up to scratch and at least be considerate of passengers who lost their reserved seats when they were forced to change trains.

items.title: Absolutely dire!!
items.review_text:
I've never had to deal with such terrible customer services in my life.

My train for a meeting was cancelled. I didn't go on the journey as I would have arrived too late. 
First I am told I can get a £14 refund for a ticket that cost over £80. Then I'm told to request my refund an entirely different way.

It's 2018, yet I have to physically fill in a form and send it off... with the tickets. You can see I didn't get the train, you can see it was cancelled. So why on Earth can't you just refund someone??

Inept and seriously slow customer service, who don't know what they're talking about and don't seem to know their own company policies.

The worst part is the trains are consistently late, cancelled, have something broken on them or are absolutely filthy.

AVOID LNER AT ALL COSTS. I will be from now on.

items.title: Gum on seat ruend a £500 pound kilt you…
items.review_text: Gum on seat ruend a £500 pound kilt you can pay to fix it thanks

items.title: Find any other way Don't use LNER
items.review_text: Unhelpful staff. Misleading ticket sales. No customer care except for standard letters when you complain and very minimal compensation when you book first class seat kings cross to Edinburgh and stand in the carriage join to Newcastle.

items.title: Friendly staff
items.review_text: We were first time travellers with LNER from Edinburgh to Kings Cross station. Thank you to Peter that managed the food cart on Monday 15 October on the 13:30 train. You contributed to a lovely and memorable experience. Your kindness is greatly appreciated.

items.title: 3rd time travelling with them since…
items.review_text: 3rd time travelling with them since takeover from virgin and they have cancelled all seat reservations if not the entire train journey alongside other issues each time i have travelled. on first occasion they upgraded to first class free of charge but now see it as an opportunity to make more money by forcing people to pay for an upgrade. Tried to complain immediately via there website but this is impossible do via mobile phone assumedly hoping that you cannot be bothered by the time you have travelled the length of the country. 100% customer dissatisfaction rate since takeover. Shocking.

items.title: Booked first class for a treat
items.review_text: Booked first class for a treat, 1 hour 45 minute journey without a single offer of a cold drink despite promise of at seat servive and lovely glossy menu of what might have been. Made even worse by response to the effect that complimentary refreshments are not assured but thanking me for valuable feedback. Wasn't feedback, was a complaint, to which I still await satisfactory resolution.

items.title: LNER "call-centre" - the definition of an oxymoron.
items.review_text:
I haven't even been on the service yet but if their customer call centre is anything to go by - I can't say I'm looking forward to it.

Let me begin by saying that I TRIED to use the web-site to carry out a seat change but the system resolutely refused to let me. It would highlight one of the seats I had been allocated, and showed the seats where I wanted to move to as being free but no. Every time I clicked on "Save changes" it politely told me that it hadn't and asked me to try again - which I did - repeatedly.

So I surfed over to the contacts page and was met with the predictable "Use the web site" fob-offs. I had tried that, so I just wanted to speak to a human, to see if they could do something - or explain why I couldn't.

That's 15 minutes of my life I won't get back. I don't know what was worse; the really awful "musak" assailing my ears, (likable only to the tone deaf or those on love with what electronic jiggery-pokery will do to the human voice), or those who like to be told every few seconds that "Someone will be with you shortly" - they won't.

I travel regularly by train in Italy and the service from Trenitalia is not only massively better than what passes for "service" from LNER but it does so at under half the cost. No doubt LNER will bleat about subsidies but if you can't even manage to run a call-centre - what change a rail franchise?

Rubbish. I wish I had booked to fly.

items.title: Warm Carlsberg
items.review_text:
Boarded with a slight spring in my step - Friday at 4pm, is there a better time to be hurtling through our beautiful country in Limbo with no responsibility and a cool beer in hand.
Quickly pulled in to the pits of hell with the information that Carlsberg was the only tipple of choice, a drink only chosen when faced with the that or a murky puddle of goose whizz. Scenario quickly escalated when I was informed they're warm cans with no sign of chill (they're cupboards not fridges) and that they'd just sit there stewing, the drink alternative of a Frey Bentos.
Next to the toilet - where I was met with a flush system that one can only assume was powered by an old man weeping in the cistern.
Worst train ever

items.title: Thanks to the local staff for doing all they could
items.review_text:
On 10th September we travelled on the 11:30 from Kings Cross to Edinburgh.
The train developed a technical fault which made it unsafe to continue so we were "reversed" back to Kings Cross where a replacement train was waiting on the other side of the platform, so all we had to do was walk across the platform, the layout was identical so we took our same seats.
Unfortunately because of crew availability the train had to end its journey at Newcastle - but at every stage the staff kept us informed and told us what they were doing and what we needed to do - including telling us how to claim refunds.
It was a pain but I felt that LNER excelled themselves in trying to minimise the inconvenience and keep us updated.
The return journey was on time and without incident

items.title: Review from someone that works for another train operator.
items.review_text: From a rail employee from another train operator. My wife and I were stranded in Edinburgh buy this company on 22/09/18. Due to over head line faults. There were no buses provided and no taxis either. At the station no announcements were made giving any information to the hundreds of people waiting for their cancelled trains. It is the train operators responsiblity to get you the paying customer to your destination. I was forced to pay for a hotel for a night in Edinburgh which I will be claiming from LNER as well as a full refund for the ticket cost. LNER should be ashamed of how little information and no help was offered to their paying customers including myself. I’m so glad I don’t work for LNER. There is no way the train operator I work for would leave any of their customers stranded hundreds of miles from their home or destination. Shame on you LNER.

items.title: Unclear terms of service used against YOU.
items.review_text:
While riding the train, the wifi was completely unusable (which you have to pay 5GBP for) - GMail took about 5 minutes to load, let alone more network intensive websites like Facebook. 

I understand that these things happen, which is why they have included a specific clause in the terms of service for the wifi, stating that if the wifi is unacceptably slow, they can offer a partial or full refund (on their discretion), which is great.

Except that when I tried to apply for a refund, they refused offering the reason "You used it for too long. Had it been only a few minutes, you would have gotten a refund." Had this rule been known in advance, maybe I wouldn't have put myself through the frustration of staring at loading screens for hours.

So yeah - unacceptable speeds, and intentionally hiding refund conditions from the customer to avoid giving a 5 pound refund. Well I hope the loss of customer trust and most likely any future business was worth it, LNER.

items.title: Every part of this experience was…
items.review_text:
Every part of this experience was terrible: 1/ Price - the cost of a ticket should be illegal. 2/ Reliability - constant excuses for delays and lateness. 3/ Standard seating - the seats are positioned close together with a very narrow galley running though the carriage, walking through the carriage with a suitcase is almost impossible. 4/ First class - don’t waste your money. Slightly larger seat. This is definitely not a 1st class experience. This is a standard experience with a 1st class price tag. 

The massive price tag with a low standard experience just leaves you feeling completely ripped off. This company is a shamful example of how train companies are completely ripping off the British public.

items.title: First time I have travelled by train…
items.review_text: First time I have travelled by train for years, feeling is, never again with LNER!  I travelled from Kings X to Edinburgh Waverly.   It became evident near the beginning of the journey there was no water in the taps to wash ones hands after using the toilet. I accepted there may have been a problem/technical fault but again, 5 days later returning to London there was still no water from the taps to wash ones hands with and it got even worse in that at least three toilets I know of were blocked and frankly the conditions were disgusting.People were walking up and down the train to find a working one and eventually queuing to use a blocked one. I did write to them about but got a standard letter back by return telling me the trains are cleaned morning and night and sometimes technical problems occur.

items.title: They couldn’t run a model railway
items.review_text: They couldn’t run a model railway. Completely incompetent, staff could care less. Always delayed and they communicate nothing. Staff are rude, dismissive and about as useful as a chocolate frying pan. At Kings Cross they always leave it until the last minute to announce the platform forcing people to be in a mad stampede, when they could announce it early enough to allow people to board the trains in a civilised manner. One of the worst companies in the UK for customer care!!!! And I bet they’ll put fares up again even though the service is much worse. They have a monopoly and use it to exploit customers. Disgraceful!

items.title: First time and last time I'll travel…
items.review_text:
First time and last time I'll travel with LNER.
We booked tickets on the last bank holiday in august this year. Sadly couldn't reserved seats. 
When we arrived on the friday the train was already fully packed and no seats available at all. It's quite a long way from London to Edinburgh standing more than 4h. And sadly we were not the only unlucky ones.
On our returned journey the 27th same game. No seats available. We tried desperately several trains to London but everybody seemed as desperate as we were. My friend managed to get a seat in the 1st class paying extra 25£. I didn't get the same luck and had to stand again 4h20 in a smelly train with broken toilets. I counted up to 20 people standing in the section of the train I was and that was not including people standing in the corridors and in the other carriages.
I'd love to understand how the hell it's possible to permit people to book tickets still when the train is over booked. We paid 142 each (one way and return) to stand on a train for almost 9h. Awful travel. If I knew I would be standing I would have buy flights tickets instead. The policy of this company is clearly scandalous. They should provide seats to all their customers. That means limit the booking on the trains.
The staff was also not great. When we came to the desk in Edinburgh to ask if by chance their were any spare seats we could reserve we spoke to a very awkward women who looked at us like idiots.
I'm trying to get a refund of my tickets with very little hope it will succeed. But for sure I will never travel again with them.

items.title: What an unpleasant first time…
items.review_text:
What an unpleasant first time experience.... we decided to make a return journey by train from London to Newcastle for the weekend to see family. Leaving on Friday morning returning Monday afternoon. 
Upon booking we were offered 2 seats together with a table which sounded perfect as we both had work to do during the journey. 
Upon boarding it became evident that no seats were booked for us and the end result was that we had to stand all the way to Newcastle,  which also meant that it was not possible to work thus losing a days productivity. Furthermore, due to an old back injury, standing for this length of time becomes considerably painful. I am shocked to learn that longhaul trips are overbooked to the point that the carriages are jam packed to the brim. Had I known this I never would have considered the train. It is ridiculous. Hoping to ensure that the return journey would not be the same story I immediately called reservations whilse still onboard, only to be told on various differrnt ways, that there was nothing they could, or would do. Thus we also had to stand for the length of the return journey!!! The result is that I am engrained with such a poor opinion of the entire LNER service that I will never recommend them to anyone. It is Far easier to fly or even drive as at least then We would get a seat.

items.title: Worst experience ever had
items.review_text: Worst experience ever had.  If i had the option of no stars..they wouldn't get any.  Made a reservation online through their service provider which did not book our seats.  Definitely took our money.  There were way too many people on the train and having to stand in the aisles and in front of the doors. Standing 3 hours is so ridiculous and how can they expect us to stand all the way London to Newcastle.  We paid the same amount as the people sitting.  We were then told we can't book seats as it's full.  Then why book the ticket if it's full?????  Greed !!!!  I will never take this train again.
